Name: Butlins
Title: Disappointing
Review:
Took my little girl to see the ‘Amazing Animals’ 3D show, with a title like that I expected maybe safari animals or animals in the jungle or Antarctica or something. Turns out it’s actually about the worlds most venomous creatures where they had 3D wasps buzzing about, a snake biting at the audience, a shark attacking the audience, jellyfish which come down from the ceiling where the audience are warned ‘they will sting you’ amongst other things. It ends with a gorilla coming out and then chasing the hosts through a door where they could be heard screaming as they are being attacked. Before each venomous creature comes on there’s a rather loud scary alarm that goes off which freaked my daughter out each time it came on. Obviously it’s not real but my daughter was absolutely terrified and was screaming and crying, she was traumatised. There were a lot of kids there who were also screaming and sobbing and trying to hide from it all.
I went to complain to the staff after who were not at all bothered by the sight of my sobbing and traumatised daughter. I got told lots of kids love it and it does state not suitable for under 5’s. But if I had any idea it was about dangerous and venomous creatures I’d never have taken my daughter in. It’s not suitable for kids at all, it’s frightening and unnecessary. They could have made it into a lovely film about animals and been educational too. But the aim is to absolutely terrify children. You have been warned. My little girl had awful nightmares last night since we saw it.
Most of the staff are rude and unfriendly. A lot of places there either close early or don’t open at all for half the week.
Read less

Name: White Swan Arundel
Title: Brilliant
Review:
Came for dinner a few weeks ago. Lovely, cosy pub. The food was great, I am vegan and there was more than one option for me which was awesome! Staff were brilliant too, attentive but chilled! Great experience all round!
Read less

Name: Avisford
Title: Easter Sunday Roast Lunch
Review:
Don’t go there. 7 of us went for a family Easter Sunday lunch. Waited an hour for starters and a further 45 mins for the main course to be delivered. Roast lamb tough, no mint sauce brought to table.
Chicken cold and dry. Pork and beef fair. No horse radish sauce delivered.
Roast potatoes raw and had a blow torch to apply bit of a sun tan. Cabbage boiled since yesterday. Didn’t bother to stay for pudding.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Get me home
Review:
Got off to a horrific start when i arrived early ( as it says online i can) to use facilities.no can do, as nowhere to put luggage.( non drivers please note!). Then after queuing was singled out for security check. Says random, but was already written in bold letters on my paperwork) needed photo id, which i wasnt told when booking over phone. Then they wanted the bank card id used to pay to verify i hadn't used stolen card. This is after 18 previous visits over the years! When got into accommodation tv didnt work. Called the number left to report problems- message said service not available! Entertainment very limited throughout day. No 'party dances' of an evening. Shows have an hour between them, leaving you the option of using arcades and losing your seat, or sit twiddling thumbs.....so mich more to complain about i could fill a book. Do not come here. Get on a plane and go somewhere exciting ( and much much cheaper)
Read less

Name: Inglenook
Title: Great real ale pub
Review: We visited Pagham and had to visit the Inglenook ,always a good selection of ales at a very fair price ,you must visit .

Name: Sen
Title: Excellent value
Review: Went with my sister, fantastic food, lovely staff, good value. Prawns were a highlight! Only complaint would be that the rice portion was tiny- all other portions were a good size.

Name: Butlins
Title: Great service from Julie Vincent
Review:
I check in for 2000s weekend
& Julie Vincent serve me she was very nice, helpful and information given to me was very good. Keep up the great service to me and every other person who walks into the 3 main butlins,
Now I have a good impression on bognor regis butlins.
Read less

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Visit to Arundel Castle
Review:
We visited Arundel Castle while on a short break, it was on my 60th birthday, My mobility is limited & walk with a stick, I was a bit worried how I was going to get around , but I needed of worried as there are staff in buggies to take you up the steep hills, all staff we encountered were very friendly & helpful, the gardens & the chapel were worth a visit .
Read less

Name: Agmering Manor
Title: Impressed so returned a second visit
Review: Village hotel venue, with a very good restaurant and excellent service and value for money. Open to non residents, so perfect for mid week treat, Thursday French dining, or Sunday Lunch

Name: Pub & Kitchen
Title: Great meal and service by Anna
Review: My wife and I recently ate here for an evening meal for the first time and we had a super time. The food was delicious and delivered promptly. Really surprised at the high quality of food and service given how busy they were. Our waitress, Anna, was welcoming from the start, cheerful and attentive throughout. Anna knew the menu very well and gave thoughtful recommendations based upon our requirements. We cannot wait to go back soon.

Name: The Lion
Title: Lovely pub with open fire and friendly staff
Review:
Eight of us met here at 12.30 for a Friday lunch to start a weekend on the south coast. Parking was easy this early and the staff here are very helpful and friendly. The only problem we had was that our table was in the far left hand corner of the pub and it hadn't warmed up yet so we sat for the first half an hour with our winter coats on - less than ideal. The food overall was pretty good... we all enjoyed what we had chosen and nothing was sent back for any reason (my girlfriend had the fish and chips for £9 which was a good sized portion if ever so slightly overcooked while the liver and bacon was very good with plenty of gravy).
When we wanted another beer or bottle of wine our waitress brought them over pretty quickly despite it beginning to get busy in there.
So the main question I always ask myself is would I go again and the answer is yes, we'll meet up there next year to start our annual south coast weekender with our group of friends.

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Food..Cold, Stale
Review:
Food and service was so poor..
Rude staff, never been to such a poor place. A shocking experience for all six of us..Such a let down..

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Lunch meet up
Review: Great selection of good food in a comfortable relaxing atmosphere, in the hamlet of Shripney. I would recommend it for it's a friendly place to meet.

Name: The Town House
Title: Upsetting experience.
Review:
When we arrived at the Town House we felt it did not appear as bright and cheerfyul as it does in the photographs. We also found the tables too close together. We were allocated a table at the bar end, in front of a passageway with a view of the unisex toilet door.
My pate-de-foie terrine turned out to be just a small portion of pate which was okay but nothing special. My husband's scallops starter was nicely cooked. My main course of half a lobster was also nicely cooked. Sadly my husband's surf and turf was overcooked and cold. The waiter returned it to the kitchen and the same meal came back re-heated and even more overcooked. The glass of champagne was nice as was the half bottle of Chablis. The waiter was efficient and friendly.
We had made this booking using a voucher from 'Gourmet Vouchers. Our son had given this to us as a present for a special occasion. When we came to pay the bill - which had come to £32 more than the £100 voucher - the problems started. The restaurant had received only £50 from Gourmet Vouchers instead of the £100. This was entirely the fault of Gourmet Vouchers who telephoned my husband the following morning to apologise and to pay the restaurant the balance. We gave the restaurant the receipt for the payment to Gourmet Vouchers expecting them to deal with the problem. The manager told us we would have to deal with it and wanted us to pay another £50 then claim this back from Gournet Vouchers. As they had offered us no proof that they had received only £50, but we had provided them with proof that the voucher was for £100 we refused (leaving our contact details) but paid the rest of the bill in cash. Unfortunately this meant we had no cash to give the waiter the gratuity he deserved. The manager loudly argued that they did not have to take Gourmet Vouchers at all - they do their own vouchers - and behaved as though they had done us a big favour by taking it when they accepted our booking. As we left nobody opened the door for us nor wished us a 'good evening'.
The problems ruined our evening......we could forgive the 'not quite up to scratch' meal but as it was a special occasion for us we would have liked to leave the restaurant with a memory of a happy evening. Instead we left disappointed, embarrassed and rather upset.
We totally accept that the problems were the fault of Gourmet Vouchers but feel the resaturant could have handled the situation far better than they did.

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Lovely Atmosphere
Review: Lovely family meal enjoyed at this pleasant restaurant. We varied in age from 4 years to 76 and each one of us thoroughly enjoyed our meals.

Name: Out of Bounds
Title: Not subtle about closing down!
Review:
Took our eldest to a birthday party so decided to take the younger one to have a play too. Soft play is excellent and both boys enjoy it.

I ordered food for our youngest and myself. At 5.30 just as I had collected our food the soft play closed. The staff then started to clean up the seating area by the soft play where we were sat. They were putting the chairs up on the tables around us, and not quietly either.

I recommend ordering a kids burger instead of an adult one as you get more for your money on a kids meal.
Read less

Name: Flying Fortress
Title: Large Unruly kids in under 4’s only section
Review:
Arrived for opening time with my 22 month old and all was great. Soon after arrival it got busy.

The under 2 and under 4 areas suddenly got busy with either giant 4 year old’s or kids and parents that cannot read the signs as they were running riot with no parents to supervise in these areas.

My daughter was getting pushed all over the place. Staff we uninterested when I complained about it. Not a great experience this time
Read less

Name: Waterside Café
Title: Wanted to look at 6 ducklings.
Review: Walking through cafe to riverside and not having been there before, we were approached by a female member of staff who told us it was private land and unless we sat down to order, we should leave. My son explained we were just showing our 4 year old grandson the ducklings. She said we could see them from the bridge and repeated that we should leave. What a mean, rude and unreasonable attitude on a lovely sunny day. Having just returned from Germany and France, where people could not be more helpful and kind particularly to young children, staff training here is clearly sadly lacking. We certainly would not give that establishment our custom in future.

Name: Ye Olde Fish and Chippe Shoppe
Title: Poor Value, Small Portions, Won't Return!
Review: I have had a takeaway from here before and said never again, however American Express were doing a 'Shop Small' promotion for here, so thought let's give it one more go. Guess what they are having trouble taking American Express cards have I got cash, funny that! We had 2 Regular Cod and compared to the Felpham Chippy they were more like small. Also they put everything into cardboard boxes so a five minute journey home they have sweated and gone soggy, Felpham Chippy use paper so this doesn't happen. Also at £12.80 for 2 regular cod and 1 large chips, a lot more expensive than other nearby establishments! Will definitely not come back!

Name: Premier Inn Littlehampton
Title: New Years eve
Review:
Short staffed long wait for food and reception main door to accommodation not secure breakfast cooked to order no breakfast the same undercooked or overlooked unfortunately lack of staff due to sickness but disappointed
Read less

Name: YHA
Title: Great little stop
Review: YHA Littlehampton has everything we needed and was in a great location. Easy walk to everything and right by the river. Family room was basic but clean and tidy. The host was very organised and helpful.

Name: The Diner
Title: Do yourselves a favour and go to the fish and chip shop opposite!
Review: dined there earlier this week. incredible long wait. food eventually arrived... cold and wrong order. when enquired how much longer we had to wait we were told there was already a 45 minute delay but we should have been told that upon arrival. service was poor and food even worse.. won't be rushing back ....

Name: Butlins
Title: BUTLINS HALLOWEEN AND FIREWORKS 3 Day break
Review:
We stayed at the Ocean Hotel this time, last time we had an silver apartment.The hotel we thought would be better for us with 3 small children.Check in 10 mins wait and room ready at 1.30pm, so very prompt. Only 2 lifts working for a 5 floor hotel, so very busy with people getting into there rooms and one time we had to wait half hour for a lift so that was one of the worst parts of this hotel .Hotel very clean and our room- adequate space for 2 adults and 3 children..but was it HOT , so hot in October we had to have our balcony door open every day to cool down, air con did not seem to work either. we had to chase up 3 times for a paid travel cot and then eventually at 5,30pm it arrived just in time for bed time!, so not impressed with that service when it was pre booked months ago .The double bed mattress was absolutely discusting, covered in large stains, thanks goodness a sheet covered it as was horrible to see. and the beds very hard, not the best sleep...The bathroom had plenty of towels, only 2 toilet rolls and NO handwash(remember to bring some) the room was serviced daily except forgotten one day by 5pm and we had to chase up and then ask for more milk , and loo rolls...Hotel restaurant we also booked before and the food choices were very good..breakfast and eve meal. plenty to choose from and cater for children needs too. with bibs and cutlery we always nearly just walked in every time..and staff were happy to help us if we asked for anything. Park so much to do..and entertainment but 3 days was ample to do everything there..the children loved the characters ,puppet shows and main stage shows..and rides in and outside . Not enough for under 1 year old to do, so bit of a struggle as the baby part has been shut down in the sky pavilion which was annoying as would have been ideal.Firework display was great and Halloween eves too. would we go back- yes next year maybe to same time in October, and same hotel, yes as long as lifts sorted out. as a further one broken the day we left! overall we had a nice fun packed time and the kids were all happy to be there and ocean hotel is so much better than apartments in our opinion and was lovely not having to think of meals every day, worth paying the extra for them
Read less

Name: Cardanom Bay
Title: Evening meal with friends
Review:
The meal we had recently at Cardamom Bay Bognor was not very good.
We came in at 7pm and had our poppadum’s, then our starter. We were then forgotten about and did not received our main meal until 8.40, this was only following a reminder from ourselves.
Our food had not been prepared and were offered a free drink. When the mains did come out at 8.40 they were rushed and were not to a good standard, two of the sauces were horrible, and the lamb was tough and not edible. We complained at the time and asked for the chief to try them, but we did not get any feedback from this.

I don’t normally leave feedback apart from when the food and restaurant is exceptionally good, but on this occasion due to the low standard and disappointing meal I feel that this needs doing, not sure if this is your normal standard but we were all very disappointed. We did pay the full amount for the meal and the service charge but were not happy with the quality of the food and the service.
An email was sent to the restaurant but was not answered.

Name: Sen
Title: Always a lovely experience !
Review:
Why has it taken me so long to write a review of this local friendly restaurant ?
We came today to celebrate a friends birthday , a cheeky Friday
 ‘mums out at lunch !’ So yes not the busiest time to visit , yet we got what we were after ...
a relaxed atmosphere , not feeling rushed or hurried - the freshest of food and able to keep ordering to feed our ‘grazing appetites !’
What we loved was the time spent with who is known as ‘Happy’ the restaurant owner - chatting to us about all things local, we even met the local ‘potato supplier ! ‘
Thank you for a lovely afternoon , quality Prosecco, beautiful food and as always a great dining experience .
The ‘Friday girls ‘
Ps looking forward to getting on that trip to Spain with Prosecco suppliers A&A !

Name: Beachcomber Inn
Title: Holiday
Review: Not that good had better at wetherspoons and that's bad still if you are hungry go home and make a sandwich

Name: Black Horse
Title: Mid week lunch
Review:
Staff pleasant and efficient but the pub lacked atmosphere.
The menu was somewhat limited in choice.
The beef burger was dry and lacked flavour.

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: Couldn’t Fault It
Review:
A true credit to Travelodge. The staff are amazing, Dulce, Seth and Debby were amazing!!! They made me feel so welcome......it is in a convenient location right next to the racecourse and not far from Goodwood.
Read less

Name: Harbour Park
Title: Great place for children.
Review:
The outdoor rides are great for children aged about 4 - 12. £20 for an unlimited ride wristband is excellent value (though the whole wristband/tokens/tickets info is a bit confusing), and an adult can accompany small children on certain rides for free, which is a refreshing change.Our 6 and 10 year olds went on rides over and over again and had a wonderful time. Nice little cafe, reasonably priced.
It would be nice to have a couple of simple little rides for toddlers in the same area or a little play area for them. Didn't go to the indoor activities, but the soft play looked good.
Large car park adjacent, reasonably priced for a sea front position.
Read less

Name: Ocean Hotel & Spa
Title: Excellent hotel
Review: Stayed here for a 4 day break with our children. The room was a good size, the children had their own “room within the room” so, we had a little privacy. Its close to all the activities and the pool which is a bonus. I would take your own pillows as the ones provided were quiet thin. The restaurant & bar on site are very good. The terrace is very present on a warm day. Would highly recommend.

Name: Fino
Title: Disappointing
Review: We came here for my partners birthday meal, and when we arrived it was lovely the young lady who served us at the bar was lovely and the young bar man was fantastic, unfortunately that was the the best bit of are evening, we ordered a bottle of wine before our meal, the wine we ordered was OFF, and one of our drinks had something weird floating in it, which we showed the waitress, we asked if we could replace the wine and the waitress told us we could only pick from a certain selection, we were offered no compensation for this and to be honest it made us all fell quite sick, the prawn cocktail starter was properly the worse thing I have ever tasted, watery crayfish with absolutely no taste, we all had the same starter and was hugely disappointed, the mains all required seasoning, and we decided to not even bother with dessert, the bill was over £200 for the 4 of us, very unsatisfactory!

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: STEER CLEAR
Review: Wow . Table dirty , dirty pots everywhere. Waited ages for service. Child portion served for an adult. Dry beans . Asked for chips and peas and got beans . Lumpy gravy . Asked for sausage and got a torn one in half . Appalling needs shutting down !

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Cozy .
Review:
We stayed at the attached Premier Inn at the weekend. When we arrived on the Saturday after booking in we decided to have lunch before going to a wedding. Lunch was fine fast served only problems were lack of veggie options or lack of stock to provide meals.
Next morning, Breakfast items a bit spaced out around area , Were happy to provide veggie sausages for the wife.

Name: Littlehampton Fish and Chips
Title: Disappointing
Review: Come here regularly but today the battered sausage was not fresh and crispy, dry and had clearly been sat in the heat cabinet for a While.

Name: Bailiffscourt Spa
Title: Expected a lot more
Review:
We had a family trip this weekend to celebrate Father’s Day with our 8 month old. Overall our expectations where not met. The hotel is beautiful, as to the grounds and surrounding area, the rest below the cover is poor.
The room was a nice size, nice decor and comfy bed. But was dark, very dirty, bathroom taps fell off in my hand, was hot and when opening the window the smell from the kitchens came in!
The service was mixed, every time we sat for a drink/food we had to ask for a menu/to be served and then chase them. Shouldn’t be a surprise we wanted to eat and drink, also bad for their business as they are losing out on revenue by not serving and making people wait.
The eve meal was disappointing, poor produce, small portions and very bland. The chef should not be Proud of that. My breakfast was lame, veggie breakfast with no sausage = one shrivelled tomato, one burn mushroom and a tiny portion of beans, looked pathetic on the plate!
The spa is run down, nice on the surface but tired and so so busy. Couldn’t even get a seat to feed our 8 month baby, loads of towels left and no one overseeing removing them.
Stayed in the chain a number of times, this is is by far the worse and only gets away with due to the location/building.
Save your money and go elsewhere
Read less

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Disappointing Customer Service
Review: So disappointing, in fact, that I can't even comment on the food! We visited without a booking at midday during school holidays and were told there were no tables without a booking. Fair enough. But we were then told we could book a table for 1pm. So we returned at 1pm, with four hungry children, and were told there was an hour's wait for food. Had we been told that at midday then we would have just eaten elsewhere sooner and not put off lunch to wait for our booking. Absolutely ridiculous.

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Used To Be Brilliant
Review:
I took my family to the Black Rabbit today for Sunday dinner. Booked a table for 4:15 (late lunch/early dinner). Not overly busy this afternoon. The girl serving us looked disinterested from the start.

The food came out quickly. My wife’s roast beef was dry and tough, my lamb felt like it had come out of the microwave. I think you can tell a lot by the roast potatoes on a roast dinner and once again they where dried up and tough!

At no point during the meal did anyone come and check on us or offer more drinks. We had a desert board plonked on the table after waiting 15 minutes for our plates to be cleared away.

The black rabbit was a lovely place and holds some good memories for my wife and I, but I won’t be recommending it again, and I don’t think I’ll be visiting for a long while.

If you’re looking for a cracking roast, try The Corner House in Worthing. It’s just been promoted to top of my list of places to go for a roast. Got to say for post meal satisfaction the Toby Carvery beats the black Rabbit on today’s performance.

Name: Ristorante Al Mare
Title: Lady
Review: Went to their Sardinian evening with friends and had a fabulous feast and time. For starters we had a mixed antipasti platter, to follow smoked fish, to die for, and a fresh seafood salad. Followed by a classic Sardinian pasta dish of Mallardusu with Bortagga. Excuse spelling!! If that wasnt enough we were then served the most scrumptiuos meat platter of pork, lamb and Sardinian fennel sausages with roast aubergine and fennel!! To finish Sardinian biscotti soaked in Mirto liquer!! It was a feast and accompanied by a white and red Sardinian wine. It was a great evening restaurant full and buzzing highly recommend. All of the food is cooked fresh. For a local italian it is absolutely delicious and great place to enjoy an intimate lunch or dinner with friends and family. Great value fixed price for the Sardinian night.

Name: The Gravy Boat
Title: Home ^__^ it's where our heart is.
Review:
Came here for my birthday treat, we were usually in here once a week though as saving for our wedding we've cut back a bit. We walked in and had smiley booming hellos from the staff who know us now by name, and always remember our drinks orders...even to the gin we tried the last time we were in. Fantastic memories they have and it really does go a long way!

Thai mussels as always to start Absolutely stunning flavour, Thai is my favourite to cook and I will never order it anywhere else except here. Stunning!

Added extra as was birthday treat, an addition from the new menu some stunning padron peppers. One of my Absolute favourites. Delicious!!

For main I had the new (improved) trio of fish. The shell on prawns took me back to Greece yum yum. I will have this again and again. This place knows how to cook seafood to a T.

We were so full to order dessert however they kindly brought out some birthday white chocolate eclairs for my birthday on the house. To die for.

I adore this place it's my favourite. Will be having my hen do meal in here Feb / march time I can't wait for my lovely ladies to dine here :-)

Thank for fabulous food and a great service can't wait to come home again

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Amazing Castle and Grounds
Review:
Me and Mrs Maverick Tendency went to Arundel for our honeymoon many, many years ago and, as we went in February, the castle was shut. We have been back to Arundel several times since and everytime the castle has been closed so this time we made sure it was going to be open! Anyhoo it certainly did not disappoint! The gardens are wonderful and the castle very grand. Me and Mrs M.T enjoyed it all very much. Lots of history and the guides are knowledgeable - did you know, for example, that the current Duke of Norfolk is responsible for state occasions? Not cheap but well worth the money. 5 Maverick T stars for this one.

Review by Maverick Tendency
Read less

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Shame
Review:
Such a shame for a low rating having stayed at lots of Premier Inns with no problems. Beds are super comfy, staff of Premier Inn lovely and extremely helpful.
It’s a shame some noisy unruly guests ruined our last night and some rude staff at the adjoining pub/restaurant ruined our overall experience.
Read less

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Don’t have the Liver and don’t expect much of a response if you complain
Review: Just visited the Spotted Cow following recent change of ownership. We’ve been going here for many years but were very disappointed by today’s meal. In general terms service was slow, plates were cold, and food wasn’t that great (potatoes on roast lunch had a pre-cooked feel rather than fresh). However our main issue was for the 2 of us who had liver and bacon, which was threaded with tubes; this made a large amount of it inedible. Our feedback secured us a 10% reduction off the cost of these dishes, which seemed to us a very inappropriate response. Having waited over 15 minutes for the bill whilst they debated our feedback, we couldn’t be bothered to take it any further. So having been a regular customer for many years, we won’t be going back unless we hear of a fairly miraculous turn around! (as an aside, the young waitress who served us was very nice).

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Lunch
Review: Food was very poor, and not as advertised. Our burgers came with no onion rings, a seed topped bun instead of a brioche bun, had chunky chips rather than skin on fries and the lettuce which was also not advertised was under the burger so it was soggy and warm. Would define not recommend eating here. Also the caesar salad said it had lardons in it, but it was clearly streaky bacon sliced. Avoid if possible. Waitresses were also rude too.

Name: Premier Inn Littlehampton
Title: Wedding to attend
Review:
The Premier inn is close to a busy road, with Annexe closer to it. If you want a less noisy stay, request to stay in main block. Unfortunately, our room in the older block needed decorating and a new carpet
Read less

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Fascinating place, lovely guides
Review:
Visited with the family, opted for the ticket which gave us access to the grounds, gardens, rooms and bedrooms. Well worth it, although did notice tickets can be upgraded after purchase.

Gardens were lovely, the views from the keep were outstanding and the guides were great. Happy to answer lots of questions from our youngest.

Couple of things to call out for info:
There are some very steep steps,
pushchairs/buggies are not allowed in the castle rooms
Castle rooms don’t open till 12
Read less

Name: The Bear Inn
Title: Lovely place but lack of service for the restaurant
Review:
We waited over an hour for our food to arrive, which normally would be fine as we were a big party- however we booked prior to coming and most of it was burgers and there was two other tables in the restaurant. We also had to wait a long time to get served, and never got checked on if he wanted more drinks.
 We asked to pay on 4 separate cards and the remainder in cash (we were a party of 12) we were told they didn't have the technology to allow this. We weren't told on arrival and none of the party could have paid the final payment amount on their card. We asked the waitress how she could accommodate this and she was very aggressive and said it was up to us to sort it, even interrupting our friend and upsetting her afterwards.
 Very disappointed especially as friends traveled down for this dinner for a special occasion. However the pub side looks great and we have never had any trouble with service on that side, normally served by a smiley gentleman.

Name: St Mary's Gate
Title: very disappointed
Review:
came here for a meal in the evening, lots of dogs waiting for us to give them food, while I like dogs, should not be allowed to keep worrying people that are eating.
this place used to be more up market. shall not be returning.

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: Amazing food and service
Review: Visited with my friend and loved the American vibe of the restaurant, the food was amazing and staff where very friendly, will definitely be back soon!

Name: The Diner
Title: Lost a bit of spark but still best food option
Review: We visit Butlins usually atleast once a year, mostly for just a day. We came here when it was new and couldn’t believe how nice it was, fresh and bright decor, lots of memorabilia from the 50’s and 60’s. Food has always been great for the 3 visits we have had and service whilst a little on the slow side this time despite helpful and friendly service from kenny wasn’t the main issue. Our 2 previous visits were brightened up by the girls donned in 50’s outfits singing and dancing around the restaurant, something that made it unique, but for some reason was dropped around a year ago apparently, we can’t find out why?

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Thoroughly disappointed
Review: Was exited to have seaside fish and chips but was very disappointed by the lack of quality. The chips were overpriced and tasted like they were from a tacky take-away. Batter was soggy on the fish. Could have got better quality fish & chips in land. In my opinion the worst fish & chips I’ve ever had and I would certainly not recommend. Ruined my lunch on the beach.

Name: Butlins
Title: February half term fabulous fun!
Review:
Back again (how we can stay away eh?)!

We stayed in the Ocean Hotel, it looking as clean as it was when it first opened. Freddie at Reception treated us as though we were the only guests he'd met all day - so polite, jolly, taking such great interest in my boys - what a great start!
In fact, every member of staff we spoke to went well out of their way to help us / make us feel at ease, as per our requests. And of course, the legend known as Ritchie....! Thanks Ritchie for the advice you gave my boys, and not just about football either.

With the new dining system we were able to eat in a variety of locations, for both breakfast and dinner (we were too full to eat lunch!) - this gave our stay such variation, no day was in no way the same. And as for the choice of food - I think The Deck came out top favourite, but that along with the Ocean Hotel restaurant and Papa Johns too. Another thing I find that people overlook is the 'background' music playing whilst we ate - it was such an eclectic mix, tunes for everyone, so giving the great age range of our group songs to sing along too whilst we ate, so adding to our fun (I wasn't the worst singer btw!).

My eldest son (genuinely!) beat me for the first time ever on the go-karts - at least I had the ice cream from the 'pink cows shop' (so funny) brought for me this year by the chuffed victor!

We must return to experience the much-anticipated new leisure pool - that's going to enhance our stay so much more.

Thank you Butlins - you've again managed to give my family and I such an amazing experience / stay / holiday / total rest.

Just fab :-)
Read less

Name: George & Dragon
Title: Rude welcoming...
Review: Having recently moved to the area, we had been told this little pub was a must to try. I called and booked (knowing how busy Sunday's get in a good pub) plus we had a dog - they were more than happy for us to bring him. We had been for a long walk before hand but made sure our boots were clean before entering the pub after seeing signs stating boots should be removed if dirty (completely understandable if ours were!) Unfortunately we walked into what I can only describe as very clicky locals sitting and judging at the bar (I LOVE going to a pub with welcoming locals which I expected but unfortunately this was not the case) and not one greeting from the staff. The first word which was said to us by an older lady was "please can you leave and take your boots off, you're making my carpets dirty" no 'hello, how can we help' or anything. I'm completely understanding about the removal of boots when dirty but no dirt was on our boots and quite frankly her attitude stank. I've been the owner of five successful pubs in Sussex and if a bit of mud on a carpet in a COUNTRY pub is an issue then they need a rethink or learn that sometimes mess does happen but a hoover or dust pan and brush can be a quick fix. Unfortunately we walked out and found another humbling and welcoming pub down the road which we had visited prior for a drink. We will not be returning.

Name: Rustington Manor
Title: Our three day break
Review:
“Rustington Manor Hotel “. is a three house conversion.
Run by a couple of young Very Helpful people, plus other staff...
It has 7 Bedrooms (as far as known) on the first floor, accessed by a staircase (no lift is available)
There is one bedroom on the ground floor suitable for a disabled guest. Ground floor Toilets are available for Men & Women.
The Dining Room, Breakfast Room ,and Bar-lounge are well furnished.
However, being a “Hotel” we expected hotel standards...
The Breakfast Buffet table showed minimal choices, whereas the hot food had to be ordered..The Menu stated items which were not shown on the buffet.
Our bedroom was not serviced in our 3 day stay only given clean mugs and more biscuits / tea/ coffee etc on the tray.
The Dining Room had no dinner available Monday, Tuesday, or Wednesday, (should it be required): they had bar food only.
We can only consider this so called Hotel, to be nothing more than a 2* B&B.

Name: Arundel Cathedral
Title: Stunning inside and out
Review:
This beautiful Cathederal sits on top of the hill overlooking the town, its a bit of a climb to get there through the towns medieval streets but its worth it. Impossing and grand on the outside and tranquil on the inside. A must visit when you're in Arundel.
Read less

Name: The Southdowns
Title: Sunday lunch
Review: Been here before really enjoyed the food and atmosphere, decided to take my family there last week truly wish I’d not bothered, food was not good at all, my grandsons burger was disgusting bun was so burnt, my roast potatoes were definitely out of the freezer won’t be eating here again gone down hill sorry guys.

Name: Best Kebab and Burgers
Title: Bad terrible disgusting
Review:
Food came cold
The workers are rude
The place doesn't look clean
Never would eat from here again
The food I ate made me very ill for a few days never ever again

Name: East Beach Café
Title: Rip off
Review:
Had the fish finger sandwich today at £8.50 ( no chips or salad included). For that price I was expecting homemade fish fingers with fresh fish. What I got was clearly cheap quality (grey fish) frozen fish fingers with zero flavour. Very disappointing and will not be going again.
Also, coffee arrived after the food

Name: Inglenook
Title: Disappointed
Review:
Checked in. Room small but clean. Shower was very good. Room very hot and when you open windows very noisy from traffic outside. There was a fan in the room, this was noisier than the traffic!

Had breakfast there on first
And second morning. Chef took order and was super friendly and funny. Food was really good and freshly made.

On last evening decided to treat Friends to farewell dinner at the Inglenook and book the resturant for 4 adults and 2 children.

Meal was super disappointing. People next to us returned their meal (not sure why) and this should have been a warning! I had also seen a previous meal wending it’s way back to the kitchen.

We’re asked a few times if we were ready to order - finally made choices to be told half of them were not available! Now had to start again!

Ordered scallops starter. Small as expected- over cooked and cold! Also I think my husbands had been halved to make a serve and his were almost undetectable on the plate!

Mains arrive. Friends chicken supreme had less chicken per serve than the kids chicken nuggets! Also didn’t look that nice. The trio of pork was ok but not cracklings on the crackled one! Fish was incredibly small and probably should have been thrown back!

Very disappointed.

We were charged for an extra fish which we had actually cancelled when we saw the size on another table and changed for the supreme - which was equally small.

Final mornings breakfast - different staff member. Bit rude. Took order. Came
Out with plates held in a towel. Ot oh - well bacon had probably been kept warm for quite a while as almost impossible to cut and scrambled egg where previously had been freshly made was mushy and sat in a pool of water-microwaved? A pet hate of mine. Saving 3 minutes of time and the worst thing ever! Fork literally fell through it! YUK! Did not eat and left it all. Service staff did not question why I had ordered a plate of food and left it all!

Would not recommend the food or resturant sadly.

The Sunday roast I did not have but just say it all looked lovely. This was with the first chef I in countered who was very friendly. Polite and funny. Would highly recommend him and not the one who cooked the night of the dinner and the following breakfast! Sadly did not get his name.

Name: Carlyle's Café
Title: Lunch with family
Review: I rang at the weekend to enquire if Carlyle's did gluten free meals, the lady I spoke to was called Katy & she was very helpful & said they did offer gluten free so I made a lunch reservation for eight of us to have lunch. It was our first family visit here and I would have no hesitation in recommending Carlyle's to others, We were warmly welcomed by the staff who were very patient & helpful with our various orders. Our food was very nicely presented, well cooked & reasonably priced.The premises & toilet were very clean. A very big thank you to all the staff, we will definitely come again when next in the area.

Name: Golden Grill
Title: Best Kebab ever
Review: Its the best kebab l ever had in this area very friendly staff food quality is super well done guys.

Name: Royal Norfolk
Title: My gosh. What an experience
Review: Well I’ll try to be polite as possible. I paid just under £100 for one night stay. As you enter the lobby you are greeted by broken tiles on the floor and a lovely lady who tries to up-sell you a room with sea views. Stupidly I took this option and unless I was sitting on top of the kettle in the corner of the room I could see no sea at all Infact all I could see was a derelict building and an empty car park. Apparently (after asking for the WiFi code) I was informed that the internet is only available on the room directly above the router, not weird at all really !! The bed served its purpose however I have thrown my wrist out trying to turn the radiator on. Moving on swiftly the breakfast is served at 8am downstairs, make sure you don’t enter this room at 7.58 am otherwise you are likely to be arrested and locked up for the rest of your life. As for the service itself it’s all plastic cups and forks that resemble garden pitchforks. We sat down in an empty room and was rudely greeted by the table police who aggressively told us that this table was not ours and we must sit at another one so in fear we agreed. The previous table remained unseated for the remainder of the breakfast serving. I’m not going to comment on the food itself, I simply haven’t got the the energy however I did ask for another piece of toast and the manager came to the table and declined my request stating it’s against the policy and flatly denied me. Her English wasn’t great but rather than making a fuss I just left it at that. After showering and getting ready to leave we were interrupted by a knock on the door, it was thr manger again saying they their state of the art technology states we are smoking in the room. Funny thing is neither of us do and we were quizzed for five minutes about this we were given a filthy look upon departure. Make your own mind up about this place. It’s absolutely disgusting in our opinion

Name: Trevali Buest House
Title: Rude Rude Rude owners !!!! Beware
Review:
On arrival we - 2 adults with our 2-year-old baby were stopped in front of their entrance stating a child is not allowed. Although booking was done via Hotels.com, Lady came up with a paper stating our booking through Expedia is for 2 adults only. Hotels.com had no answer as to why owner had Expedia reference and said they can’t help as child wasn’t mentioned while booking.
Room information on hotels.com stated room accommodates 2 adults and child if child shares bed with parents. B&B’s website states children are welcome. Despite of this they said children are not allowed and closed the door.
Our fault that we did not confirm baby while booking. The thought of this being a problem never came into our mind as baby co-sleeps with us occasionally and we booked a king size bed for that night. We told hotels.com about the treatment that we got there and we had no intention to stay with such uncourteous Owners. Finally, after a struggle of an hour, we arranged alternative accommodation via google. Before moving we just knocked on their door to show their own website policy, to which one of the owners said, ok then a child and mum can stay in the room and also tried to make fun in a sarcastic way. We understood they are after making money without letting us in, hence we left to the next hotel by cursing their rude behaviour.
Beware and be careful while booking this venue, as its near Butlins Bognor Regis where families booking rooms can easily fall into this trap.

Name: George Inn
Title: Good choice
Review: Booked at the George on a friends recommendation certainly not disappointed. The carvery on a Sunday was excellent with choice of rare or well done beef and plenty of vegetables. You weren’t rushed and if you fancied a little more meat there was no problems you just asked for more will certainly book to go back.

Name: Beachcomber Inn
Title: Just basic, decent food
Review: We ate here 1 afternoon whilst at Butlins. Food was reasonably priced and delivered to the table quickly. My Chicken and bacon melt was lovely. Conveniently located on site too.

Name: Avisford
Title: Terrible
Review:
This is a very, very poor standard hotel. The rooms are incredibly dated - apart from a large TV, they haven’t been updated since what lion likes the 80’s. The building itself and rooms are tired and poorly maintained. No air con rooms, which on a warm day like today makes them almost sauna like. Cleanliness is lacking throughout. Staff were reasonably friendly and helpful. Location is nice, set in lovely countryside. However, that’s about the hotels only redeeming feature. Do not stay here.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: BUTLINS ONLY IN NAME
Review:
having been to all three camps recently it is obvious bourne leisure have no interest in people who have holidayed with butlins for a lifetime.they have completely turned it into a corporate money making machine cutting corners wherever they can.the evening entertainment is now a very very poor in- house low budget disgrace of what was once a great evening out with professional bands and acts.all the people giving good reviews are either friends and family or new visitors who never saw butlins in its heyday,something which we will never see again under bourne leisure.
Read less

Name: La Cucina
Title: Lovely...
Review:
Started with the usual anti-pasta. Followed with an Arrabbiata and a sea bass.

We didn't book but should have as there were a couple of large groups and as a result we were just in front of the bar. Couldn't really complain as we dropped in on the off chance.

Food was brilliant, bags of flavour and reasonable. The Wine list was above average with most bottles on the higher end of what you'd expect to pay, but you do pay for what you get.

Specials were nice but not for me on this occasion as I'd already decided ahead of time on the choices.

Tips; book early and in advance, clearly a popular choice for locals and mid week. Look at the specials and try the Rioja.

https://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/ShowUserReviews-g664980-d12538985-r714956183-Establo_Lounge-Rustington_Arun_District_West_Sussex_England.html#

Name: Little London Teashop
Title: Poor food - poor service
Review: Won't visit again. Very limited choice of menu. Limited opening hours. Car parking not easy nor always available.

Name: The Mezze
Title: Food and drinks amazing
Review: We have been to mezze Saturday night I have never tryied Turkish food before and when l asked the owner about it he said I trust the quality and the taste of my food sir if you don’t try you will never know ) was nice to seen someone so sure about them selfs at the end of the night food was amazing from start to finish, staff was so friendly .l have seen people on here saying it’s over priced, I don’t think so at all you get what you pay for it was amazing quality food and drinks thank you will definitely go back

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Worst cafe ever!
Review:
Absolutely disgusting! My friends and all our kids decided on a road trip to bognor for the day. All happily sitting down in the cafe waiting for our breakfasts. What a bloody let down !! Bacon wasnt cooked, egg looked contaminated, bread stale it was never ending !
We asked the manager to come over and he refused. We asked the waitress to call him over and again he refused so we ended up at the front with our full plates. And what an terrible manager he was ! No apologies, he tried blaming us and he was so rude. Definitely would recommend you all avoid this place. It wont ruin our day though! Vurals need to close down

Name: Little London Teashop
Title: Cold Coffee
Review: I was at Bognor Regis for a business and I had 15 mins spare. As I was rushing I ordered latte to take away and it was cold by the time I walk to my car. I would have taken it back but I didn’t have time.

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: A waste of a great location
Review: From the outside the place looks very inviting, nice lighting, warm and great location, however when you get inside, reality hits hard. It has an open plan kitchen and the room for the restaurant is actually quite small. I love a good burger, but here they were just ok, then you add in the arundel pricing, uncomfortable chairs, greasy smell everywhere, the wait for the food and skin on fries which I hate it all did not add up to a great experience. Plus the fact that is 2019 and there are plenty of option to make many, test vegetarian burgers so my other half would have been more happier.

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: Excellent
Review: Excellent service from day staff at this hotel pleasant stay very helpful would highly recommend staying here local to all shops and sea front good location nice place to stay rooms always clean and tidy

Name: Haskins Garden Centre
Title: Something to eat
Review: Brilliant freindly staff food great had jacket potato chilli con carne very tasty wife had soup and fresh bread, outdoor plants and garden furniture ect, in doors had Christmas theme bit early but very festive plenty of parking, went there for something to eat wasn't disappointed.

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Dreadful Christmas Day meal
Review:
Booked back in August for Christmas Day lunch. Visited in November to check where we would be seated as we needed to fit 2 prams next to the table. Was advised it would be a table in the main restaurant area with plenty of space - perfect - or so I thought.

We arrived on Christmas Day and were seated at a table in the conservatory area on the opposite side of the restaurant and it’s as if we were completely forgotten about. No Christmas decorations in this area and absolutely no atmosphere. We waited almost an hour for our starters and then almost another hour for our main courses. The majority of the food was lukewarm at best and when someone on our table asked for mustard, they were told there wasn’t any. The wrong food was also brought out several times. A table next to us were brought out desserts before they’d had their main courses! We also asked for some jugs of water for the table and were told they didn’t have any jugs available.

A very disappointing experience to say the least.

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: The Worst Ever
Review: Weather a bit showery so I took my Grandchildren in for some traditional seaside food. The order was mixed up. The chips were hard, the fish tiny & the mushy peas were mostly water. They charged a fortune & told me their card machine was broken so I could only pay cash. Never again. Be warned, wish I’d looked on here first!

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Not impressed
Review: Visited today with a friend and all tables were dirty and sticky. We had to use the menus as a table cloth! Also the staff are dressed terribly, in scruffy shorts and tops. I wanted a gluten free cake and they supposed to have a choice of 3, but only had a flapjack. I have ordered white wine spritzer and the glass was very dirty. It is such a shame! When the lounge first opened it was good, but I think it has gone down hill and as it is stands now, I would be embarrassed to bring my friends again!

Name: Butlins
Title: Rooms disappointing
Review:
We paid £586 for 4 nights in the silver rooms. We had a double and a twin room.

Neither of the TVs had any signal.
There were only two sockets per room. All were far away from the bed - which is problematic because a family member has respiratory equipment that needs to be plugged in and used overnight.

Pretty disgusting they’re ripping off families for profit.
Read less

Name: Butlers
Title: Nice Restaurant, excellent food, friendly staff
Review: Butlers is a lovely restaurant in a good location in Arundel. Nice ambience to the restaurant, and friendly staff, and reasonable prices. We had our meal on a quiet Tuesday night, but the food was excellent across all the courses. They deserve to do well.

Name: Butlins
Title: Awful
Review:
Wow this place has gone down hill. Same music being played as 10 years ago... most kids are into pop not music from the 60's!!! Get with the times!!! Hardly any activities put on. New pool is a let down.. for tiny little kids and rules as per usual ruin any fun. My advice, for £100 more i could have gone to centre parcs with great pool and their rules are much more relaxed and fun. Much better equipped accommodation too... we had hardly nothing we needed in our seaside apartment and when we requested an ironing board we got this... see picture... says it all doesn't it!! 😂
Read less

Name: 47 Mussel Row
Title: A nice visit
Review: Enjoyed a lovely meal, starters a little overpriced for the size, really enjoyed the main, staff couldn't offer much advice over wines and when unsure about mains didn't offer much advice over what was actually in the dish, however were friendly and felt well looked after

Name: The Fish Factory
Title: Disappointing
Review:
I visited this restaurant on Saturday night. We usually go to the Worthing one which is always busy and buzzy on a Saturday. Also the food is consistently good. However Littlehampton was so different. By 8.30 we were the only table with one other so no atmosphere. I ordered Hadock fried in matza meal with chips. the fish was over cooked, almost burnt and therefore the fish dry. There were 8 chips on the plate - far from generous. They did bring a bowl of chips when I commented how small the portion was.
I shall definitely stick with Worthing on future.

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: New Years Eve Celebration
Review: Well what a fabulous evening....We always go out with our best friends to celebrate New Year and we were not disappointed. All the staff were friendly and polite, checking everything was ok throughout the evening. The food, pre ordered, was tasty and good sized portions available. The overall price was extremely good value and we would seriously consider repeating this if the venue chooses to do this again next New Year's Eve.

Name: Butlins
Title: Great for kids
Review:
Did a four night break with hubby, 2 year old and four year old. Lots of live shows, great games centre, toddler fun fair and fantastic swimming pool. Will definitely come again.

Pool had wave machine, several slides, toddler pool that was heated. Great chaging facilities and swimwear dryer and plastic bags, you need one pound for lockers which are returned.

Lots of gift shops in facilities including a small mini market really useful as ran out of nappies. Beach five minutes from main gate. Taxi 5 minute £5 ride from station.
Read less

Name: The Holly Tree
Title: Sunday Lunch
Review: Great location and very friendly. If you go between 4pm and 6pm they offer special offers. The food was good, though not brilliant. Having said that, it's well worth a visit. They also have musicians regularly in the bar area which is fun.

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: AWFUL FOOD
Review: Ordered the chicken pie and veg cold veg. Pie was full of knobbly chicken that was inedible. Such a shame beautiful poor and lovely staff. The very same thing happened 6 months ago thought and hoped there would be a improvement clearly not. Will not be going again!!!

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Went for a couple of drinks
Review: Was very nice atmosphere and relaxed pub to go for a drink.i don’t know what the food is like as I didn’t eat there.but the staff were all friendly and the customers all very friendly as well.will defentley be going back here again for a few drinks.

Name: Osca's
Title: Great Fish & Chips
Review: Have been coming here for a few years. We always order cod and chips and have found the food to be excellent quality and fairly priced. Staff are very pleasant. Nice to have the option of eat in or take away.

Name: Riverside
Title: we liked the area
Review: the accommodation was not very good the gas fire dident work ,the floor carpit was filty and badly stained ,the bedding was disgraceful fit for the bins ,no light in the small room ,and the bed is to small for the double room and uncomfortable the place would of been ok for a short stay ,,but for a week and over £200 out of season I believe was disgraceful I could of gone abroad for the money with better accommadation

Name: Premier Inn Littlehampton
Title: AIr conditioned nightmare
Review:
Hermetically sealed rooms are not my idea of a perfect nights sleep. As far as I and other fellow sufferers from claustrophobia and sinus problems these rooms are a no no, Obviosly misplaced faith in the efficieny and durabality of air conditioning systems.
Read less

Name: T-Bone Burger
Title: Oh dear!
Review: Friendly staff, cold beer. The 2 steaks we ordered medium came out created. Stringy gristle through my sirloin.( Can't believe that was sirloin) it said ' on the bone ' mine came out off the bone with a bit of bone chucked onto the wooden board with the meal.No you don't get a plate. You get a wooden board full off score marks from previous customers. Friends have had good meals in there and we went on that recommendation. We will not be going back and feel ripped off for being charged £56 for the ' privilege '

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Average at best.
Review:
It's a roof over your head. Nothing fancy and no frills. The shower was quite poor quality and wasn't up to par with my bog standard shower I have at home.The staff when checking in we're polite and helpful (they even offered to give us tooth past and tooth brushes for a charitable donation) The breakfast was poor.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: BEST time at Butlins 80s weekend!
Review:
Butlins 80s weekend was one of the best weekends I have ever had! From the moment we pulled up to the resort, a party atmosphere had been created by the enthusiastic and helpful staff. The lady that checked us in was also brilliant! So chatty and cheerful and provided us with lots of great advice on how we should approach and enjoy the weekend ahead.
We were lucky because we had booked silver apartments but were told we had been given ones that had just been renovated and they did not disappoint! We were surprised by the amount of space we had and the cleanliness was of a good standard. The only criticism I would give is that the showers are very small and not very powerful.
There were 14 of us altogether and we were in 3 separate apartments meeting up regularly in the apartment that sleeps 7 people with plenty of room for us all. We headed out on the Friday to the sky pavilion first before hitting the centre stage night club. Great music, great people and a fantastic atmosphere resulting in us not getting to bed until 3am and feeling a little fragile in the morning.
I was lucky enough to escape the hangover so a small group of us headed to the pool party at the splash waterworld on the Saturday morning. This was one of the highlights of my weekend. Again, such a good atmosphere with every one having fun and enjoying the great 80s tunes.
If you’re a fan of activities then Butlins had a lot to offer during the day such as go karts and arcades. We chose to go bowling which was great and at £7, good value for money.
I will say there was not a lot of variety when it came to food but I did enjoy the fish and chips and it wasn’t too expensive. They delivered to our apartment for free and it was a very quick service.
Saturday night was also brilliant where we saw Go West and Pat Sharp before ending up in the silent disco.
Overall we had a fantastic weekend and have already booked to come back in May!Just a little tip....it’s quite a walk from the car park to oyster bay apartments so I suggest just bringing one big suitcase to avoid getting a bad back with lugging heavy bags!!!
Read less

Name: The Fish Factory
Title: Friday Lunch
Review: Third visit to Fish Factory. Very disappointed. The member of staff who greeted us was off hand and dismissive - no eye contact at any point. We should have left then! The place was cold. The Mushroom Wellington was mediocre - served on a plate of 'sauce' and accompanied with chips which lacked any flavour. The one leaved lettuce salad that accompanied the Red Snapper contained random pieces of lemon rind and lots of un- pitted olives. Not what I expected for £14.95. A shame, we like to support local businesses but we won't be returning.

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: Food Poisoning
Review:
Order roasted Cod, was sick 4 times about 4 hours later.
I complained but they were not interested, would not eat there again. Greasy smell when you enter restaurant.

Name: Avisford
Title: October stay
Review:
We stayed her for a quick relax before school half term as a small treat. The staff are good but dealing with a hotel in need of repair and restoration. The rooms are tied no heating and the noise from hall ways and above made it impossible to get any sleep. We booked for dinner and when we sat down later that evening were told basically there was nothing on The menu. Because we hadn’t booked anywhere else or told they didn’t have anything we were stuck with picking a few thing off the snack menu. Food came out at different times and we had finished by the time our daughter got her food as they prepared it wrong. I have always believed in the Hilton chain but this site is terrible and we got far from the usual Hilton experience. What a shame :(
Read less

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Grounds over priced at £13 per person
Review:
Visited at the weekend, Arundel Castle charged £5 just to step inside the gate and see a few stalls with plants for sale, if you wanted to see any further inside the grounds it was £13. I have seen the grounds and they certainly are over priced and extortionate for a whole family to go. Inside the castle is different as you are paying for the history and tour but they need to reduce the price for just to look at the garden.
Read less

Name: Inglenook
Title: Extremely welcoming!!!
Review: We Visited the inglenook hotel and as soon as we walked through the door we was warmly welcomed as well as our 2 dogs. Very relaxed atmosphere, with brilliant service. The landlord was always checking we was ok or if the dogs needed more water and he came over with treats for them. Highly recommend visiting this pub, we will be returning!

Name: River Breeze
Title: Very disappointing
Review:
Only 1 option for a vegetarian child, pizza and chips. This looked and tasted like a crusty microwaved £1 pizza. Peas were a weird shade of green (from a tin).
I ordered cod and chips, not sure how they managed to produce a meal with so little flavour.
Can’t understand the good reviews given.
Outside of the shop is very deceiving, promising old fashioned good food but in reality should have to gone to Iceland!

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Reuniting with friends
Review: Not empressed. Our friends like this pub for real ales and ambience! Not anymore. Menu been swashed. No vegetarian food except lasagne which was full onions and chunky tomatoes. Lack choice!! Waitress was very inexperienced, didn't know what dishes came with what!! Shame need to get there act together otherwise can see failure. The place was empty.

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: The Black Rabbit
Review:
Visited for drinks yesterday.
Was ansolute dissapointment.
Tired disinterested scuffy staff.
Drinks tasted watered down.
Beer unpleasant.
Filthy tables etc.
Awful!
Couldnt leave soon enough.

Name: Foxwood
Title: Bank holiday
Review: The campsite itself is very nice but I struggle to understand how they can charge so much for a pitch when they offer no facilities. We paid £170 for three nights and stayed in the forest section. We were told we couldn't forage for wood to make a fire (surely that's part of the fun of staying in the forest) and had to buy it from the reception. Showers were good but that's about it!

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: The worst sandwich I have ever eaten!
Review:
I visited The Black Rabbit last Monday, (not even a busy day)!
I ordered 2 BLT Sandwiches and 2 cups of tea, payment was taken upfront at the bar at time of order.
50 minutes later, no sign of the teas or sandwiches. I decided to check at the bar, and was told it was on its way.
Another significant amount of time passed, when finally the order arrived by which time were feeling very deflated. I could hardly find a single piece of bacon in the sandwich, the bread was dry and the salad limp, both BLTs the same. You would expect after waiting for more than an hour for a sandwich that something magnificent would arrive.
I can honestly say it was the worst sandwich I have ever eaten, and I have eaten all over the world.
It is a great shame that the service and food here is so poor as the location has so much potential.
Don't waste your time, the whole experience was terrible and I will not be returning.

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: good views
Review: This hotel had a very minimal budget point but was clean tidy and better than expected, the view of the sea was good and the receptionist who greeted us was more than freindly, good conversation and a clean room what more could you ask for the price point

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: What’s happened?
Review:
I was eager to return here as last time the food was amazing(see my other review).
This time the chips were soggy, crumbly, almost white and tiny portions, I asked if I could have vinegar first then salt but was told they’re already wrapped and I need to request that when ordering? Vinegar first then salt sticks to the chips, salt first and you wash it off with vinegar. The battered sausage was still good but not impressed with how things have changed in just a month.

Name: Arundel Historic Tours
Title: Interesting and enjoyable tour
Review: Martin provided a great tour of the town, explaining the history and architecture, as well as pointing out places from his childhood. Excellent value and highly recommended.

Name: The Holly Tree
Title: Great meal
Review: Arrived at the Holly Tree at 5.25 on Sunday afternoon and noticed they finish serving Sunday dinner at 5.30. We were worried that we were too late, but they were happy to serve us and I have to say the meals were enormous and delicious. Thank you for allowing us to eat! Pity we don't live nearby because we would certainly be back.

Name: Star Fish Kingdom
Title: Stephens
Review: Good Chips poor fisf not fresh frozen and full of fat not enjoyed at all the fish was the triangled shape type you buy in bulk not nice ,not what you expect at the sea side

Name: Cedar
Title: Excellent Food & Service
Review:
We had two meals in the restaurant both of excellent quality both food & service .
Great selection & reasonable price

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: Old and tied .Needs overall
Review:
very outdated . Worn and tied. Very surprised how the room was so basic to other travelodges and premier inns I have stayed in. Especially it was not cheap to stay for 1 night. Glad it was only me using the room.
Read less

Name: East Beach Café
Title: Best avoided
Review: As we were told the café was full (even though there were empty tables) we foolishly went to the kiosk outside to order food and drinks. It was barely organised chaos. The queue just didn't move, while they faffed about pretending to know how to prepare food and drinks. When we finally got to order they had run out of most things we wanted on the limited menu (sausage rolls and sandwiches) so we ended up waiting 20 mins for some chips to be cooked, which was only a small portion. The tables out on the beach were dirty, with rubbish underneath them. A poorly managed place, which clearly trades on its location.

Name: Pub & Kitchen
Title: Little gem on Butlins resort
Review: Visited this last weekend during our Butlins stay and thoroughly recommend it. Lovely Rib -eye, good kids menu and great service

Name: The Deli
Title: Healthy
Review:
This is a little jewel. Very welcoming. Clean, With healthy homemade produce on show. The service is warm and accommodating to both take away and eating at this location. The menu is inviting with a good selection of freshly prepared to order Sandwiches, cold or hot meals with homemade specialities on the day. Good friendly service.
I only had time for meeting and coffee but was so pleasantly suprised by this little gem i will be returning with colleagues to eat and in future to purchase food to take away with me as i am sure my colleagues will also. Very well done.

Name: The Lamb Inn
Title: Saturday lunch
Review: Was disappointed with the menu as it was nothing like what I saw on line. Was not given the menu as looked on line the food was reasonably.

Name: The Base Skatepark
Title: Indoor Scooter or BMX ramp
Review: Indoor warehouse they have different times for different ages take or hire a scooter and helmet small big ramps one with a foam pit, cafe upstairs friendly staff , small merchandise and you must buy THE BASE sticker!! Good price.

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: Food and service
Review: Our waiter Josh was phenomenal, always had a smile on he’s face,asked if we wanted more drinks without asking him,the burger was very nice but the main thing that I would defo recommend was the bacon chips

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Disgusting dirty room
Review:
Don’t stay here. We asked for their best room, was told we had one of the best, we showed reception the photos they made no attempt to clean the room, just offered £50 refund on a £246 per night double, which we refused. Shower didn’t work, broken tiles, dirt behind broken bathroom door, disgusting brown wet stuff on cushion, mould growing around taps, rotten mouldy wood around the whole bath pigeons nesting in roof woke us at 5.30am. If it was free I would not stay there again. They emailed me confirming that they are happy with the condition of the room that you can see in the photographs. They won’t comment on the brown wet stuff on the cushion. We aren’t regular reviews or complainers but this was so disgusting we felt we had to say something.
Read less

Name: The Mezze
Title: 5 Stars
Review: What a fabulous restaurant, the food was delicious, the service excellent, it has a great atmosphere and is very reasonably priced, I couldn't recommend it more.

Name: Golden Grill
Title: Absolutely disgusting
Review: Absolutely terrible!! One of the worst kebabs I’ve ever had. Me and my partner got a kebab from here 2 days ago and I’ve never seen or smelt anything like it. Mine smelt like dog food which put me off straight away so therefore I didn’t even bother to go near it, however my partners looked and smelt a lot better so he continued to eat his, what a mistake that was. We was both up at 3 in the morning due to him throwing everything back up to then was woken back up at 7 to him on the toilet with one of the worst stomach aches his ever had!! I wouldn’t bother getting anything from here unless you wanna be throwing up and on the toilet for the next 24 hours. Biggest waste of money I’ve ever spent.

Name: Butlers
Title: Rude & Dusmissive
Review: Went in to ask about their terrace. Young girl behind the bar informed me that no food being served in the garden because "we've got 90 in the restaurant". No consideration for the fact I have an assistance dog. She didn't even look at me, told me the dog would have to go round through the back. Bunch of prats. No customer service.

Name: Cardanom Bay
Title: Bit Rushed
Review:
Came here a few weekends ago. Having booked a table, when we arrived we were told to take anyone that was free. Waiters came over quite quickly and gave menus and took away the extra place settings that were on the table.

Having had only a few mins to look at the menu they came over for our order so we asked for some more time. A few more mins and we placed our order and drinks order.

Food came quite quickly and it was really lovely. There was masses of it and we could t finish it all but it was good food. Quickly cleared away and asked if we wanted deserts but were quite happy to just finish our drinks. Asked for the bill. The whole visit was done within an hour and we did feel a little like we needed to be quick eating and drinking but otherwise it was ok.

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: Great Spa Weekend
Review:
What a wonderful hotel - beautiful setting right on the beach. Food and service good and clean and comfortable bedroom.

Climping starter in the restaurant (lobster, crab, prawns) was incredible, ravioli very average indeed.

Spa treatments were excellent although the spa could do with more seating/loungers and the changing room was small and cramped. Lunch at the spa is overpriced and slow.

Overall it was a fabulous weekend, it was my 2nd visit and I’d go back again.
Read less

Name: BailiffsCourt Restaurant
Title: Spa disappointing
Review:
Really disappointing. I booked a pedicure for me and my daughter as a birthday treat. I asked for us to be together and was asked to pay the £126 which I did.
I also asked if it would be possible to have either a glass of fizz or a cuppa together whilst we were having the pedicure and was to,d this would be fine.
The duration was confirmed at one hour.
On arrival we were given literally a few seconds to choose a colour of varnish and told not to bother with the swatch book as all the colours were not available.
Then to my surprise my daughter and I were taken off to separate rooms. I obviously questioned this and to my surprise was told that they did not have the facility to do two people together.
The pedicure was done lying down so would be difficult to drink wine or a cuppa.
,there was no option of gel polish and I was told we needed an extra 45 minutes at the end of the treatment for the nail polish to dry.
After painting the first foot, the beautician commented that the polish was nearly finished and was too thick. She said that she had no more and then poured something in to dilute it.
After the pedicure I was directed to a room to wait for the polish to dry. It was dark and cold with no heating on.
I can honestly say that this was not the pampering luxury visit I’d hoped for, and paid for.
I did phone to discuss my concerns and was told the spa manager would call me back. After several days I then phoned again and someone finally came back to me.
Poor show.
I really couldn’t recommend this to anyone.

Name: Silver City
Title: Had food poisoning symptoms after consuming
Review: Big shame here. Have been using Silver City for over a decade yet this time the Beef Curry was watery with less taste and, the most likely culprit regarding the food poisoning I ended up with, the chicken chow mein was different in appearance colour, taste and smell (shouldn’t have chanced it but assumed maybe different chef/owners so different style/recipe). Four days since consuming and still having stomach problems. Have consequently checked with The Food Standards Agency website and found the Food Hygiene Rating for this business is a 2 (Improvement Necessary)! I agree with another reviewer that the sweet & sour sauce portion has reduced in size in recent times also. Time to find a new option for purchasing this Cuisine (once I have recovered from this terrible experience and feel up to trying it again).

Name: The Gravy Boat
Title: Perfect
Review: Had the most fabulous lamb rack ever, and I have had a few! Both our meals were amazing. The waitress was lovely and very efficient. All in all a great experience.

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Not bad but wouldn’t return
Review: Over priced and food is definitely not as good as people are making out. Deserts came with very strong alcoholic cream which it didn’t state on the menu and the portions are tiny! Ridiculous to have to pay for each side that you have with each main will not be returning unfortunately.

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Amazing coffee and service
Review: I went to Establo Lounge on Sunday morning for a coffee and a catch up with a couple of friends, after a dreadful experience at Costa last week. We were cheerily greeted at the till by a lovely young man with curly blonde hair (sorry - we didn’t catch his name!), who invited us to sit down whilst he made our coffees. He also recommended we tried the beetroot fudge cake, which was delicious! Our coffees arrived very quickly, and were beautifully presented. We will be coming to Establo every week for our regular Sunday coffee!

Name: Black Horse
Title: Evening Meal
Review: Lovely pub in a back road in Binstead. For our evening treat of meal we started with king prawns wrapped in pancetta which were very good and this was followed by a crab salad which was very tasty. All accompanied by a good bottle of Chablis. Worth a visit. Recommended.

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Valentines
Review:
From check in with bob to the service at the castle restaurant with steve and jess, the service was a1. The food was top notch. Room 7 was class, 4 post bed and huge bathroom. Top marks all round and many thanks to sandra the head cleaner 👍👍👍
Read less

Name: Famous City
Title: takeaway
Review: ATROCIOUS! Cold and very greasy. I enquired if this place has changed hand and was told no. I know it has as last time we have takeaway there was very good.I would never use this place again.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Poor food bad rude customer service
Review: Well done steak arrived bloody and half raw, After ordering no blood and well done after 45 minute wait. Manager had to be called over as no one asked how was meal, sent back blood put mum off, and told you always complain you will have to pay for it.Manager told us not to come back in ever again,Mum left in tears and traumatised. Having had the same meal last week in the rusty cutter Portsmouth mum enjoyed steak and was perfectly cooked. Staff also on hand who asked how meal was,very good customer service here.Suggest chefs and management have some training from Portsmouth rusty cutter they could teach them a lot.

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: Would not stay here again
Review: Refused to provide us with 2 keys for our family room, no room service (change sheets, empty bin) after first of two night stay, room very hot with no ventilation. But very quiet due to no one staying their in middle of August which speaks for itself.

Name: Angmering Manor
Title: Fabulous decorations
Review:
32 members of my WI went for lunch on December 17th. On entering we were greeted by beautiful Christmas decorations, then we went through one room to get to the room we were eating in & it was like walking through a Christmas wonderland. All the food was excellent & on my table not one word word of complaint was heard all complimentary comments.
Read less

Name: The George, Burpham
Title: Lacklustre food
Review: Great venue , friendly staff and luvly dog friendly country pub atmosphere but, I’m afraid to say ,the food was poor . It’s wasnt a gastropup standard meal . We’ve eaten here before and it’s been good . Are standards slipping or change of chief ??

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Poor experiance
Review:
I booked this online and had a good deal- so I thought.

I was traveling from wales for a family funeral and asked if I could check in early. I didn’t hear anything back until 24 hrs later saying I could but at an extra cost of £20.
