I declined this and said I would review this service once I return home from my trip.

The room I stayed in was room 11. This was at the top of the hotel in what felt like the furthest corner. The hotel had a funny smell which wasn’t very pleasant.

The room was ok but you could tell that it needed some work with it- bath had a hole in that looked like it was filled in with some putty. The paint was knocked and chipped away. I was rather disappointed and felt I would’ve been better off at a local travel lodge.

The hotel was dead and it felt like I was the only person in it- no offer for upgrade like most hotels would offer. I felt like the hotel cared more about the money than customer service and experience.

The food did smell nice but due to poor experience from start I ended up going to local competition which I was glad of.

I spoke to family who live in area and they laughed at me when I said I was staying in this hotel- they advised its been going backwards in recent years.

Say the least...I won’t be coming back.
Read less

Name: The Lamb, Angmering
Title: Anniversary meal
Review: After years of knowing about this place we finally visited for a special meal. Food was lovely and the atmosphere was good. We had 3 courses each and a bottle of Prosecco and it still came to a very reasonable price.

Name: The Thatched House
Title: Extremely disappointing
Review: Three of us went for lunch, looking forward to seeing the newly refurbished pub and restaurant. There was no problem with the service at all despite there being only one person serving behind the bar and waiting on tables. The food was just awful. Two of us ordered the liver and bacon. When it arrived it looked as if it was a mound of dog food. The presentation was dreadful. The liver hadn’t been trimmed properly and was tough. My whitebait was so over cooked it was virtually inedible. We wondered if this place actually has a chef or whether an untrained person was in charge of the kitchen. Many years ago the Sunday roasts here were excellent but we shan’t be going back again for the food. The interior has had a very nice facelift but the food lets it down badly.

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Okish!
Review: The pub/restaurant itself is nice and the food we had tonight was ok, but it wasn’t anything to write home about. I had the pork belly which considering it was slow roasted was very tough in places, the flavour however was really nice but the veg and potatoes it came with were non existent. The green bean has been boiled to death and had no crunch to them and the 2 carrot sticks I had were very tasty, however would have been better if they were peeled first and more of them, like wise with my potatoes. My other half had hunters chicken, which was nice but the gammon was very fatty, it’s worth noting this doesn’t come with any side dish of veg or salad so you need to order extra. We also shared the garlic flatbread, again it was nice but not enough garlic butter or cheese! The best bit about our evening was the waitress who was very polite and friendly. All in all It was ok, however it isn’t on our places to eat again!

Name: Sea View Hotel
Title: Awful Avoid To avoid disappointment, Food was Awful like a school dinner and Service was Poor And They Were Rude .
Review: After Visiting for fathers day, It was Extremely Disappointing three of us had the worst Sole meal ever full of Bones, Uncooked and Cold with a Sad Vedge side plate between Two. All in All the service was Poor and The waitress was Rude, Never asked any Information or How the food was. Avoid! Would never go again and Certainly Would Not recommend .

Name: World's End
Title: What a way to ruin a 60th wedding anniversary
Review:
What a way to ruin a 60th wedding anniversary

I hadn’t heard great things but my Nan and grandad had booked it for their 60th wedding anniversary. All together there were 12 of us. From the get-go we all felt quite rushed to eat - we had already let them know our ordered before we arrived and we were serviced within 5 minutes of sitting down. I had roast beef and it was disappointing - the potatoes tasted like frozen Aunt Bessie’s. It was all slightly cold as well. I asked for some more gravy and the waitress who looked so miserable said she would get some. I waited for 10 minutes and still no gravy. I asked again and she said ‘yes I’m getting it’ in a very teenage stroppy kind of way. She then comes out with the gravy in a measuring jug!!!!!!

When it came to the cake and Prosecco, I was refused a glass of Prosecco (despite being 27 and being with my whole family) because I didn’t have my ID. I understood, but to then be told by the waitor that if I tried to drink any he would come and physically take it away from me was extremely rude and threatening. I decided just to have the cake but wasn’t served any cutlery with it. I asked for a fork (from the moody waitress) and she returned with 25 forks and chucked them in front of me without saying anything.

Overall a very, very, very disappointing trip here. Unhappy staff who clearly didn’t want to be there and were taking it out on customers paying a lot of money. I definitely won’t be coming back.

Name: Grub & Gumption
Title: Wonderful breakfast
Review: Lovely independent restaurant. Breakfast was fresh and crushed avocado and spinach was really tasty. The other breakfasts our friends had were also very good. Service was cheerful and you can sit outside if weather is good. Short walk from beach too.

Name: Anokha
Title: Very bland and disappointing takeaway
Review: Just had a takeaway delivered this evening as the restaurant had been recommended to me. After an hours wait the food was not very hot and was bland and tasteless. Biryani had big clumps of rice in it and sag aloo had hardly any spinach. Will not be ordering again

Name: Mamma Mia
Title: Excellent, as always
Review: Delicious Italian food in a welcoming and cozy setting. Vey attentive service by all the staff as always.

Name: Butlins
Title: Wouldn't go back in a hurry
Review:
Just got back from here, Monday- Friday, 2 adults & 2 toddlers (twin girls 2 1/2 years old) We booked a "Gold" apartment.... nothing "gold" about it... firstly when we got up to the apartment the front door was open.. walked in it smelt damp and stunk of weed so we walked straight back out down to reception to complain... they were nice enough about it but the excuse was they'd just had an adults only weekend. Anyway they "upgraded" us to the Wave Hotel.
The hotel was surprisingly quite nice, friendly staff, we were on the 4th floor with a balcony, we had to bring the chairs in off the balcony because of the kids. mini fridge didn't work so we complained and they replaced it the next day.
They activities for toddlers are a bit limited, firstly the large soft play thing in the main tent kids have to be 0.9m they've section off part of it for toddlers but its really crap its just 3 floors to climb up and 1 slide to get down from the middle to ground floor that's it.. no ball pit nothing.
The fair ground rides they have be 0.9m or 1m even with a parent and the toddler fairground inside the tent was only a couple of rides which our girls didn't want to go on without us which we couldn't go on. we ended up spending a fortune on the little arcade rides £1 a go. The kids loved the arcade putting 2p's in the penny pusher machines.
Read less

Name: Pagham Beach
Title: Visit the beach
Review: Poor old pagham beach is being swallowed up, however if you turn left and walk toward Bognor it’s fine and right will take you ali g the spit and eventthe nature reserve which is well worth a few photos

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: disapointed
Review:
My son booked the table for a special occasion you where advertising special weekend deal that did not apply to the weekend that we came. Really which weekend not made clear.
Everything we ordered was unavailable because you had no dough was not offered an alternative even though it was only 7.00 in the evening. The whole experience was dissapointing after I had chosen you as my husband and I had eaten there a couple times before and really enjoy it.
I doubt we shall return.

Name: Butlins
Title: 80's weekend
Review:
10 of us stayed for the weekend. My partner & I stayed in the Wave hotel which was very comfortable, nice bathroom & brew facilities. The rest of the party stayed in the chalets which were very basic but comfortable. We found the park very good as everything was close together. We ate at the Beachcomber for a delicious breakfast & the Pub& Kitchen for dinner. We also ate at the Diner where the staff were very pleasant & attentive. Overall we had a very happy stay as there was a very good atmosphere as it being adults only & everyone was there to have a good time.
Read less

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Golden wedding Anniversary
Review:
My husband and myself had our golden wedding Anniversary here on the 17th March which was a Sunday we where a family of 15
Everyone enjoyed there meal. And it was great for the grandchildren to dress up, as I made them there costumes, to wear.
Was able to take Balloons and the cake I made. Staff was very friendly.
We ordered all our meals before we went as this saved a lot of time, and it all arrived on time.
We chose knights table as wanted a memory for the grandchildren.

Name: Arun View
Title: Family outing
Review: We went for lunch with another couple who were family, three had cod and chips and one had scampi and chips everyone enjoyed their main course very much and then one couple shared a sticky toffee pudding and one couple shared an Ice Cream Syndae dessert as we couldn’t have eaten a whole dessert each and they were also excellent and good value. The restaurant was really busy at lunchtime as well but the service was excellent and prices are very reasonable also. The views are always lovely there because your right on the river. Excellent everyone really enjoyed it well worth a visit.

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: No idea I'd be stopping in a cresh.
Review:
First of all the motel is clean ish! Very very dated compared to the other over the road.
The staff on reception are helpful and polite so absolutely no problem there.
I personally am booked in here through my work I have little choice where I stay when you work for a very large corporate who do all your bookings for you .
This is my second week of staying in this motel and between 9 am and 12pm the place has become a cresh, the cleaners have obviously brought there children with them to work as its school holidays and yes child care costs a fortune but on the same foot staying here also does.
My job involves working into the small hours and therefore being in bed all day ( or trying to be )
All around the corridors are signs saying please keep quiet people may be sleeping and I Personally hang the sign on the door to say I'm sleeping.
Now I've done this for years and I sleep with earplugs in but sadly here I'm plagued by children playing in the corridors outside my room it's a big place and I've looked outside to have a word with the cleaners but they are not even on this level the kids are just running around being kids because they don't know better.
Just be warned if your thinking of staying here .
Read less

Name: Fox Inn
Title: Six for Sunday lunch.
Review: Walked from Butlins after a riotous evening ( 70's ) week-end, very good lunch for six people, good range of beers, good service, followed by a slow return walk to Butlins via the seafront putting green? Boys will be boys.

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Good value place to stay
Review:
A group of us recently stayed here for a long weekend and it was very pleasant. The staff were all very friendly and helpful,food was very good value, breakfast was good and the rooms were spacious with lovely big beds. I’d recommend staying here. The only downside was it was a very busy road and we could hear the traffic from our room.
Read less

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Limited choice
Review:
Stopped here for lunch - everything on the menu was far too big so just had starters - gluten free options incredibly limited especially if vegetarian.
Flavourless food, overpriced.

Name: Bagels and Coffee
Title: A very well hidden treat
Review:
I had read about these "chimney ice creams" previously while looking for things to do with a guest. This was the first time I've actually experienced it!! Very excellent treat. £5 and you get an amazing huge "chimney" come, choice of 3 flavours, also a sauce again choice of 3-4 different fillings. Then chose your delicious ice cream from a wide variety. I can't even describe the cone but it is delios!! Kind of cross between a crepe / French pancake and usual American pancake.

The owner is a wonderful character with a good sense of humour. Staff are friendly too.

These magic treats should be better publicised so more can flock in and spread the word if their uniqueness.

Highly recommend stopping there for a great treat.

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: FIRST AND LAST VISIT
Review: Booked via phone 31st Oct at 14.22pm for Sunday lunch on 3rd November, said we wanted the carvery and how much was it. Was told it was £14 and given the time of 2pm. At no time was I informed there was a "carvery system" and now wish I had looked on here and read Helen of Brighton's review of the 18th August. First off they said they could not find my reservation in the book then someone had a look and found it! Told them we wanted the carvery but waitress said she would put our name down for it?? meantime get our drinks. 30mins later still no news re carvery yet see people coming back with food from there (remember we did not know about the carvery system then), asked waitress again how long it was going to be and she said she did not know! Err what about going and finding out for the customer! I had not opened my bottle of drink and we decided to leave then without eating as could see this was going nowhere and it was getting late for lunch, went up to pay for partner's bottle of drink which had been opened and half-emptied (both soft drinks, not that that matters), they then tried to charge me for both, said I was not paying for mine as I had not opened it and had wanted it with my dinner which did not seem to be coming - we had pre-ordered carvery on the previous Thursday and no mention made of their carvery system to which man on duty at counter said he only works weekends! No appologies made whatsoever. This establishment might look the part, but needs vast improvement on customer service, safety, eye sight tests/reading classes and their so called carvery system (never ever come across this before) which I was informed was due to being in a small area with too many people going up and live flames of candles there ... HEALTH & SAFETY is this safe with young children around? Lit candles on all tables, as a family eatery would be safer for battery candles hence still look the part. Our table also was sticky - needs to be spray cleaned after every use, simply health and safety requirements. We really had been looking forward to this but still got our Sunday roast.... further down the road at the Swan... no "carvery system" there, and meal was delicious and cheaper! Even on an off busy day, no excuse for poor manners towards customers and have the courtsey to keep them informed especially of your so called "carvery system".

Name: The Mezze
Title: superb
Review: great meal. very polite and friendly staff. we were staying at butlins so it wasxa welcome break to get out for a while. would certainly recommend ...

Name: Butlins
Title: Wonderful weekend at Butlins at Bognor
Review:
Fantastic family weekend at Butlins Bognor. Amazing activities, something for everyone (ages 6 - 74)! Really noticeable was the friendly, professional staff. The service was brilliant everywhere we went! Stayed at The Wave, fun rooms, immaculately clean. And the new pool..... fabulous!!! We really enjoyed it. Thanks all for making our trip wonderful.
Read less

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Lunch out not up to usual standard
Review:
Just had lunch with my wife at Black Rabbit. We have been coming here for many years and always been happy. Location is fantastic. However, this time service was not good (limited knowledge of menu with no support from experienced staff, requested ketchup never arrived) and the two 'crayfish open sandwiches' looked good but the tomatoes were watery had no taste (Previously chilled too much?) , the dressing made the bread soggy and the crayfish did not taste fresh.
My wife could not eat hers and I left most of the tomatoes. Drinks were also at the very high end on price. We just wanted a nice lunch out but went home disappointed.

Name: Mustards
Title: Roast
Review: Our first visit to mustards we had the 2 course meal was absolutely delicious , roast beef was cooked perfectly and apple crumble was great, definitely will be returning soon

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Non returner
Review: Despite reading previous trip advisors regarding The Spotted Cow we thought we would come for Sunday lunch, the service was attentive yet slow to receive drinks to our table. On ordering Roast dinners that we opted for they came quickly to the table, the meat was very fatty and the food itself was not hot which I would expect! We had to ask again for more drinks and for dessert menus. Very disappointed visit.

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: A few pints
Review: A very friendly pub i love this place.the staff are very friendly here and make you feel very welcome.the drinks may be more exspensive here but its trully worth it.great staff especialy the older guy behind the bar keep up the great work guys.

Name: Passage to India
Title: Tasteless...
Review:
After reading all the reviews of this place i was excited to eat at what I thought would be a hidden gem. The menu boasts that the restaurant has been open since 1990 and I can report that it appears nothing has changed since 1990. The once red but now overwashed and faded napkins are arranged in a fan in front of you, the one glasses are the smallest ever seen but also made of the cheapest ‘cut glass’, In 1990 it may have been accepted to do this and also offer low quality food but nowadays with the choices we have of high quality mouth watering Indian food available this just shows its self as a massive disappointment. The shrivelled up lamb chops were absolutely tasteless, the only flavour coming out of them was salt everything comes with a ‘salad’ which is a bowl of lettuce with a single lonely piece of cucumber, tomato and olive.
None of the flavours penetrated the variety of meat dishes ordered, it was almost just like a coating. A blessing or a problem? Not really sure.

Name: Zeera Lounge
Title: Rude!
Review:
I should have known when I phoned to book our meal that we were not going to enjoy our evening.
Whoever answered was curt and most unwelcoming.
No change when we arrived at 7pm on a quiet Sunday evening- customers and welcome sparse.
So we ordered- the waiter was the same man who had answered my call earlier and was surly and unhelpful.
The rose wine we ordered was unavailable and a bottle of Barefoot was offered as an alternative- which is available at 2 for £10 at a local convenience store. He agreed to let us have it at the price of our chosen wine - £15.95.
Food ordered- fairly uncomplicated other than my partner not wanting Lamb tikka on his mixed grill.
Poppadoms and dips were fine - predictably he tried to take them away when we were done so we had to ask for them to be left for our main.
Mixed grill arrived and looked good, apart from the pile of unasked for Lamb tikka - this was replaced with chicken when mentioned.
The food was good - but the service was not.
We were polite paying customers in an obviously struggling restaurant and I didn’t expect the cold welcome
There are plenty of other similar restaurants in the vicinity so I would have expected some professionalism.
We won’t be returning.

Name: Arundel Brewery
Title: Great local business
Review: Loved the shop. The staff was helpful and friendly. Great location just by the main road and river. Really liked the original choice of cans.

Name: Butlins
Title: Very disappointing
Review:
We Arrived May half term with my two children aged 11 & 8 to a “New Style Silver Apartment”. This holiday included no meal plans, no additional extras and cost me a few pound shy of £1000. The website explains you can enter the park from 1pm but cannot access your room/apartment until 4pm. We went to our apartment at 4:30 and the cleaners were still in our rooms cleaning. We were self catering so had to ask to put our food we had bought into the fridge, the cleaners allowed us to do this but not without a look of disgust. The apartment was still dirty even after they had left, windows had lipstick on them, glitter all over the chairs dust on the radiators, scum on the backs of the bathroom doors and chunk of plaster missing from one of the door frames. The kitchen was not well equipped; no frying pan, limited kitchen utensils, a tea towel thinner than a muslin, and bowls that were greasy. We had to ask for another towel, the vague looking guest services employee and explained she’d get one to us that afternoon...it never came.

The apartment is ‘rough’ looking, very small, dark and depressing. They’ve crammed bunk beds into one room so that not even the door will open. They’re old apartments attempting to look new but unfortunately failed.

The swimming pool was the BIGGEST let down. It was freezing. It’s newly refurbished and looks fantastic, but the pool temperature is unbearable. The que for some of the slides varied between 30-60minutes. The pool is open to the general public so it gets ridiculously busy and unfortunately for those who have paid for a £1000 holiday have to suffer the consequences. The changing rooms were filthy; the floors covered in mud.

The entertainment in the evening was ok however people using mobility scooters would often block entrances, doorways and fire doors to park them. I don’t believe there are any parking facilities for these. When we asked a member of staff to move the scooters from a fire door he explained “it was not his responsibility”. This was the last straw in an already horrible holiday.

I’d decided on a Butlins break this year instead of a holiday abroad. I thought it would be easier for my family and also saved some pennies. I wish we hadn’t have bothered.

I feel let down, exploited and sad for my family and especially my children. It was a horrible holiday, please don’t waste your money guys, go abroad, Centre parcs, haven...any. Please don’t give your hard earned money to this cruddy establishment.
Read less

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Run out Monday!!
Review: I met two friends for lunch on a Monday and we did not get off to a good start with ordering the drinks they only had huge bottles of sparkling water, no apple juices or J2O’s basically everything we wanted. We settled for coffees in the end. I chose the muffin with eggs and mushrooms which was nice, my friend had the sausage one which she thought was ok and my other friend went for a meat soup and when it was served had mushrooms in it which she is allergic to. She asked for the veg soup but that had run out so she had a bowl of chips and we then went over to Waitrose to have coffee and cake. Not our best experience there and it was not that busy sadly.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Sadly nosedived ☹️
Review: Well very sad to say that the place has nosedived. The dining area was so cold we had to move. Tried to order some very common items and told they were sold out or the spit roast chicken isn’t being turned on again tonight as we are closing soon... at 7.45pm!! food order wrong and overcooked not worth ordering again to incur another delay and then an assertive discussion about the bill, neither of the male staff seemed that bothered and one even seemed to find it funny. Tipped the waitress as she tried hard but no one else did. Won’t be back, which is a shame as our daughter was asking to come here on her birthday. We will find a better local independent place. Very disappointed and will be deleting the app.

Name: Magna Tandoori
Title: Disappointing - dreadful service
Review:
I have used this restaurant for the past nine years on weekend visits to Bognor but for the last time. Last night the service was awful, we waited 20 minutes before anyone came near us and nearly 1.1/2 hours for our order with no apology or explanation by which time hunger had almost passed. The food when it came was ok and when the bill came I was going to argue some money off but decided to just pay up and I will not be using that restaurant again. My guests live in Bognor Regis and they are regular users and they will not be using the restaurant again either. Our preferred restaurant will be The Cardoman Bay in future. There was not a single apology or excuse, the people on the next table had been waiting longer than us. I think they were prioritising take away orders. I see that I am not the only one to complain about the poor service

Michael Wilkinson

Name: Swanbourne Lodge
Title: could do better in such scenic location
Review: look amazing from outside with big sign saying Sunday roast but not available on Sunday, fine we tried what on the special board . the staff have no idea what's on the special board, fine we showed her. ask for medium cook liver bacon got a dried flip flop instead. OK thats fine but the drinks are overpriced. £2.70 for coco powder and warm coffee and weak mug of tea? polite young staffs but unhappy senior staff and chef thats can make Gordon Ramsey sound elegant

Name: Fox Inn
Title: Lunch Visit
Review: Lovely pub with separate dining area to keep children from the bar. Food was well priced and came really quickly. Ordered 2 x Childrens Ham, Egg & Chips and there was plenty for a hungry 6 & 7 year old. Make sure you look at the specials board too... Steak & Veg Pie was a huge chuck of pure delightful melt in the mouth and the Soup on the Day (tomato & roasted red pepper) was perfect.. with just enough of a kick to make it the best I’ve ever had!! 7 Flavours of Ice Cream to chose from for after is a perfect touch!! Was recommended this place and will certainly be recommending it on!!

Name: Church Farm
Title: Incredible staff and wonderful memories made
Review:
I am a frequent visitor to Haven sites usually visit a few times every year and Church Farm is one of our favourite places to spend time. On our most recent visit (17-19 May 2019) I would like to express just how impressed I was. My 4 yr old twin girls took part in the mini archery, mini fencing and learn to bike sessions with Callum. His approach with them was brilliant, he was patient and kind and really helped them to enjoy all of the activities.

Ranger Oakley was also brilliant with my kids, my son did the fire lighting session and my girls were too young but Ranger Oakley took time to explain to the girls why and even let them observe the session from a safe distance (with me supervising them also). At the end he let them have a marshmallow and this extra effort he made really helped to prevent them feeling sad about not being able to participate.

I booked my son in for the football session and when we turned up he was the only one booked onto the session and I thought we may have to cancel, however, Harry (I think) the man running the session made a big fuss of my son saying they will do 1-1 skills session and adapt to what my son would like to work on. He really made an effort with him and my son thoroughly enjoyed that session. At the end of the session Callum and Ranger Oakley both joined in for a little while and honestly my son was totally made up with this. (He doesn’t have a dad so for me this boy-bonding with such positive male role models was absolutely incredible for him to experience). Id like to say a heart felt thank you to these three guys for going above and beyond to make such happy memories for my children.

The entertainment team in the Show bar were as always brilliant with the children and polite and kind at all times. The bar staff are always happy and I have never had to wait more than a few minutes for service even when the site is incredibly busy.

The site was spotless and well maintained and the caravans are always spotlessly clean and comfortable. The admin team are always helpful when I call (often ask to link bookings as we come with a group of friends, or at times when my dad has been a visitor they accommodate his limited mobility by situating us close to the amenities).

The security always do a great job and I feel very safe on this site at all times. Special thank you to Ray for his positivity and for always having a smile and a high five for my kids even after the 14,000th time of passing by.

Honestly, I can’t recommend Haven Church Farm enough. The staff’s dedication to their jobs are a real credit to the company. Thank you for helping me in making wonderful memories visit after visit with my children.
Read less

Name: Carlyle's Café
Title: Lovely atmosphere
Review: Popped in for the first time last month with a couple of family members and I am so pleased I did! Lovely clean establishment, polite and smiley staff and child friendly. Decent prices and delicious food, looking forward to returning ☺️

Name: Moathouse Café
Title: Lovely Lunchtime Treat
Review:
Visited with the family, husband and son loved it as they serve breakfast all day. Food great and you must try the ice cream milkshakes.
Big bonus is that is dog friendly too and they even supplied water and a sausage for her too.
Would visit again

Name: Masala Lounge
Title: Takeaway
Review: Received our takeaway meal last night, delivery man was very rude, literally no words spoken, apart from stating price. Unwrapping food was disappointed with the amount of oils that had spilled over in the bag which seeped into other items, thankfully the food was acceptable

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Not a very good advert
Review: Fairly busy Saturday,but no tables in restuarant as all reserved,but many empty. Very rude woman on bar wearing white shirt and black trousers. Food took an hour to arrive. Salad bar needs to be kept topped up as many bins empty. Mens toilet very scruffy and water everywhere. Come on Harvester get your act together. Had similar experience in Chesterfield. Will have to seriously think about using Harvester again

Name: Inglenook
Title: An amazing Christmas break
Review:
We have just had a wonderful Christmas break at the Inglenook.
From check in on Christmas Eve until we checked out on Friday 27th we have had a fantastic stay.
Our room was clean, comfortable and quiet and all the staff are very friendly and welcoming.
All our food was included in our break. There was so much thought put into the stay - the tables were beautifully presented and the food and the service was excellent throughout the stay. Father Christmas even paid a visit to the children at lunch time.
My husband and I have just enjoyed a lovely relaxing Christmas break and would highly recommend staying at the Inglenook at any time of the year.

Name: Fino
Title: Bland food.
Review:
Very bad experience, bland food, over priced, uninspiring menue.
This is not Italian at there best, perhaps they should look at other Italian menus to get an idea.
The table received the food extras well after the meal had arrived. This didn’t really matter as it all tasted the same.
This is ok if you only want to eat pizza otherwise compleatly skip on this place as it has to be the worst meal all 5 on our table had ever eaten, would not go back even if buy 1 meal and get 2 free.
Awarding 1 point as the ladies and gentleman’s toilets clean.

Name: Swanbourne Lodge
Title: Disappointing Sunday lunch
Review:
Heard they had started doing Sunday lunches so thought we'd give it a try. Meat overcooked, yorkshire puddings flat, broccoli anaemic. Reminded us of school food. When you're competing against the likes of nearby Red Lion for Sunday roast at a similar price, quality needs to be much better.

Hopefully just teething issues and they'll improve.

Name: Hotham Park
Title: Beautiful
Review:
Hotham Park is very well kept, mostly by vollunteers, it is worth a visit for a stroll a meal in the cafe or crazy golf. Ideal for all the family. Crowded at 0900 on Saturdays as the Bognor Regis Park Run is held here.
Read less

Name: Picturedrome
Title: Mary Poppins Film
Review:
Where else to see a traditional family film but in a Classic and authentic style picturedrome.
Comfortable and priced for all families to be able to enjoy.
Visit all and enjoy the atmosphere and comfort whilst saving your money unlike other places.
Read less

Name: Dee Dee's
Title: Breath of fresh retro air!
Review:
Clearly a lot of love and affection has gone into this renovation of this place from it's new owners!

A lovely retro 50's theme really stands out in this quaint village, with its bright colours and decor, even has a jukebox!

The food I tried was lovely, I had a sausage sandwich, and it was delicious! I'm fussy with sausages and these were excellent and bread was super fresh! An amazing selection of cakes, pastries and savoury bits available and I'm told a selection of cakes will be coming soon. Very tasty coffee too and a wide range of cold drinks in the retro coke fridge.

The two girls running the place are genuinely warm and welcoming and really make you feel at home and you can tell they really enjoy doing what they do!

Will definitely be telling everyone about this place!

Name: The Diner
Title: dreadful experience ☹️
Review:
Service is dreadful, staff standing around chatting so took a while to be seated, would only do drink orders to begin with (even though we were ready to order food) so had to wait for someone to come to order food back which took ages.

My wife ordered the salad, asking if she could have both the salmon and shrimp as she hadn’t eaten anything today, but was told this was not possible even though both on the menu. This was after placing the order as the waiter didn’t know where the dish was on his tablet then came back. She was advised that if she wanted the shrimp as well it had to be the starter??? Made no sense...

Drinks took ages (had to ask), food took ages (had to ask) then I sent my chicken and waffles back as it was over cooked, dry and burnt (see the photos). The bacon tasted of charcoal, the chicken breast was dry and chewy... even the waffle was crispy and overdone. How it cleared the pass I have no idea, but a replacement came out quite quickly so I assume I was given someone else’s dish. Sorry to whoever that was!!

Overall feeling was staff don’t care, they work hard to avoid your eye so they don’t have to come and help and service is far from important to them. A real shame as we really enjoyed the food the previous time we came... we won’t be going back

(10% off the bill after questioning why we were charged full price after our experience and still felt like they just didn’t care...)

Name: East Beach Café
Title: East beach cafe, littlehampton, west sussex
Review:
I booked based on information on a board inside the cafe. An evening of live music: french jazz. The music started whilst we were eating our starter. It consisted of one female singer with recorded music backing. As the base thudded she sang, very badly, mainly frank Sinatra type songs with an occasional french song thrown in. The noise was awful. I complained that this was not french, jazz, or live. All the reasons i booked. The manager approached, very tight lipped, saying that this was...
My friend suggested that it was better to pay and leave. Which we did. The rude attitude of the manager was wuite unacceptable . The starter was good. The evening an expensive disaster.

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: Nice stay
Review: This is a typical travel lodge. The room was a nice size, clean and comfortable. The breakfast was very good. We paid over the odds as it was Goodwood weekend but if you pay the normal travel lodge price it is value for money.

Name: Elmer Tandoori
Title: Overcharged on the bill £29. We were a party of 8.
Review: Overcharged on the bill £29. We were a party of 8. Only realised after checking the bill the next day. Ignored messages.

Name: Butlins
Title: Disappointing half term break
Review:
We booked a Gold apartment for 3 adults & 2 children February half term and were very disappointed: The accommodation smelt stale and was not clean when we moved in with a thick layer of dust on the dishwasher, rubbish down the back of the sofas, dirt, elastic bands and clips behind the bedroom drawers and stained bedroom curtains. We had only 1 dishwasher tablet left for the whole week and dirty wet towels we left on the floor were folded for us to reuse. We asked Guest Services what we might expect from daily housekeeping which we had paid for and were told only beds were made & bins emptied unless we requested otherwise. This is hardly daily housekeeping and we never saw the housekeeper to ask for more cleaning. Reception staff were apathetic to our complaints and so we bought some cleaning materials ourselves to get the job done. We could only access the cutlery drawer by opening the fridge door first (bizarre) and the fridge had door struts missing so the milk fell out every time it was opened! Entertainment and site facilities were generally good so it’s a great pity that the accommodation was such a let down. We filled in a satisfaction questionnaire and requested feedback but have received no response to date -again disappointing.
Read less

Name: Ocean Hotel & Spa
Title: Fab week stay - great fun
Review:
Just enjoying the final night of our stay at Butlins in this nice hotel.
Room and hotel have been of good standard and great value. We didn’t take the meal plan option but paid as we go... still good value and eat out of resort a few times which was nice. Fish and chip restaurant is a must... beachcomber pub served a great value breakfast too.
Nice running route along the sea front for a morning run. Staff were all brilliant, my teenagers had a great time. Evening Entertainment has been fabulous too. Thank you Butlins - just what the doctor ordered!

Name: East Beach
Title: High standards continue to be maintained
Review: Stayed here for the second time this year. The usual high standards were present: 1) warm welcome from Anthony, 2) great breakfast, 3) very clean room, 4) hot shower with great water pressure. Walking along the beach in the winter season is still a great experience, and the location is perfect for that. I'll be back next year.

Name: LA Café
Title: Awful ordering
Review: I'm not one to complain but as I phoned this cafe up to order some breakfast on a Monday morning, they never answer the phone. This is not the first time it has taken me at least 6 calls to try and get through to them I tried online and they wouldn't take the payment for some unknown reason. Also as they have a minimum for delivery I though I would not be charged but they seem to add a 2 pound charge even after the 13 pound minimum order. Very disappointed with the customer service well lack of it.

Name: Parsons Table
Title: Exceptional lunch
Review: Visited the Parsons Table for lunch today and had the most delightful hake. Great dining - thank you.

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: Third rate hotel
Review:
hugely overpriced
bedroom not made up,no soap in shower. Poor decoration,no bar, no restaurant only a vending machine.
Generally very very very bad value for the money. Although there was a revival on in Goodwood and bedrooms in the area were hard to come by there is no way an hotel of this standard should be allowed to charge £148.00 a night.

Name: Arundel Historic Tours
Title: Martin the postman
Review:
We saw an advert at our campsite for walking tours, and decided to try.
Absolutely brilliant. We learned so much, Martin was very interesting but didn’t overload us with too many facts and figures.
I’m sure it lasted more than usual as we were the only guests and we found him fascinating.
Thank you.
£5 well spent, worth every penny.

Name: La Campagnia
Title: Lively and friendly!
Review: This is a restaurant with a good buzz. For an October mid week it was well frequented. I was with a group and most dishes looked good. The sardine starter I had was a little disappointing, it was one sardine and not with a huge amount of flavour. The main course was very good and the desert too.

Name: Rustington Manor
Title: Terrible
Review:
I went to ladies that lunch at Rustington manor this week. The speaker was excellent.
However everything else was appalling. Firstly the service. They take orders before the speaker giving the kitchen a good hour to prepare. But instead of bringing the meals for one table at a time, the staff wander around asking who ordered what. Two ladies on my table received their meal at least 10mins before the rest. The vegetables which came first, were cold by the time all meals arrived. So the service is chaos.
I ordered chicken Caesar salad. After one mouthful I didn't eat it. No crisp lettuce, no croutons and no parmesan cheese. Chunks of chicken in a dreadful sauce. The other meals were no better. Burnt salmon and a burger bun still partly frozen.
I doubt any of us will go again, which is a shame as we enjoy the speakers.
The food and the service needs to be vastly improved!

Name: Black Horse
Title: Birthday Meal
Review: We took Mum for her 88th Birthday. Attentive, pleasant, lovely staff. Good choice of food on menu, to suit all tastes. Food delicious- only disappointment we were all too full after starter and mains to partake in their scrumptious sounding puds !! Highly recommend. Booking necessary as very popular. Hope you enjoy it as much as we did.

Name: Pagham Beach Café
Title: Good service,tasty food
Review: We happened on this place while out walking. It might have only been a cheese salad baguette but it was very tasty!

Name: Harbour Park
Title: Children's paradise
Review:
Children love the variety of rides. Water flume, large slide and many more.good value if wristband purchased for the day which provides limitless rides all day.
Read less

Name: La Cucina
Title: AWFUL PIZZA'S
Review: Visited La Cucina on Thursday evening after travelling from London. The restaurant presents a very inviting ambiance and the service is very good. However my wife and I both ordered a well done pizza. It arrived at our table looking ok, however the middle of the pizza had under cooked dough under the topping which was also under cooked. We were both tired after our trip and were not in a mood to complain.On paying we were asked if everything was ok. At this point I voiced my opinion of the pizza. I got a usual answer "You are the only one to complain". I feel so privileged to be the only one. Maybe I am used to real Italian wood fired pizzas.

Name: The Gravy Boat
Title: GREAT SUNDAY ROAST
Review:
First time of going here and we wasn’t disappointed we had the carvery and it was brilliant lots of everything.
If you choose the large plate don’t even bother having a starter or pud you will be full.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Breakfast
Review: Gavin was pleasant in seating is promptly and the manager Kate came over and checked our breakfast was to our satisfaction.. all in all a great start to the day

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Totally incompetent
Review:
After deciding to spend the day at the adjacent Harbour Park, we decided to have lunch here. Fair enough, we hadn't booked, and it was full. This we were told after waiting 10 minutes for anyone to come to us. Advised we could book for an hour later, which we did. However, when we returned, while there was a table for us, we were told there was a wait of at least an hour for food, so our children would have had to have waited 2 hours. If there was a wait for food then, then presumably there was when we went in earlier, but no mention of it, no apology, just a shrug of the shoulders.
So, can't comment on the food or the service if you ever get served. Instead we went back to Harbour Park and had tasty chips in the cafe there, brought within 5 minutes and much cheaper.

Name: Butlins
Title: Terrible food and room
Review:
We arrived just after 1 we picked up all are Kay’s but we were told that we could get in at 3pm Wich we were ok with but the. Things went down hill the keys would not open are door but when I went to see why I was told that are keys were set up for 4pm Wich really wasn’t good we then went to the yacht club we had payed for premium dining but at best I compared to standard the food was over cooked the attitude of the staff was poor we were made to feel so unwelcome when we went to complain we were told simply Nothing they could Wich really ruined our holiday we have wasted so much money for a service we haven’t received when we got in are room are light looked like it was just stuck there broken tiles it certainly not worth paying for the silver rooms
Read less

Name: Premier Inn Arundel
Title: Superheated room beyond belief
Review:
Please hire mobile air con units

If you put a dog in the room you would be closed by the RSPCA why should it be different for a human

The corridors are cooler

The temperature in the room was being circulated by the fan not cooling the room

This wasn’t the hottest week of the summer but the room stat showed 29 degrees Celsius

The food and service was excellent but let down by lack focus on client comfort regarding heat
Read less

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Disgrace
Review:
Visited the gardens of this beautiful castle today. A stunning setting. Unfortunately it was ruined by the attitude of the meet and greet lady. She’d never heard of Foster Carers let alone a discount. Then her attitude to a Veteran was serving personnel only. Not a great ambassador or example in front of foster children.
Read less

Name: The Alex
Title: Noisy
Review:
I live a few feet away from this pub and they have no respect for licensing laws or the surrounding neighborhood. Regular lock ins, loud music blasting across the area until way past closing time, idiots (including the staff) shouting and arguing in the garden while in a shameful state.

Shut up or the police are getting involved. I moved here to study and won't struggle with my degree just because the owners of this pub have no respect for the town they serve.

Name: Linden Fisheries
Title: New ownership is not a good thing.
Review: Established owners who won the awards and consistently produced good quality food have now retired. New owners are pleasant but cod now has skin on and is a smaller cheaper cut. Batter not as good and chips pretty ordinary. Have recommended this place for nearly 20 years, not now. Previous comment about former owner being rude is not the experience I and many hundreds of others, including all those charities he helped, had but each to their own. Was the best chip shop in the area in my view with honest and friendly service. New owners need to change their offer or will struggle.

Name: Flying Fortress
Title: Total Rip Off!!
Review:
Came for a visit today with two children under two, after waiting for 20 minutes in the food queue to then be called and what an utter disappointment! Had macaroni cheese which cost just short of £7! To be greeted to a desert bowl of about four mouthfuls of macaroni cheese! Utter disgrace for the price! Talk about over charge it’s a joke! Plus environment heath need calling which I will be making a call as the whole place needs a deep clean especially those so called toilets! For the prices sort it out!!!!!
Read less

Name: The Lamb Inn
Title: Food was great, but the time taken to receive service was not!
Review:
I had to contact the service person after 25 minutes to clear the table fom the main course, this resulted in a further 20 minute wait before the table was cleared and the dessert menue was offerred. Forom ordering the desserts, it took a further 20 minutes to receive the food.

There was clearly an understaffing of service providers and this was confirmed by the response when I contacted the service Person who's answer was "we are very busy". Poorly managed and no apology.

Food good, but dont go unless you have all the time in the world to live with long delays!

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Charming Hotel with Oodles of Character
Review:
The Norfolk Arms is a charming hotel with bags of character based right in the heart of Arundel. The first thing you will notice with this hotel is how friendly all the staff were. From the reception desk, to the bar staff, to the cleaners. Always polite and helpful.
The hotel is clearly old, and weaving through its corridors and stairways gives a real sense of its history. The room itself was tastefully decorated and very clean. The bathroom in our room did not have a shower, but the bath added to the overall relaxing experience.
For £5 a night we were able to leave our car in the car park. The location of the hotel meant we could enjoy a full day walking on the South Downs without having to drive.
The breakfast included was continental followed by a full English, vegetarian option or fish breakfast available. All very nice, but if there was one small criticism, the sausages could be improved.
There are plenty of bars and restaurants within a couple of minutes walk. However we enjoyed the beer in both of the hotel bars.
The deal we had on this room was amazing, and it would be hard to stay anywhere for that price.
Overall a wonderful weekend away in a wonderful hotel. Highly recommended!
Read less

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Poor service
Review:
We had booked a table and were kept waiting for a good 5 mins before anyone actually acknowledged us. We get seated and about 5 mins a women came over and took our order. We patiently waited as it was busy other people were getting impatient but we weren’t. Our food came out and it was all slapped together not worth the £11.49 that they were charging for the vegan burger. The lady who served us was doing too much at once serving about 15 tables at a time which is ridiculous! We ordered 3 refills which we had one drink then the machine broke down. Once we had finish we asked for
Bill got the wrong table bill took me a further 5 mins to get the woman back to say it was the wrong bill. I gave the lady cash she said she would be back with change I said ok thank you. She actually thought I was gonna let have the £6 tip I don’t leave more than £3 in a top high end restaurant let alone here after this service. I the followed and said about
My change who she replied I thought you didn’t want the change! I’ve given this place a dozen chances everytime I come here there’s always something. I no the feeling of it being busy and I was patient I don’t moan etc but it’s everytime I attend here for
Lunch/dinner.
Disappointing as they have such a good vegan range. :(

Name: Village House
Title: Village house hotel
Review:
Looks lovely from outside. However the rooms are so old and in need of renovation. Rooms
Iook like a care home. Food average. Had to wait a long time for breakfast & this was annoying as we were in a hurry to leave.

Name: Mustards
Title: Best Sirloin
Review: Great service and food . We had a large group and everyone commented on how good their meal was . I opted for the sirloin which I don’t normally choose and it was probably the best I have had , cooked to perfection. The staff were very attentive and the whole evening was a success and the entire party all enjoyed themselves.. This restaurant is a great addition to the town and hopefully it continues like that and doesn’t allow the bar to get overrun by loud young men from the town spoiling it for the diners ..

Name: Parsons Table
Title: Parsons Table - excellent lunch
Review:
We'd booked well in advance and saw several parties who hadn't booked, walk away as there were no available tables. It started badly for me, as the Vegetarian options (Gnocci and Cauliflower) were ones that I'd had recently elsewhere and didn't want again. I explained this and they asked what I'd like; they rose to the occasion and presented us with a lovely three course lunch. We had an excellent Sancerre to accompany the meal.
Truly excellent.

Name: Fusion
Title: Not impressed
Review: Six of us visited to celebrate a birthday on a Friday evening. We were the only customers in the restaurant. Ordered our pizzas, first one arrived, then over five minutes later the next pizza arrived, then over five minutes later the next one arrived.... you get my drift. By the time the last pizza arrived the first one was nearly finished. Round pizzas served on square plates overhanging the edges! Weird. No choice of red wine. Extremely confusing gin list. Music far too loud. Personally I won't be going back. I wish i had read the previous reviews about them only being able to cook one pizza at a time.

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Tasteless turkey
Review: Been here 4years running for our Christmas do and the turkey has always been the best, this year however I think they must have a new supplier (cheaper) it’s was tasteless and could have been anything! The whole place appears to have gone downhill , desperately needs a shake up as this used to be a fantastic pub!

Name: Black Horse
Title: Father’s Day Lunch - rude manager !
Review:
We visited the Black horse for Father’s Day for Sunday
Lunch and waited over and hour for our Main course,
and when I mentioned this to the Manager he was
extremely rude and not sympathetic to his customer
at all - he just seemed to think he was in the right and
didn’t seem to have the no how to deal with the situation
just have an aggressive manner, after this confrontation
we all got up and left his pub as we didn’t feel welcome
and we also felt why should we spend our money with
such an arrogant manager at the helm, we will certainly
not return!!!

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Vastly improved
Review: Having visited Establo a few months ago in the summer and having to leave a less than impressive review, I am happy to have had a much better experience this week. It seems a lot more organised, staff are clearing tables faster, the food now arrives hot instead of cold - overall a much more enjoyable time at Establo! It was a great addition to the village when it first opened and that enthusiasm had somewhat lacked in the last year. However it seems it is back on track and thriving once again!!

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Awful
Review: Booked a table for 7 place was In chaos. Sat and had to ask the waiters in the end to take our order 25 mins later the drinks arrived . Salad bar was disgusting hardly any choices with mess and old food, bowls were dirty. We then waited for an hour and no food arrived so we walked out in the end. Such a shame as it spoilt the evening . Drinks arrived in dirty glasses too :( don’t go there unless you like a long wait dirty salad bar and chaos

Name: George & Dragon
Title: Evening meal with grandparents
Review: Fantastic food great service and friendly traditional atmosphere definitely worth a visit highly recommend!!

Name: McDonald's
Title: Bad language
Review: I don’t appreciate coming to McDonald’s with my children on Friday evening 4th October and two colleagues (females with glasses and a black high bun each) talking to each other and one of them says “for f@£k sake” in front of my 9 and 6 year old. NOT IMPRESSED. Thought this restaurant was meant to be family friendly!!

Name: Ye Olde Fish and Chippe Shoppe
Title: A local gem
Review: Well worth a visit - fish cooked to order so there is a small but worthwhile wait. The quality of the fish and batter is exceptional. Pies are made by the butcher next door.

Name: Avisford
Title: How can Hilton have a Hotel like this?
Review:
I stay in many hotels around the world and have stayed in various Hilton’s where you expect a certain quality, hence the reason I booked this hotel for a weekends stay whilst at the GoodWood Members Meeting.

I was shocked when I walked into my room to see how poorly kept and badly maintained the room was.

Wallpaper was stained and peeling off the walls.

Skirting boards were cracked and coming away from the walls.

Ceiling in the room was showing cracks and starting to bow.

Ceiling and walls in the bathroom were covered in damp patches and the paint was flaking off.

Dead flies on window sill and all edges of the window the sealant was cracked and covered in grime.

For the price I paid this is honestly the worst Hotel I have ever stayed in and the Hilton should be ashamed to be charging people to stay in such a shocking environment.

When I approached the front desk staff they said they would offer me a discount of £20 as a good will gesture.

STAY AWAY
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Xmas fantasy
Review:
We have been coming to butlin's for the last four years and we have always enjoyed it. 2 out of the 4 visits was with the sun but this year we have booked direct. The only complaint we have is that so many of the people who booked with the sun get upgraded, we have never had that privilege and just wandered if people who book direct ever have that privilege. Apart from that query we would recommend it whole heartedly. The staff the entertainment is brilliant but the queue is horrendous for the pantomime we had to queue for an hour to get a seat where our grandson could see. I think that it is unrealistic to expect children to queue for this length of time.
As we have already booked for this December shows that we love butlin's at Christmas
Thanks butlin's for making my grandson a very happy boy.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Bognor Vs skegness
Review:
I've been going to Skegness for about 5 years in a row so decided to try bognor for a change, it cost £100 more and was worth £100 less. As soon as we arrived we were sent to wrong check in point. Back to right one with all our luggage. Given our accomodation details as far away as possible from check in building to find it was already occupied. Back all the way to check in to be asked if I'd gone to the right place. They checked up and blamed a"misprint" with booking reference sent to so called gold apartment that looked like a silver quality with extra bits added. Damp smell in dishwasher area. On Thurs night around midnight there was a slug near dishwasher. No rain all week so that wasn't the cause of it. Complained on Fri morn to guest services and " they can't help what comes in from outside" no apology or anything. 1st and last holiday in Butlins bognor. Fairground apartment in Skegness last year was10 times better for about £100 less
Read less

Name: Sen
Title: excellent!!!
Review: This is the best place in Bognor. amazing food, amazing people, amazing atmosphere!! highly recommended if you want to eat the best seafood in bognor and feel the mediterranean atmosphere.

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: Shout out to Karim & Emily
Review:
We came here (Butlins) for a 60th birthday celebration weekend knowing we would want some food when we arrived on Friday night, and Friday being the day of fish and chips we headed straight here.
There was 11 of us in total and from the moment we arrived to the time we left we were all really well looked after by Karim and his team.
The drinks menu is pretty comprehensive for a chip shop restaurant and myself and my partner enjoyed a couple of delicious cocktails (2 for £10) while others had wine, beer and soft drinks.
Food order was taken by Emily and it all came out pretty promptly. I had the chicken pie and I can honestly say it's the best pie I have had for a long while and everyone else commented how tasty their food was.
Everyone's food was hot, plentiful and very tasty. Not an empty plate at the table.
Might be coming back for a homemade fish finger sandwich for lunch today......
Thank you again Karim and Emily for a lovely meal, great service and lovely atmosphere.

Name: Papa Johns, Butlins
Title: Family day
Review: Greeted with a smile from Amanda, served efficiently and friendly staff. We had the buffet lunch which the kiddies loved. Pizza was hot and salad was lovely and fresh with a great choice. Will definitely be back on our next day out at butlins.

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Oh dear...
Review: First the good points...the location is wonderful, the staff are reasonable. But...the food has never been it's strong point. Popped in last night and had 2 prawn and avocado starters, a single portion of sweet potato fries , a pint and an apple juice (£28!). The picture does not do full justice to the food, old mushy brown speckled avocado, tasteless scraggy tiny bits of prawn and a tasteless watery sauce. Chaps, must try harder, this was appalling. 5 stars for location, as for the rest ...Oh dear.

Name: Fino
Title: Lovely meal
Review:
We had read a lot of bad reviews about Fino but we decided to give it a try.
We went with friends and had a lovely evening. The staff are very friendly and efficient. The food was good and plenty of it. Previous complaints said the portions were small but for us they were ample. All our dishes were beautifully cooked and flavoursome. We were so impressed we have booked for Valentine Day.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Shocking
Review:
I have given this place chances across 7 years of travelling to Littlehampton to visit family but have never had a decent meal.

This one actually topped it though. Went for breakfast - took 40 minutes for our cold breakfast to be brought to us.
Mine was freezing cold and the plate swimming in grease so I returned it and asked for it to be taken off of the bill. No problem.

When we went to pay, my husband explained the issue to the member of staff and that we have had previous issues to which her blasé response was "well, I recommend you stop coming back then. It's just as bad to work here".

Explains everything.

Name: The Thatched House
Title: Great place for a drink and/or meal
Review: Welcomed immediately by attentive staff. Excellent meals and drinks by our part of six. Will return soon.

Name: Wheatsheaf
Title: Inexpensive but uninspiring and not worth eating out for
Review:
We ate on a Monday night enticed by the "kids eat for £1" offer.
Walking in from the carpark you have to enter through the bar and everyone turned to look at us. I strongly considered leaving and going elsewhere. It just felt too pubby to be a family dining venue.
The kids were happy enough with their mini toad in the hole - it really was mini though, shame a larger version isn't available for older kids as at least it's a bit different to the options on every other kids menu.
I ordered a pie which was really not worth it - I'd have got a better one out of a freezer box from the supermarket.
Hubby got sausage and mash which were fine.
The kids of course wanted the build your own sundae which they were pleased with.
Service was slow, no one came to clear our plates and I had to chase up on our food as it was taking so long to appear.
Overall if you are eating out for anything other than necessity I wouldn't bother.

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: lunch on sunday
Review: we went here for the first time last sunday for breakfast, the staff all seem nice and polite, but when the food came it wasn't very warm, egg wasn't cooked properly and there was a hair in mine, I also asked for no chocolate on my capp, it came with chocolate, she offered to change it, but I just had it . I mentioned this to the bar staff, and they said sorry, so we gave it another go today, thinking maybe it was a one off, the egg was good and no hair, but the food was stone cold, and again cappo had chocolate, also the brown and white toast mixed up on wrong plates, my husband doesn't like me to complain, he just says no fuss, we wont come back, I totally agree with him on this point we will not b back. I also saw that dogs are allowed inside the pub where people are eating, I personally don't like this.

Name: The Mezze
Title: Fun eve out with great food and atmosphere
Review: Group of us on a sat eve. Relaxed atmosphere even though a busy restaurant. Several large groups so service was a bit slow but the food was absolutely fabulous and worth the wait. Table of eight but my friend and I had the mezze for two. Yummy and lots of it. Liked the interaction between waiters and customers. Bongo playing for happy birthday. I may have got up and danced with them and showed them some belly dance moves. Really enjoyable eve. Not too expensive. Will defo go again x

Name: La Campagnia
Title: New Years Eve
Review: Got a table on New Years Eve without a booking. However restaurant was fairly full. Menu very Italian and had all the usual suspects. All the food and wine were very good. Nice evening.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: What a difference a week made
Review: Me and my family visited this harvester on the 2nd of June and the service was brilliant, couldn't fault it. But one week later wow. on the 9th June we Visited again. I had a operation on my mouth and couldn't eat much so i only wanted a few spoon full of my sons yogurt and a sip off his coffee. But i was told i had to pay £3.99 for 2 spoons of yogurt and £2.99 for a sip off coffee. the way the waiter and manger spoke to me i was so embarrassed and felt so upset. A few time before that at different harvesters they let me do it.

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: Very disappointing experience
Review: Kept my husband and son waiting a long time to have drinks and food order taken last night. An unfortunate mix up with the staff led to this. Husband’s drink had blue tissue in it. To be fair he didn’t raise this as an issue and I am sure it would have been resolved if he had but by that stage he just wanted to pay and leave. Food ok. Overall a very disappointing experience.

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: Best restaurant in Butlins
Review: During our stay we visited most of the food outlets in the resort. In my opinion this was the best food with the best service. Whilst my family had the traditional fish and chips, I had the Sea Bass. All the food was cooked well and well presented. The staff were cheerful and attentive. In fact, one of the chefs came out and did magic tricks with the children. I would recommend this venue to anyone staying in Butlins.

Name: Reema
Title: Terrible
Review:
No Indian taste is all rubbish .customer service is horrible.
Nonsense restaurant rule if u are 3 people u have to order 3 main course. What kind of uk law is this ??

Name: Butlins
Title: Poor
Review:
The new Splash pool changing rooms are absolutely disgusting. The floors are covered in gunk. There was a soiled nappy trapped between the baby changing unit and the wall in our changing unit - woman at front desk seemed utterly uninterested. I was expecting Splash to be something better than, or at least on a par with Centre Parcs - it is nowhere near that level. Woburn Forest which was opened 5 years before this over-hyped Butlins water park is just head and shoulders above it. Main buildings are very tired and worn looking. We had a photo shoot at Splash and after we had walked around the pool areas taking photos were told to return the next day, I explained the next day we would be about 200 miles away, and asked why I wasn't explained that beforehand, girl shrugged and said contact guest services. Went to guest services, closed. Phoned them the next day, then told to phone photo booth, several calls later was told I couldn't have them due to GDPR. Contacted customer service ... not interested in my issue, nor my time being wasted like this, and when I said that they should tell customers that if their photos were taken after 4pm, that they had to be in the resort in person the next day to collect them (ie not to waste our time as customers in a fruitless excercise), customer service respond, and I quote 'your comments regarding this being communicated to guests will be kept in mind for future discussions'. That they will only 'keep' this 'in mind' for 'future discussions' makes me think someone needs firing in their customer service department, and as for my wasted time just an empty word 'sorry', not even "oh hey look you wasted part of your day and an hour or so trying to get your photos by contacting guest services, etc, as the girl advised you to do, here's a 5 pence voucher to buy a sweetie". I got nothing for that, just "Yeah, sorry about that". If you think that is customer service, honestly you need to have a massive rethink.
Read less

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Terrible experience in restaurant
Review: Inedible food. Both meals returned. Offered a complimentary dessert but declined. Manager didn't even come over and apologise.

Name: WWT Wetland
Title: Always a great day out
Review:
Love visiting here as it's really accessible for me in my manual wheelchair. There's plenty to see on the way round and the majority of paths are tarmac or boardwalk with only a few slopes - the route to the butterfly garden is woodchip (I think) so that's more tricky to wheel over and I've only tried that once because it's too difficult. Hides have ramps and wheelchair areas inside, so you can get up close to the wildlife.

Since visiting earlier this year, they've improved accessibility even further by getting rid of the manual double doors and replacing with a wide single door which is operated by a push pad, making it much easier to open.

Staff are always friendly, I once had to get a chap to push me back up the slope from the pond dipping shed because it's very steep, and he was very helpful.

Diving duck feed is fun and informative and the boat trip is always a treat, staff friendly and knowledgeable, and it's a lovely way to relax after wandering round.
Read less

Name: Parpadelle
Title: Always delightful
Review: One of our favourite stops. The staff at Osteria (which we have nicknamed 'copper tables') always provide smiles, friendly greetings to go alongside beautifully presented coffee, delicious cakes and yummy food. Even when dealing with 'difficult' people which we witnessed today ( If you do not want to share a table don't go to a restaurant where long sharing tables are a feature !!!) the service at Osteria is first rate.

Name: Premier Inn Littlehampton
Title: Not to the usual standard
Review:
I have visited and stayed at many Premier Inn hotels and this is one of the worst. I spent 2 weeks in the annex on the ground floor and the sound proofing between the upper and lower floors is non existent. At 5am every morning the elephant in the room above me started to get ready for work but, what sounded like training circuits in military boots. The pub restaurant next door and part of the hotel group would get minus 3 points from me. Dirty, plaster hanging off the walls, feet stick to the carpet and food terrible. Come on Whitbread spend some of the Costa money on you hotels
Read less

Name: Charcoal Grill Meze
Title: Twice in one week!
Review: Yes .... good enough to warrant two visits in one week ... good menu, wonderful flavours, generous portions & great hospitality in pleasant surroundings. A special mention to Neil for introducing us to owners & chefs alike & for ensuring both visits were so memorable. Good luck guys in your new venture.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Great food
Review:
Called in for a meal after being out for the morning, were seated straight away and offered drinks that arrived quickly.
We both ordered a burger meal, they were very nice.
The staff were friendly (Megan and Lucy) were our waitresses.
After we were offered a dessert but we couldn’t eat anything else.
We will be returning there again with family and/or friends as is a nice friendly atmosphere with good service...

Name: Sea View
Title: Excellent Meal
Review: Visiting friends in East Preston who took us to the Seaview. Excellent varied menu, friendly helpful staff. Had the veggie cottage pie with cheese mash & fresh veggies. This was so tasty with beautifully cooked veg. All the meals were fresh & beautifully presented. All four of us felt the atmosphere was great. You can also take dogs here if you wish. Will definitely go back when we come to visit our friends again.

Name: Cardanom Bay
Title: Disappointing
Review: Let me say at the outset that this is a popular restaurant that has a good reputation. On the Saturday night we visited it was busy and people seemed to be enjoying themselves. The ambience is good and the staff are friendly and attentive. But...we had a bit of a nightmare. One dish had to be returned uneaten as it was too tough to cut, never mind eat, And of the other three starters and two mains we tried there was a distinct lack of flavour or spice. Perhaps we were just unlucky, a busy restaurant on a Saturday night with a chef under pressure, but spending £107 for three people (no deserts but a few drinks) we were so disappointed. When the meal peaks with the poppadoms you’ve got to be a bit deflated, and on this occasion it did.

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Very cozy atmosphere
Review: We met friends here on a chilly Monday night. It was fairly quiet with only a couple of tables taken but that didn’t detract from the atmosphere. I ordered a vegetarian dish and my husband had a burger, not very big but nice. The menu is quite varied along with tapas which we didn’t try. We had churros with chocolate and caramel sauce which were scrumpy. I would definitely visit again when in the area. Apparently it’s fab in the summer with an outside veranda and the doors slid open.

Name: WWT Wetland
Title: Loved it
Review:
It was a wet day but we enjoyed the wildlife and the excellent cafe for tea. Good shop too! Bring a brolly!
Read less

Name: White Horses
Title: Lovely comfortable stay witb delicious breakfast
Review: Had a lovely stay whilst visiting family. Stayed on my own with 2 young children. Very friendly and helpful hosts. Breakfast is delicious! Beds are very comfortable and room is very clean yet homely. Great value!

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Birthday meal
Review: Lovely staff very helpful but food was poor not very hot small portions was shocked at the state of the chairs upholstery was stained really bad looked dirty would not go back such a shame as everyone was so nice that served us I had pie over cooked most of my friends had apple pie but was very small & not hot all served on cold plates

Name: Moathouse Café
Title: The morning after the night before!!
Review: Fantastic cafe serving fantastic food from extensive menu. All freshly cooked. Had, full English, 2 vegetarian breakfasts and smoked salmon on toast with poached eggs. Brilliant value for menu. 100% recommended. Will be going again

Name: Premier Inn Littlehampton
Title: Yet another stay at this hotel
Review:
We have stayed here many times now and find the staff first class and the rooms clean and everything works as it should, the breakfast is always cooked to order and the choice is varied , altogether a pleasant stay again.
Read less

Name: Church Farm
Title: Nostalgic trip back to Church Farm
Review:
We came here on the Sun Newspaper £9.50 holidays and I chose Church Farm as I had many holidays and happy memories coming here every year as a child before Haven took it over so it was a real nostalgic experience.
We were greeted by Ray who is on the security gate as you enter, very nice chap who made us very welcome. The check in staff were very professional and polite.
When I booked the holiday I upgraded to a comfort plus caravan and we were extremely happy with it as it had multi room heating, as the weather was very cold this was a bonus. We were in Ballast Rise which isn’t too far away from the entertainment and swimming pool etc so it was a nice short walk to get there.
Our only gripe when we entered the van was that the cleaners hadn’t hoovered the floor and dining benches and they were covered in bread crumbs.
We were given a three bedded caravan and this was very welcome as when we hired a high chair for my friends little toddler the very helpful chap that bought it along didn’t hesitate when I asked if he could move the single beds in one of the rooms so we could place the travel cot in there.
You will need to bring your own cleaning products i.e washing up liquid, washing up sponges and tea towels and oven gloves. There’s lots of cutlery, utensils and crockery supplied though. Nice big TV too.
The park is very well maintained, we loved the indoor swimming pool, the amusement arcade and soft play area was such fun for the little one. There is a restaurant called Mash and Barrel which we ate in one afternoon, the food was really good. There is a shop on site too, but further down the road is a local Tesco express and near the seafront is a CoOp.
We also used the local Chinese takeaway along the road just about a one minute drive from the site called Jasmines, very good food.
We will definitely come here again and looking forward to next time.
Read less

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: 2 stars
Review: Customer service was shocking. Food was alright but bought out while still eating the salad bowl and was just dumped on the table

Name: The Lamb Inn
Title: Good food
Review:
Just come back from the Lamb 2nd time this week food is excellent for the money,very good service by the girls who know what they are talking about food wise.
Will be going back next time we are down
From Birmingham

Name: The Swan
Title: Hopefully just a blip
Review: The food and service have been pretty good recently but the menu seems to have gone too fancy. Spicy harissa lamb was not just rare it was uncooked and wasn’t really spicy. Tried hard with the fish pie but I succumbed finally to the lack of seasoning and abundance of dill. Shame because it’s a great pub.

Name: Riverside
Title: Terrible derelict site
Review: We've just come back from our 4 night stay and we'll never go back ever again. The caravan was filthy with ripped and black sofas. The site looked derelict with a shut locked up soft play, not a single soul in the swimming pool area. We had a basic bronze caravan so we didn't expect much but clean would be nice. We ended up sleeping there but dining out and spending our days out in Butlins instead. Will never go back again.

Name: Bognor Museum
Title: Interesting and free !
Review:
Great to visit rain or shine ! Lots of interesting displays ! Set in a nice old building, this museum just a stones throw from the front is a great must see for all ages !
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Awful stay
Review:
I booked a 4 night break to Butlins in Bognor Regis for my son’s 2nd birthday. We arrived on Monday 10th June to find there was no entrance for those on foot (we travelled by train) we then had to stand in the pouring rain until a staff member found our booking and told us where to check in. You cannot enter your apartment until 4pm so that is a waste of 1 day. We got to our standard apartment in Egret Avenue to discover cigarette ends and broken glass outside the door. Entering the property there was a distinct smell of cannabis. It got worst the more I looked around the apartment. The table was broken, there was thick dust everywhere, the kitchen sides hadn’t been cleaned, there was chunks missing out the floor and table, the bathroom had blood marks on the walls and hair/dust everywhere. The toilet was broken and the whole apartment needed renovating. There was no way I was staying in that apartment regardless of price. I complained to the lady in the Oyster Bay Reception and showed her the pictures of the apartment. She rang someone who said I can be moved to a different apartment.
