Luckily enough we were moved right next door to my sister and her family. We decided to check out what the resort had on offer... except everything was shut except the arcades and a few restaurants. I assumed it was because it was late in the evening. The next morning my fiancé was making us a cup of tea when the kettle blew up and threw boiling water all over the kitchen narrowly missing my son. This had also tripped the electrics meaning we had no electricity. My partner went to guest services and explained what had happened. He was told it was a priority and would be sorted within 2 hours and someone would come and clean up the water. We stayed in the apartment for 3 hours waiting, but no one turned up. We had to go out as my son was throwing an absolute fit at being stuck indoors. I assumed someone may come and sort it whilst we were out. Unfortunately not. We got home to no electricity and a wet floor still. My fiancé decided to sort the electrics himself and we cleaned up the floor. My fiancé is Type 1 diabetic and needs the fridge to keep his insulin cold. Luckily the fridge remained at a cool level. We never heard anything back from guest services or maintenance during our short stay. We then decided to take advantage of the new swimming pool. Unfortunately the main pool and wave pool was much too cold for my son. He ended up with blue lips so we had to leave there. The children's pools were warm, but much too crowded to actually do anything. We then decided to do some rides, only to find it all shut down. We had no idea that pretty much everything on the resort shuts at 5pm. In summer. Including the pool. This is ridiculous. We decided to go and try The Diner for dinner... which was shut. Then we thought we will try Scoop the ice cream parlour, this was also shut. By this point I had already had enough. What the hell did I pay £400+ for? They charge you for EVERYTHING regardless if you have a pass. Want to ride a go cart? That’s £6 per go! Want to ride a dune buggy? That’s £2 for 1 go. Want to ride the new VR machines? That’s £5 per person. Want to play mini golf? Thats more money. Want to rent a family bike? Thats £9 for 30 minutes. We couldn’t use the outside parks because they were under maintenance. We couldn’t use the soft play throughout our stay as 1 it was just too busy and 2 the toddler section was overrun by bigger kids bullying little ones. So our days consisted of walking around or spending more money on the arcades. I was extremely disappointed. On Wednesday evening after another nightmare of a day (being turned away from the pool because it was for hotel users only in the morning, to finding restaurants shut again and eating the same thing for the third time) we decided enough was enough and we left Thursday a day earlier than planned. There was no one in guest services or reception to check out or to complain to, so we dropped our keys in a box and left. I have never EVER been so appalled by a resort for families in my life. I will never go back. I’ve complained via email and asked for a full refund.
Read less

Name: The Beresford
Title: Terrible
Review: Went there for xmas day lunch. Starters were served almost as soon as we sat down at our table. No service to speak of, had to fetch our own drinks from the bar. The carvery was terrible, small and badly cooked. Veg was swimming in water and sprouts could have been used for field artillery. Staff dumped black bags next to us and were clearing table as we were eating. Will not go here again, 2nd time at this tired cavery same bad experience

Name: Wheatsheaf
Title: Christmas lunch
Review:
Fantastic time at The Wheatsheaf, perfect for a get-together.
Lovely food and very well looked after. Thank you guys xxxxxx

Name: Pub & Kitchen
Title: Really annoyed with myself!
Review:
Amazing food, lovely service can not believe we are three days into our butlins holiday and we’ve eaten in other restaurants (and we paid £54 for a family of 3 at a buffet to eat mediocre food that wasn’t particularly nice either in one establishment)

My husband had the lemon chicken, I had shepherds pie and our son had sausage and mash. 3 clear plates here!

Vegetables were fresh and cooked to perfection and we had a nice selection of vegetables too, we’d recommend the home made bubble and squeak croquettes starter too. The main food in itself was stunning and very reasonably priced (£33 for 3 meals) considering the location of restaurant and the standard received! (Husband even did the strong serviette test ‍♀️)

1 full day left and we shall 100% be back tomorrow!

If you prefer quality over quantity (although portion sizers are pretty fair too) this is absolutely the place to dine if you’re not on a dining plan!

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: Very very basic
Review:
Shower poor, car park was full up, wifi very hard to set up, extractor fan full of hair, curtain ripped, teenage staff. This review must be 200 words so I'll add that the mirror was old, there was no electricity sockets by the bed, no air-conditioning, generally felt it was very basic. More like a back packer type of stay.
Read less

Name: Swanbourne Lake
Title: Walk
Review: Afternoon walk around Swanbourne Lake and Arundel. Good path all around the lake and lovely views of the clear water and loads of different kinds of ducks. Free parking all along the road. Very pleasant.

Name: Butlins
Title: 90s Reloaded Weekend
Review:
Stayed here 7-10 June for a 90s reloaded weekend as a group of 7 girls for a hen party. I cannot possibly recommend this event highly enough, we’ve already booked for next year!

The acts were brilliant (except S Club, they were desperately awful!), the venue was clean, well looked after and felt really safe. We didn’t see one argument, fight or single bit of unpleasantness all weekend and everyone was very friendly. Kudos to the staff for serving at the bar so quickly and keeping everything going.

We had two silver apartments next to each other and they were great, very clean and comfortable. Only negatives were that there was only one plug socket in the twin room and very few anywhere else. Also the shower had very poor pressure so took ages for hair washing.

If you struggle carrying things upstairs make sure you ask for a ground floor apartment, there aren’t any lifts. (Obviously there are in the hotels). Fortunately there was a helpful stag group who were happy to lug our bags.

We didn’t bother with the dining package and we’re pleased we didn’t. The supermarket on site is very reasonable and there’s also Burger King, hotdogs, Papa Johns etc that’s cheap and easy.

Toilets everywhere were well kept and always stocked with loo roll - cleanest toilets I’ve ever seen at a three day music event!

Highlights of the weekend were the Vengaboys, Peter Andre and the comedy club. They all put so much effort in and really put on a great performance.

Wouldn’t hesitate to recommend it to anyone and can’t wait for next time!
Read less

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Poor service
Review:
Visited here today for a family birthday.

Allowing pets into a restaurant is a strange idea and having 2 yappy dogs behind you when your trying to have a nice family meal for a birthday celebration is not my idea of fun.

Starter was average at best. Steak was not cooked medium as requested.
Pudding well.....

We asked for 2 x 3 scoops of ice cream. 2 toffee and one chocolate and one vanilla and 2 chocolate.
The waitress didn’t write it down and when the order came it was wrong. We told the young very done up with makeup who then returned to correct the order.

Another waitress came and asked what we wanted again. So for a third time we were asked what we wanted for pudding.

We will not be visiting again.

Name: Piccolo Italia
Title: Best garlic flat bread I’ve ever eaten
Review: Outstanding hearty Italian food quick and friendly service will definitely going to be a regular from now on

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: great place
Review:
nice place to for the price. booked 4 days before we acturally stayed got a family room for 2 of us. warm and clean rooms. good shower and bathroom. no where to go at 1.30am to get any food tho but all good very recommended.
Read less

Name: White Swan Arundel
Title: Worse pie and mash ever!
Review:
We had Beef short rib, onion and thyme all butter pastry pie, red wine gravy, mash at £15.95.
When it arrived it looked impressive, unfortunately we didn’t enjoy it.
The mash was really dry, the gravy had zero flavour, it was like brown water. The meat in the pie was quite fatty, there was no flavour and definitely no thyme, very uninteresting.
We had a side portion of veggies at £3.95 which we left most of because the broccoli was hard.
Read less

Name: Pizza Express
Title: Very Disappointing
Review:
We booked Pizza Express for a lunchtime meal, but the whole experience was mediocre at best.

Despite having booked, our table was not ready, and tables were hastily rearranged to accommodate us.

The table concerned was filthy from the previous customer, and the request to clean it, did seem a little too much effort for the staff involved.

Our calamari was burnt, though the dough balls were fine.

The pizza’s were okay, but nothing more.

Everything was a disappointment and we won’t be returning in a hurry.

Name: Empress Bar
Title: Accommodating and friendly
Review: I go here for lunch, sitting outside by the river on warm days or inside overlooking the river on chilly ones. The staff are friendly and accommodating, the food good. I especially enjoy the fresh sardines and reckon the coffee is the best in Littlehampton. Unfortunately, as you approach the premises they don't look too welcoming, but be brave and push open the doors. You won't be disappointed.l

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: Disappointed
Review:
Extracted fan not working properly so there was a smoky haze in the restaurant had to take baby’s outside for air after a few complaints the windows were opened which helped. The restaurant would benefit from sun shade on window as we had to seat with shades on or find shade.

The food was ok although they forgot one of our parties food completely no real apology.

Staff not very welcoming or friendly.

Would not recommend and will not be returning.

Shame but something needs to change.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Caroline Gilfrin
Review: Good value for money and such a variety of food to choose from. Had steak and look at mine.. it looks like a pig! (see photo) not shaped into one, so spooky. Made us and the friendly waitresses chuckle. A special mention for our waitress Lynsey, she made us feel welcome and was so attentive. A credit to the restuarant/company. She deserves a prize.

Name: Bangkok Lounge
Title: No
Review: Went here last night as it had such good reviews. Please save your money or go to tuptim siam instead. My partner literally walked out and vomited across the street for a good 10 minutes, he had chicken. I still have the taste lingering in my mouth, it refuses to leave. The man serving didn't seem too interested in anyone and was the only person there, no customer service skills. Food didn't feel authentic, maybe reheated and reheated hence the vomiting. Loo had nothing to dry hands on, had to use bog roll. Waste of money.

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Rude staff member
Review: Visited on 10th Jan 2019. Young staff member very rude and patronising. No doubt thought he was being "clever".

Name: La Campagnia
Title: Average food, poor service
Review:
The food was fairly average, but the service was very poor. It does seem that we got the one surly, disinterested waitress and unfortunately that ruined our experience.

I would guess the other waitresses knew the weak-link as occasionally they would enquire re drinks and then our waitress would come over and look exasperated at the others for doing her job.

In total we had to wait about 20 minutes for starters, when the restaurant was less than half full, and then our main was about 45 minutes after finishing the starter - and only arrived 10 minutes after we queried with the waitress. Perhaps we were unlucky as there were people who arrived when we were eating our starter and had left before our main arrived. But our experience was ruined by the waiting and this particular member of staff.

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Castle
Review:
Went here today with family apart from being a bit pricey it was a good day out, saw lots of rooms and the garden was very colourful.
Read less

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Worst experience and service
Review: What a dreadful experience we had at Establo today. We arrived and placed our order and unfortunately one meal was missed off, we understand that mistakes happen and the young male server apologised and informed us that it would be dealt with straight away and to expect a 5 minute delay. we had all finished eating and after 20mins there was still no sign of the missing meal meanwhile we had also had to send a breakfast back as the poached egg was like a bullet and the toast had been burnt but cleverly disguised by being turned upside down. We asked several times where the meal was to be told that it was coming whilst we watched everyone else being served. After 30 minutes we gave up and left. No apology just really bad service. That’s definitely our last time there.

Name: 47 Mussel Row
Title: Never fails to pleased
Review: Once again it was just fantastic, food was beautifully cooked and tasted amazing. The tempura prawns alone are worth going for. The mussels were piled high and the chips perfection. See you again very soon

Name: Ocean Hotel & Spa
Title: Avoid Avoid Avoid
Review:
This place is terrible, the worst thing is the paper thin walls, and loud banging doors and lift areas, we were very unfortunate to have be put next to a family from hell, The adults were noisy, The were kids noisy, banging screaming and shouting until the early hours, it ruined our stay from day one, we have been coming here to this butlins for 4 years now, but we have never stayed in the ocean hotel, it’s always the wave, but this experience has done it for us now, no more butlins ever again, it’s ruined our holiday, we asked reception to deal with it, I believed they tried, but the noise continued, we are so unhappy, I have video proof and still nothing.

If you want a nice family holiday, don’t book here, you won’t get any sleep whatsoever, full of chavs and pond life.

I did plan to review the new pool, which in my personal opinion is very dangerous, and the poor quality of the hotel room, with its cobwebs and peeling paint, but I seriously haven’t got the interest or energy, butlins has just gone down hugely in my expectations, avoid avoid avoid.

The only plus side is the staff are actually fantastic, but what can they do when the whole resort is full to bursting point with undesirable chavs.

Name: Papa Johns, Butlins
Title: Big thank you to Emma H
Review: Had the best experience tonight, all the staff were super friendly and helpful. There was one lady Emma H who went above and beyond any customer service i have ever received. She really made my daughters birthday extra special. Massive thank you Emma H, your a star xxx and of course the food was delicious as always, shout out to the chefs for doing a great job and always smiling.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Awesome bar staff Sharon
Review:
My experience at your establishment was brilliant, sharon at the bar was very welcoming and very friendly, food was brilliant, will definitely recommend
Thanks Sharon

Name: Avisford
Title: In need of major refurb!
Review:
I have been fortunate to stay in many Hilton hotels..this one was a bit disapppointing!The corridors and rooms were very outdated.. the doors to the rooms were heavily scratched and need of a some tlc.. the room we were put in had woodlice in the bathroom!! Moved to another room and the carpet was so worn out could almost feel the wood.. facilities are good but having woodlice and being so outdated is not the Hilton standards I know!
Read less

Name: Agmering Manor
Title: Lunch with Probus of Arundel
Review: Service verry good. Food excellent. Friendly staff. We went to the hotel as a club with wives for one of our monthly lunches and this venu has always proved popular.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: sunday lunch for 4
Review:
We booked for 4pm lunch on ordering we found out that the Sunday lunch was not available which was a disappointment and a surprise .
So we ordered from the menu we all had the sirloin steak meal which to be honest was very good and the steak were cooked perfectly to our individual tastes .
overall after the initial disappointment the meal was very good , and a special mention to our waitress Bob who looked after us very well.

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Terrible
Review: Just had a meal Off the Christmas menu.two coarses for £19.95 total waste of money.service terrible food could of been a ready meal from a supermarket

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Dinner time
Review: Two for one on meals was lovely food and great value for price. The amount of food was perfect. The restaurant was clean and staff friendly.

Name: The Norfolk Tap
Title: Aggressive reception from the guy that ran it
Review:
So last week my partner and I walked into the pub, it seemed to have a nice vibe and we were going to sit outside with a nice cold alcohol free beer.

The young guy behind the bar was very sweet - he's the reason I am giving The Norfolk Tap 2 stars rather than 1. The young guy asked how we were and what we would like. I asked what alcohol free beers they have - they didn't have any, but he said he could pop across and get a couple of Becks Blue for us from the hotel - we were more than happy and grateful that he would do that.

Then someone said very loudly in an aggressive tone "why would you do that", I didn't realise he was talking to us at first, then he said it again but louder. I assumed it was just a local at the pub, drunk having a joke. But I looked at him and he said very seriously "Why would you come in here and order an alcoholic free beer, WHY?!" I explained because that's what we wanted.

He then proceeded to go on about how he ran the place and didn't understand why people came in and ordered alcohol free beers. He was hostile and aggressive. Not a very nice way to greet new customers at all. He could see I was quite shocked and taken aback by what he was saying so started to backtrack. He kept saying we should try the 3.6% beer as it is low alcohol, I tried to explain to him that we aren't drinking. He couldn't seem to comprehend it at all. He said there are no good alcohol free beers so he wouldn't stock them. Which my partner and I both said there were lots of lovely alcoholic free beers out there. He said "Well no local breweries that sell them", I corrected him and told him there were. It's something my partner and I have looked into a lot. One brewery I gave him was the Laine brewery in Brighton - King Limbo is a lovely beer, it's extremely popular in Brighton and Hove, we've actually been told by a few bars and pubs in Brighton they can't believe how much they're selling of it. He clearly didn't know what he was talking about, which is fine, we don't expect people to know everything about non alcoholic beers, as it's a fairly new trend that seems to be picking up. What wasn't ok, was the way he spoke to us and treated us.

We promptly got our Becks Blues (which were smaller bottles than the normal and more expensive than normal as well), sat outside and drank them quickly and left. We were shocked and upset by how the guys spoke to us and certainly won't be going back there. Of course people can have their opinions but if you're running an establishment then you shouldn't criticise customers and keep your opinion to yourself.

Name: George & Dragon
Title: Verny nice food, decent price and good service
Review: Visited on a Tuesday night to celebrate an anniversary. Pre-booked and was fairly busy. Rib eye steak and ribs for mains were very good and well proportioned. Pudding was stick toffee pudding (exquisite!) and a sussex cheese board - very nice but maybe the cheese needed to relax a little to come to room temperature. Together with a very nice bottle of merlot and service, the bill was £70 which I think is fair value. It was my first visit here in 5 years and it's one that I'll come to again,

Name: Portuguese Grill
Title: The Right Decision !
Review: We were going to get some Fish and Chips but then we changed our mind when we came across this place. We love Portuguese food, so it didn’t take long to make the final decision. We were shown a table outside in the back yard as the front and inside were packed. It wasn’t the most pleasant of surroundings, but it was OK. We ordered some calamari as starters which were not too bad, and Pork Skewers which were very tasty. Some of the pork sausages had some hard bits and the pork meat was a little bit tough, but I couldn’t really complained as the portions were massive, served on gigantic skewers and in the flavour arena it hit the spot. A bit disappointed that they had run out of Pastel de Nata! Maybe next time. Service quite friendly. The bill was very reasonable

Name: Syrup Café
Title: Best brekki in Bognor
Review: Absolutely love the breakfast here. Non greasy, well cooked, fast friendly service. Excellent value for money! I now come here every week with my mum.

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: Holiday stay
Review:
Very enjoyable experience, staff were extremely friendly and rooms clean.

The front of house were very friendly and knowledgeable while asking for ideas for things to do in the area.

Defining confided this travel lodge for your stay here.
Read less

Name: The Mezze
Title: A Jewel of a find
Review: Whilst staying at Butlins and being very disappointed with the food especially as one of our party contracted serious food poising we all escaped the blandness and ventured out into the town, we discovered The Mezze, fantastic fresh food, great atmosphere and very welcoming staff, we were so delighted that we returned agin the following evening and received the same above and beyond treatment...Well done The Mezze

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: Lovely 2 night stay
Review:
My partner and I stayed here as a rest-bite from running our business. We got a deal for staying 2 nights with dinner and had a thoroughly lovely time. The hotel is quirky, and upon reading the history of the hotel it makes sense. Lovely grounds, and very very friendly and attentive staff.
The food was delicious. I'm lactose intolerant and the staff were understanding and attentive to this. Additionally, the chef amended some of the dishes for me - proving that the food is fresh and made from scratch.
My highlight though, was the spa. My partner and I spent most of our time between the pool and the sun loungers. We tried all the facilities and had a massage (which was amazing!). I fell in love with the products they use, was given some lovely samples and am now a customer of TempleSpa products! I was impressed with the temperature of the shower pre/post sauna (cold but not too cold!), the abundance of available towels, helpful staff, testers and products every where to aid the experience etc etc. So many little details to make if feel luxurious.
Whilst there, I happen to overhear another customer complain to the Spa Manger that they didn't like the redecoration (it hadn't been completed) and general grumbling. I felt the complaints were totally unjust; but I was impressed with the polite, emphatic. and dignified way the Manager handled this customer stating that it was all work in progress and that they had all been working hard on the revamp. I can only imagine the long hours that go into a revamp of a spa.
Well done guys, looking forward to coming back soon.
Read less

Name: St Mary's Church, Felpham
Title: Stunning
Review: Step inside this church and you really are stepping back in time when church was at the centre of most people's lives. Beautiful and peaceful church in pretty village setting.

Name: Swanbourne Lake
Title: Walk round the lake in an hour
Review: Beautiful lake to walk round, or enjoy a rowing boat or just chill with an ice cream or a fresh crab sandwich from the cafe

Name: St Mary's Gate
Title: Saturday lunch
Review: We needed to be at the cathedral for 2.30 on Saturday so decided to make a day of it as we love Arundel. We decided to pop into St Mary’s Gate for lunch and were so very glad we did. The young lady who served us was so welcoming and helpful, she did say there may be a delay as there were quite a few tables already booked. We were happy to have a drink and wait for our lunch which proved not too long. The Confit Duck was just amazing as too the Seafood Pie. By the time we left, the entire place was packed making life very hectic for the staff but they remained smiling and extremely efficient. A good choice on our part.

Name: Carlyle's Café
Title: Excellent
Review: We visited here for breakfast for the first time, very pleasant breakfast well cooked with quality ingredients. Very pleasant staff and will certainly use again. Highly recommended

Name: Pizza Express
Title: Very poor cuisine, burnt and rubbery.
Review:
We were served by a very pleasant staff member Amy, and the assistant manager sorted out our issues. The meals served to me and my wife were poor. My wife ordered a Penne pasta meal which was pre-cooked and re-warmed, but had burned edges and was rubbery, tasteless and looked very unappetising. Some way into the meal my wife discovered a burned area inside the pasta dish too.
Very unpleasant.

My meal was a Pizza Carbonara, which had large lump of black carbon on the plate with it, and the egg in the centre was hard. All around the edges, the base was so hard baked that I could shatter it in many places with a tap of my knife. I requested a replacement soft egg which was provided without fuss.
Neither of us was able or willing to finish the meal.

Although we had a reduction for this, I did not feel very comfortable with the meal and although I am local, will be avoiding the place again.

Get your act together Pizza Express.

Name: China Palace
Title: Good Food
Review:
Went to this restaurant for a meal with colleagues for a change. Hadn’t eaten Chinese for a long time.

The place was nice and staff really helpful and friendly. We had a set meal and couldn’t fault it. It was very quiet, so lacked atmosphere. But will go back again.

Name: Avisford
Title: Tatty n tired
Review:
I just feel sorry for this hotel. Not sure Hilton brand at all! The ‘spa’ was dreadful. Staff miserable, sauna was so dirty! Staff member went to loo while I was in changing room and didn’t wash her hands. When you call ‘reception ‘ it takes 5 minutes for someone to answer the phone and then you can hardly hear from poor quality of phones. Charmless and again I feel sad for the place.
Read less

Name: Butlers
Title: Sunday roast
Review:
Dropped in for an impromptu Sunday lunch after previous amazing experiences, the owner seated us in the lounge bar area as it was rather busy, however this in no way impacted on our service nor experience.

The roast Lamb rump and seasonal vegetables was without power of any Sunday roast I have had, and the gravy was spectacular!

I cannot say enough for the friendliness and efficiency of service and food enjoyed on the day.

Can not wait to return.

Name: The Diner
Title: Disappointing and frsutrating
Review: We were disappointed and frustrated after coming to the Diner yesterday whilst at Butlins. We were looking for somewhere to have lunch and had previously been in the Diner for milkshakes earlier in our holiday and thought it looked like a good place to have lunch. However after picking our food from the lunch menu and looking forward to our food we were told we should not have been given the lunch menu as the previous day there had been such a delay getting the orders out from the lunch menu so they were not offering it yesterday!!!.. my husband and I were very annoyed as by this point we had all drank our drinks and made our choices and instead of having a reasonably priced lunch now only had the option to pick something from the main menu which was much more expensive and our disappointment and frustration meant we did not fancy anything from the main menu but felt it too late to leave even though I very much wanted to just pay for our drinks and leave and find somewhere else. So we made another choice and ordered the children their meals and were all disappointed with our food. My son ended up his tears he disliked his meal so much as the pulled beef in his taco's (which were supposed to be make your own but came already made up) was so spicy he spent most of the time soaking his tongue in his water and my daughter left most of hers as she said her chips were awful and the burger not much better. I ended up giving most of my dinner to the children so they had something to eat and got the bill leaving with a bitter taste in my mouth of the whole experience and paying £46 for some lunch!.. Definitely the wrong decision to go back for a meal and we should have just stuck to visiting for milkshakes.

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Extraordinary pub / restaurant in perfect setting
Review: Our wedding day was special and after the ceremonony at Arundel Town Hall we asked our guests from every corner of the UK to join us for an informal meal at the Black Rabbit. Ian and his team made sure that despite our booking not being for a formal reception, they made a wonderful day even better. Thank you to all of the staff at this great place.

Name: La Cucina
Title: Birthday Meal
Review: First time in this restaurant and was very impressed. Very accessible and easy to get around. A very warm welcome from the staff and very helpful. I started with the tomato soup followed by a pizza to finish panna cotta. The service was excellent and very attentive all the food was excellent and piping hot. A return visit is a must. A fantastic birthday meal for my wife.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Supper with a friend
Review:
I had a lamb burger was really hard to say what meat it was could of been beef
My friend had a pie which was all pastry no filling
On the plus side dessert was very nice and the waitress was nice

Name: Parsons Table
Title: Lovely meal, very friendly staff worth a visit.
Review: Lovely restaurant & great food, the staff are friendly and attentive. The only downside is it is quite noisy when busy. The menu choice is good and food is excellent

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Felt grubby
Review: Been here several times and it was better. Left fairly quickly tables uncleared of previous plates and glasses, people on nearby tables clearing stuff from previous customers onto the vacant ones tables and menus were sticky. Went to the Lamb Pub nearby which was immaculate and just felt better throughout. Similar prices no comparison on this visit. Hoping for a good old fashioned clean up and we shall be back.

Name: River Breeze
Title: Great location but old and tired
Review: We found a table of our choice. Staff welcoming. Food was good if you wanted fish chips. Chips could have been crispier. Other food was not so good and the salad consisted of iceberg lettuce with some tomatoes not cut properly so core still there. Soft drinks were from their tap but this not disclosed on menu and charged at bottle rates. We asked for coffee and it was served full of milk, we not asked how we liked it. Took ages to get any attention from the large amount of staff standing around chatting.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Very pleasantly surprised
Review: I took a group (12) visually impaired seniors here for lunch and we were all very happy afterwards. The group had been before and enjoyed the experience and were even more pleased with this visit. We were seated in a light, airy part of the restaurant and the service was quick and professional. We all had drinks and then took advantage of the "5 for 5" (I think!) where five mains on the menu were available for £5 with a choice of four desserts for £2.79. The mains arrived and there was surprise shown at the size of the portions - BIG! Our server - Denise - was very good and could not do enough for the group - understanding the problems and acting accordingly. She even made out individual bills for the members so there was no problems with mix-ups etc. Really above her normal duties and very much appreciated by all. Thank you

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Family day out
Review: Went to Littlehampton with our two young girls grandchildren and decided to have lunch at the Windmill Harvester as we usually do only to be told that we could not come in unless we had booked as they were short staffed. The restaurant was empty. Surely they could have served a couple of tables rather than turn custom away. Very inconvenient.

Name: The Fish Factory
Title: Superb choices of fish and seafood
Review: We greatly enjoyed our evening at The Fish Factory -- a lovely atmosphere, superb food and wine, thoughtful provision for our 3yr old, and very friendly staff. We would definitely come back if we stay in Littlehampton again !

Name: Partners Café
Title: Excellent lunch very good value too
Review: I had scampi and chips, my wife avocado `and smoked salmon salad. Both excellently prepared and served. Quantities too generous even for us! Lovely place. Will go there again

Name: Mr P's Classic Amusements
Title: Best arcade in the country
Review: Great to visit Dave and the gang in Bognor again. The arcade was buzzing, terrific to play old school fruities again. Finally managed to "Grab the bank" can't wait to return to the only arcade where you get value for money.

Name: Piccolo Italia
Title: Lovely restaurant
Review:
Lovely restaurant. Great food. Good price.
The charm of the place is like you are going back in time or enter into a restaurant in Italy years ago. The service was good and the food was lovely, wine too very nice.
The sirloin steak I had was amazing, cooked to perfection and really impressive. Served with lovely fresh salad and potatoes.
Service very good also.

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: Fantastic value for money!
Review:
We travelled up from Cornwall to Chichester for an event that was running at Goodwood for the weekend. I booked a room at Arundel Fontwell for one night for myself, my husband and my 7 year old. On arrival we were greeted in a friendly manner, given our keys and directed where to go. Luckily this wasn’t too far as being pregnant I was already exhausted! On opening the door to our room it smelt of cleaning products which is always a good sign! And it felt clean. The bathroom itself was clean and there were fresh towels. There were spares on the shelves just outside of the bathroom which is handy! In the room there was a king size bed along with a pull out single for my son to sleep in. Both in clean condition, clean sheets and both beds comfortable. Extra pillows on the selves as well as a fan if needed. A TV was available with freeview which was ideal as we spent the evening relaxing. There was a kettle with cups/sugar/teabags/coffee/milk for tea and coffee which we didn’t use in the end but was nice to know this was available to us. There is no restaurant on site but there is a Burger King/KFC a 5 minute walk around the corner. There is also a little Pub a few minutes drive away that we passed but did not go in. Chichester itself is only a 10 minute drive away from big supermarkets (Sainsbury’s/Lidl etc) which is ideal if you are staying away for a little time. Overall the room we stayed in did the job for us, there was barely any noise even though the Travelodge is situated by a busy road which some people have previously mentioned in other reviews. It may have been the room we were in but given that we only spent the night it did the job nicely. Thank you very much to the two members of staff who welcomed us. Will be back.
Read less

Name: Portuguese Grill
Title: A good place to go
Review: Pleasant grill with friendly staff.Food is good with a strong Portuguese influence ,all prices very reasonable

Name: Jade
Title: Dont bother
Review: Ordered our food at 7. Called at 855pm and was told at least another 20 mins. Asked if they had started cooking it yet and they said no. Asked for a refund. Person on the phone said fine and put the phone down. Appalling service. Don't waste your time or money.

Name: Mustards
Title: Lovely late lunch
Review: We are here around 2pm on a Monday and it was absolutely fantastic. The light lunch menu was varied and it was difficult to choose! Great service, delicious food. Will be back!

Name: Shoreline
Title: shoreline hotel
Review:
I stay in the shoreline hotel for my 6 year old daughters birthday and I would like to thank the front of house in the restaurant Amanda Harvey,what a credit to your hotel,she was so welcoming and made us feel like family and went above and beyond for my daughter for her birthday which she talked about for days and ask to see her again not butlins or presents.

I'm surprised Amanda isn't in a higher position because she has a great personality and the best smile and couldn't do enough.

Well done 😍
Read less

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Amazing....
Review:
Thoroughly recommend a visit. The place is steeped in history which we found fascinating. The staff were very helpful and informative. Lots of stairs so not easily accessible for some. Once up the stairs though views are incredible, interesting and pleasantly pleasing to the eye. A beautiful chapel, library and dining room. I would encourage you to go, you won't be disappointed.
Read less

Name: Raj Doot
Title: No dinner ☹️
Review:
Well what can I say, recently moved to the area and had tried one of the other takeaway Indians but fancied a delivery , registered with Just eat,, ordered a meal from Raj Doot, sat back and waited, about 45 mins later text from Just eat my order had been cancelled, no reason, just try another restaurant !!
So, won’t be using either now, back to the first takeaway, which was great and reasonably priced, their loss ‍♀️

Name: Butlins
Title: Not good.
Review:
I have just returned from Bognor Butlins, where I stayed in a deluxe suite. The 2 sofas and the single beds were extremely uncomfortable, very hard mattresses and the sofas were the worst I have ever sat upon. The so called entertainment was boring and chiefly aimed at children. The later evening shows were just a repeat of the same boring 'pretend' singers that have been there for goodness how long. I only saw 1 redcoat during my holiday and she didn't bother to speak or smile at any of the guests. I have been holidaying in Butlins for many years, but this could be the last time. The new pool has no viewing area and there is no real place to actually swim. It is also very expensive in the shops, you can buy the same goods in Bognor town centre at more than half the price of Butlins. The food in the restaurants is fairly good, but is cold by the time you get to your table! It is very expensive for not a lot now. Shame on you Butlins, Billy Butlin must be turning in his grave, he always said when you paid for your holiday there was nothing else to pay extra for. Now everything is extra. Shame really.
Read less

Name: Cardanom Bay
Title: New Year's Eve Dinner
Review:
Firstly the food is very good, especially the main courses. Kalamari tasteless. Samosa's left to go hard. Wine ordered not delivered, wrong (higher) price charged.
 Service slow, but hey it was NY Eve and all enjoying themselves. First course arrived after 50 minutes following knowing nods from staff. Table next to us placed their order 15 / 20 mins after us and their starter arrived first. People queued for reserved tables to be told they were not (yet) available. Food collections were running well behind. Only way to pay was to stand up and visit the main reception desk.
The owners should learn not to grab every reservation and to ensure the kitchen staff were adequate in numbers...sorry to say but this has now happened to us on three occasions.....SO BACK TO THE MAGNA TANDOORI

Name: Hotham Park
Title: Excellant place for a walk and great food
Review:
Visited on Sunday and great for a walk and the food in the cafe is amazing and great value too. Would recommend the pizza.
Read less

Name: Pub & Kitchen
Title: Amazing Restaurant for Food Allergies
Review:
We've been going to this restaurant for the past two years because it's the only place in the Butlins site where we can eat safely due to our son's severe food allergies which cause anaphylaxis (eggs, nuts, peanuts and sesame). He's only 5yrs old.
Tom, the chef is absolutely amazing and has been for the past two years. He always cooks fresh and will suggest dishes that aren't always on the menu but he'll cook it as to ensure Archie is safe. We can't fault any of the service provided. The managers, waiting staff and Tom are all fantastic and a credit to the company. Everytime we visit, they always remember us and Archie's allergies.
If you suffer from severe food allergies, please check this place out. The staff will welcome you and ensure you are well looked after.
Thank you Tom and everyone else at The Pub & Kitchen for looking after us, as always. See you at Christmas!!

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: Great food & atmosphere
Review: We first visited this restaurant last year on our Just for Tots break & did so twice again on our latest visit. Tina & the team are so warm, friendly & welcoming. The menu is vast & has lots of choice for vegetarians as well as being very reasonably priced. The portions are huge & the food is incredible. Would definitely recommend!

Name: Pizza Express
Title: Planned End Of Day Our Visit
Review: We booked Pizza Express after a day out in Arundel. The childrens' meals are fantastic value and sufficient enough for our hungry early teen and nearly 10 year old. My wife and I had starters, a main and a side as well as a dessert. We were able to use a 3 course discount voucher. My wife's a vegetarian and was delighted to see the fungi pizza back on the menu. Food was fab and service swift and spot on. We'll be back when we next visit Arundel.

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: Beautiful food and great value
Review:
Very friendly staff and lovely meals, a surprisingly good variety of food considering it is a fish & chips restaurant.
Very clean and spacious.
Big portions, great value for money.

Name: Cardanom Bay
Title: Awful customer service, mistakes made & very rude.
Review: We ordered a takeaway, the vegetatrian korma was instead a chicken korma. We phoned up to tell them of the mistake, they re-read our order to us which listed the veg korma, the phone was then passed to the "manager" who told us we were wrong as he personally packed the bag and definitely packed a veg korma. He questioned if we'd checked our order properly... which obviously we had... this is why we were complaining. I understand mistakes happen, but to be told we were wrong and argued with was not acceptable. We had a break from this restaurant for a few years as we had the same experience then. We thought as it had been a long time since our last experience (of being sent the wrong order, then argued with when we phoned up to complain) that things should have changed, only to have the same experience again. Really poor service. We won't be back.

Name: Sylvan Oak
Title: Dinner with family
Review: Excellent and friendly service, the halibut with beans and red onions melted in the mouth, we even tried discreetly to ask for the recipe but they would not give that out.

Name: Avisford
Title: Charity black tie event
Review:
Main course beef was the worst meal I’ve ever Ben served it had sinue through it and was so hard .
Shame because the actual event was very good and the charity made money.

What was disappointing was I wanted to complain to a manager and was told none available but would pass my details on and Someone would come back to me

This didn’t happen and can only consider the standards have fallen and they don’t care.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Fab birthday meal
Review:
Just had my son’s 11th birthday meal with his friends at papa Johns. The guys here are amazing. So friendly and do a fantastic job.
James seated us and took the order, he was so lovely with my son about his birthday and friends etc. Throughout our meal he was kind, funny and attentive. Kevin then brought the cake out and got my son on the chair and had everybody sing happy birthday 🥳
Thank you so much James and Kevin for making my sons birthday meal so special and fun you guys are truly special.
Read less

Name: Empress Bar
Title: Poor managment.
Review: My friends and I were booked to play this place on Saturday last and afterwards they refused to pay the fee. The place was like a sauna and there no fans in there for customers, only one facing the bar. When we arrived there were maybe a dozen people in there, and when we finished there were ten. This they blamed us for! I would never trust these people and won't even rate them.

Name: The Lamb, Angmering
Title: Home sweet Home
Review: Once again another wonderful time Spent at The Lamb in Angmering. I say “home sweet home” because this is exactly what coming back here feels like. This is not our first visit but to keep returning speaks volumes. My partner stays in some of the best hotels in Europe but The Lamb is easily up there with the top quality hotels and Quality is what keeps coming at The Lamb. Once again the welcoming and friendly staff on arrival. Our room was just beautiful, spacious and tastefully decorated. Fresh clean towels every day and an abundance of hot water for baths and shower. What we did like was the plentiful tea and coffee in the bedrooms, not just a couple of English teabags like you get in some of the big hotels where you have to ring reception to get more. The breakfast was fresh and boiling hot and the dinner menu was too difficult to choose. So many delicious dishes, beautifully presented and looked too good to eat. Sunday lunch was to die for, the best around. An Abundance of top shelf drinks to choose from alongside wines and beers. Thank you The Lamb, I came down With my family as part of my 50th birthday celebrations this year and you did not disappoint. Such a lovely time and many happy memories spent in this little gem of a place. We will absolutely return. See you next year.

Name: Tajdar
Title: 5 star Indian food
Review:
What a lovely place to go for an Indian meal. They do take away & delivery so no excuse to miss out.
We’re big fans of curry, this did not disappoint. Great service, great menu, & fabulous food! The flavours are something else. All freshly cooked (so you do have a wait early on) & you can tell it’s fresh.
I’ve never had chicken so succulent & tasty, I had chicken tikka, others in the group had a madras, korma, garlic chicken & a prawn balti. Every one of the dishes were divine.
Do suggest you book as gets very busy.
Ps - Good wine/drinks menu too, going back again next week.

Name: Butlins
Title: Disappointed family holiday - rubbish customer service
Review:
Before I start, I’ve been going to Butlins skegness for the past 6 years with no issues having great holidays with my young family. Bognor Regis is totally different!

Accommodation
We stayed in a silver room. It was clean and tidy on arrival. However, the floor was quite uneven and the front door didn’t open all the way as it caught in the opposite wall in the tiny hallway. The bathroom was very basic (as you would expect) but the shower was very hard to climb in and out as it was higher than your average step. The toilet was letting water through every 30/40 seconds. I reported this but it didn’t get fixed until I found a maintenance guy who was very helpful and fixed it for us.

Resort
Was clean grounds well looked after but some areas are looking tired.

Dining
We had paid the extra for premier dining. We have used this dining several times at skegness and loved it. Totally disappointed at Bognor - no live stations as described, all self service. People that where meant to be chefs had no idea what they were doing.
I complained onsite at guest services. Belle - a member of the team said that’s just the way it is at Bognor and the two sites are totally different. She stated that I would have to stand corrected when I mentioned never being allocated a dining room at skegness! She stated I could ask for something off the grill at anytime. I asked several times and was told that this wasn’t allowed. They did get me things when I persisted but I shouldn’t have to as it was part of the package I had paid for! One particular night I asked about the grill menu and was told it was cheese burgers, but they where also on the self service so I could “make one myself”!! Not quite the same experience!!

Funfair
Very good. My children loved the swings and the sizzler ride. Felt very safe again.

Pool
Brand new pool opened this year. The children loved it. All the rides where open and well staffed. It did feel busy at times. The changing area floor is very slippy so just watch little ones in there. They don’t have changing room attendants like st skegness.
Read less

Name: Penang Village
Title: Absolutely perfect!
Review:
A fabulous time as ever at this fabulous restaurant. The food is always divine & cannot fault anything.
This time we didn’t have a starter as we know the mains are such large portions. Our friends had Lemon chicken & Kung po chicken which were perfect.
I had Kung po chilli prawns which were fantastic as always, I also chose noodles with
beansprouts which were excellent...half portion next time, Nick’s dad. Huge portions.
Hubby had King Prawns satay which he loved.
Truly delicious but it is the charismatic Nick & his lovely mum Kim who ensure everything is exactly how you would expect that make this perfect along with obviously excellent food!

Name: Findon Rest
Title: Handy for Worthing Cemetery But
Review:
Booked for me, too Budget. Staffless so serviceless. Two of the 4 poor parking spaces occupied by stone horse trough. Last arrivers must park outside naighbours properties, which I bet they love. Room too small for 2 to walk and dress in, even with only a 4.5ft bed. Noisy Massorator plumbing.
Advertised as a motel but is 4 bed 2 floor shed on small triangular plot.
Even in little Findon there are other better options.

Name: Cockburns Tea Rooms
Title: Perfect ambience and quintessentially English
Review: Our daughter gave us a gift voucher for afternoon tea for two. The tearooms are quaint and furnished traditionally. The staff were very welcoming and the tea itself could not be faulted. They even warmed the scones when we were ready. We thoroughly enjoyed the experience and will certainly visit again.

Name: The Mezze
Title: Another great visit
Review: We have been here a lot and it still is one of the best around. It is always full and you do have to book to be sure of a table. Keep it up lads

Name: The Holly Tree
Title: Such a disappointment
Review: We decided to meet here for a drink on bank holiday Monday and in fact we decided to go elsewhere. It's such a shame this pub doesn't fit the pretty village of Walberton - unfortunately, it needs some immediate attention and is looking shabby and tatty. The outside area was not cleared up when we arrived with plates, food and empty glasses on a few tables - this is just not acceptable. Cigarette butts were all over the floor which clearly weren't from Monday alone and the chairs and tables looked grubby. The decor inside just doesn't work - the pub doesn't know what it is. Querky might describe it, but, what would work here is a traditional country pub with some atmosphere and ambience, tastefully decorated and in keeping with the village. The seating arrangement inside just doesn't work either and I couldn't have imagined eating here as a family - cant comment on the food, but it looked like it might be from a fryer. The male toilets smelt nasty and again were very tatty....such a shame. We have been here before and it just looks worse....such a shame as it could be so much more. We wont be back I am afraid.....

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: An absolute hidden gem!
Review:
Our room was perfect with a very large clean bathroom, service impeccable, food wonderful, perfect for a peaceful short break. For a special treat I suggest breakfast in bed. We didn't spend much time in the Spa but it all looked clean and tidy. Will definitely be returning!
Read less

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Worst fish and chips with big cost with no clear bill
Review:
My family was 3 people was staying in Bognor holiday . This is the worst fish and chips I have ever had. The large cod I did order ? it came up a 1 and a haft small fish as size of my 2 finger .
My wife has small cod , My son has same with me and chips as well plus that we have 3 can of coke.
The bill came up to £34.88 pence .I want to have the receive for checking up each items for the bill .
Finally He gave me the small piece for print to show the total only .No VAT, No detail of each meal?
I did not want my family unhappy for the go out .I have to pay for that. He was quick to take the money.
Lesson learned, very overpriced for what was dished up,never again. Just want to share as I was surprised it is happen in ENGLAND

Name: The Lion
Title: Always Excellent
Review:
We have visited the Lion many times and have always had an excellent meal,
The staff are friendly and make you feel welcome
The food is excellent and the portion sizes are very generous.

Name: Bailiffscourt Spa
Title: Overpriced, average food, lackadaisical service
Review:
Set menu not worth the price. Wine list expensive. Staff largely absent when you need them. Chef has an undeserved amount of self regard. Better gastropubs serve up similar experience at half the price and bother. Hotel largely empty and ordering drinks required patience and good humour. They need to stop staff disappearing all the time especially at those prices. So frustrating because the hotel itself is attractive.
Read less

Name: 47 Mussel Row
Title: Sunday Lunch
Review: We discovered this restaurant by chance - and we were very pleasantly surprised. The service was excellent, the staff very friendly and we thoroughly enjoyed the food. We both opted for the champagne battered fish and chips. They were delicious - accompanied by a pea puree and tartare sauce. Lots of choice on the menu. We will be returning soon!

Name: WWT Wetland
Title: Lovely place to wander
Review:
We enjoyed our visit in the March sunshine. We stared with coffee on the cafe and wandered in and out of the hides. Each one has a different scheme. There are binoculars and bird identifying guide books. Plenty of birds and well labelled. We particularly enjoyed the guided boat ride though the reeds.
Read less

Name: Butlers
Title: Excellent food and cheerful service
Review:
My wife and I went for wedding anniversary treat! And treat it was. We had a really high quality meal with melt in the mouth filet of beef and there’s a good menu for meat, fish or vegetarians. Our mains could not have been cooked better. I won’t mark down, but we always like a good helping of vegetables and there were no sides to help us. We also think a choice of potato based offerings for steak dishes would help as not everyone wants fries. However the chef did a simply superb job.
The desserts were also superb. See the menu online. We will be back for another treat in due course.
The bottle of wine was fabulous too. So often wine is not that good even at a hefty markup, but our bottle of Malbec was superb.

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: I'd come back again :)
Review: Fantastic staff! Very polite and kind, happy to assist. The entire hotel was clean and tidy, including my room. It was prepared well ahead my check-in. The bed was comfortable, all the appliances and furniture were in good condition. All in all, 10/10!

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Certainly no return visit
Review:
Not a cosy pub at all. It was furnished like a cafe, the pub was cold, no heating.
The lunch menu was a choice of 5 mains. Our food was Luke warm, the battered fish was soggy and all 4 of our meals covered in this fried greasy cabbage. The only thing was nice was the puddings. We were very dissapointed. Can see why the pub was virtually empty.

Name: Avisford
Title: Disappointing and Poor
Review:
Rooms were nothing like the modern ones pictured on the website. The room we had was pokey, tired and in general poor condition. The common areas were tired with poor decor and in general poor state.

I was disappointed for the money I spent, especially as the room suffered from no running water on Saturday morning.

This was almost twice the price of the local Premier Inn but at least with a Premier Inn, you know what you’re going to get.

The polite and friendly staff were the only saving grace for this place.

Definitely the worst Hilton I’ve stayed at.
Read less

Name: Mustards
Title: Perfect
Review: Amazing food and wonderful atmosphere.Couldn’t fault anything ant the staff all so friendly and kind. The best place I have ever eaten and would highly recommend. Definitely going back very soon.

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Great pub to sit by the river.
Review: We went for lunch. I had steak frites and was surprised by the quality and size of cut of the steak. My wife had a ginormous sandwich that looked excellent. She took half home to have later. The beer was great, sitting outside was lovely and it was well priced. What's not to love, I'm coming back!

Name: Butlins
Title: Centerparcs this is NOT
Review:
With a young family we have stayed at Centerparcs many times and thought we'd give Butlins a try.

We booked a Nelson stateroom in the Shoreline Hotel, arriving on the hottest weekend this year.
 The air conditioning was broken. It took the team 4 hours after much pestering to inform us it was not repairable(no surprise)
After a visit to assess the heat level they agreed it was not acceptable and we would be relocated.
This was to the Wave hotel, the other side of the complex. It was gone 8pm. We were unable to move the car as the Wave car park was full. We trapsed with kids in pyjamas ladden with bags across the complex,with not one teeny weeny offer of help of anysort.

So just be aware, that is the level of customer service they offer if things go wrong.

You can pay very good money but don't expect the level of courtesy to families that Centerparcs on the other hand offer.

On a positive note the show was great,rides well staffed, pool lovely(though not quite as good as Centerparcs) But be prepared for spending a long time queuing for ...everything!
Hope this may just help if you are considering a first visit with little ones.
We lost a precious day of a very short weekend break with overtired kids, thanks to Butlins.
Read less

Name: Haskins Garden Centre
Title: Not very dog friendly for food or poop.
Review: My wife and I visited for a snack. The place was fairly busy. I had a scone and Latte and my wife had a Rum Baba and tea. The Rum Baba was delicious and, as my wife said, they are hard to find as not many places do them. We had to sit outside because we had a dog with us, luckily it was dry. It would be good if they could provide an inside area for doggy people like Wyevale garden centres do.  Food was quite pricey but we sort of expected that. Out dog made a deposit outside the centre but we could find no waste bins so ended up taking it away with us - not good!  We purchased some dog bits and greeting cards, both fair value.  On the other hand the girl on the till was very pleasant and had a treat for the dog!

Name: Butlins
Title: Family disaster.
Review:
PLEASE READ THIS EVERYONE. I visited here last year. NOT family friendly VERY unsafe place. Man killed this week by 1 punch. I was in a similar incident last year. No help, no feeling of safety on site. PLEASE DO NOT VISIT THIS PLACE IT SHOULD BE CLOSED DOWN.
Read less

Name: Behar Kebab
Title: Waste Of Time Don't Bother
Review: Ordered a take out and an Hour and Three Quarters later Nothing Arrived after 3 phone calls chasing it! No apology Very bad customer relation.

Name: The Norfolk Tap
Title: D&JB
Review: What a great hotel, restaurant and bar. A great value room, which was upgraded without any asking (thank you).

Name: Butlins
Title: Poor accommodation
Review:
So sad to have just checked into butlins for 6th time over 5 years to the ‘gold’ accommodation - seaside apartment.
Really poor quality accommodation - really disappointed. Recommend go for hotel every time.
Read less

Name: Pizza Express
Title: Burnt to a crust pizza
Review: Family meal on Saturday evening my wife and I ordered pollo ad astra and pollo forza pizzas on a romana base. Both totally over cooked and burnt. Forza was so inedible it was sent back, waiter immediately offered to discount cost and replace. Credit due they realised just how poor it was. But food of this low standard should never reach the customer. The bases on these pizzas have now become so thin that in a busy restaurant it must be difficult for the chef not to burn them. Children's pizzas were fine. Have eaten many times at this restaurant chain but will not return.

Name: Pagham Beach Café
Title: Great as always.
Review: Holiday every year in Pagham and always use this cafe for our meals, mostly takeaways. The food is really tasty and freshly cooked, good value and good sized portions. Staff are friendly, efficient and helpful. You can eat in or out on a large patio with lovely seating and shading. Ice creams at the associated shop are lovely. Less than a minute's walk from the beach.

Name: Boat House In the Marina
Title: Party
Review:
Lovely location and venue, however I was at this 16th birthday party from 730 till 930 unless things kicked off before or after this time the kids were well behaved I didn't see or hear any swearing or fighting from any of them,as for the alcohol issues yes it seemed some did bring alcohol but as soon as this was known the father did announce over the microphone it would be confiscated.
As for going outside it was so hot at the venue you needed to get some fresh air.
And as for the food if I wasn't there when they announced the food was ready to eat you would have thought oh the foods gone well but in fact there was only 3 plates of sarnies of which you never knew what they were,vol ou vonts which were cut into small pieces also what was in them no idea,and some small bits of quiche,and last of all a small plate of gluten free sarnies,we even took the one and only small pot of nachos off the bar to eat at least you knew what they were,my 12 year old daughter could have done a better spread.
The owner was sat on a stool most of the night,as for saying it was slander from l wicks review you should practice what you preach as you were not professional on this matter at all.

Name: The Diner
Title: Family Meal
Review: Couldn’t complain one bit , food was on point. Brilliant service from Chloe very chatty & friendly towards the kids . Highly recommend it 100% beats The Pub Kitchen which we was not impressed by the service or the food and for the cost . Make sure you visit The Diner

Name: Glorious Spa
Title: Always a lovely experience
Review: Thank you to Bryony for a perfect gel mani today and a brilliant facial last week. I was so lucky to have won a draw for the facial...a great incentive for further treatments!

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: A nice hotel but spoilt by some staff with very bad attitudes
Review:
This is a great hotel very expensive but worth it but my god they need to do something about their staff, if you pay for a luxury stay then you are not just talking about the rooms and grounds but also the way you are treated but he staff and this place falls far far too short of that, it does seem like a attitude of we have your money now sod off, if you check all the negative reviews on her trust pilot and google they are all about the staff and my experience was in line with what they are saying, a great hotel but serviced by low quality staffing, if this place is to stay in business for the long term then they need to invest in good quality staff training, also watch out for your end of stay bill as they are very very tricky and do not encourage you to question it,
Read less

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Very Poor Carvery
Review:
We went to the Knights Table for a family birthday lunch on Sunday. After reading the many excellent reviews we were really looking forward to a lovely meal in a relatively new restaurant in Arundel.

Unfortunately our experience didn’t match the reviews.

After ordering the carvery for all of us we were told by the waitress that there would be a little wait, about ten minutes, while the carvery was ‘freshened up’.

However when we reached the carvery we were greeted with beef that had literally been seared on the outside and was raw and very bloody, 2 chicken pieces that were so pale they also didn’t look cooked and gammon that was over cooked and incredibly fatty. With the benefit of hindsight we should have refused the carvery and ordered something else but stupidly not wishing to make a fuss we carried on with it. In reality the food should never have been offered to us. There were little veg, the carrots had almost run out, the Yorkshire puddings were cold and tasted like cardboard and the roast potatoes inedible.

Interestingly, soon after we had been served, the carvery food was cleared and replaced. Perhaps we chose the wrong time to eat but again we should never have been served such poor food.

When the waitress cleared our plates, saw how we had left most of our food and asked how our food was she said ‘thank you for being honest and we welcome feedback positive or negative’ but with respect these are clearly just words.

Oh and for the record my husband would only have given a one star, not two as I have.

Whilst the decor is quite quirky, the hard wooden bench seats we were given were quite uncomfortable.

Unfortunately, we will not be returning to the Knights Table which is a shame as we do like to support local businesses.

Name: Dog & Duck
Title: Lovely little place
Review: Tucked down a side street. Off the beaten track and away from most of the people out for a drink. Varying local ales and other drinks here. No music, no food, just people prepared to talk if they have something to say. Great.

Name: Mustards
Title: Excellent food, excellent value
Review:
We had a really lovely evening and a very good dinner indeed. Staff were all lovely and extremely efficient. We had delicious gins at the bar first (very good drinks menu), and all enjoyed all 3 of the courses we chose. The desserts were outstanding, as was the sirloin. Food was beautifully presented, especially starters and desserts, and service was uniformly flawless. Good atmosphere, tables not crowded, very comfortable. So pleased to find we now have a superb restaurant like this in Bognor. Very impressed by the value - prices very moderate for such good food.
We will definitely be returning.

Name: The Holly Tree
Title: Planned a visit based on incorrect website so went home hungry
Review: I had arranged to meet friend's visiting from the Netherlands here for dinner. Before making the arrangements I checked the Holly Tree website, which states restaurant is open 6-9 Mon-Fri. So after arriving just before 7pm on a Tuesday evening, and ordering in drinks, we asked for the menu. Being told that they don't do food on a Tuesday because its quiz night, that only people do the quiz have food , and even then offering us to do the quiz (that didn't even start until 8), I was pretty pissed off. My friends and I ended up finishing our drinks and going our separate ways, so what should have been a good evening was ruined by misinformation and damn poor service.

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: Overpriced restaurant and lackadaisical service
Review:
Place suffers a head chef who clearly has a high opinion of his cooking. Food was no better than a decent gastro pub at half the price. Waiters and waitresses keep disappearing whenever you need them. We had to find ours in the sulking around the kitchen - not a single one in the restaurant for 15-20 mins
Read less

Name: Avisford
Title: Over priced, dated & unclean
Review:
I stayed at this hotel for an event. The room was really hot and the window barely opened as it got stuck. The room wasn’t very clean, dust everywhere and the bathroom wasn’t clean. Found bugs crawling around the bathroom. I’ve been to much better hotels for a fraction of the price of this one. Defiantly not worth what I paid for. The event was lovely however.
Read less

Name: Fox Inn
Title: Sorry no
Review: Went in for a few pints and only had one. Kids running around in a bar that says no kids. Staff more worried about there phones and hair than serving the customers. Waited 15 mins to get the second round and there was only me and on other at the bar. Gave up and went to The Thatch instead

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Birthday Bash
Review: A very warm welcome from staff, especially Sharon. Food, service and atmosphere was as excellent as ever. Well done, really enjoyed our family time here.

Name: Avisford
Title: Fantastic running of a great wedding
Review:
I stayed here for 2 nights over the duration of a friends wedding and I was impressed with the service of the hotel. My bedroom was a bit dated however it was clean and provided all the facilities required, there was also an iron and ironing board already in the room which i was happy with. The bed was really quite hard however the staff were happy to place a mattress topper which they did and that did make a difference.
The main thing for me was how fantastic, organised, friendly and attentive the staff were with the running of the wedding. The day was seamless and you could really tell they were working hard to make it a special day for all involved.
Read less

Name: Rustington Golf Centre
Title: STUCK TO MY ICE TEA !!
Review: Woman got “stuck” to my Ice Tea, not sure how that is possible but it was an incredible sight, 100% would recommend. I was standing there for at least 6 seconds while she tried to become un-stuck to my plastic cup and I would do it again in a heartbeat. Thank you.

Name: St Mary's Gate
Title: Nice but slow
Review:
Our food, when it came, was very nice but although we had been warned of a thirty minute wait when we ordered, the food didn't actually arrive for around an hour and a quarter, and some people didn't get what they'd ordered (two orders of ham, egg and bubble & squeak transformed into ham, egg and chips without mention by the waitress). We had to gobble our meals and get out quickly to avoid being late for the event we had met for.
I appreciate that the pub was caught off guard by a lot of people in different parties needing to be in the cathedral next door at the same time but staff should have stopped accepting food orders or warned of the longer likely wait.
I would also strongly suggest that, being the cathedral's nearest neighbour, someone at St Mary's check the cathedral website for big events coming up (or even ask the cathedral staff!) and have more kitchen and bar staff on to cater for a predictable increase in numbers.

Name: Pub & Kitchen
Title: Great roast
Review: Love this resturant second time there ans enjoyed totally.. We all needed a proper dinner after a few days of fast food.. Recommend staff lovely food fab and nice and clean.. Thank Tony our server..

Name: Waterside Café
Title: Gluten free and allergy delight
Review:
We had a fabulous lunch there. What a relief to find such a friendly and helpful bunch who fully comprehend allergies.
Food was fab and the location is delightful
Great staff.!!!

Name: Avisford
Title: Ladies that lunch..
Review:
Decided to pop into the Hilton for a spot of lunch, and what a treat it was. The food was great and the bar and seating area was spotless. We were very well looked after by a lady called Verity. Thank you. We'll be back!
Read less

Name: The Waverley
Title: Wedding
Review: Went to my friends wedding here on 22nd December 2018 and it was a great evening. The room looked great and we all had a fab timre

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Never again
Review:
Often driven past this pub and wondered what it was like inside. Decided to stop for a meal today. Really wish we had done the usual and driven past.
We were shown to a table and drinks order was taken. The drinks were served and the waiter poofed. Never to be seen again!!. A very nice waitress took our order. 2 gammon steak meals. When they arrived we couldn't decide if it was processed peas or dried up garden peas served with it!! The chips were warm at best. Looked awful. That said the gammon tasted nice.
I needed to visit the ladies room. OMG. I dont expect the room to smell of roses but what greeted me was disgusting. There were only 2 toilets. 1 had lid down and stunk of human waste. The other stunk of vomit. It made me feel so sick it was all I could do to not vomit too. I could not use the loo as I needed to get out and away from that stench. I rejoined my husband and told him what I found. To my horror I could still smell vomit! Realised it was on my hand from opening the door. Disgusting!!!!!

Name: Belinda's Tearooms
Title: It’s a must!
Review: This tearoom is not only beautiful but also had the best tea I drank in 8 days in England! I highly recommend the Victoria Sponge Cake and the Scones. The atmosphere was such a joy and I can’t wait to go back someday. Make sure you stop in!!!

Name: Butlins
Title: ABSOLUTE RUBBERY
Review:
So I haven’t yet been to butlins but since booking on the 7th of Jan I am already wishing I didn’t. So as I said I book on the 7th of jan just a few days ago. I happened to check the prices again on the 12th of jan as I was going to book for someone else for the same time. The prices since I book days ago have dramatically drop nearly £200 for the same time in July. I saw online that thr lowest price is guaranteed. So I decided to call and see if there was anything butlins could do since it hasn’t been a week since booking. Well the first lady I spoke to was absolutely useless. The second lady tried to help but I have been told as I book the last apartment available the could not do anything! This is absolutely ridiculous I cannot even cancel and rebook as I would no be receive all of my money back and if I upgraded it would have to be done on the price which I would have received on the day of booking, even tho the price of a upgrade to the difference would be less than £10. I am absolutely disgusted and this will be the first and last time i will be visiting Butlins!!! I wouldn’t be to bothered if I didn’t book less than a week ago and the deal was meant to be up to 30% off and an extra £40 off and now the deal is and extra 30% off and an extra £30 so im a bit confused as to why its cheaper now. I definitely will not be advising anyone to book with them as you’ll never know when to book to get the best deal. Pictures below of the price difference in just a few days!!!!
Read less

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: A cracking dinner
Review: Me and the boys came in to the beefeater for some food and drink, the service was great and hazel was extremely welcoming, our food came at the right time and I was truly thrilled with the food. All in all a fantastic evening and I will be returning very soon.

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: A great visit and especially lovely with all the tuplips
Review:
Well worth a visit to this beautifully kept castle. Great grounds and of historic interest. We especially liked the library
Read less

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Day Out
Review: At long last a restaurant management team doing an outstanding job. We had table booked for 17-00 and we received a call from Sharon one of the duty manages at 16-00 stating that there was a problem with a kitchen fan and that they were unable to cook until the engineer had fixed it ,I ask if possible can we come at 18-00 and this was rearranged and an email was sent to me. On arrival at 18-00 all was well and we had a very enjoyable meal and was looked after by Megan my ribeye steak was cooked just right and my wife's chicken was also very good. Very accessible and easy to get about, I would rather receive a call like ours then waiting about in a restaurant not knowing if we would be able to eat or not a big thank you to all at crossbush beefeater we have a fab time.

Name: The Diner
Title: Slowessst service ever
Review: This has to be the slowest restaurant in the history of the world. The clock on the wall is definitely there to prove this to you. Waited an hour for basically a burger and chips.. there were 8 tables so not exactly busy. Avoid

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Dog friendly and warm
Review: Really appreciated a dog friendly warm spot after a long fresh walk down the front. Wouldn't have minded semi or skimmed milk as an option and hot chocolate was warm rather than hot but overall enjoyed it and very grateful for the warmth!

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Nice atmosphere
Review: We visited at 7.15 on a Friday night and were surprised that our first two choices from the menu were already unavailable. Service was good and food arrived quickly and was good.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Worst service ever!
Review: I’d been here over an hour, I’d only been served starters and drinks. Mains took 1 hour and 25 minutes. The service was terrible. We were basically ignored the whole night!!!

Name: So India, Little.
Title: Never again
Review: Visited with friends and we were enjoying the evening until main courses arrived.No one had cleared our table of empty plates and glasses from previous course so the staff complained there was no where to put the food?.We had to ask for more cutlery as well.We were about to eat dessert and have coffee when we were abruptly told they needed the table back.The staff were rude and argumentative.My children had to leave without finishing....Absolutely disgraceful treatment.Will never go again!!.

Name: Harbour Lights
Title: Food and Coffee
Review: Harbour lights has reopened and is serving delicious food and tasty proper Coffee. This is a great place to stop for eats with a fantastic view down the river Arun.

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Disappointingly poor value
Review: Adequate looking menu but nothing remotely special but nonetheless was expecting it to be well executed with some real cooking for the price . However it is clear that the food was largely if not wholly processed. Simple burger and fries at 14 pounds was excessive and badly prepared . overcooked skinny fries , Less than fresh bun and swamped in that pink mayonnaise that even the Burger Chains use more judiciously. The service whislt pleasant was slow although it was a very busy Saturday night. Still that in itself was easy to predict and staffing levels should have reflected this . Everything else was average or worse and the bill was an unpleasant reminder of how poor an overall experience it was . Beautifully situated it could be so much better . Get a chef or a menu that is worthy of the price tag . I eat out a fair amount in the South East and wouldn't consider eating here again when there is so much better choice locally.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Disappointing in nearly every respect.
Review: We visited the Harvester after an afternoon cinema visit. We thought it would be nice to eat and have a drink and extend the occasion.
