Sadly, the service was slow and offish and the food (all main courses) was by and large poor both temperature and taste wise. Also, the restaurant itself was quite grubby/messy after perhaps a busy Saturday afternoon. We were disappointed. It felt like a tired impersonal chain restaurant struggling to cope with the demands put upon it. May be we were just unfortunate on the day.

Name: The Windmill
Title: It’s was,...ok
Review: We came for a family meal, for a time and day in the week that you would have thought would be busy, we were one of the few tables in. Not passing judgment, we ordered. The menu was very small (consisting of around 7 items max!) Food was very slow to come out, and our waitress was uninterested. It made for an uncomfortable evening. We have been before in the summer and the menu has been full, and the food has been delicious. Hopefully we just got caught out on a bad day there

Name: LG Café
Title: Not what I expected
Review: We received a warm welcome which was nice but sadly this is when the enjoyment ended. Coffee ok but the big let down was the patisserie which were not the standard you would expect from a shop specialising in French patisserie.

Name: Partners Café
Title: Yummy Breakfast!
Review: Wonderful food, relaxed atmosphere and spot on service. what more could you ask for, will definitely be going back.

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: Quirky property and that’s where the fun ends ....
Review:
During our 24 hour stay, I’m not sure we met a single person who knew what they were doing. And that’s not for the lack of staff. After what felt like a reluctant ‘end of shift’ welcome at the front desk, we were shown to our room at the other side of the site. The guy showing us around didn’t know the facilities and referred us to a new guide in the room and said everything we needed to know would be in there. We we’re left thinking why bother and just provide the key? However when we found our way around the room we just felt it lacked facilities and was old and antiquated - in need of an upgrade!
We had paid for one of the more expensive rooms with a four poster bed. This was probably the best part about it. The rooms are poorly equipped; an old sofa facing and dirty tv in a sitting room area, no mini bar despite being far from the main part of the hotel, large bathroom but the shower stopped working half way through washing and left one of us roaming the room for 15 mins covered in soap. We tried to call reception to report and get some help, but we’re told ‘turn all the taps on and that should reset it’. This didn’t work so we called back at which point they sent someone from house keeping, who on arrival said ‘I can’t help you’. We gave up, sat for a further 15 mins and had another go. Fortunately some cold water had returned enabling a rinse before dinner. We reported this when back at the house and received a £100 discount on the bill and an offer to move rooms. Having already wasted time and feeling frustrated, we stayed where we were to avoid the hassle of packing and unpacking again. We thought we’d just get up and leave in the morning.
The main house and restaurant are essentially a network of little rooms with a mish mash of chairs - plus the main restaurant. We were early for dinner and thought we’d grab a drink. We struggled to find anywhere to sit and when we did couldn’t to find anyone to serve us as they were all stood around chatting. They forgot to call us for dinner and after 15 mins we had to go and find someone. Sat at the table we were presented with a mostly empty bread basket and no choice, so declined, only to see full baskets with more choice being offered later. It took an hour and a quarter to receive our main course despite pre-ordering 90 mins earlier and we had to pour our own wine. The food was actually very good when it arrived.
Breakfast in the morning wasn’t much better as we sat forgotten waiting for coffee for 20 mins. We complained and were then asked what we had ordered again as it had been put in the bin. The hap hazard service continued as I received two poached eggs that were hard and looked like they’d been on the floor.
On top of this we paid a premium price for two spar treatments on day one. The treatments were actually very good but the-facilities, much like most of the buildings needed a good clean. Staff just stand around despite there being dirty cups and plates in the relaxation room, along with crumbs on the furniture. Towels just littered the place in the changing rooms and by the pool. Garden umbrellas lean against the wall inside, which just says we don’t care about presentation. The food and drinks are really expensive in the Spa and not great quality either. Two sandwiches and one glass of wine for £35.
All in all we felt it was a really poor experience. When we explained our disappointment at check out we were still only offered a miserly £100 off the final bill of nearly £1000. They advertise a luxury, unique experience but the reality couldn’t be further from the truth. Unique in its incompetence maybe.
We had paid the majority upfront when reserving our rooms but we left without paying the final amount in disgust given they weren’t prepared to take our comments and thoughts seriously. The arrogance in dismissing our experience as purely ‘our opinion’ is a further amateur hour outrage. We await a call...

AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS!
Read less

Name: Littlehampton Beach
Title: We love our beach
Review: Clean unspoilt beach and sand. Shallow when the ex tide is out. Dogs can be off the lead on a good portion of the beach throughout the year. I live here and am totally biased 😊

Name: The Spur
Title: Very very poor food...
Review: A Sunday roast that gets served with 3 rock hard potatoes that were reheated from the morning, 2 slices of reheated 2mm beef delivered already cooked a few days before or at least that's what it looked like, vegetables at least 5 minutes after the beef and potatoes, totally soggy and over cooked, the only reason it's not 1 star is it was not poisonous and the only option apart from going somewhere else which I will do in the future, there's so many good places to eat in the area, no idea why anyone would go here twice apart from being bad cooks themselves and not having any imagination, or maybe if you like sitting in the pool table room on old cafe tables then this might just be your cup of tea...

Name: Zeera Lounge
Title: Disastrous online take away order!
Review: We were really looking forward to a curry so decided to order 3 meals and sides from Zeera Lounge. The order was placed online, on their website, at 5.15pm but knew they didn’t open until 5.30pm. Selected delivery time between 6pm to 6.30pm which included a £1.00 delivery for some reason, the website says free delivery for orders over £18. Come 6.30pm it still hadn’t arrived so gave them a call. Not ready they said. Probably another 15 minutes. We weren’t impressed so said we would go and collect. On arrival at the shop we were told it still wasn’t ready so we waited patiently. After another 10 minutes I insisted on collecting the food. Again told that it wasn’t ready and would we like free drinks while waiting. Absolutely not. At this point I said don’t bother and I wanted a refund. Nobody knew what to do including the manager who made an appearance with our food. Again I declined the food and insisted on a refund. To rub salt in to the wound he said I had to ring a number to get a refund as he didn’t know how to do it! Miraculously, on advising him that I would be happy to take cash, he denied having any cash in the till, then proceeded to pick up the card terminal and process my refund!!! I collected the money to my card and advised him to enjoy the food they had taken an hour and a half to cook!! Never again -I have a life to live !!!

Name: Swan Hotel
Title: disapointing
Review:
we often use the swan for drinks, and this time it was very disappointing, the service was poor, the prosecco was warm, they had no cold small bottles and would not open a large cold bottle, the bar was noisy and the tables dirty, so we left
Read less

Name: So India, Little.
Title: Will not be returning
Review: We had the mixed started for two, which included samosas and onion bhajis, which inexplicably had been soaked in sauce and so had turned to mush. In fact, all the items of the mixed starter were in one container and comprised one lump of mush. See the photos. It was inedible.In the pilau rice were hard clumps of rice suggesting that it has been overcooked or cooked earlier and reheated.The chicken baltic was dry and swamped with onion.This meal was a complete waste of money. It ended up in the bin. I feel angry. We won't be returning.

Name: India Gate
Title: We Return Every 3 months
Review:
My wife and I return to this beautiful Indian restaurant roughly every 3 months! All I can say about this restaurant is AMAZING! food is absolutely fantastic and 1 of the best curry houses I have ever been to!
Staff are always welcoming and willing to go the extra mile!
The location also is great! In the heart of a beautiful medieval village!
Brilliant! A MUST try!

Name: Ristorante Al Mare
Title: Evening meal
Review: Had a great relaxed night, The hosting was great, always is, the food was superb, and Roberto comes and asks how your food/experience was. Another loverly evening.

Name: Black Horse
Title: A triumph of style over substance
Review:
An exciting looking place, particularly inside. The bars and eating areas are comfortable, stylish and a fashionable mix of old and new.
We were looking for good, simple pub food but sadly our beer battered fish, vegan pie and turkey roast left us disappointed. The ingredients seemed fine but the plate of food left us wanting our food better cooked. The vegetables were simply undercooked.
Staff were friendly and placatory and offered a free meal but who wants that rather than a tasty meal?

Name: The Windmill
Title: Great starter and main
Review: The chef is Italian and is happy (with prior notice) to cater for gluten free/vegan/vegetarian. Best to arrange this when booking a table. Good food nicely presented and beautifully cooked,good service and friendly staff, in a homely atmosphere garden at the rear with a covered area so dogs are welcomed if they are well behaved.

Name: The Diner
Title: Very poor service
Review: Came in on Friday and after waiting for about 10 minutes at the front we were seated at a table and 3 menus were thrown on the table for us. The table was dirty with sticky sauce on it. The lady didn’t tell us if someone would be over to take our order soon but this is what we assumed?! We waited and chose off the menu what we would order, them waited some more and no one came over to us. It was busy in there but not full, we were just past the lunch rush at about 2pm. After almost half an hour of no one coming over we got up and walked out - no one even noticed! Very disappointing service.

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: Stunnung Fish and Chips
Review: First day of the season, starting as they mean to go on. Fish and Chips was stunning. Venue ready for a busy half term week. Manager Karim very welcoming

Name: Fino
Title: Birthday celebration
Review: Table for 4, ordered drinks 2 gin and tonics, whiskey and lemonade, cider. One of the gin and tonics has no gin in!! Good start to the evening,starters came out, followed by main course,we had to ask for correct cutlery for main course the waitress said we usually get it right!!! The meal was ok but not nothing to right home about. Staff are young and inexperienced, but with time and good leadership it hopefully will improve,value for money no maybe a revisit in 6 months time it may be better.

Name: Avisford
Title: Tired hotel in need of renovation
Review:
I booked a two-night stay at this hotel assuming that I could trust that the Hilton would have a good standard of room and service. How wrong could I be, the room I was given was stuffy, no air con and the floorboards creaked every time someone walked by the room. The gym equipment was ancient, and you could barely swing a cat in the room. I complained and was offered a complimentary dinner. I ordered a curry, it was so bland, and the meat was chewy, I had return it and tried the steak, after a long wait it arrived and was tough as old boots. At this point I lost the will to live, won’t be staying again in a hurry. The only good thing about this hotel is the grounds and the golf course.
Read less

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: T.B.S as advertised on their store front - Total B S
Review:
Took my wife here for our anniversary, as i have heard some rave reviews, we are big foodies and love a good burger. Starter - Wings in buffalo sauce - dry breaded wings with a 'drizzle' of buffalo sauce, garnished with chive, hmm, not sure about this, if you like American wings like b-dubs this didn't even come close. The cocktails were expensive, poor tasting and very weak. i asked for a cocktail not a fruit juice...

i was certainly holding out for the burger. i ordered 2 - the flamin chicken burger (My wife also ordered this), which was flamin wrong - a whole block of stilton appeared to be smothered on top of the dry crispy chicken; the smell of which made me feel sick - buyers beware...A little tip to the restaurateur's - perhaps put the stilton on the side so you don't ruin the burger for everyone? The second burger, a fairly reasonable gourmet beef burger with bacon and cheddar, caramelised onion, lettuce, pickles in a brioche bun which i would give a 3 out of 5. For desert i ordered a sticky toffee pudding, hoping that my sweet tooth would provide solace. i was given a Cold sticky toffee pudding that stuck to the roof of my mouth forever churning like a cement mixer..come on guys, Chef Mic (rowave) cant even help you here...

Moreover, Already complaining about the copious amounts of Stilton on the burger, a cheque comes to the table, and i see the flamin chicken burger x 2 were still on the bill. One of which had bacon added (£1.50) in addition, did this little piggy run away as i never received the bacon. We again complained and management kindly decided to give us 50% OFF ONE burger after ordering 3 burgers, 3 cocktails, beers and a desert i thought our server was joking. My wife nor I even ate the flamin chicken burger it was so bad, of course as i have decorum i thought lets just pay, get out of here and take to the review sites and wherever else i can to deter people from visiting this establishment. A poor, poor attempt of a burger shop, go to the States and do some research guys, so cliché, Elvis music, really?...after this ordeal we will NEVER be going here again.

Name: Avisford
Title: Not up to standard sadly
Review:
I paid for this room for my parents for my dad's birthday. They are old and my dad has a disabled bad but they were left to bring their bags down to reception (there is no lift). They were also told there was money to pay on the room, which was corrected but they were upset by this.
Read less

Name: Lemongrass Restaurant
Title: Honestly this restaurant continues to disappoint
Review:
Honestly this restaurant continues to disappoint, after six months of not using this restaurant I’d forgotten just how bad the food was there, however 15 minutes into the meal I again remembered why we have not been back for over six months.
The food was very salty and in one dish also too much sugar , either way this was definitely not good Thai cuisine.
I reported this to the manager on duty who seem to have little or no interest in the complaint and never said a word back to us before we left that evening

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Harvested Littlehampton
Review: Salad bar is a real disappointment from previous visits, not such a very good selection anymore, portions of main meals have shrunk and again not such a variety to choose from. Our waitress didn't know what one of the ordered drinks was , she thought it was a dessert!!!! and I had to go to the bar to collect it . One of our main meals had the steak missing!!-

Name: La Campagnia
Title: Good food, small restaurant
Review:
Good food at a good price.
Fairly quick service.
Pleasant surroundings.
Only complaint that it was very cramped - too many tables in a small space, which detracted from the atmosphere.

Definitely recommend booking!!

Name: Butlins
Title: Watch your kids
Review:
My 2 16yr old granddaughters were given a questionable cigarette by two toerags who worked at the resort and we were evicted from the camp. I have complained on numerous accounts but because they were caught with the item they are the guilty ones.
No mention the fact that there was nothing on my kids prior to arriving at the camp.
They were approached by two morons on the afternoon of our arrival who gave them the item and informed them if they liked it they could have some later that night. They were caught in the smoking area with the said item and we were out by the next morning.
Watch your kids and who they mix with or talk too because they are not even safe in Butlins.
Read less

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: a good value for money meal
Review:
Although very busy we didn’t wait long to be shown to a table.
Food was very nicely presented and good portions.
Thought the kids mail meal for our grandson was excellent and liked the salad bar.
We were served by a lovely lady called Caroline who was so friendly, absolutely lovely and although rushed off her feet she never stopped smiling.
Would definitely return.

Name: Gaskyns
Title: Disappointing service, won't bother again
Review: We visited yesterday (23/8/2019) arriving at 3:15pm. The place was empty with the exception of 2-3 ladies in the very small and overgrown garden at the back (not open and spacious like the pictures above). There were 6 of us and 3 children (9 in total). I asked what cakes there were and was told 'I can't remember' - what a really poor response. Had I not been with my family I would have walked out. I didn't bother to have a cake as they clearly couldn't be bothered to sell us them but the kids had a chocolate brownie which tasted of coconut (assume this was coconut flour) and said they were dry. My coffee had the tide out, I assume this was because I had it black and it was all the machine would provide, considering I asked for it black it would have been nice to add a little bit more water but hey like I said service isn't this places forte. And then to top it off at 3:55pm someone shouted to clear the tables as they were closing and then two young girls appeared and cleared our table. You would think they'd be run ragged all day as they had no energy about them, probably why they were shouted at or was that for our benefit as a large hint to get out, I can't be sure. Won't be going back.

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Lovely dinner!
Review: We had a lovely last minute dinner at the black rabbit with family. The service was quick and all of the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. It’s very well priced and you receive genuinely good food! I would definitely recommend!

Name: Tajdar
Title: Worst experience
Review:
Service was poor at best and the waiter didn’t temper to bring all the food. Found a hair in my meal and waiter didn’t think it was an issue, my friends stopped eating their as they were well and truly put off their meal.
There was no apology all he said was I will get you another one and at this point we didn’t feel that hungry considering what I had found.
Certainly wouldn’t go back there

Name: The Town House
Title: Birthday Lunch!
Review:
First time visit for a friends birthday lunch and it will not be my last. Fabulous food in a lovely small and friendly restaurant. The lunch menu gives a really good choice and my halibut was fabulous and cooked to perfection.

Will definitely return to this little gem.

Name: East Beach Café
Title: Very noisy
Review: We sat down at a lovely table overlooking the beach. The restaurant was half full but there was a table of 10 or 12 behind us and five to our right. This restaurant has a wooden floor and the noise was so great that we could hardly hear each other speak. We felt very uncomfortable and left.

Name: Spring Cottage B&B
Title: Lovely Bed and Breakfast in a quiet location close to the sea
Review:
This was our second stay at Spring Cottage and both times we stayed in the Pink room,
Very comfortable, Great hospitality from the owner Michele. Would highly recommend. Very clean with all amenities.

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: What a Treat!
Review:
For a real treat in the depths of an English winter you couldn't beat a day or two at Bailiff'scourt! not only superb food and beautiful surroundings but two excellent leisure pools, the outside one heated, a sauna and a steam room. And the staff are smashing too!
Read less

Name: The Mezze
Title: Rubbish
Review: Rubbish food, rubbish service, expensive for the rubbish quality. Give this one a miss. We will never come here again. Be warned

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Nice food but under staffed
Review: The food is nice but had to consistently chase up the drinks very under staffed Carrol was working very hard and was friendly

Name: Elmer Tandoori
Title: Total Let Down
Review:
this restaurant hides it really bad food behind its low charges,
the Quality of the food is a mar on the image of the concept of having edible food that represents anything like Indian food,
And not all that was ask for in the take out call was provided.
Pleases avoid this sham of an eatery, do not waste your time or money.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Awful bar maid
Review: Come to have a meal with my family who have come a long way to visit me; get told we need to eat for our table as we had arrived early which is absolutely fine and the young man who told us this was very welcoming and accommodating for us. We then go to order a drink. Now I have worked in loads of bars; I am a 22 year old who has many visible tattoos. I was ordering drinks for my family only to be ID. Now this again is fine but when I told the lady that I was indeed 22 and had been here many times and I wasn’t drinking and also having a meal here I got the foulest response saying that I still need to be ID which wouldn’t have been the issue. The issues was the way this women treated me as if I was stupid. Then once we were seated me and my family felt like we where being watched and it made our time every uncomfortable. This is very unfortunate as the other staff members where every nice and welcoming. Truly a massive shame.

Name: Premier Inn Arundel
Title: Typical premier inn but a little tired
Review:
I could say the room was too warm, the shower didn't work well enough and is difficult to climb in to over the bath with no safety rail.

But I could also say it is budget accommodation at an inexpensive price for a night or 2 is fine
Read less

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Antagonistic Supervisor made a bad situation so much worse
Review: After 1 hour 45 minutes, having sent one starter back and then getting the wrong meal for my Son we left with only 3 out of 4 of us having eaten. The Supervisors attitude to our complaint was agressive and antagonistic. Disgraceful.

Name: Pub & Kitchen
Title: Amazing restaurant
Review: Brilliant restaurant at Butlins the food is gorgeous the service is first class and served very quick. The kids loved the soup and the mini mess. The steak was cooked to perfection and the lamb shank was gorgeous. The duck salad and garlic mushrooms were really nice.Tony was excellent and looked after us would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone staying

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Cold Sunday Roast
Review:
What a rubbish Sunday roast, it was cold on cold plate, veg not cook, not even salt and pepper,
When i dinner was bought to the table we were asked if we would like any sauces, we asked for mint sauce, salt and pepper Oh and can we have knifes and forks, the girl was not amused, came back with a tiny pot of mint sauce, pepper grinder & knifes and forks. waiting for salt got fed up after nearly finishing the food i went to the bar to ask they gave me a a small pot of salt said we dont have anymore salt shakers (joke). The lager shandy was as flat as a pancake. It was the worst sunday roast i have ever had put in front of me and for £14.95 per plate it is disgusting to charge for that.I wanted to bring to the attention but after standing there for 5 mins thought enough is enough, let people know what it is really like.

Name: Six Bells
Title: Mr writer
Review:
Called this morning to make a booking and got an answerphone message saying nobody was available.
Checked out on google at 11am which said they were closed so Visited website and there was an option to make a booking which I did at around 11am for this evening 6pm asking for confirmation.
Nothing all day so I called as soon as open 6pm this evening and was told fully booked. I asked why I was not contacted and I was asked why didn’t you call as they were there all day. I told them that I did call and asked why they didn’t check email bookings. They had no answer! Very unhappy

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: AVOID
Review:
We are here yesterday for my daughter in laws birthday & we’re extremely disappointed.
The food was beyond poor - cold & poorly presented & not as described on the menu.
When this was addressed with the manager he was rude & disinterested.
Needless to say - we won’t be going back or recommending this place to any one.

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: Very Good
Review:
The Mac & Cheese burger that I had was excellent, and probably one of the best tasting burgers I've ever had! My wife had the 'veggie' option and she also said the taste was lovely.
George was 'spot on' with his choice of Pacifico larger for me after I told him what I prefer.
Would love a TBS nearer to Alton though!

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Never again
Review:
Went for Premier breakfast 3 days running while staying at excellent premier inn next door.
Floors were filthy, same debris under table 3 days running.
Only one staff member available for breakfast who was doing their best.
Buffet totally mis-managed every day. Huge amount of items out of stock including basics like cereal, dried fruit and pastries. Even coffee and sugar frequently under-stocked or absent. Would not use again.

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Dreadful service by uninterested staff.
Review: Special on Tuesday evenings. Staff at bar were unaware of special. Food was good but bar staff had no clue as to what wine was on offer. Food was eventually served. Tables were not cleared for 2hours. No table service. Seemed like 16 year olds working with no experience and no interest. Great location but service has dropped beyond belief from original standard.

Name: The Dragon
Title: Excellent food
Review: Tasty food and lovely atmosphere, the restaurant has beautiful decor we shall return for more family gatherings.

Name: Shoreline
Title: Our Delight
Review:
Fantastic sea view from the room, with a neat little bedroom for up to two kids. The food was very good and the staff, from front of house to cleaners, were polite, friendly and happy to listen. They dealt with me and my family's complex needs with ease and efficiency. The beds were a bit stiff otherwise it would have been a five. Don't let that stop you choosing this hotel for your Butlin's stay.
Read less

Name: The George, Burpham
Title: My birthday lunch
Review: What a disappointment!We were told soup of the day was mushroom,which my wife ordered.She was served leek & potato which she was told was "better then mushroom"!She should have been given a choice IMMEDIATELY if mushroom was not available.I ordered asparagus with poached egg and hollandaise sauce.The egg was almost hard-boiled!The Old Speckled Hen on handpump was way too long in the cask and tasted horrible.A 10% non-discretionary service charge was added to our bill.We will NEVER go back here again

Name: KFC Bognor
Title: Awful oily food
Review:
Tried it few months ago wrote to head office fobbed off. Gave it benefit of doubt again today today.. BIG mistake.
14 piece bucket given 10 legs 4 thighs - absolutely dripping in oil , same as before.
Can only assume they giving breast n best pieces to friends n family not visiting customers. Fontwell superior in every way.
Do not touch Bognor KFC you will regret it.

Name: The Beresford
Title: Popped in for lunch
Review: What a lovely find. We were in need of lunch and were in the area, so popped in to The Beresford. It's a very big place with lots of tables and has a lovely little garden area out the back. They offer a carvery every day, which looked delicious, however, i hadn't had a burger in ages, so had that. It was massive and extremely tasty and came with all the trimmings, including the best chips i've had in a long time. They had a good selection of drinks too and i chose the local bitter, which was also very nice. The service was excellent - very friendly and efficient. We sat outside in the garden,as it was a lovely day and the inside is quite dark and has quite old fashioned decor, which was clean and tidy. We will definitely go back and would recommend this to anyone. It is good value for money and very tasty food. A great family run pub.

Name: The Thatched House
Title: Food Ale.
Review:
We had a lunchtime drink followed by a restaurant meal of fresh lobster and a cod fish dish.
Superb lunch time staff with excellent food and service.
I didn't think the beer could get any better from the previous landlord, but with a increased throughput even better.
A credit to the village with increased standards and presentation after the refurbishment.

David and Natasha.

Name: Bailiffscourt Spa
Title: Disappointing
Review:
I visited here with a friend for a well earned spa day. Spa treatments were lovely and well administered. The pool and facilities are available to hotel and members to use. Although the pools were pretty empty, there were not enough beds to go round and we had to share a bed as did others.
 From arrival to Lunch was 5 hours, which we knew when we booked. On arrival there was a machine upstairs to make your own tea or coffee. We were told snacks were available during the morning but were not. In the end we had to ask and were told only biscuits were available which we gladly accepted. All food and drink is taken in the lounge which is upstairs, so we were up and down several times.
Cream tea was included in our package but was inedible, with the scones being bitter to taste and of a sand like texture. We reported this to reception and were told they would be taken back to the kitchen , we were offered a soft drink as recompense but declined. We aware also told the hotel would be in contact regarding this but they never did.
I wouldn't s place unless you just want a massage and a quick swim but a £160 it is a waste of money
Read less

Name: Avisford
Title: Disappointed
Review:
Came here for a weekend stay when was going to the races. Check in was at 3pm, however our rooms were not ready till 4.20 Giving us only 30 mins to get ready, after travelling a long way this was very annoying. 2nd issue they was a problem with payment, As everything was delayed I wanted some room service to eat, after taking my card to swipe I asked how long room service took and lady said up to an hour. So I said forget it. A family member had paid for our rooms, how ever I had the room rate taken out on my card. It took me 3 phones calls to sort this out and also promise of a call back which never happened. Not all but the reception staff I dealt with I found a bit rude. The rooms our outdated and tired. Would I stay here again NO is the answer. I would except a much better service from a Hilton.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: 70s weekend
Review:
We have just come back from 70s weekend staying in the ocean hotel, we had a brilliant time.
We booked breakfast and evening meals with good selection of food for both, very friendly staff always going out of there way to help you especially Ashley, bedroom nice and clean. In fact it was clean every where and staff so friendly. The groups and tribute acts where fantastic will definitely be going back.
Read less

Name: Carlton Hotel
Title: Not my cup of tea
Review: This is my opion, I will never go there again. Sea view and balcony. No its a back room facing the town. Football hooligans welcome but not for peace loving couples. Staff, don't get me started. No staff just the owner with no people skills. I would ask for my money back but, hay ho. So disappointed 😥

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: 4 groups of people from coach trip overcharged... be warned...
Review: 4 groups of pensioners from a coach trip were over charged, how low, or shall I say how high can they go. Disgraceful !!

Name: Butlins
Title: Food issues in the deck restaurant
Review:
Be aware when you read the opening times of the deck restaurant. If you decide to have a fairly late swimming session, decide to shower and change before eating make sure you do all this and then be at the restaurant by 6.15. My wife and grandchildren decided to late swim etc.. we arrived for food ate the first two courses, but somewhat bemusedly watched the kitchen staff remove all food including deserts, when I enquired why I was told the restaurant closes at 7pm! No amount of discussion changed the situation, in fact it seemed I was in the way of their clearing. Shame because this spoilt a good experience. Guess we should have selected all courses and sat with them in front of us cold apple crumble mm mm! Great customer service restaurant times to suit staff not diners always attracts you back! But not us bye bye butlins!
Read less

Name: Pagham Beach Café
Title: What a disappointment
Review:
We visited Pagham for the weekend for a little mini getaway. The weather was better than expected on the Sunday so took a lovely stroll along the seaside, played some games in the authentic little arcade and then we saw the sign for fish and chips, what a result! We couldn’t think of a better way to finish off a lovely seaside visit that proper chippy chips! Well what a disappointment!!
Firstly we were greeted by a very rude man who seemed to see us as an inconvenience (I understand that there is a cafe attached but I feel that you shouldn’t offer take away if you can’t handle it) the poor cashier was lovely but seemed very uncomfortable and aware of the weird atmosphere, we then asked if we could have some smaller/ portions of chips which he seemed confused about and then simply said “no, we can’t halve portions”, weird , its chips, it’s not like we were asking for half of a of fried egg.
Then the chips...... wowee...why on earth would you waste a location like that by chucking some oven chips in oil and hoping for the best. They were rubbery bits of food formerly known as potato, no authenticity at all.
We were all so disappointed! Such a shame.

Name: Spice Paradise
Title: Not a happy vegetarian customer
Review: Have used this takeaway a few times over the years. Tonight was one of a few occassions my order (and my mums partner on separate occassions also) has been wrong. A particularly appalling experience when you are a vegetarian and recieve a meat dish instead, the second time tonight. As such I clearly asked for a vegetable peshwari curry on the phone. I drove to collect the order. When I dished this out to myself and partner at home we were disgusted to find out too late after the first mouthful that it was in fact chicken. Already extremely annoyed that I had to interupt our dinner and make another journey to the restaurant. I was further dissapointed to be greeted with small apology and wait for a replacement curry; but no offer of a goodwill gesture refund for the trouble and insensitive mistake. As a customer who may not be regular but has used their business for many years this is not good business, or good business in general.

Name: The Fish Factory
Title: Awful meal and freezing cold restaurant
Review: Awful meal, the starter looked so unappetising and the sides of the plate were sticky. Went here despite an awful Christmas lunch last year but had been assured it had improved. A cold plate is always a bad sign, I wouldn’t serve food at home without warming the plates. Surely this is a general rule. The Yorkshire pudding was like a cannonball, nobody on my table ate them. The pig in blanket was the saltiest sausage wrapped in a cremated piece of bacon, it was rock solid and completely unable to cut through. The vegetables were completely tasteless, roast potatoes hadn’t been anywhere near an oven. The gravy was so salty. The pudding was no better, it was all quite disgusting. On top of that it was freezing cold in there. Will definitely not be returning.

Name: Arun View
Title: Family lunch out
Review: We all agreed to meet here because it overlooks the river in Littlehampton, whilst being entertained by activity on the river we sat down to three course meal, the service was prompt and very politely given, definitely go there again next time we are in Sussex.

Name: China Palace
Title: Fantastic!
Review: We had a fantastic dinner at The China Palace recently. The staff were so warm and welcoming and the food excellent. (Do book, as this is a popular venue!) We chose one of the set menus, which was delicious -there is also an impressive wine list and the herbal tea list to follow is definitely worth sampling. This was one of the best meals/experiences that we have had in a long time, in a lovely setting. (Do look up at the ceiling in the restaurant, it is hundreds of years old and very beautiful). We plan to return very soon!

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Crumbles for chips at premium prices.
Review: Kids meal at adult premium prices ! We ordered two sausage and chips two teas. £23 ! Not that the price matters, but the portions where terrible. We waited for service. We made a complaint to the rotund fryer who just shrugged his shoulders. Avoid.

Name: The Mezze
Title: The BEST Turkish!!
Review:
If you enjoy Turkish food or even if you want to try it for the first time, then you are in for a real treat here. The food is absolutely delicious - I have been to many Turkish restaurants over the years, but this one is ‘hands down’ the best one I have ever eaten at.

The service was exceptional, fast and friendly and the prices were also excellent. Faultless!! Thank you for a wonderful dining experience.

Name: Black Horse
Title: Brilliant!
Review: We had a family birthday lunch here yesterday for a 2 year old. We were giving the skittle alley to use and it was perfect. The children were able to run around making as much noise as they wanted without disturbing other diners. Lunch was excellent with very generous portions. Will definitely be visiting again

Name: Church Farm
Title: Worst wi-fi in a uk caravan park?
Review:
The park is clean tidy and very family friendly, only downside, phone reception is poor and their internet, wi-fi is appalling, I have been here for 5 years running, complained first year that one of the booster masts wasn't working . It's still not after 5 years. Playing a game, what takes me usually about 10 minutes has just taken 2 hours and 20 minutes. Reported problem again this year, absolutely no response. Will for this one reason be thinking carefully about not returning. Everything else is brilliant such a shame that this spoils it
Read less

Name: Murrell Arms
Title: friendly but not at all busy
Review:
was just passing through after helping friends with a house move in yapton
pub was a bit empty.a bit like the atmostphere
only had a lemonade as I was driving back to Portsmouth the owner was certainly a bit drunk I think he drinks the profits talking to a man in there who is a regular said it is only busy on Friday nights and there used to be live music but the profits are low and the only thing that keeps it open is its listed building status.

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Terrible!!
Review: We booked in Sept for our christmas dinner special treat as a family, we expected a great service & lovely meal at £58 a head, as this year was a treat for me to not do the cooking. The staff were dis-interested, never once were we asked if everything was ok with our meals (That is usual practice & something they should do!) The starters were shamefully small & disappointing to taste. The mains were no better, & the desserts also mediocre (everything was dry & rubbery!) I personally left there not eating any of my courses! And the other guests on our table didn't want to complain as its christmas day, but for me? If you dont want to work christmas day (understandable!) Then dont work in that line of work! My experience there today has been So bitterly disappointing that I will never eat there again at any time of the year as we have done many times previously. Their website says that they will make our day special, which is what we wanted.. but never again! Totally ruined our christmas day!

Name: Parpadelle
Title: Work meal of the highest standard
Review: We were all very pleased with the attentive service we received on a wet Monday night. The waiting staff were ever so patient, particularly Kirsty. The starter of scallops, potato rosti and crab bisque was my highlight, so much depth of flavour to the sauce. I have had casual lunch downstairs with the wife before and it was lovely but cannot wait for an excuse to return with the family upstairs for the more refined and atmospheric experience.

Name: Linden Fisheries
Title: sadly gone downhill after change of hands
Review: Since changing hands the overall offering has gone downhill. Supply lines have obviously changed and quality now poor and standard of cooking substandard. Will not use again

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Food not great
Review: Very hit and miss with food. Convienient location but would avoid anything on the menu that wasn’t a burger or chilli. Tapas is very poor, the large basket of bread you get with it doesn’t make up for it. The staff seem friendly if there are no queues, but honestly avoid the food, overpriced and poor quality.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Truly Awful
Review:
We arrived at 11:45 only to be told they don’t start serving food until 12 midday when it clearly states on the leaflet we had and the menu it said 11:30 and showed this to the guy behind the bar. He just shrugged. We were shown to a table by a window and soon discovered the carpet was filthy with bits of last nights dinner scattered around. (Disgusting).
On closer inspection we could see the carpets in our area were very dirty with bits of fluff and food. The carpets looked as if they had not been hoovered in months. The whole fabric of the place is awful and needs a complete renovation. The service was slow and the burger was mediocre with a burnt bun and the jacket potato was small and hard.
 Will never return!

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: Exceptional on every level. (...and way better than any in the ‘Pig’ chain!)
Review:
We stayed at Bailiffscourt to celebrate both my fiancée’s birthday and as an early wedding present. We have two hounds, who travel with us to most places and it was important they joined us for the stay. The hotel could not have been more accommodating, right down to the dog bowls, biscuits and doggie towels that greeted us on arrival at our room in the Gate House.
The Room was wonderfully comfortable with a large four-poster and small Knole style sofa-bed. It also featured a large bathroom with walk-in shower and roll-top bath...it was furnished to a very high standard.
My fiancée had a couple of spa treatments and said the staff were fantastic, and the treatments, excellent. I also used the gym, and as a regular gym user was impressed how well-equipped it was for a hotel facility.
We had dinner in one of the small lounges, understandably, dogs aren’t allowed in the restaurant. However it was incredibly comfortable and we both remarked, that it was like having our own mini private dining room! The staff were outstanding and looked after us superbly. Supper was also wonderful and to a Michelin standard.
Breakfast in the courtyard was also wonderful, the staff again, excellent and they even brought out sausages for the hounds... with whom, it was naturally a huge ‘thumbs-up’!

The grounds and setting of Bailiffscourt is absolutely beautiful and it’s proximity to the beach, a lovely bonus...we had a long walk with our ‘boys’ the next morning...to blow away the cobwebs, before setting off home reflecting on what a truly wonderful experience we had and that we will definitely return!

As a side note, I mention the Pig in the title of this review. They don’t allow dogs which is their choice and may appeal to some people, but I have to say, were quite condescending in pointing that out. I’ve also eaten at several in the Pig chain (the Beach, Forest etc) and Bailiffscourt is in another league from both a culinary and service perspective!
Read less

Name: The Lamb Inn
Title: Great trip down memory lane
Review:
I visited The Lamb at Nyetimber having booked the day before. I took my 85 year old mother and my wife. We have enjoyed family holidays at Pagham for over 60 years and The Lamb was always one of our highlights with a Lamb burger and a Shandy/cider following a stroll.
We were not disappointed with either the service or the meal itself which was well presented, very tasteful and of reasonable proportion at a fair price
Despite their tills ‘having a moment’ the staff worked through it whilst it was put right.
Finally a chat with the Landlord on the way out, reminiscing over past times made our day. Great pub, great food, what more could you expect.

Name: Hotham Park
Title: Great little park
Review:
There is a new fabulous mini golf and a climbing frame and kids play area. There is also a miniature railway. Its an oasis of calm. Cafe is great as well.
Read less

Name: Robin Hood
Title: very very disappointed
Review:
Went for Xmas function and very unhappy with food. One diner had plastic in their starter, all veg over microwaved and mushy, Yorkshires rock hard, gravy lumpy and thick. Xmas pudd was so hard could not cut through it. And worst of all everyones food was not hot. Upon complaining were given a measley 10% discount.
Have been here many times day and night and ALWAYS the food is only warm at best, even when we have been the only people in! How can this be? Smebody needs to get a grip. Strange all the good reviews are from first time reviewers, what a coincidence

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Good eats
Review: Sharon at the bar was very helpful on choice of food and drink.next time I will have normal fries.Pleasant surroundings to eat .Best Sam Miguel for a long time,wife enjoyed Asian beef salad and I had a chicken burger quite moist but wasn’t taken with tikka batter but east was good.SHaron the server is very polite.

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Rubbish
Review: This must be the worst chip shop I've ever been in 16 of my family went in yesterday 14th April none of us looked at prices very disappointed with meals cheap sausages cheap food in general then after we finished the bill was extortionate cost over £110 and toilets were disgusting wont be going there again

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Very impressed
Review:
Very impressed with the quality of the food which was really tasty and good value. We ate at 12.30 on a Sunday before it got too busy and staff could not have been more helpful. David our server was working hard keeping all customers happy as the restaurant got busier and busier.
Although we were there for two hours we were not in any hurry and as it was a birthday meal didn't want to rush just enjoy. Would certainly recommend but allow time and we will be back

Name: Boat House In the Marina
Title: Friendly Service and great food with a view!
Review: We love visiting Julie and the team, always a warm friendly welcome, great tasty food and an amazing view. We have also been to a few of the event nights and had a fantastic night..... would highly recommend.

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Lovely Stay in a beautiful Old Hotel.
Review:
We stayed in The Norfolk Arms as a Christmas treat to my mum.
We had a wonderful time.
The staff on reception were very warm and helpful.
Once we got to our room which was a twin room, it was lovely.
A comfortable size, not overly big but more than enough room for two fully grown women to stay and not bump into each other.
Bathroom was nice, small but functional.. The shower was lovely.
We stopped and had a night cap before we went to bed in the really small and totally cosy bar, it was like someones old fashioned sitting room, we loved it.
After having a greats sleep in the comfortable beds, we went for breakfast and again we had no complaints at all.
The buffet continental was really nice and was constantly being replenished and the hot breakfast was of a very high quality.
The breakfast staff again were very warm and welcoming.
All in all we absolutely loved this Hotel and would stay again in a heart beat..
Read less

Name: Avisford
Title: One night stay
Review:
Very nice hotel with friendly staff. The grounds ( golf course ) is picturesque. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful at all times. Had a lovely evening meal as the food was of a high standard. The room was nice and clean. Had noted that there was a fan in the room as there appears to be no air conditioning. Didn’t really matter in the winter as you want heating. Also noted that there was no lifts and needed to walk upstairs to my 2nd floor room. Overall a nice pleasant hotel worth staying.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Great fun
Review:
First time visiting since 1970s, now bringing my two children age 7 and 9. Booked through sun holidays but a family member upgraded us to the Wave Hotel so I can’t comment on the silver room accommodation I would have stayed in. Wave hotel is very good, lovely comfy beds, big room, air con, separate child’s themed room, nice and sound proofed.

Pros and cons so far- halfway through my break

Pros

Swimming pool - it’s out of this world, rapids, slides, wave machine, rubber ring ride, areas for babies, you name it it’s got it. They allow smallish inflatables, good cafe attached with Costa coffee
Entertainment - loud but of a good quality, take ear plugs for the skyline gang!
Food court dining package - loads of choice and delicious, staff clear tables quickly. Get there as early as possible to avoid queues
Staff - make the kids feel welcome and lots around to ask questions etc

Cons

Arcade - expensive, games are either £1-£3 each not much fun if you have a large family
Outside areas - a little untidy noticeable litter in the day but has gone by the morning, and cleaning crews are visible
Cash machine - charges you for withdrawals, captive audience situation so not fair

I will update review at the end of my stay 🙂
Read less

Name: Sea View
Title: Friday night dinner 6/9/19
Review:
Ambience, busy snd generally ok
Bar staff attentive and friendly

As usual Mine host and partner were typically aloof, unresponsive , unfriendly and showed no interested in their customers
They will not even think to say hello to village locals who have been in their pub many times
Things got worse than the cold atmosphere as the Food served was really awful, yukkkk nasty

Drink selection ok

Even if you consider this as only a local pub it still falls very short of acceptable,

In fact it seems to get worse each time we visit it, the only redeeming point is the garden on a sunny day

It is very obvious that the landlord and partner have no interest in the hospitality industry, they seem to have no interaction with their customers at any point, very strange!!!

SO mr and mrs Landlord “ if you hate this hospitality life then we suggest sell up and move on !!!

The Food really terrible, obviously it was precooked, frozen and then microwaved to within an inch of its life
It was really bland , hot as hell and disgusting , we ordered fish and chips, calves liver and mousaka,
all diners left their dishes ,
at least our tables company was good, and the bright side was at least our dog had a good feast

Best to avoid except for a drink on a summer evening

Name: Butlins
Title: Avoid Ocean Hotel
Review:
I’ve left a full review of the hotel on the hotels page, but let’s just say we were less then happy with the noisy doors, light switches, lifts, and neighbouring guests. It totally ruined our holiday from the first night, with noises into the early morning, all 5 of us were kept up and I personally did get a wink of sleep, I’m so disappointed with butlins ocean hotel, the design of the rooms, corridors, the actual doors and the sound proofing.

We have visited butlins every year for 4 years, the wave hotel is so much better for noise and layout. But this year also saw a huge influx of lower end clientele, unfortunately I would call them chavs, I understand that this isn’t butlins fault, but it’s a fact. These guests are load and anti social, we will be taking our money elsewhere from now on.

The plus side is every single member of staff on that resort is a credit to the organisation, so friendly, so up beat and just fantastic, shame about the room and guests.
Read less

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Not impressed
Review: We stayed next door at the Premier Inn which was spotless and newly refurbished. We almost didn’t have breakfast but decided to at the last minute - big mistake. Shown to a table by a strict miserable looking woman, who pointed out where everything was then disappeared. The fried breakfast items were already cooked and being kept warm(ish). The pastries were sparse and didn’t get replenished, the fruit salad consisted of melon and melon, am assuming there was originally other fruits that had been picked out and again not replenished! There were no muffins or bagels and just 2 crumpets which looked stale. The Greek yogurt was in a tiny bowl and ran out before we reached it, by which time we’d lost interest and couldn’t be bothered to ask for more. We’ve had numerous Premier Inn breakfasts over the years and they’ve always been delicious. Not here. What’s happened???

Name: Magna Tandoori
Title: Fawlty Towers revisited
Review:
I have found Bognor Regis’s answer to Fawlty Towers, The Magna Tandoori. We have just spent part of our evening watching a gradually unfurling tale of woe.
We’d booked and arrived on time, were shown to our table in a very busy Restaurant and sat watching for quite some time before we had to ask for someone to take our order.
This gave us the opportunity to watch a procession of waiters walking up and down the restaurant, without appearing to notice what was going on.
We were being served by a waiter who seemed to have a wish that he was a million miles away from the restaurant, to say he was surly, rude and couldn’t really care less what was happening to us would be an understatement, he then proceeded to ask the order taker to accept our food order.
A starter devoured, a Prawn Puri, as food goes it scored around 3 out of 10, boring and heat with no spice zing to it. Having used some cutlery a new fork came bouncing across the table with all the grace of a Barnes Wallis bouncing bomb, thrown instead of placed. New plates were treated similarly with no grace at all.
The food, served reasonable quickly considering they were so busy, was quite good, not spectacular, but regular ‘Indian Food’, in good sized portions and reasonably priced.
Behind us continued the melee of people, it was bit like eating in a train station. Trying to pay, after finishing what we wanted to eat, was again moments of delights and leaving our utensils at the finishing positions on our plates, we were passed by at least 6 waiters who looked at our plates and just walked on by, sometimes walking to the other end of the Restaurant and walking back again.
You would have thought the fun would stop there, but they had one last treat for us, the bill was brought, with hot Towels and 2 After Eight mints between 3 people.
So, thank you Magma for such a fun ‘Fawlty Towers’ evening.
Will we be back?
Maybe when Customer satisfaction comes higher on your list, than cramming them in and some of, not all, your waiters realise we are customers. If I want to be treated this way I will go back to Won Kei in London, where the Waiters are expert in the art of giving customer satisfaction by being rude all the time but have perfected this art so well that we enjoy it.

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: The perfect place to sit by the river and soak in the beautiful view.
Review:
This is a very special place. The location is quite idyllic. Down a long long lane and into the heart of the South Downs. There are loads of tables along the side of the river Arun and the views of the water meadows and Arundel Castle are exquisite.
Each day the Black Rabbit caters for hundreds of tourists and visitors. It’s not fine dining by any means but perfectly adequate good food and they have a system which copes admirably with the huge numbers of visitors. Salads and burgers are the order of the day. Chicken dishes and Children’s menus. .

Name: Sen
Title: Perfect Tapas and Sangria
Review: We really enjoyed this meal and it went so smoothly, we had a group of 11 people for a work get together. Sangria arrived at the table in good time, we had the perfect amount of talking time before the food arrived. We ordered the banquet at a set amount per head, which was great value. Every inch of the table was covered in lovely tapas, everything from king prawns and calamari to chicken, pork and meatball dishes, garlic bread and several vegetarian dishes too, the food was good quality and kept on coming until we were full. The staff were very attentive and provided a great service. Such a lovely atmosphere in there too, felt like we were in Spain... it was perfect

Name: Avisford
Title: Groupon Spa day
Review:
Disappointed. Very nice lady doing massage in spa but NOT-SO-NICE and unprofessional who did manicure and pedicure. Asking what country am I from and talking about BREXIT - seriously? Also if you go for pedicure you expect a scrub, balm, massage or anything to be done to your feet. Not only painting nails (not great technique either) . With no UV lamp. After she finished she told me to wait for an hour until nail polish will dry. An hour seriously? Not such a good deal at all.
Read less

Name: The Roundstone
Title: So disappointing
Review:
Every couple of months our family meets up for Sunday lunch, and this time we chose The Roundstone. Car parking was good and It looks like it’s had a refurb recently as it looked nice inside the restaurant area.

We were kept waiting to order our meals, and had to go looking for someone to take our order. Prices are quite high ( we were charged £1.20 for soda water and lime - usually about 40p everywhere else). The food, when it arrived, looked ok, but not great. The roast beef was tough, in fact so much was over cooked - the veg was often soggy, whereas the Yorkshire pud was rock hard. The veggie meal included a meat sausage wrapped in bacon. The menu said that extra gravy, potatoes and Yorkshire’s were free with Sunday roast, but we were charged extra for gravy, and the waitress wouldn’t take it off the bill until we pointed to it printed on the menu. Whilst the waitress tried hard, it was clear that the restaurant was running on minimum staff, who seemed young and inexperienced.

Outside the restaurant, the back garden area was really scruffy and strewn with litter. The tables weren’t cleared throughout our entire stay.

All in all, this wasn’t a great experience.prices were above average, but just about everything else was below average. We won’t be going back.

Name: Waterside Café
Title: Great Food, lovely setting.
Review:
We parked to go to the castle gardens and decided to have a coffee before we went across to the castle entrance but when we saw the menu (and smelt the bacon) we had a little brunch while we were there.

Can recommend the bacon sandwiches - quality ingredients, quick and friendly service and good value.

The view from the cafe terrace is lovely and we were luck to be there on a sunny day and saw it at its best.

Name: LG Café
Title: over priced and bad chairs
Review: we came here for a snack during the week the cafe was empty when we enter but no one rushed to make us feel welcome. we had a brownie each and some homemade marshmallow to take away which were tasty,if on the pricey side . The worst part of our visit were the chairs plastic ,hard and uncomfortable i saw this pointed out on another review where the owner has pointed out there designer but should the first job of a chair it being comfortable to sit on regardless of the price.

Name: Premier Inn Littlehampton
Title: Premier Inn Littlehampton Hotel
Review:
The heating system was not working. We were not informed of this fact until after trying to get it working we then asked at reception and we were then informed that there was a technical problem and they offered no consideration to us of the inconvenience this caused. Reluctantly a staff member asked if we required a backup heater as only a few were available, this was accepted by me but proved to be inadequate. This condition continued for the whole weekend duration. The heating was also lacking in the attached Premier restaurant so we were unable to enjoy a comfortable evening. Further the bar staff seemed to be pre-occupied causing a delay in service and were very lax although there were few people patronising the bar. Our order of coffee during the evening was undrinkable so with some embarrassment I returned them to the bar staff. I was THEN informed the coffee machines were not working correctly so our money was refunded so we returned to our cold uncomfortable rooms. On leaving I wished to register my complaints however although we waited 10 minutes no member of staff attended the reception desk. We left having spent an unhappy weekend which upset myself, my wife & my friends .If I had not prepaid I would have requested compensation.
Read less

Name: BailiffsCourt Restaurant
Title: What a Dissapointing experience
Review:
We booked for cream tea.
My wife's birthday present.
We where told we could not sit outside as they had a wasp infestation!!

Not offered a table in the dining room, we where shown a made up table what looked like a large broom cupboard.

We sat down the only table in the room which is tatty and needs completely redecorating.

Then the food came out, dry flavour less sandwiches, the scones where dry and reheated, the cakes where boring with no imagination or flavour, we only saw our waitress once, not even when we left.

We have had cream teas in many places.
This is the worst and one of the most expensive.
Avoid this hotel, management don't care, no apology.
If your local try south lodge or the Grand hotel

Name: Lamb Angmering
Title: Highly Recommend this Hotel
Review:
Last week we stayed two nights at the Lamb at Angmering.
The accommodation was first class as were all the staff.
Do not bother to search for somewhere to eat as their restaurant is excellent both for food and service
The Bar is very friendly and a nice place to finish off the evening.
The Lamb is a perfect base for visiting West Sussex .
We would highly recommend the Lamb at Angmering.

Name: The Fish Factory
Title: Very disappointed
Review: I took my mother - who lives locally - to lunch here on the spur of the moment as we happened to be in Littlehampton at lunchtime. We've been here a couple of times in the past and decided to "treat" ourselves. Unfortunately, it wasn't much of a treat. We waited a very long time for our meals - the restaurant was not full but there was one table of 10 being served and I guess that's why we were waiting so long . It must have been 45 minutes before our food arrived (certainly the man at the next table had 2 pints of beer while we we waiting) and I wish we had decided to give up before it did. My cod and chips was fine but mum's grilled plaice was not very well cooked and cold, accompanied by boiling hot rice - maybe in the hope it would warm up the fish. She wasn't able to eat much of it as it didn't taste right and was "slimy" in texture. I suppose we should have complained at the time but we didn't get an awful lot of attention from the waiting staff who were obviously busy elsewhere. There seemed to be some regular customers getting much better service than us. It's unlikely we'll visit again but I don't expect they would care! One other problem we had was with toilet accessibility - mum couldn't actually get into one of the cubicles - she is blind and uses a stick and couldn't find a way to wriggle round the door - maybe we missed a disabled access loo as I notice another of your customers brings her mother in a wheelchair.

Name: So India, Felpham
Title: Nice curry place
Review: We went here on a Saturday night and it was very busy so we were squeezed in a bit and the service was a bit slow. Everyone seemed to really like the food although for my taste perhaps it was a little on the mild side. Would happily go back.

Name: Tandoori Nights
Title: Maybe wrote last review too soon
Review:
So perhaps I wrote last review too soon. Really good to eat in as I mentioned decor could be updated. But had a really poor delivery.
Second time in a row they forgot something with the order.
This time it was onion bahjis. I called the restaurant who said they'd send them out might be 20 mins or so ... Or I could have them free next time (it's technically not free next time as we've paid for them? So how do you work that one out and also... How do we prove this next time? ) I opted to have them sent out.
6 days later.... still waiting!!!
Never arrived. And paid for.

Thought this would be our new favourite home delivery Indian.... But twice in a row...would rather eat in. Hey ho!

Name: The Diner
Title: Holiday
Review:
Took my family for lunch while on holiday.
Lovely people, quick, friendly and great service.
Food good. Liam you were a star, we all thought you were great especially my 2 little girls. Many thanks

Name: Pizza Hut
Title: What a terrible place - avoid for special occasions!!
Review:
We were staying at Butlins for the weekend for my son’s birthday and thought Pizza Hut might be a good place to go for dinner to for his birthday as he loves pizza. I booked a birthday table online specifically stating it was a birthday (they have a separate page for special occasions), and then called up the restaurant to ensure they understand it’s for a birthday and arrange decorations as promised on the site.

We turned up on Friday, 21st June, and told them we were there for the birthday table. The lady helping us found the booking, asked us who the birthday table was for, and then we handed over the cake to her.

We noticed there were no decorations or anything on the table - just a plain table with your usual menus. We were a bit surprised as we always got decorations and our server at least wishing my son a good birthday at Papa John’s. At least we have a cake, we thought.

Dinner goes fine and service was okay. We waited for about 30 mins for the cake, and finally, fed up, we asked for our cheque. The lady brings the cheque, we pay and she thanks us for visiting.

Confused, we ask her about the cake. She apologises, goes back into the kitchen and comes back with the cake - still in the box and in the plastic bag and leaves it on our table and walks away (with an apology though). It was a surprise, but she just puts the box in front of my son.

Thanks, Pizza Hut, for ruining my son’s birthday. Taught us to stick with Papa John’s - which we ended up doing - we re-did the birthday there the next night. Shame on you Pizza Hut - your brand will not be seeing us visiting again.

Closing this place down would only improve the reputation of the brand name - I hope they do!

Please avoid for any special occasions unless you want it ruined.

Name: Picturedrome
Title: Cinema
Review:
Love this place, friendly staff, affordable prices in a historic old building. The Picturedrome now has a new screen which rivals all the big cinemas but at a fraction of the cost. Well worth a visit.
Read less

Name: Sen
Title: The best restaurant, ever!!!!
Review: Sen is my favourite restaurant. It has fantastic food, a fabulous atmosphere and friendly staff. Nothing is too much bother. I would highly recommend Sen to everyone, it's well worth a visit. Having been tonight and had great food, I've just booked to go again on New Years Eve.

Name: Black Horse
Title: Lunch with party of friends
Review:
We tried out this venue for the first time with our group of friends and I cannot rate highly enough the quality of the food and service that we all received.
There was an excellent choice of dishes on the menu as well as a "specials" board, and we all thoroughly enjoyed our meals, which together with the friendly, attentive service, left us in no doubt that we would be returning to this restaurant which is set in the countryside near Arundel.
It is so easy for people to complain about things, but our experience was so good I felt I should help restore the balance with a very positive "thank you" to the manager and staff concerned for making our visit so memorable.

Name: The Lamb, Angmering
Title: Suoerb meal out.
Review:
My wife and I have just been to the Lamb for a meal out and are so pleased we discovered this gem of a place.

The dining area has a nice cosy feeling to it and the staff are very friendly and attentive.

For starters, I had the Pigeon and Black pudding terrine off the al a carte menu and my wife had the beef brisket off the specials; they were absolutely lovely indeed, a good start to the meal. For mains, I had the mushroom tagliatelle and my wife had the house burger. My tagliatelle was exceedingly tasty indeed with a beautiful creamy sauce. I finished the meal off with a cheese board (All of the cheese's were superb.) whilst my wife had a couple of scoops of ice cream and a couple of scoops of sorbet.

We're so glad we visited and will happily come again sometime.

Name: Out of Bounds
Title: Mini Golf
Review:
Mini golf was enjoyable with different holes than normal. However the price for 2 adults was ridiculous too high!
Read less

Name: Ship & Anchor
Title: Wonderful food
Review: Great food and great service. Home made ice cream is to die for! Also, I had pork belly one night - best I've ever had.

Name: So India, Felpham
Title: Impressive Indian Restaurant
Review: We have been coming here a few times over the last few months, on our trips down to Felpham and never been disappointed. The staff are friendly and efficient. The menu is extensive and the food quality is top range. Whether it is the salmon tikka or a Lamb passanda it is a great night out. Thank you guys for the great dining experiences

Name: Arundel Jailhouse
Title: Just Terrible
Review: 5 friends and I attended the murder myserty night and arrived shortly after the 19:50pm entrance time. I was part of a group of 6 under two separate reservations whereby 2 emails were sent to ensure we were sat together. We were initially split onto two tables and the lady on the entrance arranged for us to be seated together, meanwhile we were asked to go to "the bar" (there was enough room for 2 people to stand). A make shift table was made with us perched on the end. A bottle of wine was eventually offered for this mix up. Unfortunately the evening got no better, the starter was terrible, vegetarian dish consisted of a slither of quiche, the same quiche on the main buffet table, some lettuce leaf with no dressing and 2 slices of a baguette which were marginally larger than a £2 coin and stale. The waiting time after the act and into the main meal was a long time eventually eating at 9 30. There was no organisation to the buffet and quality of food was terrible, it also ran out of a lot of things. Lastly the dessert was served at around 10.20, a slice of cake which none of the 12 people on our table could tell what it was, chocolate apparently. The act was neither entertaining nor funny and relied on sexual innuendo names of characters to force a laugh. It was arguably one of the worst evenings out I've ever had, although the other party on our table were quite funny.

Name: Haskins Garden Centre
Title: Five star official food hygiene rating and five star quality and value
Review: Official food hygiene rating on display in restaurant is dated 19th November 2013 could have been obsolete. Alternative website stated there is new certificate dated 2nd August 2018 but I could not verify this from the official website. The quality of food is superb. I had carvery that was very good value and the broccoli was fresh, green and a la dente. My wife had a lasagne that had true continental flavours. The original garden centre and site has been extended and improved and has additional shops to make it a potential tourist attraction. Our preference for ambience would be for the detail of the restaurant and dining areas to reflect that we were at a garden centre rather than a merely a modern, hygienic and comprehensive collection of excellent buffet or carver serveries

Name: Moathouse Café
Title: Family friendly
Review: What a fab little cafe, we live locally and it's the first time we've visited, family friendly, our son loved his dinner! Superb and attentive staff, will deffo be back, menu has enough choice for everyone, even puddings and fab looking milkshakes.

Name: Harbour Park
Title: Crying guy
Review:
I decided to bring my kids down to harbour park as I live in London and wanted to treat them, however when I took them on the waltzer a blonde guy was crying and my children didn’t want to go on it.
Read less

Name: Premier Inn Arundel
Title: Visit to Arundel
Review:
Great value, good location and nice staff, the room was clean and roomy, however could not change the room temperature. would definitely stay again, easily walking distance to the main town of Arundel.
Read less

Name: The Lion
Title: Sunday lunch
Review: This was about the 6th time we have been to the lion but on this occasion the food was dreadful . I had Welsh lamb and most of that was fat. My partner had scampi and her chips were stone cold . We both left most of it which was a shame . We ordered two coffees with cream and ended up getting milk instead of cream and had no spoons to put the sugar in . Don't really know if it was just a one off . It wasn't really busy at the time .

Name: Raj Doot
Title: Best Indian in the area
Review: We have been coming here since it opened. The staff are very welcoming and helpful. The food is excellent and cannot be bettered(we have tried most things on the menu- anything you can have the heat you want)We have bought family and friends from out of the area and everyone always to come back for more!

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Great lunch
Review: Sunday lunch carvery and what a feast! I had the vegetarian option and felt truly catered for - mushroom and goats cheese Wellington was tasty, fresh and filling. Potatoes veggie friendly and freshly made meat free gravy on request. First time there and will return, thank you to staff for helping make our visit so special.

Name: Butlins
Title: Terrible behaviour drunken
Review:
I booked the 80’s weekend for myself and two grown up daughters. I understood it would be an adult weekend and that there would be drinking loud music dressing up etc which I thought could be a fun and upbeat weekend centred around live music.
Unfortunately the experience was not positive. We arrived on site at 5:30 ish bearing in mind you cannot access your accommodation till 4pm. There were already people so drunk they were unable to stand and vomiting in the toilets.
The first night the behaviour of people on site made us feel intimidated and unsafe. Large groups of drunk men making lewd comments whenever females passed, which if made in the street could result in arrests under sexual intimidation. Noise levels throughout the night were high, which we expected but At 4am the people in the accommodation above ours were kicking the doors banging slamming and vomiting.
Hours and hours of shouting banging and loud music throughout the day and night, I know I may sound like a boring old whatsit but if it was clear when booking then I wouldn’t have booked it.
The Saturday morning we went out to see if there were any of the other activities on offer eg the pottery painting etc only to be informed that they have to close these on the adult weekends as the “ men get in and smash the place up”
It felt unsafe, a lack of security / Butlins staff except at the bars. Check in offices etc closed so no one to talk to I had to ask in the restaurant how we could check out. They confirmed they had heard there were “some rude, difficult characters “in the area we were staying. i’m Not a prude or of a fragile nature. I feel there is not enough information given when booking as to the expectation you should have. They have a behaviour charter but it seems these do not apply on adult weekends.
It may be the case that our experience is not the norm but it was our experience. Unregulated groups of very drunk people spoiling the experience for others.
Again if you just want an 18-30’s experience and your 30-60 this may be just what you’re looking for ( and why not) but if you just want a fun weekend cantered around the music rather than just how much alcohol can be consumed then maybe not.
Read less

Name: Rustington Manor
Title: Afternoon Tea
Review: So completely and utterly disappointed booked an afternoon tea about three weeks ago for today as a Mother’s Day treat for my mum and a friend. At time of booking specifically asked what was included and was advised selection of sandwiches, cakes scones baked on the day, a glass of Prosecco and unlimited tea or coffee. When we arrived our booking didn’t seem to have been made. The front of house staff didn’t know what an afternoon tea was, there were no scones or cakes available but the could make us a sandwich, Melba toast and biscuits. We decided not to stay and went elsewhere and would not return or recommend. The only positive was that the member of staff we were dealing with was very polite and apologetic.

Name: Pizza Express
Title: Cold plates for potentially hot food intentional!
Review: When my pizza arrived rapidly cooling on a cold plate I asked for it to be heated up. Very good waiter obliged. When the pizza came back the plate was still stone cold. The waiter explained that they couldn't heat the plate as it would crack. Also that when food was ready to be served it was placed by the door so likely to get cold. Not a professionally run a restaurant....... Are all Pizza Expresses like this nowadays or is this a bad franchisee?

Name: Sea View Hotel
Title: Family Sunday Lunch -AVOID
Review:
Was so disappointed with this as a restaurant. Not only was the place itself very dark and dreary the staff and food also reflected this dingy atmosphere.
Food was at best poor, served cold, bland tasting and small portions (in this case you wouldn’t want a big portion!!!) Staff all looked at you as if you were an annoyance being in the restaurant and I don’t think I saw anyone behind the bar smile once! The restaurant was overrun with dogs which was very unhygienic whilst trying to eat!!! Very rude waitress (and older woman) who didn’t ask how our meal was even though when collecting our plates over half the meal was left on them.
