My dad simply said to her “we didn’t enjoy that too much” she then replied “well clearly” and continued to crash about with our plates!! The worst food and service I have ever experienced!!

Name: Pagham Beach Café
Title: Always good!
Review: We only live about 2 minutes from here, so visit quite often. This time, we went on a Saturday evening with another couple. Extensive menu, reasonably priced, quick service as usual. Staff always friendly. We had a jug of sangria between us (£16 - delicious!) A nice atmosphere. Well done Maria (proprietor) and team!

Name: Butlins
Title: Tots week
Review:
We have just returned from the tots week with a 4,3,2,1 and 0 aged children and 4 adults. We got upgraded to a gold apartment which was great, the beds are un-comfy but other than that an ideal place to stay. If you go self catering be warned fridges are tiny and you wont be able to store loads.

The kids had the best time they loved the shows, the fairground etc and they cant wait to go back. We had the dining menu which was fine and basic meant everyone was fed quickly and at the end of a fun day that's what we needed!

We saw Justin and Paddington show, load of people waited in a queue, we just waited for it to die down and walked in. we were sat at the back but could still see and we didn't waste time waiting around!

The negatives, the red coats...… we did Minehead total tots last year and the red coats were everywhere, getting involved saying hello, before shoes they were there talking to the kids sitting with them etc. The red coats here turned up with 2 mins to spare for the mr men, Teletubbies etc was a real shame that they weren't involved. In all honesty they may well have not been there.

The soft play is great on the first day my 3.5 year old is 99cm you have to be 100cm for the soft play. She was told she couldn't go in, then she went in the little one where there were lots of little kids and obviously peop[le were getting hurt. The next day we went to soft play and she was allowed in. The woman who told us she wasn't allowed in said it was the rules I get that but the little one was so busy with 'little' 1/2 year olds and adults and the main frame was empty, To then be allowed in for the rest of the week some staff need to look at the scenario as opposed to whats in front of them.

If you have young kids go..... they will have a ball we only had access to the old pool but that was great, we will be back to try the new pool but we wont be expecting the 'red coat' experience as they just aren't there at Bognor. If you want the full Butlins experience then Minehead is the way to go.
Read less

Name: The Steam Packer
Title: Good location.
Review:
Stayed recently and enjoyed a good Sunday lunch, home cooked with lamb and fresh vegetables. They had four real ales, two of which I tried and both were in good condition. My room was very clean with a view over the river.
The Steam Packet is more or less opposite Littlehampton railway station, the town has a good selection of shops and pubs, a recently opened artisan bakers serves delicious food and coffee.

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: A real shame!!!
Review: My husband and I haven't been here for many years and as it is close to where we live thought would try it. Walked in liked the interior airy bright so forth. Ordered drinks no problem. Asked for table barman said the restaurant manager would come to take us to table, no one appeared for 1-0 mins or more and then it was the barman who served us in the beginning. Shown to table but was able to choose as quiet. Lovely waitress very pleasant and friendly selected seats sat down. Went through the menu and thought we would go for the steak as again not had for a long time in England, this was £20.00 plus. Probably about a 30 minute wait you had to purchase mushrooms and sauce extra. No offer of any vegetables or salad. On plate looked reasonable enough apart from no colour, a few peas would have made all the difference and a grilled tomato. Anyhow we both had ordered steak medium. which to me has always been cooked on outside but still pale pink and juicy in the middle. When we both cut into the meat it was dry and clearly overcooked. it tasted to me ok but to my husband who hates anything chewy he was not pleased. He sat there complaining so I said we need to say something which we did,. Spoke to the really lovely waitress who went back to the kitchen and did offer for 2 more steaks to be cooked but at this stage my husband was rather peeved!! He did think of switching to steak and ale pie and the girl said there no Gravy!! How can you run a restaurant and have no gravy??? Oh and before that when we ordered another drink the girl came up with mine and said they had run out of ICE. Again these are surely the basics how embarrassing for the staff. Needless to say we just paid for our drinks and left quite hungry. Stopped at chippy on the way home. Never looked so smart when eating a chip butty. We also will not be returning unless they organize themselves properly. Surely the management read these reviews??????

Name: Fino
Title: Good food and good service
Review: Went recently on a lunchtime and had a great experience at Fino. It was the first visit there but won’t be the last! The food was good, the service good and they were very welcoming.

Name: The George, Burpham
Title: Not what it used to be!
Review: We went here several years ago and it was excellent however it has gone downhill substantially. We ordered two ribeye steaks which was a serious expensive mistake. My wife's steak was so tough she could not cut it let alone eat it. Mine was only marginally better. We did complain but it made no difference to the bill. We were told "A new chief is comming next week" but we will not be back next week or ever again.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Bad News
Review:
We booked a table for six for the evening, and had a terrible meal. The meals were cold, curries ok if you put the cold rice in with the curry in a bowl. Chips with other meals cold, had to be replaced. The Hunters chicken was tough, burnt and really unedible. To add insult to injury the sweets were also luke warm and had to be sent back to be heated up. They did adjust the bill.
This is the second time we had a cold meal. Thought we give it a second try. What a mistake. Won't be going back.

Name: Butlers
Title: Fabulous Restaurant
Review: I live nearby and have eaten in many restaurants in Arundel and Brighton, but I can honestly say that this is the best food and accompanying wine I have had in a very long time. We were 5 ladies and visited this venue last Saturday and we all really loved it. The service was exceptional especially considering they were so busy and they had a big group in. We are already making plans to visit again and have passed on this restaurant as a recommendation to many of our friends. I love that they are family owned and that really makes if feel very personable. Thanks for a lovely evening.

Name: La Campagnia
Title: Service was a little slow.
Review: Have been here before and liked it so much we came back a second time. Booked the table as it is really busy. The food again was lovely with good portion sizes, and quality first class. We were however left waiting for quite a while to order dessert and coffee. Yes I would recommend.

Name: Swanbourne Lodge
Title: Lovely area, bad service.
Review: It was nice sitting near all the birds on the lake but the service left much to be desired; the woman who served us was very rude to us and didn't seem like she wanted to be there. Lovely area though- maybe bring a picnic instead.

Name: Chez Moi
Title: Cosy, friendly, authentic
Review: Beautiful food, perfectly cooked and really generous portions. Don’t eat too much of the beautiful homemade bread at the beginning or the dessert will have you groaning! Dauphinoise potatoes that melt in your mouth and a deconstructed Beef Wellington beautifully put together. Run by real french people and it shows!

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: beautiful hotel in tranquil environment
Review:
Stayed in Bayliss suite -- beautiful medieval features with real log fireplace, enjoyed the double baths, comftable four poster bed. Great service. Dinner and breakfast excellent. Nice spa with indoor and outdoor heated swimming pools and whirlpools, steam room and sauna. Great massage treatment.
Read less

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Meal
Review:
We were staying in the premier inn attached
We booked the meal deal £24.99 for a 2 course meal a drink and breakfast the next day so great value for money
If you want certain things you have to pay the extra
I had the humous and pulled lamb which wasn’t overly nice not enough lamb and way to much humous
Every thing else was great
The lady that served us was lovely and really looked after us

Name: Jerichos Sweet Store
Title: Mrs.j.
Review: Lovely shop for young and old, always a treat for the children (and adults) and staff so friendly and helpful. I think the son owns it and the dad helps out but they are both happy x polite. Thank you.

Name: China Palace
Title: Good food and well priced
Review: Top tip, phone and book before coming. We're glad we did. Despite it being a rainy October Saturday it was packed. I had a vegetarian and gluten free meal that was spiced really well but not to the expense of taste. Others in the party had a chicken curry and a chow mein. The deserts were plentiful and included alternatives to ice-cream. A wine list with a fair selection. So in short you can see why it was full: good value and a good quality. Great atmosphere with friendly staff

Name: The Swan
Title: Old inn with great bar and restaurant
Review: I stayed in the hotel for one night and had a pleasant drink in the bar followed by nice meal in the restaurant . i had the fish and chips wich was i know a bit booring but living in France i miss decent fish and chips and this was fine good quality pub food

Name: The Fish Factory
Title: Disappointing
Review: Visited as a small celebration with family. I ordered Halibut as I have had it before here and it was really nice. When it arrived it was clearly not Halibut but Cod in batter. When I questioned it the waitress clearly had no idea about the difference but still told me it was Halibut. When I told her again it was Cod she spoke to the chef who told me it was Halibut. I definitely know the difference between the two but the staff clearly don't which is a bit worrying. When the bill came it did not appear on there which suggests they knew it wasn't what I ordered, but not a single apology. It is also extremely expensive, all deserts were about £7, which for a fruit salad is a lot. I will not choose to go there again.

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Another good lunch!
Review: I have eaten here since they opened, and I think it's great that I can take my 2 Yorkies-they do of course sit on the floor. I uderstand that it has been taken over recently and I was surprised to see my little corner had had the tables moved and now just a sofa and some stools, a better set up if you have children I was told, no I don't!- what a shame, I loved sitting out of the way with my dogs and once again it would seem that the kids take precident. I will have to wait and see. The food has always been good and the drinks. It would be a pity to have to find somewhere else.

Name: Wimpey
Title: Succulent, spectacular and splendid
Review:
Now that I’ve experienced the Smoky BBQ burger, I can happily die in peace. I’m a bit of a fussy eater but after speaking to the lovely waitress, Charlotte, she advised I could take out the onion rings and give them to my buddy that I was dining with (which he didn’t complain about HAHAHAHA). The service was amazing, very quick even though there were plenty of other tables in! Everything was spot on, even down to the recommended “special sauce” which my pal made sure was scraped completely out of the pot it came in!
If I could give another star, I definitely would purely because they serve alcohol with lunch!

11/10, would recommend to the rest of humanity

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Amazing Staff!
Review:
This is one of my family's favourite restaurants. The food isn't fancy but it's hearty, well-priced and there's plenty of choice (which is fabulous considering I'm a pescatarian and one of my son's lactose intolerant). The staff are amazing, so friendly and welcoming, they can't do enough to make your experience a good one.
I'd also like to make mention that we live a short drive away and when my car broke down recently on one of the hottest days of the year so far my 11 year-old daughter had to walk a long way home after school. She stopped at this restaurant and they gave her iced water and a place to rest before making sure that she was okay to go on her way. She was very impressed and I was very greatful indeed! Wonderful people!

Name: Picturedrome
Title: Top Rate Cinema
Review:
Excellent value in this gem of a cinema. A real old fashioned experience but with up to date seating.
Read less

Name: Avisford
Title: Exceptional Customer Service - Thank you Anita!
Review:
We had an amazing stay and we thank Anita personally for this for such exceptional customer service - truly appreciated! We are already planning our next trip back. The grounds are so beautiful and there is an indoor and outdoor pool, small gym and games outside. The bar area is really nice and comfortable and a great area to sit outside too. It's a little paradise escape there!
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: The accommodation cleanliness is not even 1 star.
Review:
What a dump. It’s good to see the Butlin's managing director stepping down. The accommodation is atrocious; I don’t expect 5 star accommodation but do expect cleanliness. These silver rooms need demolishing and re-building to a standard which is at least habitable. I walked into a room that had dirty plates in the shower cubical, filthy carpet, the dressing table top had coffee spilt on it, the main table was sticky with some other substance the basin was cracked and looked like it had never been cleaned, mould and dirt with cobwebs everywhere. The towel rails are hanging off the walls, to add to the list we can have wood lice all over the place inside and out, and locks on the doors that anyone can open with a long thin screwdriver, due to a purpose drilled hole next to the lock, see pictures. Let’s hope the new director does the right thing. These rooms are the only thing that let Bognor down, absolute filth.
Read less

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Good Value
Review:
Comfortable sleep and good shower, so all in in all good stay Fans supplied in room which was helpful
Reception on arrival very helpful Car parking very good
Pub attached not part of Premier Inn and not so helpful
Read less

Name: India Gate
Title: A nice meal if a little uninspired
Review: Popped in for the first time after many recommendations. I have to say it did not live up to the hype. Maybe because it was December and they were tired but the food was just ok, front of house staff fine, but not too welcoming, just efficient I would say. Would go back, although next time I will bring a friend that thinks it is 5/5 to explain to me why.

Name: Middleton Café
Title: Excellent
Review:
Received a lovely welcome, placed my order and sat down.

The friendly chef cooked my order from fresh and it was brought out to me. The food was beautifully presented, large portion and extremely tasty.

The cafe was extremely clean and I defy anybody, who eats in, to go away hungry.

Huge portions, excellent value for money, very friendly staff and open at the weekends.

Lovely experience and look forward to going back.

Name: Swan Hotel
Title: Amazing place to stay!
Review:
My husband and I stayed here for one night and it really is an absolutely fantastic place to stay in Arundel. The location is perfect right on the corner of the lovely high street. We had food in the restaurant on the evening of our stay and that was of very good standard with attentive and friendly staff. Breakfast was exceptional and plentiful again served by friendly attentive staff. Our room was very clean and a lovely size with all the amenities you require. All in all a very enjoyable stay and one we would do again and certainly recommend to others.
Read less

Name: Butlers
Title: didnt book , got a table but was very busy when we were leaving
Review: lovely meal, it was the daily special and was very good value.The sqid was excellent as was the chicken

Name: Moathouse Café
Title: Not good- very over priced and food terrible
Review: Ate there today, it’s everything I dislike about tourist town cafes overpriced for really poor quality food, it’s not good and as a family £29 for lunch seems reasonable but when you don’t eat most of it as so poor not good. please don’t waste your money try somewhere else

Name: McDonald's
Title: Not what it says on the TV advert
Review: Last night I saw the advert for the GIANT Big Mac. Two weeks ago my husband collected a take away of two GIANT Big Mac Meals. The chips were great but the burgers were a real let down. Neither Burger had any BACON in them and one burger only had one layer of lettuce and sauce in it. One burger had gerkins and one did not. Both burgers seemed to have been thrown together with everything falling out and were very disapointing. I understand mistakes can happen but this was more than just a mistake it was poor quality control. We will not be having this item again, and if we had lived nearer we would have returned to ask for replacements, which I do believe would have happened. However, how many other take away customers have had this happen to them? and this is why I have posted the review, so that action can be taken to improve.

Name: Ocean Hotel & Spa
Title: Great for a short break
Review:
We came to Butlins Ocean Hotel for a short weekend break with friends. Check in was smooth and Caroline was very thorough going through our welcome pack and letting us know where things were etc. The room was lovely, brightly coloured, clean and fresh with a nice balcony, the towel animals were so sweet. The only minor downside I could find and it really is me being picky is that the kids room had no door on it but that being said, it didn't cause any issues by not being there. The bathroom was clean and functional and the shower was HEAVENLY. We got used to the (I think) water saving feature where the shower goes off intermittently and comes back on again. The main part of the bedroom was nice. Had two chairs and a table and tea/coffee facilities with full sized mugs. Being on the 5th floor we had a great view over the side of the park/Fairground. Breakfast at the Kaleidescope restaurant was again good but very very busy. Staff did a great job of replacing items as they got finished and cleaning and turning round dirty tables for other guests to sit down at. It seemed as though all of the staff in their respective departments were genuinely happy to work at Butlins. The pool was good but very busy. The kids enjoyed the water slides and splash zone.

I have to mention Louis in The Pub & Kitchen which I've reviewed separately, he was brilliant. And also the football coach, I think he had RS on his shirt who coached the kids football was just fantastic. He really engaged with the kids calling them footballers and with the parents as well. The three children in our group who played in the age 5-7 group were absolutely buzzing after they finished playing. Unfortunately due to a long drive back we couldn't get to the Sunday session too.

The only negatives we encountered really were that the fairground closes at 5 which we thought was quite early and that the pool changing rooms were filthy. The staff were doing their absolute best but Butlins should enforce a rule where people need to remove their outdoor shoes before entering the changing rooms as the dirt from the shoes mixed with water was gross. Not to mention the hair and fluff and whatever else was on the floor. Also, the hotel lifts must have a mention, they were soul destroyingly slow. We also got stuck for a few minutes in one on Saturday evening.

All in all a hugely successful, enjoyable and tiring weekend for all involved. Thanks Butlins!

Name: George Inn
Title: Don’t go
Review: Really dreadful meal,the fact no-one was eating and the bar was deserted on a Friday evening should have given us a clue. “Luxury “fish pie....was that the one very small grey prawn I found amongst the other grey fish and grey sauce and grey potato. It really was grim,

Name: Waterside Café
Title: So disappointing
Review: Live locally and decided to call in for coffee with friends who are staying. What a disappointment! Staff seemed more interested in talking to each other while serving. Scruffy plastic seating and very scruffy build of wood and plastic. Come on make the place more inviting your prices £3.90 fora slice of very unimpressive cake, reflect a much better standard. Won’t be going again. Could be so good!!!!

Name: Avisford
Title: Tribute night
Review:
Great act good music but spoilt by sub standard food and vastly overpriced bar! £20 for two glasses of wine and £38.00 for a bottle come on that’s ridiculous! Hotel run down smells of damp cannot believe Hilton associate with this it’s a disgrace!
Read less

Name: Avisford
Title: Wedding Anniversary
Review:
On arrival my husband and I noticed the building looked grubby. We had been a few times previously so could see the differences. The reception couldn’t find our booking so was asked to take a seat. There was cobwebs over the lighting, so first impressions were not good. As we waited more than 40 minutes the room the amount of people complaining was astounding. Keys didn’t work, windows stuck, rooms too hot. One member of staff Esme was bossing the trainee around as she was trying to deal with us, instead of going around the reception desk herself. Also leaning over the desk, as she once again couldn’t be bothered to walk around it so I got an eyeful of her underwear as her dress was so short. Then proceeded to to hum to herself while everyone stood around annoyed.

The room was far from deluxe, basic and in need of some attention. The window wouldn’t stay open as the frame was rotten and there was a window pane missing which was covered up with plastic and cellotape. No air con so the room was scorching. They provided a huge extremely noisy fan which just blew warm air around as the window wouldn’t stay open. Just awful.

The lounge area had several lightbulbs out but was nice to sit in. The garden was lovely for eventing drinks.

The restaurant is our favourite part of this hotel. The food was lovely and the restaurant staff were well trained. Although service was a little slow but as it’s so lovely in the we didn’t mind waiting.

So that will be our final visit to this hotel. As there are our superior to this for the same money.

Goodbye Hilton
Read less

Name: Fino
Title: Wifes Birthday
Review: Absolutely amazing staff, had a laugh with all of us including the kids, food looked exactly the same as online pics which is rare and most importantly it tasted fantastic. we are local and will definitely be back. Prices do not break the bank.

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Sunday carvery
Review: Great food and amazing atmosphere, the waitresses were great and the roast was the best I ever had. I had the red ale brewed by meantime which was also great.

Name: Rustington Manor
Title: Three night stay for special occasion
Review: I recently stayed at this hotel with my sister who was visiting from Australia and having lived in Rustington forty years ago wanted to re-visit. How disappointing, the bedrooms certainly don't appear to have been updated, ie old plumbing, old and dirty lino/ carpets, very narrow beds. Good to have tea/ coffee and biscuits however. I would agree with a previou reviewer a 2* B&B would be more appropriate rating, particularly for the money paid. Very narrow steep staircase for maneouvering luggage. Breakfast in the conservatory was very poor particularly for what we paid. The same muffins, croissants fruit were brought out each morning and crockery not very clean. We never saw the bar open. On a positive note staff were friendly and helpful and there is free parking. Close to beach and shops.

Name: Parpadelle
Title: What an unbelievable experience...
Review:
Never in 40 years of eating out around the world, have I been so utterly flabbergasted and very distressed... after eating many many times at this restaurant over past two years with many friends, and served by the lovely restaurant staff... I went for lunch today (Thursday 3rd Jan). Being fully aware and accepting of the "round table" policy, I made a polite enquiry regarding it being acceptable to sit there as we were a table of two. I was assured by the waitress that it was fine. After a few minutes perusing menus and having ordered our drinks we were asked (by a different "waitress") to move to the "long shared table" as a party of three had arrived .I politely suggested that there was evidently room for three at the long shared table (albeit involved requesting someone move along a seat at the "shared long table") and that it was not reasonable to ask us to move. The "waitress" (whom I now believe to be... is apparently the owners wife) then made a sarcastic confrontational comment about my lack of co-operation, and re-iterated the policy in ear shot of all... (which I had previously confirmed with staff was OK). While this was going on, my guest moved us both to the end of the long table as it had been kindly and pro-actively vacated by another couple... the same "owner's wife" lady then proceeded to snatch away our drinks and menus and announced that she was refusing to serve us and wanted us to leave... simultaneously shouting across the crowded restaurant that "I had been rude to her on several previous occasions"... never having to my knowledge met or spoken with this lady before this was both unbecoming and untrue. I objected to this treatment and questioned her observations and commitment to the hospitality industry, maintaining at all time a civil tongue. She then decided to suggest inviting her husband downstairs to which I agreed. Her husband was not prepared to entertain any explanation from me and asked me to leave which I immediately agreed to do. He stated that "he knew his wife well enough".... of that I have no doubt. Maybe she would be better suited to an alternative role away from FOH. Very upset, and truly very concerned for her level of stress/anger/honesty, and now reluctantly unwilling to return if that customer service is considered policy.
Based on other reviews and the untruthful allegations made on the day, I fully expect this to be treated as an inaccurate account, however why would I? I can assure you this is 100% to the best of my recollection. I am very upset. Possibly she mistook me for someone else? - if that is an excuse? I loved eating in your restaurant. Feedback is a gift. Seek to improve rather than defend. Trust me I have over 20 years experience in Customer Service training design and delivery... and this is free!

Name: Victoria Fish & Chips
Title: Yummy
Review: I’d have to say the best fish and chips in Bognor that I’ve had. Myself and my husband both had cod and chips, the cod was absolutely delicious! And the batter was just right.

Name: Anokha
Title: Great Lunch
Review: We had Sunday lunch at the Anokha, the three of us including my six year old. I think its one of the best curries I have had in a long time. The dishes and flavours were so different, the presentation was excellent and the portions were generous. They made us feel so welcome and my six year old enjoyed it. Thankyou

Name: The Swan
Title: Lovely restaurant
Review: The ambience was excellent with lovely touches on the tables such as flowers and candles. The services was attentive. The food was delicious. Would recommend.

Name: Jade
Title: I'd give 0 stars if I could.
Review:
Rude staff.

Ordered via Just Eat app at 19:00 for delivery at 20:05 - had an email confirming food would arrive at 20:15.

20:15 comes and goes - at 20:30 I called to enquire how much longer the food would be and was abruptly told it was "on the way" and then the woman who I believe is named Becky, hung up on me.

20:50 - food arrives 45 mins later than ordered and 35 mins after their own estimated time.

I asked the delivery driver to wait whilst I checked everything was there as I had now been waiting for 2 hours. Am dismissively told "we're busy". Food is cold and has leaked over the bag. Delivery driver says "okay?" I replied "not really" and he walked off.

Disappointed. I will never order from them again.

Name: BailiffsCourt Restaurant
Title: Beautiful hotel in gorgeous setting
Review: A ten minute walk to the sea, stunning buildings and grounds and truly excellent staff make this a very pleasant experience. The adjacent spa is superb (reviewed separately) The food is outstanding. Our room in the Coach House was comfortable and large with a good bathroom. The decor and carpets are rather tired. We will definitely return here.

Name: Butlins
Title: Let down
Review:
Stayed for a long weekend this month (June) it was ridiculously busy and wasn’t even school holidays! Hotel ocean was good can’t fault it. New pool would of been good fun if it wasn’t crammed with people, too busy waiting times on most the slides/flumes was between 20-40 waiting time, you couldn’t move without bumping into someone which with baby’s is dangerous. Also only saw one life guard around the hole pool other than the ones on the slides. They should have a max capacity or something as it was just so busy. The floors in the changing room were filthy with mud , clumps of hair and god knows what else. Around the resort wasn’t enough for toddlers. My child was just shy in heigh of almost every ride etc so was really disappointed in that. Only thing my child could to was play in the park or indoor soft play but as I’ve said before it’s just to busy. Not enough for adults to do either. We took ourselves out of the resort 2 out of 4 days as was too busy and not enough to do. Also much better mini golf and ice cream parlour outside the resort! Restaurants are ok but nothing special. Wouldn’t return.
Read less

Name: Riverside
Title: Great place
Review: We had a lovely Easter here at riverside the entertainment was amazing and the staff are great.would recommend for family holiday .my grandchildren love it here.it has indoor and outdoor pool.2parks,arcade,

Name: Arun View
Title: Lunch after beach walk
Review:
Riverside pub with stunning views.
Service, quality and quantity of food consistently good
Atmosphere very welcoming and good value for money.

Name: The Town House
Title: Very disappointed
Review:
We booked the table few months before our visit to Arundel. After looking at the menu online we where really happy to find The Roasted Chateaubriand as it's one of our favourites and it seems that this place is very popular and well recommended. Unfortunately we were very disappointed with our choice.
The food was bland and the service was very robotic and our Chateaubriand came cold and tasteless. I refused to eat the starter which was Artichokes Soup as I couldn't feel any flavour of artichoke just pure cream and I couldn't even finish my main as it's already arrived cold (meat) and tasteless. We were so excited for this dinner but unfortunately we left the restaurant in the middle of our meal very upset and disappointed.
Good that it was just only one disappointment in Arundel of all that weekend.

Name: Swan Hotel
Title: Lovely People and Fantastic Food!
Review:
Thanks to my partner winning a race prize (dinner b&b at a Fullers hotel) we enjoyed a great two nights here. The staff were really nice, welcoming and attentive, the room was clean & great value and all of the meals were absolutely first class! Normally we wouldn’t eat in the same place both nights but this was a no-brainer, a real treat!
Read less

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: This hotel needs to be refurbished and cleanliness was poor in our room
Review:
The bathroom was not clean upon arrival, otherwise the Hotel is grubby all round.Unfortunately we had a busy schedule and could not always find staff at the front desk. We complained at check out and further on the telephone with the Hotel manager who promised a full refund. However this was not authorised.
Read less

Name: Pagham Beach Café
Title: Lovely cafe, good food and friendly owner and staff
Review: Popped in with my mother when last down in Bognor, really nice place for Brunch or Lunch with comprehensive menu or fish and chips if you prefer.

Name: WWT Wetland
Title: Disappointing half term activity
Review:
We visited in the February half term lured in by the ‘puddle jumping championship’ which sounded ideal for my young children who are obsessed with muddly puddles. What we found was a large, unorganised queue of families and a plastic tray with an inch of water in it. After waiting 15 minutes the children were allowed 1 jump in the plastic tray then scored out of 100 and given a sticker. The staff were trying to make it a bit more exciting but this wasn’t really possible given the circumstances. We had high hopes of a puddle assault course where children could play and splash freely rather than regimented queuing for 1 jump. Not worth wrestling them into the puddlesuit for. There was, however, a much larger natural puddle just round the corner which they enjoyed far more. This ‘event’ needs a rethink.
The boat trip however was excellent and a lovely way to end an otherwise disappointing day for the children.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Tots week
Review:
Just got back from our 2nd tots week at Butlins Bognor Regis, my little boy (3 years old) and myself had a great time, we arrived and checked in, went to check out the room and it was just a room with a double bed and a bathroom with the shower door hanging off so went to reception nd the lovely lady I dealt with was so helpful and they moved us to a 2 bed place, it was lovely, could do with a mini fridge in these places as standard as I had to buy milk every night for my little one but apparently you can hire them quite cheap

The entertainment was great, all the shows we saw were brilliant, especially milkshake live and skyline gang farewell show

There was so much for my little one to do, with an awesome newly built swimming pool/splash park, arcades, soft play, archery, balance bikes, football, fairground rides and much, much more

Massive shout out to Harley (Softplay Simon, my little boy calls him) one of the guys who works on the fairground/soft play my little boy really took to him when we came in March and didn't stop talking about him all the way upto this time round, so he was very happy to see him again. (See photo)

The ocean drive food place has a wide variety of food on offer and is always great

Cant wait to come back again
Read less

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Do not go there, plenty of other places more welcoming in or near littlehampton or bognor
Review: Food poor quality and no response when you complain.Very few other diners there and suggests already unpopular place for locals

Name: Arden B&B
Title: Fantastic!
Review:
The title of this review sums up how every aspect one looks for when selecting and staying at a bed and breakfast establishment, happens here!
Arden house deserves more than a five star rating! We were made to feel very welcome and Lucie also gave us some great advice on what to do whilst in the area.
Thank you once again Arden House for your hospitality.
Hazel and Pat
Read less

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Poor stay
Review:
Room smell of bad odour and heating panel not operating well and spoons was not clean properly on arrival. Struggling to adjust the panel and noise coming whenever people walk on corridor so it was not very pleasant stay
Read less

Name: YHA
Title: Convenient base
Review: This is smaller than some yha's. Reception only open for few hours morning and evening but entry is by keypad code so once checked in you can come and go as you please. No meals but good self catering kitchen and supermarkets locally. Dorms and common areas comfortable. Only thing was did not seem many showers etc for number of maybe some rooms en suite. Either way it was not a problem, did not see queues.

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Timeless
Review:
Great place to visit, have been back so many times over the years and never tire of spending time here, always something new to discover. Today was a beautiful day and the views and rose gardens were stunning.
Read less

Name: Black Horse
Title: Lovely Sunday Lunch
Review:
The chef sure knows how to make gravy!
We had the sharing Sunday lunch platter - all the meats were cooked to perfection
Decor and ambiance is lovely together with friendly staff
We really enjoyed our meal - we will definitely go back!

Name: Mustards
Title: Birthday dinner for six
Review: Excellent evening for friends birthday. Food choice was excellent. Steak was delicious and cooked to perfection. Wine choice was also very good. Polite and attentive service, especially by Molly. Not as expensive as we had heard......good value for money. Will return definitely.

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Dirty Rooms and Very Tired, NOisy Carpark, not suitble for night workers
Review:
Dirty sheets upon arrival, covered in hair of all kinds inside and outside the covers.
Toilet Seat Broken.
Staff too busy having Social Meetings instead of working in Reception.
Car Park was noisy in the mornings cars not starting, banging of bonnets etc..... Not recommended for NIGHT WORKERS for sure despite being in a great location.
Read less

Name: George & Dragon
Title: Bought on, West Sussex
Review: An excellent country pub with an extensive garden for summer eating and drinking and a comfortable and cosy interior. The George and Dragon has a fine range of good food both at lunch time and in the evening, and a good selection of eel kept beers.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: How lovely!
Review: Such a lovely evening, food was delicious, costomer service was great and a big thank you to our new friend Katie B! I really recommend if you want to have a great evening out. Love Daisy (Age 12)

Name: Wimpey
Title: Disappointed
Review:
The first time we have felt we wouldn't want to return.
The staff were superb but the food was poor. Burgers and sausage were very watery and sadly, tasteless.
My wife and I visited as a nostalgia trip from when we first met in the early seventies at the Wimpy in Chichester, but this time, it was so disappointing.

Name: Subway, Bognor
Title: Flies
Review: Went in for a sandwiches. Used toilet first and noticed loads of flies. Went to the counter, flies everywhere and flies and bugs on the back of the glass where all the ingredients are.

Name: Arun Leisure Centre
Title: Overpriced and below par facilities
Review: I have a membership here and frequently attend the gym and classes. I don’t use the swimming pool because the changing facilities are dirty. It seems that nothing here ever really gets updated or refurbished despite the expensive membership cost. There’s a class I regularly attend where the music always breaks because there’s something wrong with the aux connection or speakers, every week the centre claims it has been fixed and every week it doesn’t work. The range of classes is poor for the membership price, the only thing I like about the classes is that the instructors are great. In the gym, the hand towel dispensers are constantly empty and so is the hand soap in the toilets. I don’t think that there is a great range of machines in the gym and some of them break repeatedly and obviously need replacing.I think that for the price of the membership I would expect more facilities, more classes, for broken things to be properly fixed or replaced, for more refurbishments to be made and at the very least for everything to be cleaner and hand towels refilled. I often see members of staff cleaning machines in the gym but ignoring that all the dispensers are empty.The thing that really pushed me into writing a negative review is that this week the centre has been constantly been smelling overwhelmingly like people’s private parts! Absolutely disgusting. The only reason I keep going is because of the convenient location.

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: surly staff, sticky grubby tables and unable to hear anyone in our group speaking because of ridiculously loud quiz.
Review: Terrible evening completely overtaken by ridiculous over-reaction of the staff to me when I (stupidly) threw a bit of napkin at the table where the questions were being read out by the quiz master - the tissue hit her arm instead of the paper. The senior bar girl came over to tell me off which I totally understand as it was a really silly thing to do. I admitted doing it and said I would go and say sorry after the quiz had ended and I had finished eating. My apology wasn't accepted and the bar girl just stood over me and kept going on and on and on until eventually I had to ask her to leave me alone. She came back again in about 30 minutes and had another go. Again I admitted it was a really silly thing to do, I was sorry and would go and apologise. Again I had to ask her to go away as she just would not stop telling me off. I went and apologised to the girl the tissue landed on but this apology was also not accepted. I ended up asking the bar girls what else they expected me to do. 30 minutes later the bar girl came back to me for another go!! she told me she had spoken to the manager and I was barred! This was all over a a bit of tissue that I stupidly threw, admitted it was stupid and apologised for. We will not be returning to Establo

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Amazing but pricy
Review:
Arundel is a charming intact Castle and worth a visit. It has centuries of history to read and hear about and wonderful castle grounds. We have been before and have been inside - numerous rooms lavishly decorated - but on this occasion we only obtained access to the garden. Whilst the gardens are amazing and well worth visiting the price for entry for three paying people and one child was more than we expected. Worth checking before you go to make sure you get the best deals. There is so much to see that it is worth spending the whole day there. I would suggest buying the tickets that allow you to access both the grounds and the interior as I feel that would make it more worthwhile. The local village is great and there is an Italian restaurant (La Compania) that serves excellent vegan food cooked by vegans! We did not sample the food at the castle so cannot comment on that. There are long walks involved - but if you need them there are electric vehicles that can move you around. But expect to do a considerable amount of walking even then - it is huge! There is a good local car park near the entrance.
Read less

Name: Putting Green Café
Title: Family fun
Review: Very clean and relaxing. Played tennis with our 12yr olds for an hour for £6 haven’t laughed so much in ages priceless. Cafe is very sweet. Will be going back very soon to play golf on the putting green.

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: Near but far
Review: The Receptionist was very helpful but it did not compensate for the terrible bed which was very uncomfortable. Very basic, ask for hair dryer, room cold on entering, no soap or shower gel in bathroom, smell of sprays everywhere.

Name: Parsons Table
Title: Excellent meal with friendly staff
Review: I booked a birthday meal in advance and the staff took full note of our food intolerances and on the day provided our food with no problems at all, and we felt confident we could enjoy it. The meal was well presented and beautifully cooked, and served by cheerful and efficient staff. We had a lovely dessert made specially for us as we are both dairy and wheat intolerant. The surroundings are comfortable and clean, and the restaurant is well decorated. I would definitely go here again and recommend it to anyone wanting a good meal of one to three courses for a day out or special occasion. Top of my list in Arundel in every respect.

Name: Chez Moi
Title: It really does not get better
Review: Returned for a family pre Christmas meal. Both of my chidren have been in catering my son does corporate hospitalty so not easily pleased. It was perfect.

Name: The Waverley
Title: A lovely find :-)
Review:
What a lovely find, unassuming but such lovely staff, great food and drinks. Definitely would go back if visiting again. Thank you
5

Name: The George, Burpham
Title: Poor food, poor service, mistakes on the bill and high prices
Review: Had Sunday lnch here on 19 May 2019. The food was not very good for the money, and the meal stretched over 3 hours because of very slow service. Then errors on the bill, in their favour. Not helped by the waiter telling is that you also have to wait at McDonalds! And The George is not charging McDonalds prices............

Name: The Roundstone
Title: A MUST!!
Review: Was staying in the Premier Inn next door so used this pub/restaurant while we were there. Friendly staff and lovely atmosphere. Made our stay in Littlehampton complete. Would definitely come back**10/10**

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Ticks all the boxes !!!
Review:
Visited the Beefeater Crossbush, with family, after a busy day travelling in West Sussex.
After a couple of drinks we had a meal, in the restaurant, which exceeded all expectations. Service with a smile followed by a main meal & dessert at competitive prices left us feeling value for money was being provided for all customers at the Beefeater. Thanks in particular to Shona for making sure our visit was one to remember by being so professional & friendly.

Name: Swanbourne Lodge
Title: Friendly Service
Review:
We regularly visit Swanbourne Lake with our granddaughter, and the first thing we do is to visit the Swanbourne Lake Cafe for a cup of tea and a snack. The man and lady that work there (and I apologise for not remembering their names) are so lovely and helpful that it adds to the whole pleasure of the visit. They can’t do enough for you and their patience and attentiveness with some more elderly customers is commendable.
It’s a superb, beautifully British Cafe, you must visit it and try for yourself.

Name: Butlins
Title: Mixed review
Review:
We visited during a “just for tots week” and had a good time, my son is 3 and had a great time. There is good and bad to this review however the good outweighed the bad and by no means ruined our visit. We came a few months back on a day visit and my son loved it so decided to come for the 5 day trip (not really 5 days) can’t check in until 3 and need to check out by 10, but you are able to use the park before and after, we also got a great price on the room. Check in was easy with helpful and friendly staff, we had been given a slight upgrade from a 2 bed to 3 bed, while we didn’t need the extra room it was handy for storage. (Trolleys are also provided to get your luggage from car to room as it’s a bit of a trek)
The apartment was a great size and almost everything you could need was provided, (but here comes the bad)
Before I talk about the apartment I just want to say that I know the cleaners are under a lot of pressure but it’s not what I would expect from a place like Butlins.
The kitchen was filthy with crusty food left on the kitchen tops, the oven hob is also in need of some attention (maintenance wise) it smelt greasy and everything from cupboards to handles had old grease on.
Even after giving the kitchen a clean the grease was still present.
Has a working fridge/freezer and tea coffee provided.
The bathroom was also dirty (not as bad) but we had to clean it.
(I’m not a snob and have stayed in some right dives over the years and if I was on my own I wouldn’t be bothered, but this was a family break and feel things should be of better standard)
It had rained quite heavily at times during our stay and the apartment had a constant damp smell to it and in places you could see walls were wet, this probably being condensation rather than leaks. We would also find our clothes felt damp.
We tried to battle this with open windows and heaters on, however the heaters do work but are in serious need of replacement.
With that being said it is just a room and we spent minimal time in it as I said previous by no means ruined our stay.
Other than that everything else is great, plenty of restaurants form pizza, chippy and pub grub all reasonably priced and the food was pretty good. A few outdoor parks for the kids and of course the amusements. Butlins puts plenty on for the kids, play dough, arts and crafts, tiny tikes cars and so on your always find something to do. You can also do a few paid activities such as football, cross bow and bikes but we didn’t do this.
The shows are good with 3 stages showing different things throughout the day but some things are repeated. (Mr Men, Telletubbies, Skyline crew and more. My only gripe with this is that some of the bigger shows clashed but I guess they need to fit it all in.
Almost forgot to mention the whole point in us coming was a show from Justin Fletcher, it was pretty good, would have liked a few more characters rather than all the signing but still decent.
The Paddington Bear show was great and I think I my son enjoyed that even more and would say it’s a must see.
All in all we had a good time, for the price you can’t complain and my son had a great time you will always have plenty to do with your little ones be it the funfair (VERY strict on child’s heights) trampolines, Helter skelter, bumper cars or go carts (cost £6 per car) inside also has some younger kids rides, a huge soft play again very strict on heights but a smaller area for kids who aren’t quite tall enough. (They also stop the older kids, height dependent going on so your little ones don’t get wiped out) also a small new animal room with snakes, spiders etc that has an occasional talk and you get to hold/pet some of the creatures.
Staff are great friendly and helpful the redcoats go out there way to make sure you enjoy the shows.
Will say the character meet and great on last morning is a little rushed.
A few extra things there that I’m not gonna go into detail.
Burger King, gift shop, bars, coffee/snack bar, face painting, temp tattoos, wax hand models, scoops ice cream(a must) toy shop and supermarket (well overpriced)
I’m not sure if we’d stay again but will definitely return for a day visit.
Sorry for long review, hope people find it helpful.
Read less

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: Great restaurant
Review: Visited here with hubby and grandsons forgetting one is a VERY fussy 7 year who ordered a fish finger sandwich. When it came it had tartare sauce on it which is a huge no no! Manager took it away and changed it for a plain one without extra charge even tho we offered to pay for it!! And while I’m on the subject of ‘fish fingers’.... well.... if you call huge chunks of battered cod fish fingers... !! The food was fantastic!! I have dietary needs and they were VERY accommodating with me. Staff were fab with all customers but even better with the children. Prices were really good for what you get. Would totally recommend this place to all! Thanks guys for making lunchtime tasty and easy!

Name: Mamma Mia
Title: Poor service, BIG "let down"
Review:
It was meant to be a ruby wedding anniversary celebration with friends, but ended up being a bitter disappointment following the worst service we have experienced. I made the booking weeks ago and followed it up with a visit to the restaurant two days before. My friend is partially sited so I wanted to ensure we had the table by the window where it was bright.

When we arrived, the table I requested was occupied. We were asked to sit in the middle of the room where it was dark and noisy to wait for the table to become available (why were they not sat at this table in the first place was beyond me?) The waitress came over to take our drink order, we were never asked at any point later in the evening if we would like another....We then ordered our starters and mains at the same time. Food was okay, not overly special, we have all ate far better Italian dishes elsewhere. My meal in particular was warm, not hot, so I found myself eating it quickly before it turned cold. The table was cleared and the dessert menu offered and that's where it ended. We were totally forgotten about. Part of the reason for choosing Mamma Mia was to try the homemade lemon cheesecake as this came highly recommended. We were going to order 4, at just under £20 so fairly highly priced. We waited... and we waited ... To add further insult a very large party of 20+ descended on the restaurant and the staff rallied round like they were celebrities. This was the final straw. I consider it unacceptable to wait in excess for half hour to take a dessert order, who knows how much longer we would have waited had we not requested the bill and left? Disappointed. Will neither return or recommend.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Not that good
Review:
Went for family meal as kids love salad bar and ice cream.
Typical pre ordered frozen food served to the masses.
Nothing special. Always dirty messy floors, salad bar messy and food all over the place and on floor. Kids out hands in, spoons back in wrong dishes. Just not my idea of good food.
Wont rush back!

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Fun, fab food and great service!
Review: We were excited to visit this place having seen details for it before it opened. Did not dissapoint - we had a warm welcome, service was faultless and the food was absolutely delicious. Big portions so you will leave satisfied! Not just big portions but well presented, well thought out and great flavour combinations. All this in a fun medieval setting! We will definitely be back.

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Very disappointing
Review: My vegetarian selection was absolutely tasteless, lukewarm and I had stomach cramps and was very sick that night. My partners' meal, which was a vegetarian burger was basically a jumble of vegetables that just fell apart in a mess from the bun. We have eaten at the Spotted Cow several times in the past but it seems to have gone badly downhill and the food was extremely disappointing and certainly not worth the money.

Name: East Beach Café
Title: Bleak and very expensive but poorly prepared food.
Review: We'd heard of the Cafe and wanted to see the unusual architecture. Admittedly it was a raint August so it wasn't showcased at it's best but the building is cold and unwelcoming. The young server tried hard but the food was terrible. My guest had the fish and chips which looked fine but he later mentioned he'd struggled to eat it. I had the burger which was an abomination. The addition of both puled and spicy pork with cheese on top did little to disguise the taste of meat past it's best. I mentioned this and was treated to a list of why it was fine. Well it wasn't, we won't be back. It was expensive and unpleasant.

Name: Cardanom Bay
Title: Amazing!
Review:
We visited on a quiet Sunday evening. We weren't particularly hungry, and ordered Salmon tikka starter, All Basanti, Peshwari nan and bhindi (which was not on the menu, but they said it wasn't a problem) I was intrigued by the Nu Chu Chilli Masala, which we also ordered. I have never seen this dish before. It turned out to be a huge red bell pepper stuffed full of chicken masala. Very interesting and creative. There were also other dishes on the menu I had not seen anywhere else, either.
Well worth a visit if you are in Bognor, good atmosphere, ambience and service too.
Recommended

Name: Town House
Title: Fabulous hotel
Review:
We noticed this town house with a sign for accommodation when we first arrived in Arundel. After having a wander down to the tourist centre for information about a place to stay, we decided to see if they had a room.
Luckily for us they just had one left, but only for one night. We took it and also made a reservation for dinner in the restaurant.
The room was wonderful; clean and spacious with high end toiletries in the en-suite. The bed was extremely comfortable.
The dinner was amazing. My husband had steak and lobster, he said it was the best he’s ever had. I had cod on a bed of chorizo mashed potato with mushrooms and sautéed Swiss chard. It was delicious. Oh and I couldn’t resist dessert, a raspberry and lemon curd roulade with ice cream. Worth every calorie.
Don’t ever let me hear anyone say the English can’t cook.
I would highly recommend The Town House for accommodation and the superb restaurant.

Name: Butlins
Title: Full weekend
Review:
This was a second visit but with a family this time, we stayed in the wave hotel, very clean and rooms were nicely laid out, bathroom taps had handles missing and we asked for a cot on arrival and they forgot so had to re ask at 9pm on first day.

There was so much to do throughout the day to keep a 8 year old entertained, you had to pay extra for some activities which I don't think is fair, also the B line is extra money which is also not fair, people were going mad when the Stephen mulhern show was on, pushing people, running it was not safe when we were carrying children and old people being pushed, they should allocate seats and not make it a free for all, also the new water park changing rooms are right near the front door so you get freezing wind coming through in to the changing rooms when you get out of the pool, the price of drinks is a bit much nearly 5 quid for a pint of beer, so the bar Rosso was never busy really. We enjoyed our break there even though it was busy you could still walk around and not feel too crowded. Hopefully this feedback could make Butlins improve on a few things.

Overall though the kids had a great time which was important...
Read less

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Worst fish and chips and total rip off very poor.
Review:
Was unfortnate to pick this place today while walking on seafront .
The medium cod and chips are total rip off at £8.50 medium fish is very small. and mug of tea at £2.30. Was not a very clean place to eat in.
Most people i guess that are day trippers
That will go in there to eat. Be once only
For many as is so bad , and i expect that view of most people never again.

Name: Bengal Tandoori
Title: Excellent meal and service
Review: My wife and I took my daughter and grand-daughter for an early birthday meal recently at this restaurant and were very pleased with the choice, service and quality of the food. The restaurant was busy even in the early evening, which is always a good sign. My wife had a lamb dish which she described as "really nice" . We ordered a peshwari naan bread to accompany our meal and our only comment was that it wasn't as sweet as some we have tasted, but it was still very good and tasty. Portions were more than adequate and none of us went away feeling hungry

Name: China Palace
Title: Totally Misled
Review: Set Menu Price changed to per person. So set Menu now costs around £50 for 2. Instead of the usual £27-£30 for 2. Menu was not clear enough to illustrate this. Food was good.

Name: Carlyle's Café
Title: Excellent Cafe

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Not very good
Review:
We visited this restaurant at 5pm on 10th March. The scallops were served up cold, the prawn cocktail was served with dry bread and not a lot of sauce.
We all had the roast which tasted as it had been heated up from lunchtime and not not very fresh.

On a good note the waiter dealt with our situation very well and appropriately.

Unfortunately unless we knew that there was a different chef then none of us would return to the restaurant for a meal. Jame party

Name: La Campagnia
Title: Superb lunch
Review: Nice end to the week. Wonderful lunch at this tasteful relaxed restaurant. You are always offered a warm welcome by the friendly staff and a super menu. I have yet to be disappointed. Everything is good but their pasta is outstanding. Don’t miss the Fish night!

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Miserable staff!
Review: Very disappointed with the bar staff. This particular man never smiled all evening even though we brought several rounds of drinks. Think twice before going for a drink! There are far more friendly bar staff in other pubs.

Name: Navigator
Title: Non Dinner
Review: Do not bother to go in here if you are vegan ... I was told by the server that they have nothing! 🙁 honestly .. nothing! Not a lot is gluten free either .. it’s a shame as it has a nice outlook onto the beach and welcomes dogs .

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Happy Birthday- what a disaster
Review:
My son decided to take my wife (Who’s birthday we were celebrating), me and his family out to the Crossbush Beefeater’s.

We had booked a table to 16:00, but arrived 15 minutes early. We were shown to our table at about 15:50 and given the menus to read.

After 35 minutes the kids were getting restless so I grabbed the next waitress to go past and asked what I needed to do to get server.

She said they were very busy and apologised after explaining she was the only person looking after the area. She asked if we had ordered drinks. As we hadn’t we gave her the drinks order which turned up one short after 15 mins.

We asked to see the allergy menu and were told that the manager would have to serve us and she’d as him to come over. 10 minutes later he comes over and asks us what we would like to eat. We asked for the allergy menu and after that was sorted we have him our order to be told that the roast dinners were all sold out. That’s the first we’d heard of that after need at the table for over an hour.

We placed our order and waiting over 40 mins for that to arrive.

My wife’s steak which was supposed to be medium to well done was cremated and dry, my sones steak as part of his grill was supposed to be rare to medium and was well done, his chicken was cremated. His wife’s cheese burger was burnt and dry. My pie was had rock hard pastry and over cooked vegetables. The peas were a funny green and tasteless as if they’d bee cooked for a long time.

All in all a disaster for my wife’s birthday.

I collared the manager and explained about the food, he apologies and said he wouldn’t charge us anything, but the damage was done.

We ate what we could and left as soon as we could.

This is the second really poor mean we’ve had at this beefeaters, so I cannot see us going back.

What is the point of doing a 40% off promotion as well a being in taste card if you done get the staff in both the front of the house and in the kitchen, they obviously didn’t get extra staff in either!

I would vigorously NOT recommend this restaurant.

Name: East Beach Café
Title: Refuge from the storm
Review: We took refuge from a rain deluge in here and we were the only customers. The staff could not have been nicer. The hot drinks were delicious and the cakes were a little sweet for our taste but went down well with the drinks. I imagine the view is lovely on a fine day! A nice cafe but very expensive for a beach side drink.

Name: Behar Kebab
Title: Changed meat supplier?
Review:
Lamb doner from here is usually blinding. We went and picked it up as deliveries are ok but not fantastic.
The taste of the donder was bad. Wasn't cooked enough. Grey and greasy. They used to be the best. I wondering if they changed their suppliers?
Please change it back

Put me off kebab for a while now.

Name: Motte & Bailey
Title: Excellent breakfast
Review:
We’ve been a few times now, as a couple and with our children. Excellent high quality food, service and setting.

A great place to start the day.

Name: Church Farm
Title: October break
Review:
Nice clean site . Usual Haven good quality . Weather not always great but plenty for the children to do inside . All the staff were friendly and helpful. It has nice walks around it especially to the bird watching wetlands .Ate in the restaurant and enjoyed the meals. The grounds were well kept as well..
Read less

Name: Moathouse Café
Title: Poor customer service
Review:
I visited today as part of an overnight stay, my first in Arundel. I ordered 2 breakfasts anad 2 drinks aware that town centre parking was only for 1 hour. Forty minutes later, I approached the counter to say I was just about to move my van as my breakfast had not been served. I was only going to move it, my wife was going to remain in the cafe. I was told that the breakfast was just being put on the plate now. I explained that it still wasn't on the plate, and brought out therefore I needed to move my van as I would not have time to eat it within the hour. With that I was told just pay for your drinks which is not the response you want when asking for a slight delay while you just love a car.
What I wasn't aware of was that while I was at the counter a girl took the roast to my wife and asked what the problem was. When my wife told her, she explained that the wait for food is 30 minutes, something we weren't told, plus it was over that.
Definitely not a great experience!

Name: Mr P's Classic Amusements
Title: A lot of room for improvement
Review:
I write my review based on visiting all of the Mr P arcades. I will not waffle on but here is the basics.

For starters, not all of the machines are on their best payout percentages. Their website claims they have the best percentage payouts, this may be true in comparison to other amusements but losing £1000 through a £70 jackpot machine is definitely not 90%.

Any machine player will generally know if a machine is worth playing. A sign for this is “being full up”. Mr P arcades refill their machines and I have experienced this personally many times in each branch. For example, a party time could be full, the coins are dropping, you win £50 collect it and only pays £19 before going empty, then they refill or flick the hopper top up switch after only refloating £31. The next player then thinks it’s full up but does his balls in.

The arcade opening times are very early to close, however, if you are a promoter of their business via youtube, they will stay open till all hours for you, but not to normal customers.

The owners will lend people money who they get on well with, but others they will not, not very professional.

The staff will empty machines whilst you go for a fag or to the bank.

The arcades never ever have enough pound coins in, staff always have to empty machines half way through playing to get coins.

No loyalty rewards given, where as other arcades you get some kind of rewards. However you do get some free play each visit, on certain machines.

Often machines spend weeks out of use because the owners do not drive. The staff on site do not generally know how to fix the machines when they malfunction.

The air conditioning is pretty much non existent in all 3 arcades. It’s very hot in summer and stuffy most days.

You may get refreshments but that has been abused so seems to be cut back a bit.

All in all, the machines are there for “nostalgia” and certainly as with any arcades you cannot “make money” from, it’s all entertainment. You can get lucky, or you can be very unlucky.

The reason for my low score is that the brand continues to maintain they are this that and the other but in fact they are not. I’ve seen various lies, various untoward behaviour, very unfair ethics. All customers should be treated the same, whoever they are. Opening and closing should be set. Filming of other arcade users without their permission should not be allowed. They will write essays on their social media to portray they are amazing people, which some fall for, but let’s face it - they are only in it for the money in reality, nobody starts a business just for the love, otherwise they would be skint in no time.

Name: Fino
Title: Delicious family lunch.
Review: Delighted to find this restaurant. Furnishings are modern ,clean and bright and staff both pleasant and attentive. Children’s menu excellent value and quality. We were a party of 6 for Saturday lunch and everyone was delighted with their food. The menu has a large selection and I would honestly be happy with anything from the large choice.. The salad is fresh and nicely dressed. The chicken cooked perfectly. The coffee excellent. Will definitely be eating here again.

Name: Avisford
Title: Goodwood racing weekend
Review:
My wife and I have been using Avisford part since 2006, with at least one trip each year and one major function for 100+ people in 2015.
We were disappointed with the room last year, when we came down for Glorious Goodwood, the room was no better this year.
A shoddy, poorly fitted out bathroom with noisy plumbing. The room decoration was jaded, there was even two screws left in a wall where a picture was taken down. The safe did not work either, although when asked in the morning, maintenance fixed it.
If you are offered room 148, turn it down
Read less

Name: The Southdowns
Title: Very nice
Review:
Friendly, clean pub and testaurant
Our 4 meals were well cooked and presented.
Overall I would give this a 5 star rating and I'm not easy to please

Name: Passage to India
Title: Excellent food
Review: Came here with friends of mine catching up. Good amount of portions which I still manage a dessert and a couple of bottles of beer. Duck tikka massala is always my favourite at this restaurant as I can’t get it in my town in North Wales

Name: Best Western Bognor
Title: Hen do party
Review:
Can’t thank best western enough! They catered to all our needs for afternoon tea and Prosecco for our hen party! Especially Ellie she was superb and made sure everything was perfect! Thank you so much! From all us 9! Xxx
Read less

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Great location...shame about the breakfast
Review:
Good location...but the breakfast is really unacceptable in terms of quality. Since stopping the "cook to order" method, really disappointing. Rooms are of a good standard since being refurbished, however the mattresses seem to have not been replaced.
Read less

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Disappointing
Review: Worst fish and chips ever. Fish was totally dry and over cooked. Will not be returning. Would have expected more from a Premier Inn

Name: Motte & Bailey
Title: Birthday disappointment
Review:
My friends booked us in to round off a day at the races for my special birthday .
Will never go back ...
Disappointment of the highest order , food late small portions even for tapas , overpriced , bad attitude by what appeared to be head service person .
When I complained about my wine being off she accused me of shouting and then announced “ we don’t make the wine “ null points .
Younger staff were polite and apologetic but the whole experience was a huge let down for ourselves and for Arundel .
Go anywhere else but here

Name: Butlins
Title: Lovely weekend break
Review:
Just returned from a long weekend break at Butlins, not our first visit and certainly not our last. We were disappointed with our accomodation, with outlook over the bins, cars driving at us as the hotel window was at the end of the slip road to the car park. There was very little reception could do as the hotel was full so we had to put up with it and spend the weekend with the curtains closed and make the most of it. Televisions did not work apparently something to do with atmospherics and was site wide (so we were told) other than that everything was fine. Swimming pool was exceptional slides, Rapids, flumes. Lots for the little ones too. Changing rooms and lockers were plentiful- larger ones incorporated pull down changing tables and a safe place for the little ones while you got dressed. As you where your footwear to the changing rooms could do with more cleaners to keep the floors clean.
Entertainment was exceptional Stephen Mulhern, Panto, Paddington show were great we bought the B line fast passes and was pleased we did otherwise alot of queuing.
Food was good, we went for dine around vouchers as part of the dining plan and could eat at any restaurant two courses and have breakfast in the hotel. Really easy to use and meant all our food was paid for in advance. Would do this again.
 So much to do despite disappointment with our room, still was a lovely break with extra special memories.
Read less

Name: The Lamb, Angmering
Title: Superb
Review: Superb food and accommodating staff...polite and lovely. Super room apart from a couple of harvest spiders..Superb bed. What else can I say? I didn't give my title at booking and never do!...top job "The Lamb"

Name: China Palace
Title: Do not go for lunch
Review: The setting is wonderful and a few months ago we had a fantastic meal here. However this time round, the quality of the ingredients was very poor, the chicken very tough and where was the meat on the ribs. my wife complained and got an oh and a shrug. maybe great in evening but not for lunch. expensive, when the ingredients must have been cheapest possible

Name: The Swan
Title: Very pleasant staff, food could’ve better
Review: We visited The Swan Hotel for lunch on a Monday. The staff were very pleasant and professional however, the food was cold. Reading other comments, this seems to be a recurrent issue. Without going into detail, the management resolved the issue in an understanding and professional manner. I’m sure the food would be fine if the plates were warmed and the food came out to the restaurant promptly. A relatively easy issue to resolve which would result in happier customers.

Name: Church Farm
Title: Don’t even bother
Review:
Arrived to find caravan not ready, then our vouchers not ready. Had to wait 30 minutes as apparently they were not informed! ???
Then given the wrong keys to our caravan.
Meant to check in at 2pm, finally about 3.30pm.
Terrible start to our holiday as very upset children.
Will not be returning again. Strongly suggest people find a different holiday park.
Staff shrug and don’t care.
Read less

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Back to square one
Review:
Historically this has never been a good place for a meal. Drinks overlooking the river - yes, great but they just don't try enough in the restaurant. In my previous review I thought things were improving but recently they have reverted to their old ways which quite frankly are just not good enough. Went again recently (April 2019) and booked a particular table. When we arrived restaurant was almost empty except (predictably) the table we had booked. So we took another table. Then had to get up and find menus for my guests and call for a waitress to take an order for drinks. The disinterest was palpable. To be fair a young male waiter later in the meal was excellent. Food when it eventually arrived was amongst the worst I have had for some time. The bill for four of us including two courses each, two glasses of wine and a pint of beer between us
was over £90. Needless to say I did not leave a gratuity.

Name: Curry Villa
Title: Home delivery
Review: Disgusting meal. Turned up late and was cold. Will never use them again. Have used them in the past and been ok but plenty more Indians to choose from but won’t be this one

Name: YHA
Title: Lovely hostel in prime location
Review: This hostel is right on the waterfront in Littlehampton - you can be outdoors looking at the view in about 2 minutes! It's a self-catering hostel and we didn't cook in the kitchen but it looked well equipped and was kept very clean and tidy. There is a good dining room with lots of tables and chairs and a decent lounge too with lots of comfy chairs and also a TV. We had an en suite room for 4 but we had booked it for two of us. There was lots of storage space for our things and it would have been fine for 4 people too. The shower was good with plenty of hot water. The staff are very friendly and helpful and we had good advice about places to eat from Carol. We put our bikes in the bike shed around the back which was securely locked. The train service along the coast in both directions is very good and I think there were good buses too but we didn't use those. You can certainly get around well by public transport along the coast. We did cycling from the hostel and also took our bikes on the train which worked well. We really enjoyed our stay here and hope to come back some time.

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Leave bar area to clean half way through RWC2019 game
Review:
Can you believe @premierinn Bognor Regis sent us out of the bar to clean half way through Wales & Australia. Now watching it from bedroom. Absolute Liberty! @wru_community @rwc2019. Will pick an alternative hotel next time!
Read less

Name: Bognor Charcoal Grill
Title: Worst kebab of our lives
Review:
We had a chicken donner and chicken donner wrap with stuffed vine leaves on the side. The vine leaves were inedible and out of a tin which was confirmed when I called to complain.
The kebabs looked partly raw and the meat was slimmy. If there was a zero rating on the stars i would have selected that option.
The worst kebab shop in bognor regis
Trully disgusting.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Expect a long wait
Review: Stayed in the premier inn for 5 nights. Gave up eating in here after 3 of them. Ridiculously long wait for food even though the place was pretty empty and sub standard when it did arrive. Alarm bells start ringing when the chef can't even cook a steak and half the dish comes out cold.

Name: The Beresford
Title: poor seating arrangments
Review:
have eaten here several times never been a problem until today.

always booked ahead of vist,however today we were seated right out in the middle of

the the main area,not very nice when people from all directions walking in all around

our table.

we felt as though we were second rate clientele, we were paying customers like

everyone else but for us today we felt like we didnt matter, so wont be returning.

Name: Piccolo Italia
Title: Lovely friendly restaurant , good food.
Review: Decided to have the steak even though Italian restaurant And wouldn’t usually go for a steak. Best steak I’ve had serviced with salad and potatoes perfectly cooked and perfect meal. Friendly staff.

Name: Zeera Lounge
Title: Not impressed
Review: Delivery was quick but the food was very disappointing, tasted like it had been cooked the day before and reheated

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: wow!!!!
Review: Jamie the manager was brilliant Carol and Sharon served us top class service food was also amazing

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Perfect
Review: Family Christmas lunch 23 of us! Lots of happy people, food was great, the really nice thing was that the vegetables were served in a dish on the table so you could help yourself to what you liked (some places put everything onto your plate, and personal I don't like brussel sprouts!!). The 2 ladies who looked after us, Ecra and Paula, couldn't have been more helpful. Thanks again

Name: Parsons Table
Title: First-rate dining in Arundel
Review: The food is wonderful, the service friendly -- all that the other positive reviews say is true. You will have a great time here. My only complaint is that the space gets noisy when full of happy diners. Something sound-absorbent on the walls or ceilings would help.

Name: Robin Hood
Title: AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL
Review:
I attended a Christmas party here with my workplace colleagues, absolutely without question the worst food I've ever had, definitely won't be eating here again, this is the exact opposite of the SAME meal I had at the Bull in Goring, Sussex, read my review for that.
