We ordered 3 starters and 2 sharing platters to start and they were all well portioned and tasty. I had the Tomato and Mozzarella salad and it was fresh and tasty. The rest of the party enjoyed their starters.

The main courses arrived and they were also of good proportion apart from the sea bass it looked a little smaller than the rest of the mains but the party member said it was fulfilling. I had the diavola pizza with chillies it was full filling but not that hot (spicy) maybe add a spicier chilli if it is advertised as hot with chillies. the rest of the main courses were tasty and looked fullfilling as well as well presented.

The deserts were well presented and a nice light touch after the meal.

Overall I would recommend this place to couples and people celebrating occasions alike. I would return again.

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Family lunch
Review:
This was possibly the worst meal I have eaten in a while. Apart from being sorely disappointed in the welcome and atmosphere, the menu was boring. Accepting our mistake and resigning ourselves to yet another boring pub grub (food it was not) we ordered the one thing we thought was hard to destroy - baked potatoes. Mine arrived clearly having been reheated, glassy and of bad quality but my partners did not. After a 15 Min. wait a very raw baked potato was presented. We sent it back, He shared mine and we didn’t make a fuss as we were out with 7 other family members who’s food was equally as shocking.
Apologies were forthcoming from the dear waitress, who was great, for the raw potato but no effort was made by management to possibly pay for a drink or in any way recover some form of compensation for making a family lunch very uncomfortable and unpleasant. Rather that enjoy a leisurely lunch with family, we ate and left as soon as we could
It was expensive, bad quality and attitudes were not good. Don’t go, they may need to get out a bit and see what good pubs are doing these days. The days of accepting crud in pubs are hopefully over, so don’t get caught out here.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Not impressive breakfast
Review: We are local to roundstone and thought try their breakfast. What a disaster. Waited over 10 mins to be seated. Then had to ask for a glass, Spoon, Sugar. Coffe was ok. Then waited 25 mins for someone to take our hot food order. When our breakfasts arrived, bacon was really greasy, scrambled eggs were chewy and the fried egg had a raw top all round the yolk. Not a good breakfast. Won't be returning.

Name: Burger King Rustington
Title: Run out of buns
Review: The woman behind the counter waited 10 minutes before telling us they have run out of buns. we left.

Name: East Beach Café
Title: Expensive
Review:
Went for lunch with Grandson.
Limited children's menu and he just wanted a burger with chips which was not available. We asked waitress if they could do a child's burger meal as burgers were on full menu, which they did.
The portion was large (adult size) and when the bill came they charged £11 for his meal.
We had toasted sandwiches and they were £8 each.
This is a cafe wanting to be a classy restuarant hence charging extortional prices.
Definitely will not go again at these prices.

Name: T-Bone Burger
Title: Wouldn't go again
Review: Initial impression is OK,nice and modern but it feels like interior in unfinished.Toilets smelly and unkempt.Cheap kitchen towel rolls on the table (yeah,it's good to be able to wipe your hands but I would expect something that says "quality "). Staff friendly and attentive but not very professional,I had a feeling that the young girls were randomly chosen,they didn't dress or behave like professional waitresses. Food and drinks arrived fairly quickly but order was mixed up.Instead of chicken salad we have received halloumi salad.Mozarella burger was massive but tasteless and the cheese was definitely not a mozarella(too runny and transparent). Cheesy chips were covered in some kind of cheese substitute and after they cooled down it was sickly,solid goo with soggy chips that left terrible aftertaste.I tried to drown it,with what I thought was fresh orange juice,however it was bitter,cloudy concentrate that was only in colour looked like dirty orange. The only highlight was sweet potato chips which remained crispy for a bit longer(I actually wish it was only thing I've ordered). If this place wants to survive, it needs massive improvement.Way too expensive for what it has to offer.

Name: McDonald's
Title: I'll never go back
Review:
The food is Macdonalds and exactly what you'd expect.
I have eaten Macdonalds often

Sadly, as I was waiting for food a memeber of staff was joking about spitting in a young lad's meal

How could I go back after hearing that . I may never be able to eat Macdonald's again .

Name: The Gravy Boat
Title: Fantastic lunch
Review:
We had a fantastic Sunday lunch here, there were 5 adults and 3 children.

The carvery was great value for money, tasted delicious and had a great variety of options. Other members of our party had items off the main menu and the food was also delicious. The pizzas looked great as did other plates of food being served to other tables!

Kids menus had a decent number of options and were of a good size.

The service was excellent and we were well looked after.

This was the first time I have visited here but I hope it won't be the last, a great find!

Name: La Campagnia
Title: Great Service. Amazing Food.
Review:
What a fantastic restaurant.
This is an eatery we have been to before now, and each time I am amazed how wonderful it is. If it were closer to my home I would be a daily customer.
The staff are tremendous and always courteous and as helpful as one could wish for. The food is sublime. The desserts are to die for. I didn’t indulge this time but my wife had the banoffee pie, and as I type I’m hoping there may be a morsel left for me...but I fear my wife may uncharacteristically finish the whole thing.
Thank you to the entire team and I can’t wait to come back and see you again soon.
Picture of the banoffee below. Salivate on three, two, one ...go!

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Over and above The Black Rabbit
Review:
Having taken a recommendation from our B&B to visit The Black Rabbit for food we decided to take a nice leisurely stroll to the pub along the river. We looked at the menu and liked the look of the food offered. As it was a lovely evening we decided to walk along the river to the pub rather than the road.
Having taken 50 mins to walk along the river, we arrived at 20.45 A slightly longer walk than we thought it would take us.
We ordered a bottle of wine and asked for the food menu only to be told the kitchen unfortunately had taken its last order at 20.30 something I had missed on the website.

The manager was very apologetic, not really sure why as it was our mistake not his. The reason we had come to Arundel was for a belated birthday celebration for my other half.
He offered the bottle of wine at a significantly reduced cost to us and also gave us some vouchers to use for next time after he found out the reason for our stay.
Well and about anything we expected for a issue that was ours not his. It’s a shame we weren’t able to eat there that night as the food coming out looked and smelled amazing.
He called a taxi so we could get back into town.
Be aware 20.30 seems to be the normal kitchen last orders for pubs in and around the area.
We shall be returning to The Black Rabbit as soon as we are able.

Name: World's End
Title: Lovely food at the end of a lovely warm day
Review:
We walked up to the World's End on Saturday evening arriving about 6.30pm. Staff were really helpful, all the seats were taken to the front of the restaurant (catching the last rays of sunshine) but we were directed to the garden to the rear. I had the roast chicken in lemon and my partner had the burger. I can honestly say the chicken and dauphinoise potatoes were one of the nicest things I have eaten in a long time at a restaurant and the burger was very nice as well.

We will definitely return especially as in walking distance.

(Only comment I would make is that is seemed customers were having trouble finding the table numbers which you needed to order at the bar as they are imprinted on the metal disc in the centre of the table so might be worth making them a bit more noticeable, but that is a complete side issue!)

Name: East Beach Café
Title: Overpriced and very slow kitchen
Review:
Party of 8 . 2 had burgers which took over 30 minutes to arrive and when they did they were raw in the middle.
Their replacements took 40 minutes!!.
Not worth the visit as far as he overpriced food was concerned.

Name: The Waverley
Title: Disappointed
Review: Over £17 for a rump steak and the cheapest beer and what is left on my plate is half of what I was given and uneatable ! Totally left feeling ripped off ! The manager tonight was very professional and apologetic but just not good enough was my meal. Especially against my costs !!! She did offer to refund me but that was not what I was after. I had traveled, and just wanted a good meal. Will never return and certainly do not recommend!!! And refuse to be bought off by the fact it is a London brand who apparently use the same suppliers !!! Disgrace of a company in my eyes, who are thieves taking my money and providing me with crap. Pepper sauce was sweet and certainly not peppercorn sauce !!! I am feeling distress as to what I might of just ate ???? I was so hungry too I had to eat as much as I could Muster. Fries were fine, although I said no to tomato sauce, I was bought 3 different sauces. I now think the bar tender probably knew I would need to cover the taste !!! Photo of inedible steak is at least half the size I was served !!! And the sauce certainly no a pepper sauce. Should of known by the immediately spoken bar tender that I had ten minutes. Disgraceful!

Name: Linden Fisheries
Title: Under New Management
Review:
Been going here for few years, Found out the couple that run it have left.
Tried the news guys anyway - Wish I didn't.
 Chips were undercooked and a large portion was very small.
Smallest bits of Huss I have ever had and didn't even taste very nice!
Won't be returning - Bottom find a new Chippy :(

Name: World's End
Title: Meal for two
Review:
Booked a meal but arrived to find it wasn’t booked in
But got a table yehay.... but with wonky table and with chair on stones at different levels
Ok move on
Menu has gone downhill - sorry guys sooo
Fish and chips can’t go wrong with that....wrong it was a battered grey thing ...skin I think
I had cod at Mick’s chips in Rustington previous night these guys need to have a look in there to see how fish should look, it should never have been plated !
Complained - chose ham egg and chips
Yea can’t go wrong with that ... trouble is didn’t want that
I realise complainers are not wanted in a restaurant and that’s why we were asked how we would like to pay when we had full glasses of wine we were drinking!
The staff were very good but the kitchen needs to be educated, and I for one will not accept a skin in batter with 10 chips On a wonky seat and table then being ushered out of door and paying for the privilege I was not even offered how this would be dealt with
My main reason for eating out is to enjoy an experience nice meal glass of wine be waited on etc that’s why we pay these prices
I ended up feeling uncomfortable, confrontational, grouchy, kicked out, arguing with my lovely wife and departing icily

Shouldn’t be like that !!!

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: lovely location
Review: Visited this pub/restaurant on Last Sunday of December 2018. Great location situated beside the river. we had a table for 6, food was very good, roast beef with all the trimmings. A large varied menu with much variety, but being a Sunday, we wanted to try out the "roasts", all good. staff were very attentive, it was quiet as we were one of the last servings in the evening, but we all enjoyed it and were last to leave the restaurant. Would imagine it is a very popular place in summer, views are lovely, and a nice outside area to relax over a couple of ales. Will definitely return. Good value.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Disappointing breakfast visit
Review: We were so disappointed to find a drop in standards since our last pleasant visit in the summer. There seemed to be a skeleton staff available. Our waiter did his best but the kitchen was woefully inadequate. The bacon was virtually served cold, with barely cooked fat on the rasher, the hash browns were unappetising, the mushrooms tasted unpleasant. Tomatoes and fried eggs were fine. The available croissants were heated on request. The Costa coffee machine came up with warm rather than hot coffee and a latte that had very little coffee in the meagre shot just lots of milk. The dried fruit selection had inedible hard prunes. The fruit salad was good but lacked extra juice. Standards have indeed slipped. There were very few people for a Saturday morning unlike the busy restaurant in the summer.

Name: Black Horse
Title: Wake
Review:
Had a wake here on 30th January
Got quoted £9.90 per head for mixed sandwiches, crisps and free tea and coffee for 40 people
To say I was disappointed was an understatement
The sandwiches were nice I grant you that. But no way were that small amount were worth £400.
No crisps just cheap onion rings and cheese balls
Hot water for tea ran out
No one came to see us to see if everything was ok
I was embarrassed

I did complain when I got home and got £100 refund
But I would definitely check what you’re getting before you go

It’s a shame as we only went there because of the reputation
I hope they have learned something from this

Name: Avisford
Title: Shambles
Review:
Got turned away on the day after booking nearly two months in advance. Looks like a Wedding took preference. Was offered complimentary B&B with an upgrade to a suit. WELL, what a pit. The bathroom was Disgusting. Chunks out of the bath and sink, Blown wood work, mould on grout, more mastic than B n Q, and a shower, surface plumbed in plastic polly ! Cold with squeaking floor boards. And the list could go on.At dinner we had to ask to have our order to be taken, or we would still be there.
Very Disappointed.
Guy Brock. Room 224.
Read less

Name: St Mary's Gate
Title: Good location, friendly, helpful staff
Review: Stayed one night on a biking trip. Nice pub, friendly helpful staff. Room was a good standard. No frills but clean and tidy. Mattress on bed a bit soft and squidgy. Night was oppressively hot and we were supplied a much needed fan. Excellent location next to the Catholic cathedral and within close walking distance to the restaurants and eateries.

Name: Waterside Café
Title: St Laurence’s Fellowship Afternoon Visit
Review:
We had a visit to Arundel for the afternoon and after visiting the museum visited the cafe for drinks and cakes on a windy day.

Excellent and polite service where the staff came to take your orders. We

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Lunch 11th September
Review: I really hate to do this but I have been eating at the spotted cow for over 12 years and loved it, was always consistent and very good. However went there for lunch with my nephew and was very disappointed. I sometimes have the ploughmans and chose this again, was advised that the new menu was just launched. I was so disappointed this time, the ploughmans used to be so good but this time, there was hardly any salad, no apple, no relish as mentioned, just a couple of slices of gherkin, my nephew had burger which he said was nice, but the extra garlic bread with cheese was awful and not home cooked

Name: Fusion
Title: Pizza and Gin
Review:
I have been with friends before and the gins are fab as are the pizza. The goats cheese and caramelised onion is to die for!!
The staff are super friendly and knowledgeable .

Name: The Holly Tree
Title: Disappointed!!!!
Review: A friend and I went to our local pub for a meal today and upon asking for the menus we were informed they had stopped serving food as they had a quiz starting at 8pm. We wanted to order just before 7.30!!! Not really the way to treat local regulars with this kind of service so left extremely disappointed especially as we had been told that with the new landlord taking over things had improved greatly with the food. It would have been better customer service if the bar had announced that they had stopped serving or a notice was written somewhere on one of their boards informing people of the kitchen closure. It will be a while before we return which is a great shame having both worked there for two years and have continued to use the pub since leaving...

Name: Raj Doot
Title: So slow
Review: Finally given the curry an hour later than advised at the time of ordering. Food was OK but the kids were too tired to enjoy it. Will try elsewhere in future.

Name: Picturedrome
Title: Great cinema, really old-fashioned look, and really old fashioned price.
Review:
Go and see a film here. Good seats, good view, great price. An original 1950 cinema, converted into a few screens, but still reminds you of how it used to be. But movies are modern.
Read less

Name: The Mezze
Title: A tasty meal at reasonable prices
Review: Like most things Turkish, the service was attentive and the food fresh, including the bread the name of which escapes me. 425 ml of red Turkish wine and stuffed aubergine + £23.00. Difficult to beat.

Name: China Palace
Title: Still our go to Chinese when we visit for Goodwood
Review: We stay in Arundel every year when we work at the Festival of Speed and every year we have a Chinese. Usually we work so late we grab a takeaway on our way home but this year we actually managed to go in for a sit down meal. The establishment is lovely and our large party was easily accommodated. The staff were very attentive and the food was top notch!! Look forward to our annual China Palace next year!

Name: Papa Johns, Butlins
Title: Amazing service
Review: I just visited the Papa John’s In Butlins Bognor Regis and received amazing customer service from Ginnie. She went out of her way to make my family feel welcomed and satisfied, nothing was an inconvenience for her and she even tailored to my family’s specific dietary needs. She spread warmth around the whole restaurant and her enthusiasm and friendliness made the whole experience outstanding. Thank you Ginnie for turning our experience into a wonderful family memory. You are amazing!

Name: East Beach Café
Title: Stunning restaurant right on the promenade
Review:
What a find! Gorgeous driftwood architecturally designed seafront restaurant. Freshly caught seafood on the menu and deliciously presented.
On a sunny day with the doors open onto the promenade it is a joyful experience.

Name: The Mezze
Title: Authentic and friendly- highly recommend!
Review:
Visited on a busy Saturday evening- thankfully we booked. Although the restaurant was busy it had a pleasant atmosphere and we were greeted (as was every single customer) and seated swiftly in a friendly manner.
Turkish rose wine and a cocktail for me arrived while we studied the menu.
Starter was hot Mezze which we shared - it was ample, well cooked and very tasty!
Mains were equally fresh and delicious- we could watch the chefs at their grill - they were working extremely hard in the heat and can only be congratulated for the authentic meat that they were serving!
Our Shish and mixed grill was delicious, served with authentic Turkish bread, a lovely garlic sauce and hot chilli - and plenty of it!
Baklava was, like everything here, mouthwatering and authentic.
The family who run this deservedly busy and excellent restaurant are friendly and efficient and deserve to make a huge success of this business, which can only improve Bognor Regis town centre.
We will definitely be returning and most highly recommend! Thanks for a pleasant evening!

Name: Sen
Title: Perfect Find
Review: After passing several restaurants from the coast we found Sen tucked around the corner, a hidden Gem. The staff constantly smiling & friendly, the menu satisfy’s all & much to choose from. My two year old Son loved the tapas,If I returned to Bognor I would love to go back for sure.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Visit with Son and Daughter
Review: We visited at lunchtime today was shown to a quiet table in the corner waiter took our drinks order I asked for pineapple juice and lemonade he brought just pineapple juice asked us if we we’re ready to do food order he never came back finally had to go to bar to find him,food took ages to arrive and then cleared away our plates again seemed to be forgotten had to go up to the bar again someone from the kitchen took our order didn’t seem to be many staff working such a shame used to enjoy going there also asked for a gluten free menu luckily I’m not a coeliac otherwise I’d be worried as the menu had a lot of items scribbled out dishes

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Disappointing and gone downhill
Review: In the past this pub has been wonderful but it’s gone downhill (I think it’s under new management). We went a few months ago and got poor service but thought it was just an off night. We went back on Sunday for Father’s Day and it was very disappointing and we won’t be returning. They had totally run out of Sunday roasts (all varieties of meat) but didn’t actually tell us when they seated us. Only when we came to order and wanted 4 roasts did they say they had run out. I get that it’s busy as it’s Father’s Day but they should anticipate that. We ordered different food and it was ok but the service was slow, we asked for veg and they forgot to bring it out and we had to go and remind them as did the table next to us. The whole experience was unorganised and so disappointing especially as this used to be such a lovely pub to visit. We won’t be going back.

Name: WWT Wetland
Title: A collection of muddy ponds.
Review:
Not worth the expensive entrance charge. The site is a collection of dirty , muddy ponds. Not many exotic waterfowl present but lots of noisy seagulls and magpies which together with a visiting heron made off with the ducklings .
Read less

Name: The Mezze
Title: Lack of consistency
Review: Every time the level of service is different. The food is always good but the experience is mixed. It’s a gamble visiting this place- you never know what you gonna get

Name: Aldwick Beach
Title: Private
Review: The reason this beach is a little gem is because it is private and owned by the residents of Aldwick Bay Estate. Of course no one minds dog walkers and holidaymakers passing through as long as they realise the beach is private and for residents and their families and guests only. The private part stretches from one end of the estate to the other but does not include the beach huts part. The Dunes, the sitting area and the boardwalk are all part and parcel paid for by the estate residents. Only residents can park in the Dunes and they all have badges in their cars to show they are residents. I have lived on this estate for 12 years and it always looks good due to the efforts of the residents.

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Absolutely awful!
Review: My family and I visited this fish and chip shop after spending a couple of hours at the seafront...i wished I had checked Trip Advisor first! The chips were refried bits,dry, hard and tasted of greasy oil which left a horrible after taste in our mouths. The chicken nuggets tasted of a cheap quality as did the sausages, had alot of chewy gristle bits in them which put the kids off eating. Very expensive for the portion sizes and overall poor food

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Very disappointing
Review: Staying at the Premier Inn next door, we decided to go to the local restaurant as we were feeling too lazy to go out. Now we wish we had. We waited for ages for some soup and when it arrived it was tepid. Service was very haphazard and there didn't seem anyone available who was in charge and that we could complain to. So, we just ate our tepid soup and retired without eating anything else. To be fair, the next morning we had the usual Premier Inn breakfast there and that was fine. Otherwise, we would have given it one star. Chris (Bath)

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Terrible Restaurant
Review: The service in this restaurant was really slow taking over 2 hours for two courses. Being a veggie I opted for a veggie starter which came covered in bacon. That went back and a "new" one arrived for me to find out that they had picked the bacon off, leaving some behind. They took this one away saying they would cook a fresh one. The next one arrived and surprise surprise there was still bacon on it and it wasn't very warm for a supposedly freshly cooked starter. The bowls they used for the meals were chipped as well so on the whole a bad dining experience, If it hadn't been for the good company it would have been a complete disaster!

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Breakfast
Review: I took my girls for breakfast during half term and couldnt fault it at all. Wonderful prompt service by Kirsty and a great selection of food both hot and cold and a great value for money. The manager, Jamie also took the time to come over and make sure we were enjoying our breakfast and made the effort talking to the girls even though you could see it was busy. Great treat and will definalty be making a return.

Name: Toast
Title: PhilA
Review: I’ve visited this cafe several times over the last 2/3 years. The food and service have aalways been great. The prices are very reasonable. Thermistor also a very nice loo!

Name: The Deli
Title: Best homemade quiche
Review: Another great lunch. Home made cheese and beetroot quiche. Delicious. Lovely to sit in the garden enjoying the sunshine.

Name: Swan Hotel
Title: Lovely
Review:
Last minute deal and worth every penny of the £80
Comfy room
Amazing gin bar and the staff were informative and fun.
Breakfast was plentiful and local
Fresh fruit the best choice I’ve seen in a long time

Cooked breakfast of many options

Table dressed well, fresh flowers n all the quaint knick knack holders all go with the quality of service.

Excellent location

Highly recommend this hotel
Even the tiny faults were enjoyable
Hot tap in room 5 wobbles when u turn it
Bottom step to staircase rather deep n caught me foot on the way up and down ( obviously will never learn)
Read less

Name: La Campagnia
Title: Fish Night
Review: Fish night was recommended to us and we discovered a great restaurant with a good atmosphere. Loved the choices from the fish menu. Only one negative comment the trio of fish came with what should have been juicy prawns but unfortunately they were very dry and not enjoyable, but this wouldn’t stop us returning.

Name: Crown Music
Title: Mr simms
Review: It was a lovely public bar until they employed a female called Louise who has a disgusting mouth on her as she doesn’t care about who is around her being adults or children it’s totally disgusting what comes out of her mouth I certainly won’t recommend the crown Littlehampton to anyone.

Name: Tesco Café
Title: Get some staff in!
Review: Took an elderly lady in a wheelchair shopping at Tescos today and called in to the cafe for lunch.It was NOT a good experience. At a few minutes after 12, I started queuing...and the only cook announced he was going off on a break!This meant that there were NONE of the main dishes available,just breakfast or ready made sandwiches and cake.This left just 2 lovely woman doing their best,nether of whom were trained to cook anything.I believe neither of the women have been there long.A large queue(people thinking they could order the items advertised of course)...my companion waited 20 minutes for her fry up,and I waited 25.The women were most apologetic. The breakfast itself was fine but of course we had finished our hot drinks by the time the food came. Many people had walked out (we would have done had it not been for the wheelchair with us.) Everything in the cafe is dirty,,teaspoons stained,cutlery not washed properly,teapots stained,floor needed sweeping,tables piled high with dirty crockery. It's half termweek and it was lunch time...for goodness sake, GET SOME STAFF AND A CLEANING ROTA!

Name: Butlins
Title: We love the 70's
Review:
Our first visit to Butlins

Me and a few friends had a fantastic weekend. The fancy dress cant fault it we all wore pink the pink ladies for a hen do lol. I am definatly coming again everything at our stay clean and tidy. The food in the deck wow so much choice I didnt know where to start. Staff friendly, although on the omlette station my omlettte had been burnt and I explained this to the person and got a rude reply and further telling me they were shutting down the station. Although a friendly team member overheard and approached me and apologised on the persons behalf the staff member from the counters told me the name of the person is steven. We did notice there had been 15 minutes of service left not impressed I ended up eating other food. I felt that a complaint would go no where but please ask staff to be polite we pay good money for most of it a good service. The Trip over all best I have been to I will be returning. I did notice how welcome you all made us feel. A shout out to resort safety they are down to earth and a brilliant laugh.

We thoroughly enjoyed the stayed apart from what we have mentioned.

looking forward to our next booking

Thank you
Read less

Name: Church Farm
Title: Great stay at Church Farm - lovely park, friendly staff!
Review:
We have just returned from a lovely 2 week stay at Church Farm. This was our fourth visit to a Haven park and we really enjoyed it. Church Farm is not as big as say Hafan y Mor but the park is beautifully kept and has several features that make it worth a visit.
First of all the staff were fantastic and really made our stay enjoyable. Our 3 girls absolutely loved Ranger Oakley so compliments to him! He really put a lot of effort and humour into the Nature Rockz activities and was by far the best ranger at the parks we’ve visited. The girls also loved the lifeguard (Adam?) who joined in the pool activities, they had loads of fun playing with him. Everyone else was good-humoured and helpful, even the security guards were really nice right down to the cheery wave goodbye as we left. It makes a huge difference so please pass on our thanks to all the staff.
There was an issue with our accommodation on the first night and this was really well handled at reception so thanks for that also.
Our accommodation was very clean and well kept, no signs of wear and tear or poor housekeeping anywhere. All the public areas looked great. You can walk to the lagoon from the park which was lovely and peaceful.
The outdoor pool was beautiful and Sussex has lots of sunny weather so we were able to enjoy it. The water was lovely and warm – I hate cold pool water so I was delighted with this! The pool areas were well maintained and there were plenty of attentive lifeguards. The indoor pool was fine too, just in the sunshine it was nicer to be outside.
I love the outdoor terrace area with a view of the outdoor pool and direct access to the playground. You could eat from the Mash and Barrel or The Terrace pizza here or have a drink at the lovely rattan seating areas. Compliments also to the man who runs The Terrace at the weekends, really good fun.
The park also has an outdoor sports/games area, basketball court, tennis court, covered activities range and Water Walkerz / Bungee Trampolines which were perhaps my only quibble with the park. You can’t book the last 2 in advance with your activity passes, and I had to complain after 4 times in a row asking to use the Water Walkerz only to be told come back later – they did in the end send someone over to run them for us. I appreciate they don’t want a staff member sitting beside them day in day out in case someone wants to use them, but I think you should be able to book a time or a ticket in some way rather than having to keep on asking.
We didn’t eat in the Mash and Barrel as it’s always mediocre at any Haven park. We ate at Cooks & Co fish and chips out of necessity and it was just ok but expensive. The Terrace pizza was nice but pricey. There are a few places to eat nearby in Pagham / Nyetimber but they are a bit of a walk away so better to drive if you have small children.
The arcade area was of course popular with the kids as it always is, they love those 2p machines!!!
The regular evening shows weren’t amazing. The entertainment crew were enthusiastic but I think the shows could do with a bit of a revamp. Check out the visiting acts though – in our second week there was a comedian and he was excellent, we all enjoyed his show.
Apart from the friendly staff and the park amenities, it’s a great area for a holiday. The weather is lovely and there is so much to do in the area. Chichester city is only a few minutes away. Portsmouth is half an hour away and there is loads to see and do, we went back for 2 days (if you buy a Historic Dockyard ticket it is good for a year from the date of issue – just be warned, the Mary Rose requires a separate ticket). Brighton is an hour away. We also went further afield to Legoland and Chessington.
For groceries there are lots of shops around: Pagham has a Co-op around the corner from Church Farm and a Tesco express. Chichester has a lot of shops. There are also superstores in the area around Havant including a massive Asda.
We had a lovely time at Haven Church Farm and would definitely recommend it!
Read less

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: Disappointing
Review:
Booked an early dinner for 5 people as was the best reviewed fish and chip restaurant in the area.
Very disappointed. Waited nearly 45 mins for our food despite the place only being half full.
When the food did arrive the portions were far smaller than expected and the fish was very oily and undercooked

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Good salad bar, does what’s on the tin
Review: A popular location right on the beach, perfectly placed next to Harbour park, with a car park and the safe swimming flag area. Wise to book in summer as gets busy and the staff struggle. Large outdoor seating area and only 500yds to large play park. Generally food is as expected good staples. Salad bar is better than average

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: You have to have the cheesecake!
Review:
A friend and I came here and had mains and puds. Mains - I had the chicken burrito wrap and it was delicious, well presented and bang on for the money.

My friend had the fish finger sandwich and again, the report was that it was delicious and scrummy!

We had a couple of sides - onion rings and mac n cheese to share. No complaints with these, Cajun spice on the onion rings was a nice addition.

If you have room for desert then go for the salted caramel cheesecake - it is super rich so beware, but so delicious! My friend had a sundae , but was super jealous of the cheesecake, so I may have let her share!

The music got turned up when we were there which is why I didn’t give it 5*, it just got a bit too loud for us.

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Disappointed
Review:
I never write bad reviews, but feel I have too. We heard such good things about this place, we dropped in around 4.45 on a Sunday (maybe the wrong time) I ordered a carvery and hubby ordered a venison burger. All the veg on the carvery was cold and soggy, the roast potatoes were not crispy and soggy, the gravy couldn’t have been hot as it didn’t really warm up my Luke warm dinner. My hubbys burger arrived and the chips were just soggy, the waitress (who was lovely) asked how our meal was and I mentioned mine was cold and hubby didnt even answer she just said she would report it to the kitchen. After we half finished our meal we decided to call it a day not even bothering with the free pudding, the waitress did say, was everything ok and we did complain, the manager came over and apologised and said the chips were cut this morning, can’t help thinking they were cooked this morning too! He did take our drinks off the bill £8, but I feel taking one of the meals off at £15.95 and £13.95 would have been better as we left a lot and we enjoyed there drinks! As I said I’m not someone that complains and only do if really necessary.

Don’t think we will be returning

Name: East Beach Café
Title: Lunchtime chaos
Review: Booked table for 4 several weeks ahead through a Travelzoo promotion. Our request for a window table was refused but we were assured they would ‘do their best’! On arrival we were shown to a table in the middle of the restaurant and waited over 30 mins for the menu. Our food was delicious despite having to wait another 30 minutes. Lunch was spoilt by one child screaming, crying, running around and one behind us jumping up and down on their chair and shouting. The whole atmosphere resembled a kindergarten. Don’t go if you want a quiet lunch. Poor service, awful atmosphere. Would I go again? I don’t think so.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Excellent staff!
Review:
With having our wedding locally and many guests staying in the adjoining premier inn it seemed sensible to arrange to meet the next morning for breakfast at the Roundstone. Breakfast was very good with a lot of choice for continental and your full English cooked breakfast. Staff were welcoming and friendly. Even though there was 20+ of us arrived we still were all situated in the same area and served very promptly. Restocking of juices etc was very quick and if you caught a staff member to restock something it was done instantly.

Very friendly and accommodating, will be back again.

Name: East Beach Café
Title: No food till noon
Review: Congratulations - we queued for 10 mins watching 3 coffees being prepared and then another 10 mins for 4 ice creams to be scooped and served before it was finally our turn only to be told no food until 12 noon. No signage to this effect just a menu full of food items. And when we started queuing 3 bacon butties had just been handed out!?! Yes, you've guessed it, we won't be queuing here again.

Name: Arundel Brewery
Title: Really nice shop
Review: What a lovely shop to visit. Local beers tasted and bought as well as a bottle of wine. Great service too

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Never again
Review: Food was absolutely vile. Had a weird under taste which may have been the oil? Service was slow but they may have been down to only having a couple of menus for several tables to share. The place had an overall grubby feel to it & I personally couldn't wait to get out of there.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: I’m pretty sure I’m still stuck to the tables
Review:
Their beer selection was Doom Bar, Doom bar or doom bar. Literally about 5 beer pulls all with doom bar.

The tables were coated in so much sticky mess I am pretty sure I’m still there weeks later. Gross

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Really naf Sunday lunch
Review:
Went as a party of 6 - seated straight away. Decor is nice, recently re-done. Service was pleasant and attentive. Ordered our food which was served almost immediately - alarm bells ring at this point. Had the roast pork which was anaemic - blander it could not have got - more boiled than roasted, and had obviously been sitting in its weak juices quite a while, waiting for me to turn up. But the veg - ahh. The "chef" has taken his boiling technique to a whole new level. How shall we do the carrots - let's boil them, same with the greens, same with all the veg. At this point I realised that they do not have a chef, but someone who honed his skills doing school dinners in the 70's.
The gravy on my partners beef was so thin, that they had tried to thicken it with tomato ketchup.
When we came to deserts I thought, well maybe things will improve. Well, they do say that Hope is the last to die, and die it did. The bread and butter pudding was dry as a bone. The kids had ice cream. It came in a tub, and we were informed that they didn't need spoons as there was a plastic one in the lid!
Enough said - try any of the other pubs in the area and you will get a better meal.

Name: George & Dragon
Title: Sadly, they've lost my business.
Review: I would love to tell you that we had a wonderful time, sitting in the garden admiring the view with sandwiches and a pint, but we didn't even get to order. Arrived at 12pm, most of the tables were empty. I waited a few minutes to be served at the bar, and asked if it would be ok to eat in the garden as I was confused why there was a sign saying that food was only served on the small terrace - why would we want to sit there, crowded with nasty metal tables, when there's a beautiful pub garden to enjoy? The lady behind the bar asked if I had made a reservation, to which I had replied that I hadn't. I was then told, very firmly, that those who had booked got priority. Fine, we only want sandwiches and I understand if the kitchen is busy, I said, thinking a packet of crisps would tide us over. How long is the wait? "Even sandwiches take time," said the woman behind the bar like I was some kind of idiot, "and there are FIVE tables to give their orders before you!" What? They haven't even ordered? How is the kitchen busy? I don't think they had even arrived! It was the beginning of service, they weren't busy. I left with my family, without ordering anything. I've never been greeted in such an inhospitable manner when going to a pub, especially by the person who I assume is the landlady. She should have advised, politely and with a smile, that there would be a bit of a wait as they were busy, but asked what I wanted to drink - it's a pub, afterall! But, nope. Years spent waitressing has made me more sympathetic than most, but I was made to feel like my custom wasn't wanted. Thousands of pubs across the land manage lunchtime service, and of course on busy days there will probably be a wait, but there was no excuse for the treatment we received today. The staff were rude, service is a shambles - it was chaos behind the bar already, and all these unnecessary rules to help them cope with serving food goes to show how incompetent they are at running a pub. Such a shame, it is a beautiful location - a pub that I fondly remember from my childhood. We won't be returning.

Name: Cardanom Bay
Title: Disappointed
Review:
Have been using the restaurant for quite a few years. Went out with parents and they had warned us about additional service charge the restaurant has been recently adding. We get to the end of meal and request the bill, we find 10% is added. My parents are in the trade and point out this is a optional charge and there is no obligation to pay it! However on previous occasions they went to the cardamom bay and again this time, the higher amount including the 10% is entered by the restaurant into the chip and pin machine. I ask for the machine so I can put the correct amount in (without the 10%) One staff member became rather rude and others started pointing out to my parents that they had been charging this extra amount for a long time and what was the problem? Well the problem is you don’t levy stealth charges! Yes times are hard and we’re all trying to earn a shilling, but you don’t rip people off.......be open and honest and politely ask customers if they would like to leave a tip!!
So in summary food good, customer service needs improvement, bill/ payment methods need looking into....

Name: The Diner
Title: Meal Friday & Saturday 15th/16th
Review:
We arrived on the Friday and went to the diner. We have a great service and this was all down to KENNY. We enjoyed the service that much we went back the next night.

Well what a change that was!!!!!
Drinks had to be chased up 3 times, no drawing for the children and when I asked where it was the manager told me he had given it to another table. We didn’t get any of the starters that went with the kids deals! And then the children’s pasta came out cold. They were to busy they couldn’t cope.

If you do go ask to be served by KENNY

Name: Candle Villa
Title: An excellent stay!
Review:
Thank you Jill and Peter for a very happy stay at your home.
Room comfy, bathroom luxurious, breakfast crummy and the area charming.
We would have loved to have enjoyed your beautiful garden but the rain stopped us.

Name: Best Western Bognor
Title: A RELAXING VISIT
Review:
My wife booked this hotel as the base for a college reunion. Nine of stayed with others visiting during the day.
The staff could not have been more helpful. They ensured we could always eat together, even at breakfast. They made a point to know who was in our group and passed messages on for us.
The room was clean and well appointed with all we needed for our stay.
The hotel is beautifully situated making walks along the seafront easy.
The food is excellent. The meals are freshly cooked, enabling the chef to tailor his dishes to your personal likes and dislikes, yet the service is prompt and friendly.
We made great use of the outdoor seating area which was very pleasant.
This place is well worth a visit!
Read less

Name: George & Dragon
Title: Lunch
Review: A couple of times recently we have called in for lunch to receive a warm welcome and excellent meals. The food was well prepared, ample portions and relatively quick. Attentive staff without being intrusive. Highly recommended.

Name: Church Farm
Title: Caravan disgusting
Review:
Just home from 7 day break caravan was disgusting spills down cupboards dog biscuits in cupboards and dog hair everywhere from previous guest yes we took our dog but previous dog had urinated in cupboard leaving a disgusting smell confronted reception they sent a cleaner they just wiped dog biscuits out of cupboard took 2 days til urine from previous dog was cleaned, cleaned rest of caravan myself was promised a small refund but been home a week and still waiting. The clubhouse is far too small for the amount of guests on camp and entertainment was very poor,arcades are full of ticket machines and prizes for tickets were rubbish, glad to get home have used haven for the last 10 years and never had à problem will never use them again now
Read less

Name: The George, Burpham
Title: A Lovely Lunch
Review:
What a beautiful location & postcard pretty restaurant and bar.

On arrival we were warmly welcomed by friendly faces.
The food, service and staff were first class, all made for a superb lunch in a relaxed environment.
I must mention Harriett and say thank you to her, she made our lunch enjoyable with her attentiveness & lovely personality.

Many thanks to all, especially those whom aren’t seen, what a fabulous team you all are.

Name: Greggs
Title: Never have pain au chocolate available in the morinings
Review: Gregs never have Pan au chocolate available in mornings and when their is croissants they look burned

Name: Hotham Park
Title: Afternoon out
Review:
Gotham park is beautiful for children and adults alike there is a park, wildlife area, a train which goes round the park cafe or picnic with family dogs love it too.
Read less

Name: East Beach Café
Title: Good food and great staff
Review:
Once again confused by some recent reviews. We rang to book and make a specific request. Couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. Whilst there all the staff were friendly and helpful. Yes there were forty tables when we arrived but all were reserved and filled up whilst we were there.
Food was good and they are happy to mix and match items on the menu, even offering helpful suggestions. Whilst the basic vegetarian offer is limited it was easy to create a lovely meal.
Would definitely consider visiting again if down that way.
Kiosk coffee was good too!

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Sunday lunch 19th May 2019
Review:
Horrendous, I ordered the chicken roast. Arrived with no gravy upon I waited for 15 more minutes for it to arrive after my dinner was served. The roast potatoes and Yorkshire puddings were burnt. I reported it to the waitress ( Lucy) who said she would let the chefs know.( the chefs couldn’t of missed !)
I emailed after and only a received an apology.
I won’t be going back there

Name: Butlins
Title: Just for Tots Break third Visit
Review:
I visited just for Tots break this year for the third year running. My daughter always loves these breaks and being four years old this break should of been perfect for her. But here is a lost of how things have changed this year:

* Hardly anything open and what is open they are shutting before they are supposed to

* Advertised fair ground but they have removed a few rides for Toddlers height so were two rides she could actually go on

* Dont go midweek you wont get to book breakfast with the characters or any extras because people who go there at the beginning of the week have booked it all up and they dont save any spaces for mid week guests

* stayed in shoreline hotel, breakfast was cold evry morning

* New pool is great when you get to go in it, they shut it earlier than advertised and completely closed on one of the days of our stay.

* They now repeat the same shows throughout the week rather than performing different ones so if you stay for a full week be prepared to no each of the few shows available word for word

I spoke to Lyn Barlett from Butlins customer service and her response word for word was the following:

Whilst we endeavour to have all available and open as advertised, Butlins do reserve the right to make changes without prior notice across the resort.
Turning to your comments regarding the bookable activities. Unfortunately, booking these online isn't currently an available option. I appreciate that guests booking these on the day of arrival may have put you at a disadvantage.

Even after my feedback Butlins has determined that I am not entitled to any of my £250.00 back for a two night stay with breakfast. Even though we could not do the activities we wanted, the breakfast was cold and most things were shut or shut early.

My advice would be to stay away and that's coming from a loyal customer who has previously enjoyed their stay. They do not offer the same standard of service of activities anymore.
Read less

Name: Premier Inn Arundel
Title: Very average
Review:
Small family room, expensive for what it was. Dinner in the beefeater was good but the breakfast in the morning was appalling. Cooked breakfast slow and missing items. Continental consisted of one toaster for the entire restaurant and a few straight out of the packet cold pastries.
Read less

Name: World's End
Title: Well run and NOT pricey
Review:
Fairly big Hall & Woodhouse establishment, pubby part and a restaurant area, all nicely refurbished with lots of rural artefacts and prints. We were allocated a pleasant table but constantly in my sightline were two ladders on the wall behind my dining companion so all the rungs were strangely affecting my eyesight as I chatted...I don't think it was the wine so I will avoid that particular table in future. The radiators were throwing out a good amount of heat on a cold January evening and the restaurant was reasonably busy so good ambiance. We were in the restaurant part where all orders are taken at the table so no longer do you have to go to the counter to place orders for drinks and food with your table number so a big improvement to previous.

Extensive menu with a number of more exciting dishes in addition to pub classics, good portions, and some interesting "healthy" vegetables on several main dishes, not just chips and peas. Reasonable choice of wines by the glass and other drinks, teas and coffees to finish. Good range of both Salcombe dairy ice creams and a choice also of non dairy ices which you don't see so often.

Good service from very well trained young staff, competent and proficient although slightly mechanical. There was a delay in our second round of coffees appearing and this was picked up on by the serving staff who apologised for the wait. Most efficient.

Overall very good value, would not consider it at all pricey in comparison with other establishments in rural West Sussex.

I am somewhat biased in favour of "individual" pubs but the Worlds End is workmanlike, pleasant and professional so will return. Easy parking with both a front and rear car park.

My tip: Avoid the table opposite the wall mounted ladders!

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Poor Quality Food
Review:
We visited this Beefeater today at lunchtime. It started well, order taken, drinks given, then it went downhill. Lovely fish and chips , the picture looked wonderful, what could be better for lunch ?
The meals arrived, a tiny curled up piece of heavily battered fish, more batter than fish, a grey chewy substance inside, some peas, and lukewarm chips thrown on the plate. We should have complained, a nearby table did, it took ages for their replacement, we were short of time. The server did not come back to check on the meal and did not ask if we had enjoyed it, but very quickly brought the bill while we were still drinking and had declined pudding. I should have read the reviews, wouldn't have gone and will not return.

Name: Vardar Restaurant
Title: Won a free two course lunch
Review: Very disappointed with the way we were treated we thought winning the meal would be nice. We were told we had to have a starter and a main, the voucher stated we could have a two course meal to me that meant we could have a main and a starter or main and a sweet. We were the only two in the restaurant very cold atmosphere. Used to be a very nice place to eat but I’m afraid it has gone right down and we shall not be going there again. I got my meal for 12.50. The rest we paid for which was 27.50 that did include 2drinks which was 6.80

Name: Swanbourne Lodge
Title: Highly recommended!
Review: My Mum & I visited Swanbourne Lodge Cafe today, along with my dog. Naomi (the manager) & Julie were very welcoming & friendly. They have a varied & extensive menu, but today, my Mum & I both chose a sandwich. It was a meal in itself! Lovely fresh bread, generous fillings, served with crisps & a salad garnish. The place was clean & tidy inside. Dogs are welcome inside, so that's great if it's a rainy day. All in all, a nice surprise to find somewhere with good food, very pleasant staff and where dogs are allowed. Highly recommended!

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Disappointing experience
Review: Disappointed with the service. I have been here several times for family gatherings, but this time my family gathering was ruined by staff being rude after informing them of problems with the food.

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Excellent Service
Review: Me and my partner came for a date night - great atmosphere, excellent cocktails and great service friendly and welcoming! Have already told all of my friends. Can’t wait to come for food later this month.

Name: Café Oasis
Title: My favourite ever sandwich!!!
Review:
Bestest ever Bacon Brie and Cranberry on granary in this little "Oasis" of a café hidden away from the main street but well worth a visit .I liked it so much .....I ordered another!!Its so good that these "Non Brand Café shops exist You don't get table service in the multinational and the food is definitely cheaper and not mass produced in some industrial estate up north
Good on you Oasis I shall return

Name: Ocean Hotel & Spa
Title: Ocean Spa avoid avoid avoid
Review: As a group of friends we visit Butlins Bognor Regis every year and this year added the ‘Spa Experience’. Well it was definitely that just a shame it was a bad one. This is obviously being over sold. The changing rooms are too small and dirty. They failed to supply us with robes saying they had run out. Staff were too busy chatting on reception to deal with our complaint. Three jets in the pool weren’t working and the outside jacuzzi has hardly any pressure and breaking wind would generate more bubbles. This is the only spa facility for the whole resort. We have been told by the manager that as we went during an adult weekend they could not provide the advertised experience. Don’t waste your money don’t go !!

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Just back from Florida. Feeling
Review:
Just back from Florida. Feeling cold needed a warm up. So went to Establo. We were met by Callum. Made us feel so welcomed.

Thus us such a perfect place to visit when you want a lift

The new beer and wine was perfect

Good so lovely

Happy now.

Name: Ristorante Al Mare
Title: Seafood Lover
Review:
Delighted to find a good choice of seafood on the menu, we chose the clams and were not disappointed. They had been sourced locally and we could taste the sea. We hadn't tried fregola before but found it ideal for absorbing the sauce. Would definitely order again.

Service was great - attentive, friendly but not obtrusive.

Name: Butlins
Title: Mrs
Review:
Didn’t enjoy our holiday. Staff in the Centre stage were very rude and told me off and my family off for trying to find somewhere to see the show. We had to stand at the back where you can barely see what’s going on. Tried to complain but the response has been very unhelpful and they did not wish to investigate the matter for me even though I complained twice they replied and said that if I was unsatisfied with their non response to my complaint I had 28 days. I advised them that 3 emails of complaint should really suffice but if you are not making a booking or exchanging money they are disinterested. We were so appalled by our holiday, we left. Will only visit on a day trip pass as the entertainment is not worth going to as you can’t sit or stand in a reasonable place to see it.
Read less

Name: Navigator
Title: Great but inexpensive bolt hole!
Review: We stayed here while house hunting on the south coast. We had 2 nights in a basic but lovely and clean room with a fantastic sea view. We ate in the bar and had tasty breakfasts and evening meals. The evening meals were fairly typical pub grub but beautifully cooked and thoroughly enjoyable. If you fancy a seaside break you could pick a more lively town but you couldn't pick better budget seaside accommodation!

Name: Friary Arms
Title: Best Sunday meal
Review: I live near to friary arms even if I didn’t I would travel to have a meal here my partner and I never go anywhere else we are pensioners and not only are the meals wonderful the prices are great too even if we don’t visit for a while they always seem to remember us they are so friendly and they really care that everything is ok I can’t praise them enough

Name: Arundel Cathedral
Title: Jousting event held annually is amazing
Review:
The castle and grounds are a delight to visit but go during the medieval joust and the grounds come alive with birds of prey, have a go archery and crossbows, medieval crafts and the most amazing jousting displays.
Great for families - there is enought to keep children interested and engaged for many hours.
Read less

Name: Thai Kitchen
Title: Great food, BUT
Review: Sorry guys, I Love this place, either as takeaway or restaurant, but for the second time in a row this place has proven to be poorly managed. 45 min between the starters and the mains.... and when asked, the manager tried to tell me I am wrong.... that it is normal when it is fresh food to wait 45 min between dishes... I am sorry but I regularly sequence star Michelin tables and this never happened to me before. Just apologise do not try to argue. And the table next to us did not receive exactly what they ordered (shortage of shrimps), without telling them when served. Exactly what happened too us last time we went to this place. It is so much a shame as the cook is so great. I hope the lack if proper management will not kill this restaurant. Sorry to be rude, but I had to tell it.

Name: Butlins
Title: 3D animal Adventure
Review:
The ages rating for this show is displayed as 5+ with underwater creatures such as clown fish and seahorses. Once in the show however you are shown a series of deadly creatures which jump out of the screen with the 3D visual effect. To top it off the loud sirens and fake glowing jellyfish being lowered from above left not only my own but other children in tears and highly distressed. A nice early morning treat put a damper on the remainder of the day and although the staff were very apologetic there was a further reiteration that this is suitable for ages 5+. Any further reassurance that the other activities were unlike the 3D adventure it became very difficult to find something for our 7+ to enjoy without a level of anxiety that subsequently ruined the excitement for her. I would place this attraction at 10+ as the images shown may not be suitable for children under that age.
Read less

Name: Belinda's Tearooms
Title: Charming Olde World tea room
Review: Characterful tea rooms, lovely surroundings, great Fruit & Cheese scones , warmed through , big knob of butter , generous pot of tea for two with plenty of additional hot water , a very pleasant mid morning snack, Good value under £10 for the two of us. Will visit again when next in Arundel.

Name: Tudor Tavern
Title: New Life in The Tudor Tavern
Review: New owner has invested a lot of time, effort and money in making The Tudor Tavern a great place to drink and eat. Good food, good value for money and great service. Genuinely dog friendly

Name: Butlins
Title: Disgusting apartments!!
Review:
We stayed here for the weekend recently and not only am I disgusted in the room but the customer service to.

We complained about our room and customer service said they would get a cleaner to re clean the room however they only “cleaned” the bits we had shown pictures of and I use the term cleaned loosely because it was still disgusting! I sent an email when we got home (which was earlier than planned because we didn’t stay the full time) I received a follow up phone call in which they basically told me I should have complained again on site and that there is nothing they can do - very bad customer service.

Would definitely recommend staying in one of the hotels if you go!
Read less

Name: Cardanom Bay
Title: Tasteless.
Review: Kids wandering around restaurant unsupervised. Food was a massive disappoint, popadums had a strange fishy taste to them, accompanying sauces very watery, Pilau rice tasted just like plain boiled rice, naan bread had an oil slick in the middle and didn't appear to have been cooked in a tandor far to circular, my curry was lacking spice and chilli heat and the prawns were overcooked seemed to be all joined together and were like rubber bullets!

Name: Six Bells
Title: Great meal
Review: Went last night for a family meal for my son's birthday. We were all impressed with our meals, they were delicious (the sticky toffee pudding was awesome!) Very friendly waitress too.

Name: The Holly Tree
Title: Family birthday dinner
Review:
After the disappointment of our favourite restaurant being closed on mondays we googled pubs in the area local to where we were staying (at the hilton), and came up with this... and we were glad we did.

The outlook from the pub terrace is onto the road, but it is sstill quiet and surrounded by lovely buildings. Coupled with this the publicans have done a great job with flowers, so it still had a great feel.

The sun finally disappeared behind a tree at 8pm, and we went inside. And again we greated to a surprising interior. Far more modern than I was expecting, but still felt inviting.

The food was great, but beware... prices are relatively high, but as long as you know this beforehand you will not be shocked at the bill (I have included the current menu within pictures to give you a flavour of what is on offer and the cost).

We had a sharing fish platter to start, followed by steak, and both were a treat.

The seafood platter (£19) would have been quite enough for my husband, myself and my daughter if we had ordered a couple of portions of chips though!

Overall a wonderful evening, which could only have been topped off with slightly more attentive hosting.

Thank you for our evening meal, we thoroughly enjoyed it.

Name: The Mezze
Title: DELICIOUS FOOD AND GREAT ATHMOSPHERE
Review: We went there to celebrate my birthday. It was weekday so not very busy. Food was absolutely delicious - lamb shish is my favourite one. Not the cheapest but worth every penny. Service was not perfect though. The waiter mixed up drinks and there was a string of failures with my friend's gluten-free meal. Need to mention the chef who was sorting out waiter's mistakes perfectly and served us in person at our table. In the end it was a lovely evening and left nice overall impression however staff need training.

Name: Parsons Table
Title: Quick lunch
Review: We were visiting Arundel and this restaurants menu caught my eye. It appears to quite often change depending on the seasonal availability which is good. It also had a well considered vegetarian option which is always a winner! I enjoyed the pork belly and then catch of the day and my wife really rated the veggie options. The fixed price menu is in my opinion excellent value for money. The chef is top notch and the ambiance is second to none. I will definitely be eating here again.

Name: Avisford
Title: Best 31st Wedding Anniversary We’ve Ever Had
Review:
Booking - a doddle! App - ditto. Getting our Hilton Honors ref added to our stay - no probs. Checking in and choosing room the night before - inspired choice by me. Surroundings in and out on arrival - lovely. BBQ instead of 3 course lunch that was booked - best leave that unsaid!! Reception staff - super accommodating. Room - outstanding, previous reviews talk of tiny, paper thin walls and noise outside, “should have done your homework” - ours was spacious, airy and the only noise was the trees and wildlife. Personal touches from Richard Hopton and his team - chocolates, truffles and complimentary drinks, thank you sooo much. ‘Welcome’ system on the tv - very good, clear options and lots of info. Golf course - stunning! Decided on room service and huge tv instead of restaurant - slight issue, ordered from menu on tv only to be informed that that was wrong and paper based one in room should be used. No drop in choice though and quality was excellent. Bed and bedding - sumptuous, bed was so big, hardly saw the wife all night. In the morning - woke up to that bloody noisy nature again. Breakfast - huge choices, everybody well catered for (even the bloke next to us who put salt on his melon?). Overall a very very pleasant stay, we won’t be waiting another 31 years before we come again - thank you all very much.
Read less

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Fascinatiing
Review:
You can but different level tickets. Gold plus(9access everywhere) worth the cost. Informative room guides throughout the castle. Gardens are superb . The chapel is extraordinary. Don’t expect to find Larkin’s Arundel Tomb here though. It is in Chichester!
Read less

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Just a beer
Review:
Popped in for a beer to the bar, had a great chat with George who was really friendly and helpful and an awesome choice of music
Not a very busy night but well worth popping in for a beer if in town. Has a hotel too, apparently!
Read less

Name: Pub & Kitchen
Title: Stick to what you know
Review: So my family and I went here to have a change from the other places we've been. Not only was we rushed into our seats, but the food was that bad my wife sent her food back and refused to get anything else, my son's carrots we seriously undercooked that it was like they've jus pulled out of a vegetable patch that we second. Then to top it off, they tried charging us for items that was included in the kids menu! Seriously?! I am definitely skipping this place again. Avoid at all costs.

Name: Fino
Title: Excellent service, attentive waitress
Review:
I visited here yesterday with my Nan & Mother who live in Bognor.
The waitress who served us was very helpful & pleasant.
I had the sea bass which came with a sauce, with 2 crab arancini balls.
The sea bass was over cooked , not very tasty, the Arancini was cold , there was no evidence of any crab & the sauce had a layer (film) on the top like it had been sitting for a long time under a hot plate. I should have sent it back especially as it was £17.
My Nan had the crab risotto which did not have hardly any crab in it, was spinkled on the top.
The timing was out as 3 of our meals came out together & the vegetarian came out 4-5 mins later.
There were only 2 other tables occupied when we were served lunch, so no excuse for food taking a long time & not being served together.
The kitchen door was open & kept banging which was distracting & off putting.
There was a cold breeze, which when we went to the toilets realised it was coming from there as it was freezing in the ladies. My Son said it was freezing in the gents as well ( my son doesn’t really feel the cold) when I touched the radiator’s none of them were on.
The decor was great , very comfortable seats, it is a good location with plenty of parking, it would be nice to have proper napkins as paper ones are not as nice.
Overall a nice restaurant, food is not as good as it should be when paying between £13-£17 for a main course.

Name: Domino's Pizza
Title: Poor service
Review:
We haven’t order pizza from here in a long time and really fancied one. It arrived in roughly good time and the driver was pleasant. But one of our pizzas was Luke warm to cold.
The garlic bread and chicken was lovely.
I called the store and explained that one of the pizza was cold, only to be rudely told that the woman didn’t know how this was possible since it had been under a heat lamp for 10 minutes and been in a delivery bag. Then to tell me there was nothing they could offer for next time or even a sorry. Plus we had to reheat our potato wedges as they were still undercooked! Terrible service, need better training. I r worked in retail and I would never speak to someone like that. Utter disgusting

Name: The Deck
Title: Just ok, not great value for money
Review: Just ok, not great value for money. Food was predicatable and really expensive for what it was. Service was decent but the resort was quiet.

Name: China Royal
Title: Broken China
Review:
China Royal, what has happened to you? We are used to a friendly reception and smiling staff, but that is not the case anymore and the male waiter should note fewer muscles are needed to smile than to frown.

The food was very good as it always has been with the exception of the chicken balls that were over cooked and appeared to have been re-fried.

A very disappointing experience, we are unlikely to return for some time having been a regular for ten years.

Management, please sort this out.

Name: World's End
Title: Just popped in
Review:
We popped in on the off chance.

We were seated in the restaurant.

The food was fantastic, nicely presented and cooked to perfection.

One of the waiting staff called Lucy, was amazing she couldn’t do enough for us.

Name: Waterside Café
Title: Nice location shame about the coffee
Review: We popped in there on the way back to the car, the setting is lovely but the coffee was terrible because it hardly had any milk in it and was very tasteless. No sweetener and you can't even pay by card there. My biggest gripe though is that you can't vape there which is wrong because this is not the same as smoking and why should you tell me what to do in the open air. Why should I also have to put up with aload of stinky dogs running around, its a food restaurant for gods sake.

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: Love it here
Review:
Been many times with friends, wife and family.
Great burgers and fries, well everything really.
Would and have recommended many times.
Beautiful work guys

Name: So India, Felpham
Title: tasteless
Review: 6 of us had a meal the service was terrible the food was just tasteless sloppy and nothing like proper indian cuisine the bombay potatoes were just boiled with a dash of tomatoe on them the sharing platter well was laughable at the cost of 9 pounds we will not be returning !!!!!!!!!!

Name: The Spur
Title: Evening Meal
Review:
Having been ill with the bug we decided to go out and went to the spur,
They were busy but found a table and when some one left offered a better place,
The food was excellent,the mussels were sumptious .Very friendly staff and good value.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Don’t waste your money!
Review: This was quite possibly our worse dining experience ever! Did not want to cause a scene as it was an 18th birthday family party. However.... had it not been we would have walked! Filthy chairs, long wait for menus, even longer for food which when it arrived was utterly awful presentation, cremated, dreadful. Deserts had no brownie! Just sauce and ice cream. Felt sorry for very young waiting staff who clearly have no idea what they are doing. Dreadful night. Don’t waste your time or money! Evening ruined.

Name: The Beresford
Title: Evening meal
Review: Popped in for evening meal , Han egg and chips , was very disappointed ham was more fat than meat chips were cremated and been reheated many times , when complained staff member said well next time I hope it will be better I said under my breath ther will not be a next time , how hard it is to cook a simply dish , hence to say I will not be going back any time soon !

Name: Sen
Title: Excellent meal
Review: Had a table of 6 including 2 kids had a fantastic set tapas menu service was excellent and the owner could not do enough for us! Patricia is a legend and will definitely return soon!

Name: Victoria Fish & Chips
Title: Very nice fish&chips
Review:
Went here after recommendations on tripadvisor. Very nice food.
 Shame toilet was out of service.
 Ate in. Got served our food in take away containers. Would have given 5 stars had we had proper plates and glasses for our drinks.
But the food was very nice. Would highly recommend.

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Lovely pub restaurant
Review: Had a lovely meal with my wife, service was very good. Food was well cooked and delicious.A lovely unhurried evening meal..I would recommend dining at this lovely pub restaurant.Very good value for money.

Name: Papa Johns, Butlins
Title: Horrible service
Review:
This is 0 star restaurant the staff is extremely rude and everything that has been asked for takes over 20 minutes.I asked for a coke refill and it took 20 minutes I finished eating and that’s when the drink came.Staff are unhelpful and very rude

DO NOT CONE HERE HORRIBLE

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Overpriced and awful
Review: We sat in. Cost over £20 for one small (they described it as medium) fish and chips, one portion of awful chips, two portions of watery mushy peas and two cans of pop all served up by a surly waitress with huge eyebrows. Apparently the card machine wasn’t working (he gestured towards a calculator!!!). Wasn’t clean. Chips were poor to say the least. Don’t wast your money.

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Close it down now!
Review:
How does this place even exist. Why have the council not closed it down. We paid £17.40 for fish and chips here today. Took it across the road and fed it to the seagulls.
This isn’t food. Run a mile. Run. Keep on running.

Name: India Gate
Title: Very Dissapointing!
Review: I did not read all the reviews, wish I had. A very dissapointing meal. My Lamb Samosas were small and tasteless, as was my husbands onion Baghi. His Tandori mixed grill looked a mess and poor quality meats- my Madras did not arrive and I was told I had not ordered it-it did arrive and I wondered if it was Mircowaved , the rice portion was small portion. I have been a restaurteur/chef and I took pride in the meals I served. The staff appeared to not want your patronage, with no smiles or asking if your dinner was ok. The food is overpriced, I will not be going back.

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Very lovely.
Review:
After a delightful and brilliant lunch with friends from Beauvoorde in Belgium, I had to stop off for a quick Guinness in this beautiful thatched roof pub, on the way back to Surrey.

Excellent seating areas outside; large car park, and very relaxing atmosphere.

Name: Picturedrome
Title: Always come here
Review:
Old school theatre style cinema, it really feels like you’ve gone back in time!

Super cheap too, £4.50 on a weekend and £3.50 a weekday, snacks and drinks are fairly cheap too, much cheaper than the likes of Odeon, Cineworld, Vue etc
Read less

Name: Mustards
Title: Good value
Review: Wow - £2.40 for a good cup of coffee which came with two DIVINE complimentary sweet treats. (The last time I paid for a Costa coffee from a machine in an eatery in Bognor it was £2.69 and the machine broke down before I could even get a refill) The service was friendly AND there were real individual use cloth hand towels in the ladies loo. Things are looking up for Bognor Regis!

Name: Avisford
Title: Completely unacceptable standard of room
Review:
We visited the Hilton this week and had booked a suite at a cost of £200.

On arrival the outside looks run down but we’re open minded as to the interior. Staff on arrival were friendly and check in process was smooth and quick.

However on arriving at our room all of this went quickly downhill! I cannot even express our disgust at the standard of the room at a Hilton property. Scuffed and peeling wallpaper and skirting boards, broken tiles in the bathroom, windows that were black in the wood. But worst of all of this was the huge patches of damp and water that was coming through the walls. My child suffers from asthma and there was no way we were staying in that room - it was a health hazard and completely unacceptable for any standards let alone a Hilton suite!

On returning to reception the staff were very good and moved us into another room which was of a better standard. However can’t help wondering why we weren’t put into this room in the beginning rather than the disgusting original room as it was empty?!

Just to note the new room wasn’t perfect either and was lacking a chain that actually flushed in the toilet with ease (you had to push the button with two hands and a lot of strength to get it to work!) but was better.

Cannot comment on other facilities as chose to eat out and spend the least amount of time possible at this place, but I can say the original room we were put in was a total rip off and wouldn’t have stayed there at £50 let alone £200! Again reiterate staff were helpful.

Photos speak for themselves of the room! Not impressed!
Read less

Name: Hotham Park
Title: Amazing park!
Review:
Beautifully kept park and great facilities. Park was massive and wildlife adventure golf was good value and lots of fun
Read less

Name: Black Horse
Title: Smashing meal
Review: A group of 7 a few saturday nights ago had a most beautiful meal. Well cooked, flavoursome and very friendly service......

Name: Inglenook
Title: The Best Pub Restaurant
Review:
My Father has lived in this area for over twenty years and we always try to visit this restaurant bar for a few drinks when possible. I live in London so this is a real treat for me.
Great Traditional old pub, restaurant, hotel,
Amazing food, great chef, great staff, reasonable prices easy parking,
Very cosy with amazing fire in winter.
And don’t forget to say Hello to the Parrot.
And Tony if he is not in the Kitchen.

Highly recommended.
Steve, Julie, Theo.

Name: YHA
Title: Small hostel in good location with excellent public transport links.
Review: Friendly well run hostel by the Arun estuary. Good en-suite and self catering facilities. Close rail/bus and shops make it very convenient. Beach location and countryside visits possible by good local bus services.

Name: Butlins
