Title: Butlins got the New Pool Wrong!!!
Review:
Been coming to Butlins for 6years with a group of friends and their families. Every year sometimes 2x a year. I have a 12 and 10yo. The main attraction has always been the pool. They always spend 3hrs min in the pool. This weekend in the New Pool... we looked around and kids were so unimpressed they wanted to leave after 30mins!!!. The next day my oldest didnt bother. Stayed indoors! To think it was the one thing they were looking forward to!!! Butlins.. this pool is for 8yo and below. Nothing for older kids or adults. We loved the OLD POOL with the Big green slide that swooshed you into a deeper pool. The whirling pool with the sit and ride inflatables was awesome in the OLD POOL. In the New Pool we had to queue for 30 mins for a 10sec slide!!! And everywhere you go were toddlers!!!!! Such a shame. For the first time ever our large party is considering an alternative annual Staycation. Haven maybe... or Centre Parcs.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Great british holiday for families with children.
Review:
I came to Butlin’s Bognor for 4 nights . 4 nights was definitely enough . However it was an amazing little holiday . I have a 5 month year old and a 4 year old . So much to do for children ,my 4 year old loved every minute of it. The staff are so lovely to the children . I wouldn’t come here if I didn’t have any children as this holiday is designed for children .we stayed in a gold apartment was nice but next time we want to stay in the hotel . Fish and chip shop I recommend,papa johns very nice too .the pubs was nice , posh and clean . i don’t understand why some reviews are saying there was no entertainment when there was entertainment everywhere everyday .’At the end of the day you get what you pay for. We had a lovely little break with our children and want to come back next year so our children can have a good holiday again .
Read less

Name: Wave Hotel
Title: Easter break
Review:
Stayed here Monday - Friday
Stuff are friendly and always helpful
Stayed on the 2nd floor disappointed we didn’t get a room with balcony
Hotel was lovely and clean house keeping always tidied our room and made animals out of towels are little girl love seeing this on return to our room
We had dinning plan half board which we and a little walk too
Food was ok not the best
Enjoyed are stayed lots to do for kids it’s a shame entertainment finishes early as on holiday you don’t want to be in bed too early
Pool was lovely water was cold

Name: Fino
Title: Fantastic Lunch
Review: My Mum and I came here for lunch and it was amazing and one of the best meals I have had in a long time. The polenta crumbed poached egg starter and panna cotta dessert were delicious. Our Waitress was lovely taking the time to chat to us and was very knowledgeable about the menu and helped us with our choices. Unfortunately my Mum fell on leaving the restaurant (her own fault) and the staff were brilliant. The Waiter and Waitress were outside within seconds and helped her up, got her a chair, water and ice, they could not have done more and I was very grateful. I will definitely be going back soon.

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: Awful Bed expensive wifi
Review: Worst bed ever slept in, expensive wifi, awful toilet paper, only 4 channels on tv. Location noisy. I have to use 200 characters or this review doesn't get posted so here go's.Worst bed ever slept in, expensive wifi, awful toilet paper, only 4 channels on tv. Location noisy. I have to use 200 characters or this review doesn't get posted so here go's.What more can I say

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Such a disappointment
Review:
As our local harvester has shut down I was looking forward to dinner there. On entering staff were very friendly. Shown to table and placed our order. No mention of the stuff they didn’t have. Salad bar only had peppers, onions, carrots, sweet corn, olives and coleslaw. There was a note by the salad bar to say they had delivery problems but would have been nice to know before ordering them the unlimited drinks only had diet drinks or rwhites lemonade. None that I drink and again not mentioned only a note above the say only those were available.
The food we did order was lovely but the experience wasn’t the best.

Name: Arun View
Title: Very disappointed
Review:
A clean and modern room with ensuite, but having to access room either by going behind the bar and past staff to access the internal staircase to the first floor or alternatively via the car park and up external steep concrete steps to cross over the flat roof of the dining room then through an external door to the first floor landing.
This is little more than a pub b&b certainly could not be described as a hotel.
I had to wait a while for kitchen staff to appear to start cooking breakfast.
Then upon returning home to find that the £65.00 for the room did not include an additional charge of £7.50 for breakfast which has since been taken.

Name: Pagham Beach Café
Title: Not great
Review: Really disappointing to visit and hear the owner speaking to staff in a way I wouldn’t speak to an enemy. There are nicer ways to explain that things aren’t up to her standard. Ordered our food from the takeaway. Got home ready to eat to find such small portions. Sat to eat and the chips were the worst we have tasted. Frozen chips done in a fryer. Hard, Luke warm and like rubber. Completely inedible. The scampi was ok but £5.50 for 8 small pieces was a real shame.

Name: KFC Bognor
Title: try to avoid
Review: We love KFC this has to be the worst one we have visited, food cold had to take back, then when next lot came it was luke warm, if you want a good KFC go to Fontwell Lovely Jubbly

Name: Butlins
Title: Just for Tots visit - and first time at Butlin’s!
Review:
Just returned from 4 nights ah the Just FOR Tots featuring a Justin Fletcher with our toddler. And I have to say I was so impressed.

Neither of us have ever visited butlins before, but thought we’d take our son for a little get away after a busy few months with work and we weren’t disappointed.

Red coats were great, shows amazing, lots to do and the pool was just FANTASTIC! Highly recommend it and already considering returning in 2020!!
Read less

Name: Beachcomber Inn
Title: Birthday breakfast
Review: Lovely setting. A large group of us managed to get an area set aside for one of our party's birthday. Nice and clean with relaxed feel.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Breakfast
Review:
After visiting here on Saturday 9th August. We go regularly for breakfast at this premises, but in the last few months it has gone downhill drastically.
No plates for toast, no preserves, no muffins, crumpets and just the crusts
After asking a lovely but rushed of her feet waitress went and looked and came out with a handful of muffins apologising that she could only find these. Coffee was lukewarm.
Long wait for cooked breakfast, fried eggs were congealed where they were left on hot plate. Sausages were so burnt they looked like they were charcoal. If you want a decent cooked breakfast and good value for money may I suggest Morrisons Littlehampton or Mac Donald's.

Name: Sen
Title: Not as advertised on website
Review:
First time here for 3 or 4 yrs. We were disappointed then and disappointed this time. Overpriced and small portions. Not sure why they are getting fab reviews from posters with few posts.
Wouldn't recommend.

Name: Hotham Park
Title: Crazy Golf
Review:
Crazy Gold in Hotham Park was really fun and such a good place to take children. You pay a one off price and can play as many holes as you want to. What a fun day . Toilets abs refreshments are close by.
Read less

Name: Denmans Gardens
Title: Disappointing
Review: Sad to see that it has lost the character and magic experienced under the management of the previous owners. Particularly disappointed with the lack of plants for sale - previously there was a huge choice of unusual plants, etc. - and the cafe which used to have a superb menu and food. Now very lackluster and totally without character. Service was poor too. Won't be visiting Denmans again.

Name: Premier Inn Littlehampton
Title: Great
Review:
Perfect location for us. Lovely room, everything you could want. The only problem, as always when on the ground floor - the people upstairs are not considerate at all. It sounded like they were using the room as a gym early evening and were up and about a 6am the next day. Also, the water isn't good so spoils the taste of tea and coffee. There was also a smell from the bathroom drains, which was easily sorted by some disinfectant I just happened to have in the car. All small points and not worth mentioning for a one night stay. The staff couldn't have been nicer either. So friendly.
Read less

Name: Waterside Café
Title: Rude and unfriendly staff
Review: After a visit to Arundel Castle, we called by at this cafe to check it out only to be pounced on by a rude and aggressive member of staff who insisted we sit down immediately or leave, and then went on to conjecture that we had already eaten in town, which was not true. It was all very odd and we certainly didn't feel tempted to stay.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Harvester
Review: Stopped in for breakfast with my wife and to young sons, before a walk on the beech, my wife had the classic and I went for the unlimited option..... the eggs were rock hard the sausages were burnt the mushrooms were limp the bacon was disgusting....all in all worst breakfast ever....4 people complained whilst I was paying the bill won’t be going again

Name: Cabin
Title: The Cabin Is Back
Review:
FInally we have a landlord and landlady that are polite and are working hard to rebuild the cabin back up after the previous managers destroyed it.

The beer is now drinkable and the glasses are clean. The atmosphere is perfect and the cabin is a lot cleaner than it has ever been before.

Glad to see it on the up!

Name: Butlins
Title: Disappointing second visit
Review:
As detailed above this was our second five day break at Butlins Bognor Regis and we probably won't return for a third.

We opted for food court dining and the highchairs were so dirty that we couldn't strap our baby in as he mouths everything and the straps were crusted with old food. The food was also very disappointing , not the standard we had previously seen at Bognor at dinner time. It was far too beige and some limp lettuce and tomato with cucumber was pretty much all of the salad that was available. The breakfast was perfectly lovely though.

Also in the food court , we found it to be much , much busier than the previous Easter. There were poor customers queuing for a table with tired children and people hung around our table wait information for us to finish. We went to a paid restaurant on our last night as we were so sick of the dirty , busy food court.

The only good thing about our dining choice was a young staff member named Kieran. He greeted us all with such cheer that every family walked away from him smiling. I hope Butlins are paying him well!

The apartment wasn't cleaned very well , we found a bottle of beard oil , and some sweet wrappers in our bedroom. Also our bedroom door handle was hanging off.

We'll go elsewhere next year I think.
Read less

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Dreadful Christmas Day meal
Review:
Booked back in August for Christmas Day lunch. Visited in November to check where we would be seated as we needed to fit 2 prams next to the table. Was advised it would be a table in the main restaurant area with plenty of space - perfect - or so I thought.

We arrived on Christmas Day and were seated at a table in the conservatory area on the opposite side of the restaurant and it’s as if we were completely forgotten about. No Christmas decorations in this area and absolutely no atmosphere. We waited almost an hour for our starters and then almost another hour for our main courses. The majority of the food was lukewarm at best and when someone on our table asked for mustard, they were told there wasn’t any. The wrong food was also brought out several times. A table next to us were brought out desserts before they’d had their main courses! We also asked for some jugs of water for the table and were told they didn’t have any jugs available.

A very disappointing experience to say the least.

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: Rooms too hot on a summer's day
Review:
Great value, good location, friendly staff but the temperature of the room was too high. Conveniently close to main roads, petrol station small Waitrose and a good pub across the roundabout. I would not stay again in the summer months.
Read less

Name: WWT Wetland
Title: What a beautiful place
Review:
This was a trip we had promised ourselves not quite knowing what to expect. We had no wellies but it didn't matter. We were able to walk on very well maintained paths, while gazing at birds we've never seen before. These included Hawaiian geese, types of Swan and so many more. The real treat and well worth admission price was the boat trip included in the price. A mindful amble through reeds and rushes with a really informative guide. We are just going to have to come back as it was so good. All of us benefitted from the fresh air and calm
Read less

Name: The Lamb, Angmering
Title: A lovely pub restaurant with a very warm welcome!
Review:
We live in Kent and made this visit to The Lamb as part of a family reunion as my Uncle lives in nearby Worthing and recommended that meet here. It was a great choice!

There were 8 of us and we had a lovely table at the back of the restuarant with a big mirrior and very comfortable seating. We were welcomed heartliy by the owner as we went in and the service throughout was very good, attentive without being obstrusive. There is a lovely menu of the day which is excellent value but we all decided to eat off the A La Carte menu which had some great choices. I started with the Goats Cheese Curd and beetroot not knowing what to expect but it was just delicious and my aunt liked it so much she is going to try and make it at home! Then I had the slow cooked shoulder of lamb which was so tender and lovely to eat. We didnt have desserts due to being already quite full with the other 2 courses and our own time contratints.

It was a lovely welcoming place for our family reunioun with great food and service and a very nice setting. I only wish we lived nearer so we could eat here regaularly!

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Drinks with friends
Review: I came in last night with friends we got our drinks separately non of us was asked for ID after our 2nd drink a man who worked there came over and asked to see just TWO of our ids as he was getting worried he asked me and my girl mate did not ask our two boy mates which are the same age as us? I thought this was very rude I work in a pub myself and know you need to ask everyone in the group. Then half an hour later he came over again and said just so you know I need drinks indoors at 10pm it’s a legal law thing or something. He did not go up to any other table and tell anyone else which annoyed me again. We then went in at 10 and there was still people outside drinking at that time too. He was older than the other waiters and waitresses so might have been a supervisor or manager at the place but I must say I come in a lot for food and usually love the place but now he’s just made me feel not welcome and he was completely stereotypical to us

Name: Swan Hotel
Title: Anniversary break
Review:
Gorgeous hotel, friendly helpful staff. Lovely meal last night and a fantastic veggie breakfast just now. Huge bed and a bath to soak in. Relaxing in the lap of luxury. Highly recommended despite awful weather.
Read less

Name: Pizza Express
Title: Possibly the blandest food ever
Review: Not offered the set course menu - found out they had one as we paid the bill - so just as well we used a 25% off food. My pizza was soggy in the middle with a burnt crust. Absolutely zero taste of the rosemary and garlic oil. They also forgot the parsley until reminded. The Manager was obviously having a bad day as his customer service was definitely registering as CBA!

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Absolutely loved it just a shame not national trust or English heritage
Review:
Had a wonderful day well worth spending the extra with gift aid as this got you £4 credit per ticket to use in gift shop or restaurant. Wonderful day out far too much to put here
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: DISGUSTED
Review:
Me and My Husband And 1 year old son booked this break a month in advance . What interested me was teletubbies my son loves them .. we paid 250 pounds for our weekend stay !! 2 weeks before our break BUTLINS send me a letter stating that they have cancelled my holiday and Refunded me my Money ? No Particular Reason at all. I will never ever book with these again it’s reallt upset me and my family I am fuming I spoke to a couple a friends about this they told me the same thing happened to them !!! BE CAREFUL WHEN BOOKING BUTLINS THEY WILL CANCELL AT ANYTIME !!! Absolute Joke !! They probably sold my room for more money that’s why they cancelled I bet !!!
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Angry
Review:
We visited butlins bogner for my daughter's 7th birthday we stayed in the hotel Shoreline
we was eating in the shoreline restaurant
When my daughter was standing waiting to get her food at the help yourself section
when a kitchen staff member came along and slammed a hot plate of food down right near my daughter only for the hot water from the hot plate to splash up on to my daughter and burn her stomach
I have wrote to butlins head office several times about the incident and they have just completely lied about the situation and trying to blame my child when she wasn't at fault at all
 the staff member didnt tell my daughter to move away they just come along and slammed the hot plate down and was obliviousy that they had even burnt my daughter
I never at any point shouted that My daughter got burnt
My daughter wasn't on her own I was there with her the whole time and we was there before the staff member came along that slammed the hot plate down
we had to wait for first aider in restaurant and they told us to take my daughter upstairs for a Luke warm bath which we did
 sounds like they are trying to cover there tracks and put the blame on a small child it's disgusting I'm so angry
I think the replies from a big company like this are disgusting they are supposed to be a child friendly resort and they just don't care they have listened to what the staff have told them and only are believing what they have told them which are all lies
But everything I have told them isn't right too them
This will happen again as they just don't care we came on holiday to make family memorys only for this to happen my daughther didn't deserve this to happen to her so why did it?
How can they say the incident wasn't there fault just by believing the staff's lies
I'm so disgusted and angry
Read less

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Nice pub good food.
Review: Dropped in on the off chance and they were holding a curry night. Very good food great service and value for money. Good sized dining area with comfortable modern tables and chairs. Large Car Park. Good outside seating area. obviously popular with the locals.

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Amazing Castle which dominates the lovely town
Review:
Well worth a visit I suggest you buy the ticket that admits you to everything . The tour round the occupied part of the castle is very interesting . amazing furniture pictures etc and the norman keep is also woth a visit as it has views over the town and local countryside
Read less

Name: Pagham Beach
Title: a refreshing walk
Review: took a walk along the pebble beach and it was deserted, 11am in the morning and no one about, took the dog and she absolutely loved it, totally dog friendly, the little village is like going back a few years, nice place to spend a couple of quiet hours.

Name: Belinda's Tearooms
Title: Went for coffee stayed for lunch
Review: Such a quaint building lots of servers all very friendly so even when full very prompt service decided to stay and eat as everything looked so great big portions so no room for cake, " don't worry she said we can box em up for a take away" what a great idea.

Name: The George, Burpham
Title: A little gem in a gorgeous village.
Review: We'd been wanting to try The George since stumbling upon it on a weekend walk. The interior of the pub is lovely, old and quirky without being dark and dismal, the staff were friendly and informative, the menu was really extensive and appetising. We really enjoyed all our choices especially the trio of desserts which we shared. would really recommend it.

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Very comfortable stay
Review:
Just returned from a six night stay at this lovely hotel. Room was up to the usual high Premier Inn standard and seemed slightly bigger than I've had before. The bed (as ever) was extremely comfortable which ensured a fab nights sleep after visiting many of the local attractions.
Read less

Name: Ye Olde Fish and Chippe Shoppe
Title: Mr
Review:
Was just awful - don’t normally write on here
Fish was like it had been frozen then over cooked
Chips didn’t taste good , peas just had a strangeness to them .
There were people coming in.. maybe they don’t know any better
Was just shocked how bad .

Name: Parsons Table
Title: Birthday treat
Review: Excellent as ever. So much choice it was difficult to make a decision!! Food and staff of the highest standard a really lovely celebration meal.

Name: Church Farm
Title: Dirty sewer overflowing and horrendous stench.
Review:
We booked a long weekend (4days) at church farm. A sewer at the entrance of the caravan was overflowing and absolutely stunk. We complained straight away and asked to be moved. We weren’t moved and the drain wasn’t looked at for 3 days. We left early and are totally disgusted by the staff and site.
Read less

Name: Avisford
Title: Avoid
Review:
Worst hotel room i have stayed in for a long time. Room very warm and only top windows open, tired aircon unit too noisy to have on at night, pipes and external fans noisy and curtains too small for window and let in light! Furniture dated and paintwork chipped and cracking (as per pic of ceiling below). I would have changed room but was too tired to complain after long day at work. Wanted sleep but didnt get much. Exterior of hotel lovely but bedrooms just not up to standard. I won't stay again and will suggest my company reviews having this hotel on its books.
Read less

Name: River Breeze
Title: Never opens on time
Review: Good food ....but if on a tight schedule best go else where we rang said they open at ten its 10.20am and still not open and we are still waiting think we will now go elsewhere

Name: The Waverley
Title: Xmas dinner
Review:
Awful food. Bad service.Very disappointed. Terrible value for money. Never again. Inedible starter
Hardly any veg. Terrible dry dessert.

Name: The Bear Inn
Title: Pre Xmas family meal
Review:
We were booked for 1pm lunch 7 adults and 4 children told on seating that they had run out of Turkey! Whilst ordering the majority wanted chicken as an alternative and the person taking our order then had to then check levels of chicken (kids got thigh meat instead of breasts).
On arrival of the food we were dismayed at the lack of veg 4 small sprouts each 2/slithers of carrots and the same of parsnips and some peas (one plate had no carrots, 2 missing peas) no stuffing as there was no turkey and a Yorkshire pudding that looked like a pancake!
This was our 4 year going to the bear as a family previous years have been amazing and we were left full and satisfied this year.... well McDonald's on the way home me thinks!
TOTALLY DISSATISFIED!

Name: So India, Little.
Title: So India so good
Review: Had another meal here last night. Awesome food.Tanduri king prawn Kalia was best ever.Thanks for the recommend. Service was perfect again.We definitely back again and again. Best local for us. Thank you So India 😊

Name: The Mezze
Title: Fabulous food!
Review:
My son, who is a real foodie, and I paid a visit to the Mezze a few weeks ago. We were bowled over by the quality of the food, and couldn’t fault anything. This is a real gem in Bognor, and the best and most authentic food I’ve eaten outside Turkey.

A wonderful visit!

Name: Haskins Garden Centre
Title: Like a downmarket MacDonalds
Review: Been a few times, always found that the service is slow and the tables and flooring areas are not kept clean enough.

Name: Ship & Anchor
Title: Lunch with wife.
Review: Stopped at this pub on the way home from the boot fair. We found a seat and I ordered a hot sandwich between the two of us,It arrived quite quickly but we were very dissapointed. I asked for brown bead but it came as a baggette. We were not asked if we needed any sauces. The menu said it came with chips and salad, it did! There was very little salad and there were only six chips. My lager shandy tasted like lager flavoured lemonade due to the shortage of lager in it.The price was also high. In all a big disappointment.We wont go back.

Name: Toast
Title: Best breakfast ever!
Review:
This isn’t the first time we’ve visited as we live only a few miles down the coast but having just seen an Angmering pub/ b&b claiming to be number 1 in Littlehampton when actually this cute, honest little cafe holds the crown, I felt motivated to add my tuppence worth.
All ingredients are fresh, locally sourced and put together with love by the amazing team who run this great cafe. Eggs are free range and their fresh crusty bread is to die for!
There are several size breakfast options all with a huge mug of tea or coffee, ranging from under a fiver to The gut busting monster we saw lots of folk enjoying for less than £8.
We are not big eaters so our full English and a hot drink came to under a tenner! Wonderful! Fresh, tasty and fantastic value!
The staff are always friendly and tables are cleaned as soon as vacates. It’s quirky, clean and just great honest nosh!
Definitely Number 1 in our books (as well as Trip Advisor) - has to be tried, you WILL be back!

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Beautiful place to visit
Review:
Absolutely stunning grounds, the gardens are beautiful. Castle very interesting and kept in amazing shape for its age.

Spent about three hours here casually walking around and being thoroughly impressed.
Read less

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Disappointed
Review:
We visited Sunday lunchtime and throughly disappointed with the whole experience. We had to find our table as no one available to show us, then we had to wait to be served. The drinks orders were often forgotten and the food was so late in being served. The children’s burger was burnt and the baked beans looked over done in the microwave.
They had run out of roast chicken by 1.30!!! The roast beef was cut into thick chunks, covered in watery gravy and roast potatoes were shocking! Although there were a few of us, the waiting time was ridiculous and the food was definitely not worth the money! Will not be returning!

Name: Fish and Chips
Title: 30min wait for undercooked food avoid
Review: grim all round can't get any return business as food took 30 mins and then sausages were raw in the middle, chips hard avoid

Name: Cardanom Bay
Title: A wonderful meal
Review: We recently ate here as a group of friends. The food was wonderful, possibly the best Indian food I’ve ever eaten! We all enjoyed our meals and were left feeling extremely full up!

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Disappointing
Review:
Asked for a pint of bitter......non available , only a bottle!
Asked for a coffee......non available, machine broken!
Specifically asked waiter when ordering that jacket potato was not to have anything on it . It arrived after a very lengthy wait soggy and covered in oil. When asked for a plain jacket told that’s how jacket potato is cooked. Never had this before and manageress was unsympathetic and condescending.
Asked for a pudding but only one type available !
The worst Harvester I have been to . Clearly some Management issues at the his establishment that needs sorting.

Name: Arun View
Title: What not to like about it
Review:
I like this place. The pub is a real pub full of locals as is the restaurant. Friendly staff and excellent food. We booked a table on Thursday night before Easter and it was packed. After being seated at a perfectly acceptable table as our order was being taken a member of staff said would we like to move to a river view table that had just been vacated. We were perfectly happy with our initial table but it was lovely to be offered it.
Service is always quick and staff very attentive.
The menu is pretty varied but they do specialise in fish dishes -a lot from local fishermen. I have eaten a lot of different fish here. Also, the curry dish is nice. Just nicely cooked, fresh food in a friendly atmosphere.
Can thoroughly recommend and I have never tired of the place after coming for many years. Good range of beers, totally unspoilt pub that, luckily, has not gone down the gastro pub route.

Name: Butlins
Title: Please do not book an Oyster Bay apartment
Review:
The apartments are disgraceful, actually so depressing to stay in we left first thing Thursday of the Tots Week. We would of left Tuesday but wanted our little boy to enjoy the entertainment. This is a really shame you haven’t demolished these buildings.
If you would like to discuss further Butlins then please send me a message, your guest relations didn’t even question why we were leaving?
Read less

Name: Poppins
Title: Definitely Won’t Go Back
Review:
First Time Trying This Cafe In Town And From The Start Was A Disappointment. Staff Was Not Polite. Was Rushed To Order. Ordered The Soup Of The Day Served With Roll And Butter. Only To Be Giving Tined Hienz Tomato Soup And A Burger Bun. Had One Spoon Of Soup And Left The Rest. When I mentioned To The Lady She Was Rude And Said They Haven’t Had Any Complaints Before. I’m Definitely Not The One To Complain But Paying Nearly £5 For Tined Soup And A Burger Bun.
There Is So Much Nice Cafes And Restaurants In Bognor But this One Let Me Down

Name: The Norfolk Tap
Title: Good beer but poor quality food.
Review: Having read the good reviews we called in for lunch yesterday. Nice looking place and lots of comfy sofas. Bit disappointed there seemed to be no cider - neither on tap or bottled (apparently had just run out). My husband though very much enjoyed his pint of beer. We ordered the Fish Finger sandwich, which seems to only come with ketchup and no obvious sign of tartare sauce, and the - and I quote from the menu -" Honey Glazed Gammon and English Mustard". The "Gammon " sandwich arrived and was filled with the cheap, tasteless,mass produced sliced ham. Extremely ordinary and certainly overpriced at £6.50.

Name: The Lamb, Angmering
Title: Hygiene worry
Review: Let me say first of all the food was excellent. However it is the hygiene standard I am concerned about. If I had known that dogs are allowed where people eat I may have had second thoughts about dining at the Lamb, and I would definitely not have eaten there if I had known the staff would look the other way when a largish dog was sitting on the upholstered bench where people would later sit. This was encouraged by the dog owner. When the staff have this lax attitude where people eat, I worry about the kitchen. I was told when booking that we would be seated in the conservatory, however I assumed it would be similar to the main restaurant.

Name: Navigator
Title: Sunday lunch
Review: Another lovely lunch in the Navigator...normally eat here with friend (and dogs) during the week but today had Sunday lunch. Lovely roast pork (lots of crackling) good selection of vegetables. Fab location overlooking the sea, great food and really nice staff.

Name: Butlins
Title: Disappointing
Review:
I'm writing this review on the day of check out (not that we know where as the reception near us is always closed)
We had a silver room in dolphin boulevard which did not match the pictures. We didn't even get a double bed. Upon our arrival  (after waiting 3 hours for the room to be "cleaned") we noticed the beds had been made but that's it. An empty box of alcohol had been left under one of the beds the teaspoon was disgustingly filthy. I had to clean the bedside table and the storage unit for clothes so our stuff wouldn't get dirty and ruined, not what you expect to do on holiday. The bathroom was very small and the toilet seat not stable so we've both fallen off of it. Both of us have bruises from catching ourselves on the sink aswell. TV constantly glitches and loses sound. Walls very thin so could here next door snore. There was a light placed right outside our door so due to glass panels that light lit up the room the whole night... causing a lack of sleep  (again not what you pay to go on holiday for) nobody is policing the smoking rules so our neighbours decided to stand outside our room to smoke. My main complaint with the room is it made us feel ill. If we were in the room we got headaches and felt sick but when we were anywhere else we were fine. Not sure if there's some kind of leak in here. Also the carpet has some kind of bugs in it as I kept being bitten and if you sat on floor I unpack or tie shoes you'd become all itchy instantly. Due to this we had considered leaving early but felt to unwell to do so.

Splash is nice if you've got kids but for two adults it's a bit pointless can't do widths or lengths as always to many people. There's a toddler and parent hour so maybe a adult only hour or a aqua aerobics class would be good. The changing rooms are very slippy and dirty couldn't feel the underfloor heating either.

There was an incident Tuesday night near our apartment. So the next day we all got a knock at the door and handed a letter to explain. Massive waste of paper but nice of them to try make us feel safe.

The rest of the resort was nice lots for kids to do (not for two adults though). Lots of food places but all seem expensive for what you get would be cheaper to eat off resort. Supermarket is handy but again expensive they add money to the essentials. Didn't really interact with too many staff buy those we did seemed friendly.

All said we didn't enjoy it feel we wasted our money and will now have to have doctors checks to try figure out what was wrong with our room.
We wouldn't come again until we have children and would not stay in the silver room again ever.
Read less

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: It’s really beautiful...fantastic gardens!
Review:
We have lived in the area fo 3 years and never been!
We had an overseas visitor from Australia, where they don’t have castles, so we took her there.
It was a vast area with a huge and beautiful classic garden.
The castle itself is also huge with great views over the downs.
A bit expensive to get in but worth it and it all goes to the upkeep
Read less

Name: Hotham Park
Title: Hotham Park
Review:
My most favourite place in Bognor. I live a stones throw away and come to Forest school with my 3 year old son and often visit the cafe when I am there, which is also very lovely x
Read less

Name: Avisford
Title: Dated!
Review:
We came to stay here for an event being held at the hotel. I thought it was going to be quite a posh hotel but when we arrived it looked very dated and not very welcoming. The staff were ok but not over friendly. They put us in a disabled room which was a bit odd! The bathroom was not very clean. Bed was comfy though. I think the room was really over priced, quite disappointed overall.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: What a dump
Review:
Paid over £900 for a 4 night family Easter break.
Complete waste of money.
The place is filthy.
Our seaside apartment was discussing. There was even stuff under the sofa from the previous occupants! Including a pill of some description. Good job I found it before my 10 month old daughter did.
I’ve complained to Butlins about this and they’ve offered me an upgrade on my next visit!!! What a joke, as if I’ll ever return to that dump.

Also the place is now overcrowded, they let too many people in for day visits.
And the new pool is too cold for young children.

I’ll never visit again!
Read less

Name: Marine Park Gardens
Title: Beautifully Maintained
Review: Peaceful, leisurely and bursting with character. A wonderful place to rest and relax. I took a book and simply sat for two hours enjoying the respite.

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Dinner last weekend
Review:
This is our local pub, we had friends staying with us last weekend and visited the pub for dinner
From ordering our meals it took around 50 minutes for the food to be served and it’s was only average , one of our friends ordered a pie which was cold and he was unwell the following day. We hoped the new owners would improve this pub but sadly it appears not to have happened. In future when we want to eat in a pub in the village it has to be the Lamb and we will use The Cow for only drinks

Name: Swanbourne Lake
Title: Jenny Downs
Review: Excellent service. Staff were very kind and helpful to a solo disabled lady. Made me feel very welcome and comfortable. Food was delicious too. Thoroughly enjoyable experience. Thank you ladies. :-).

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Absolutely disgusting.
Review:
I popped in here today and ordered a medium portion of chips. The guy behind the counter picked up the paper mopped his sweaty forehead with it and then put my chips in the very same paper.

I was shocked... took the chips and dumped them straight in the bin.

What a disgusting, revolting animal does that in plain site?? What else goes on behind the scenes does not bear thinking about.

To say I won't be eating there ever is an understatement. I have also reported to environmental health.

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Disappointing
Review: I have no idea why everyone raves about this pub. OK it’s by the river but there are better views from the Waterside cafe at the bottom of the road by the entrance to Arundel castle. The food was dreadful. My husband had the ploughman’s. The waitress had to check that it was available and he wishes it hadn’t been. There was one cheese, which was sliced and looked old, the carrot was also old, the lettuce was limp, and the gherkins were OK. The only good thing about it was the bread, which was at least fresh. I opted for the baked mushrooms with lentils. I think they must have been sitting on the side as they were not very hot and very unappetising. There are much better fillings for large baked mushrooms than lentils. We will definitely not be returning to the Black Rabbit.

Name: Avisford
Title: Teerible rooms, poor room allocation for large parties but reasonable food and outstanding events manager.
Review:
A group of over 80 people booked loads of rooms for a dinner dance. The rooms were in poor state of decoration and cleanliness (see pictures). On arrival people with the same surnames and room types were allocated rooms on the opposite site of the hotel to each other where common sense would suggest that they would want to be close to each other. Rooms for disabled people were at the bottom of the garden in an annex a short drive away? That said the food was good and catering/bar staff tried hard to impress and the events manager on the Saturday night was awesome, even tricky problems that were not under his control he took on and sorted them. In summary good staff except the lack of common sense on room allocation but the venue is tired and needs a refurbishment which is a shame as the location opens up great potential.
Read less

Name: Passage to India
Title: Evening meal and take away
Review: Food is excellent. Service good. Best Indian food I have eaten and we have tried other places but none come up to their standard.

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Lovely castle, great visit but please sort your technology out
Review:
Let me start by saying that Arundel Castle is a bit like the land that technology forgot. We were unable to book tickets online as they currently have a fault... it must be a big one as we tried every day over the last couple of weeks. To make it worse, key elements of their website are not working. In the car park, they only have one payment machine that allows use of a debit card, and no online payment service. Oh and there is not an ATM (although there is one at the museum opposite the gate). After a long queue to pay for parking and a huge queue to buy entry tickets, we finally made it in. It was a lovely day and we had a great time watching the jousting, looking at the various stalls and touring the castle. It is a beautiful place and well worth a walk around. Would be 5 stars if they could make it a bit easier for customers and we’d not wasted 30 minutes in a queue.
Read less

Name: Syrup Café
Title: Good Food.
Review:
It,s not easy on the coast to find somewhere that serves anything but Chips.This place does Roast Dinners every day.
The Wife had Lamb(this appeared to be pulled)Fluffy roast potato's, carrots,peas and cauliflour with plenty of gravy.
I went for the Steak Pie and Mash(The pie had a pastry base and top and looked more burger like) The pie being crammed full of pieces of really tender steak.Prices were really reasonable.

Name: Butlins Day Visits
Title: Mislead dirty not much open
Review:
Came to Butlin’s 70’s weekend with 10 other work ladies.
We paid extra to be on the ground floor and together. (Gold) We got the ground floor but were in different blocks😬. On complaining the receptionist said we were never going to be together as they do not have two 6 person rooms together so we were mislead on booking. She said she would listen to the taped conversation to see what Butlins had said and call us back, still waiting.

Room block 4 floor was filthy and there were no shelf’s in the oven, shower head kept falling of.
Room block 5 floor was also filthy and all our pans etc had not been washed. Lots of cigarette buts out side our room which kept getting walked in. Was told they would be cleared up but never was.
A cleaner did come over and clean the rest of stuff that we hadn’t finished cleaning on arrival.

Wanted to hire the bikes out, but apparently they do not hire them adults only week ??
The fair was not open either.

We all paid to have a spa, the changing rooms had two toilets and two showers no changing separate room which is uncomfortable if you don’t wish to get changed in front of anybody, we were all queuing for a shower.
The main changing room was very small and hot, very uncomfortable considering you should be relaxing.
The spa itself seem to have to many people in at once. It was over an hour before any of us could use the hot tub also the ice room was broke.
I did have a facial and that was very good.

The floors in the clubs were awful so sticky, your feet came out your shoes as you danced.
The bands were excellent
So overall not a good experience with Butlin’s but it did not stop us having a good time no thanks to Butlin’s

Name: Church Farm
Title: Peaceful Site
Review:
We spent 7 days in a 3 bedroom Delux New Model in September. It was very peaceful but maybe this was because it was after the holidays. It was clean and fairly spacious with an on-suite toilet in the double room. The site is quite a big one and it is a pleasant walk to the seafront. There is a Co-op Supermarket and a fish and chip shop near the beach as well. We strolled around the site and along the nearby Nature Reserve. On site there is a small supermarket and Mash and Barrel but we never tried it. We had a pleasant drive into Eastbourne which took around 30 minutes. We also drove to Chichester which was only a few miles away. Another day we took the train to Portsmouth which was a great day out. Our stay was pleasant and peaceful, not to mention value for money. It is a great place to stay for a break and especially if you want to explore the surrounding areas. Recommended.
Read less

Name: Boat House In the Marina
Title: Gorgeous food, friendly owners
Review: We went for a Christmas meal. I can’t fault the food or service at all. So friendly and helpful. We’ll be returning.

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: Delicious burgers
Review: Me and my wife came for a burger and really enjoyed it. Only complaints are that the restaurant is pretty hot and sweaty on a summer evening, and bear in mind that their spicy burgers are actually relatively spicy and not the mild pretender you'd find in chain restaurants. Food was piping hot and delivered quickly.

Name: WWT Wetland
Title: Outstanding day
Review:
What a place, we enjoyed every minute and experience and stayed all day. The staff were great in all areas and at all times. Thank you all.
Read less

Name: Cockburns Tea Rooms
Title: Fabulous cake selection & tea!
Review: I recommend this place to my friends and family whenever they visit arundel. The different cakes on offer they have are so delicious and they offer vegan options and gluten free options. The tea is loose leaf apwith a good selection of different teas which comes in a large pot. The staff are super friendly and helpful and the prices are reasonable.

Name: The Lamb, Angmering
Title: Disappointing
Review: Having dined a few times during 2018, I had no hesitation in booking dinner for a birthday celebration. Venue still lovely, staff were all attentive and well mannered. For the meal itself. Starters were okay, a little basic, our choices being seafood cocktails. We were offered complementary pate appetisers which to be fair were delicious. Steak mains were of ‘pub grub’ standard, but well cooked. Having chosen fish dishes from the Specials board, all I can say is, the Red Mullet filets resembled worn out shoe soles and didn’t taste very nice at all. Such a shame considering the waiter convinced me to try this dish. I think my advice to the establishment would be, if you’re going to charge restaurant prices, you need to serve better prepared food. Whilst your team are lovely and courteous, the standard has slipped in the kitchen.

Name: Habib Indian Takeaway
Title: Lovely food as always
Review: I’ve been using Habib for many years and finally got around to leaving a review. You just can’t fault it! With eating out in Indian restaurants being so expensive these day. The food is the same, if not better and half the price.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Bit of customer service would have been nice!!
Review: We stayed in the adjoining Premier Inn and went to Roundstone for the breakfast. We were not shown where to get food and drink from or explained why there wasn’t a buffet of hot food- like it advertised. We had to find someone to ask if we can place our hot order as we were not attended to. Others who arrived after us were. We were not asked if everything was ok. Tables around us were not cleared and the place generally looked untidy. I know it’s a help your self service but a bit of customer service surly should still be expected. It was a Wednesday morning at 9am so not a weekend rush or a first thing in the morning rush.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Poor service
Review: We went on a trip here for breakfast we had a great time here in the past and no issues, however today wasn’t awful, one person running the whole of the floor taking ages to deal with one thing at a time, eventually our order was taken, 32 minutes later the food arrived, was nothing to write home about, by then the parking had ran out so was rushing couldn’t get anyone available to get the bill so resulted to using the app to pay before getting a parking ticket. Come on harvester more staff at the weekend it’s not rocket science!

Name: Westside Café
Title: What has happened?
Review: This cafe was once my go to cafe at the weekend under the previous owners.Since they sold I’ve heard not many good things about this place and months ago I see a sign go up ‘business for sale’.I went in yesterday and the current owner looked like she was severe pain, that or she really hated being there. She did not say hello to me, my partner or my daughter when she walked passed us upon entering. She ignored my partner who was at the counter ready to make an order.In the end, I called my partner away and said come on, let’s go to the syrup cafe. The owner again pulled a face like a stroppy teenager. I will not be parting with my money in this cafe until there is a new owner.

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: High priced low volume
Review: Beautiful setting, great atmosphere but very high priced drinks for very little volume of alcohol. Almost £8 per glass which you would expect a decent amount for the money you spend. Too much ice!!

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Appalling! disgusting service, Disgusting food
Review:
I WISH THERE WAS A MINUS RATING!!
Absolutely appalling service! rude (even management). waited over an hour for food, when it came out it was inedible! Burnt sausages, bacon snapped when picked up, beans stuck to plate, vege option had no vege sausages but watery spinach slapped on plate. No apology, nothing. A waitress was smashing plates in anger over something next to us? no idea what. My disabled son was so upset and we left having had no food.
DO NOT BOTHER VISITING!

Name: Tandoori Nights
Title: Made me sick
Review: I brought chicken korma and when I had it made me sick and bad the next morning. The food from here usto be good and I like Indian food. But i felt so ill the next morning after this chicken korma.

Name: 47 Mussel Row
Title: Good for Goodwood
Review: A group of us old friends stay in Littlehampton for the Goodwood motoring events. I am coeliac so eating out is a bit dodgy because of the risk of cross-contamination and thus unwelcome exposure to the dreaded gluten. Mussel Row has always been one of my favourites and their confidence in delivering a `gluten-free' experience, for me, makes our visits much more relaxing. One of our `go to' places and, if you like locally sourced food, well worth a punt.

Name: Butlins
Title: Weekend away with family
Review:
We stayed in the ocean hotel top floor with balcony and sea view. The room was very nice but failed on the cleaning . The balcony was dirty and when the cleaner came in to do the room it took her 5 minutes so was never cleaned properly. We had to ask for toilet paper as never left us any. Overall very poor value for money.
Read less

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Awful food
Review:
Im shocked how bad it was fish soggy
Tomato sauce and mayonnaise in heinz bottles but clearly wasn't as watered down n taste awful
Rip of do not waste your money or time.

Name: Fino
Title: First visit to this Restaurant
Review:
We both had a mixed fish starter followed by the fresh catch of day. Both were excellent and perfectly presented.
The staff could not have been more attentive and our wine was just the ticket. Excellent and well recommended.

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: 3 Star Room and Service for a 5 Star price
Review:
How disappointing! The room had none of the features clearly implied on the website and was scruffy. On speaking with the helpful staff they recommended I communicate by email with the General Manager who was away at the time. A week later not even the recognition of a response. A case study for losing custom and referrals through embellished marketing and a low grade approach to service
Read less

Name: Monsoon
Title: Birthday meal
Review: We went there on Friday night with my brothers who came from Leicester and whitstable for the weekend. What a great meal excellent value and very friendly staff. This was the second time one of my brothers had an Indian and he was very impressed with the meal and the overall experience. The restaurant is very modern so you don’t feel in closed with there usual style. They are always busy so I suggest that you always prebook your table .

Name: The Diner
Title: Avoid at all costs
Review:
Service very slow, food terrible, arrived cold.
Cocktails poor too. Kids meals were ok though.
We had dinner here last night and they forgot to tell us that service was over 45mins wait!
Food arrived cold in some cases. We did complain and food was replaced and drinks offered. Main meals were taken off the bill too. It’s such a shame. Oh and avoid the coleslaw - inedible !!! Errrrrr!

Name: The Swan
Title: Disappointed
Review: We stopped in Arundel on our way home from Hastings and visited the Swan to have lunch. We were quite late, it was about 2.30 but as we were told they were still serving Sunday lunch we stayed to eat. Our meals were served quite promptly by pleasant staff but when I started to eat it I found that it wasn’t hot, so asked for it to be changed for a hotter meal. The waitress took it away without any apology and so we waited again for the hotter meal, which came after a wait!! I must say this meal wasn’t a lot better. Also the vegetables were dry as if they had been kept hot since the early morning. The beef was tough, the Yorkshire pudding was dry. All in all it was a very unpalatable meal.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Would have given zero stars!
Review: Horrendous! Walked in and immediately decided not to eat. Very busy and chaotic. Sat outside for a drink. Dirty, broken tables and chairs. Rubbish everywhere. Broken glass and crockery due to the sea gulls destroying everything. No staff outside collecting used plates. Avoid!

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: Littlehampton Rustington
Review: Like all Travelodges, Rustington offered high quality basic amenities in terms of bed, shower, TV and tea/coffee facilities. Costs are kept down by not providing food and drink but these are available fro outlets on site or in nearby towns.

Name: Papa Johns, Butlins
Title: Amanda's a star
Review:
Visited Papa Johns at the Butlins resort over the last weekend with a large group which included my youngest daughter who has a gluten intolerance. This has been a problem in the past especially when it comes to Pizzas so we chatted to Amanda about her options. At first my daughter was quite teary at the thought of just eating a salad while her friends were tucking into a pizza each but it was a case of "Do not fear Amanda is here" as she talked us through everything that we could to cheer my daughter up. Then Amanda had the unbelievable idea of popping to the other nearby restaurants to see if they would deliver a gluten free option to our table (I know it sounds crazy but it's true!!)....To cut a long story short my daughter ended up with a fantastic meal from the restaurant next door with the chef even popping in to see how she wanted it.

Amanda went above and beyond anything that I would expect to make a child's day (and her father's) and I can't thank her enough.

I do hope Amanda's bosses realise what an absolute star they have on their team.

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Fancy a Joust?
Review:
Arundel Castle is splendid and well worth a visit. We took our children to the Joust festival and there were many activities to keep them occupied, including watching the Joust final. My daughter loved her face been painted which was included in the entrance fee.

The Castle itself inside and out is very impressive, I loved the library and castle has a wonderful feel to it, all the attendants were very helpful and informative.

The restaurant is themed as a castle banquet, my only gripe would be i asked for a Caesar salad however was served mixed leaves with french dressing?!?!, I asked for a Caesar salad and they just added Caesar dressing on top!?!?!. You are paying restaurant prices therefore if they serving Caesar salad, it should be with Cos lettuce etc. I was disappointed with this!

Arundel town is lovely to walk around before or after entering the castle. With some lovely boutique shops and a river runn no though it.

Overall it was a memorable day out and a hit with the children.
Read less

Name: Marine Park Gardens
Title: Nice durring the day...not so good to be around at night
Review:
The gardens are well kept and looked after. During the day there is putting available on the green (best check to see what times it is open)
Plenty of seating available for the elderly or for those who just like to sit back and relax.
I would not recommend venturing out around the gardens at night as they are not lit and unfortunately undesirables frequent the park quite often in groups, so for safety’s sake I personally wouldn’t.
If you’re in the area and want to have a relaxing walk, the gardens are worth a look along with the seafront.

Name: The Mezze
Title: Food is amazing!
Review: Came here for dinner whilst visiting Bognor Regis. The food was absolutely amazing, we loved everything that we had. I would definitely recommend stopping here to eat.

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Terrible!!
Review: We booked in Sept for our christmas dinner special treat as a family, we expected a great service & lovely meal at £58 a head, as this year was a treat for me to not do the cooking. The staff were dis-interested, never once were we asked if everything was ok with our meals (That is usual practice & something they should do!) The starters were shamefully small & disappointing to taste. The mains were no better, & the desserts also mediocre (everything was dry & rubbery!) I personally left there not eating any of my courses! And the other guests on our table didn't want to complain as its christmas day, but for me? If you dont want to work christmas day (understandable!) Then dont work in that line of work! My experience there today has been So bitterly disappointing that I will never eat there again at any time of the year as we have done many times previously. Their website says that they will make our day special, which is what we wanted.. but never again! Totally ruined our christmas day!

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Excellent food again served by Jess
Review: We all had a great meal again, wonderful steaks, cauliflower tart and our son was treated well on the kids menu, which he was impressed with. Jess was lovely and very friendly, despite being very busy.

Name: The Lion
Title: Very poor service
Review: Very slow service! We were first in the restaurant and drinks were served but it took 50 minutes for any food to be served. I asked

Name: East Beach Café
Title: I love this place!
Review:
Been here many many times and have never been disappointed. Breakfast, lunch, dinner or even just tea and cake in the afternoon has always been lovely. They do excellent breakfasts and all the food is so fresh! The staff are excellent as well - friendly, attentive but not intrusive. A credit to Littlehampton and a lovely unique place.

Thank you!

Name: Church Farm
Title: Miss
Review:
Upgrade a few weeks before from Standard to a Platinum caravan, I must say I wish I hadn’t bothered. Could book in at 1, by the time I have rang Reception Twice, to sort out the Problems and still wasn’t sorted I walked down to speck to the manager. Most of the problems were sort by 6.30 pm . Over 5 hours of holiday wasted. Blinds broke, rubbish, in bin, toilets not cleaned, bedding had ash on it and someone had been on it, cushions over the floor , marks on windows, drity marks on bathroom cabinet. We asked to move and was told there was nowhere, it was busy the weekend but Monday/ Friday was not many caravans Occupied but was still told they couldn’t move us . Very unhappy, then to top off the start of our holiday the restaurant gave our food to the wrong table and we waited over 40 minutes
Read less

Name: LG Café
Title: Dr
Review: Very disappointed. Not what we expected. Both almond croissants tasty old and musty! Coffee quite nice but very small. Need to up their game or they won't survive!

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: Fab stay
Review:
Great stay at this travelodge. Very clean rooms and great chatty staff who made my stay. Really enjoyed our time and will be back. Travelodge your what it is says on the tin and basic but great price. Thanks to all the team
Read less

Name: Papa Johns, Butlins
Title: Lovely Ginnie made our visit!
Review: We love the Pizza and Salad Buffet here, it’s great value for lunch as part of a day trip to Butlins, everything is always good but I have to especially mention Ginnie after our last visit because she was so helpful, funny and full of useful info about Butlins. She’s a real credit to the restaurant.

Name: The Mezze
Title: Fantastic food
Review: We went to The Mezze and had some lunch. We had a delicious starter of some flat bread with a lovely dip. I had a great lamb shish with fries and salad. Super child friendly staff. The only thing I wouldn’t recommend is the toilets. I’m 9 years old.

Name: Dolphin Hotel
Title: Miserable
Review: What a miserable place this is to visit. Bar staff rude and have to really push to be served and the atompsphere is worse still. Avoid and won’t be going back

Name: Butlins
Title: Don’t waste your money!
Review:
Came to Butlin’s as a family of 3 for a weekend trip. We stayed in Oyster Bay. We didn’t have high expectations as we had picked the budget accommodation as we felt the hotels were way over priced for a 3 night non peak break. The rooms are very basic, they do have everything you need but it’s all very old. We were in an end room felt like a fish bowl as all windows are over looked. If your not a fan of natural light and enjoy being watched from all angles this is the place for you. The bed was comfy, on arrival it was broken one side. Staff came around to check on all rooms which was great. Our bed was fixed quickly. The whole apartment was cleanish! The noise levels are a lot though! Walls are cardboard thin so even if neighbours are quiet you can hear it all. Best part was the stairs.... it was incredible made the whole apartment turn into a bouncy castle/trampoline/waterbed experience. Whenever anyone walked up the stairs and hit the landing jumping or not you move with them!
They need to put signs up to remind people that at 11pm some younger children still like to sleep!
The whole park is good but not great. Aimed at younger children around 8. Not much for teenagers. The staff are doing their best but you can see considerable cut backs. The fair ground only has a handful of rides so you can spend more then an hour there. The bigger more exciting drawing you in type rides are charged. And on the expensive side. As is golf, bowling, driving school - all paid for attractions.
Mirroring what other reviews have said nothing is open before 10 attraction wises and lots of the restaurants and ice cream place don’t open til 12.
Scoop the ice cream place is worth a visit. One big bonus of the site.
We booked and visited the diner on Saturday evening. This place is a joke. We waited over an hour for our food. Took 20mins after being seated for our drinks ordered to be taken and then another long wait of 15 mins for our food order to be taken. Then had an hour wait. Which would be expected but there was more empty tables then full ones. Another table walked out as it took so long. We complained and our food order was chased but still didn’t speed up the food process. Staff were apologetic but it took them a long while to come over. Not worth it go to burger kind instead!
The pool is the main attraction, it’s very new and is great. The rapids are fun but only if your children can swim. The changing rooms are disgusting! And very unsanitary. Be prepared to queue for everything.
Staff at evening shows are great though.
Very mixed bag even for a cheap weekend away with the kids, it’s not worth it at all. Another once great historical thing going down the drain! Try haven or dare I say pontins instead!
Read less

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: The gardens are splendid
Review:
We visited the castle recently and just did the Cathedral and Gardens bit. The Cathedral was very interesting and the gardens were splendid. The castle looked fairly vast but we decided not to do that part - the gardens were our interest. Well worth a visit if you find yourself around Arundel.
Read less

Name: Jaybelle Grange
Title: Clean, quiet park
Review: We recently spent a week at Jaybelle Grange Lodges. The park is very quiet and we enjoyed our relaxing stay in an Oak 2 bedroom lodge with hot tub. The lodge was clean and spacious and was provided with extras such as handwash in both the bathroom and en-suite, washing up liquid, tea towels and oven gloves (these haven't always been at other holiday parks we've visited). The bathrooms would have benefited from having a cabinet as there wasn't anywhere to store toiletries apart from 1 small basket on the wall in one, also a shelf/basket in the shower would've been handy. There was a washing machine/dryer and I was pleased we had a clothes airer as it's annoying when there's no where to hang your washing or swimwear to dry (other lodge/caravan parks take note). The free WiFi (by WiFi Spark) wasn't reliable or strong enough to do much so we ended up getting extra data bundles for our teenage daughters. We all used the hot tub (our daughters were in it every evening) although it isn't really big enough for more than 2 to 3 people at a time. Don't stay here if you're expecting a lively holiday park, it's a quiet lodge park with no facilities on site, we knew this and it was just what we were looking for. We enjoy walking and Climping Beach is only a 15 minute walk away so we visited that most days, also we walked to Littlehampton which is 2 miles away. Any issues I've mentioned are minor and certainly wouldn't put us off returning for a future stay.

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Disappointed
Review: We visited the carvery which was average,not a huge selection of veg unfortunately.Free sweet with beer custard yuk!! Not for us.

Name: Shoreline
Title: Monday to Friday break in May 2019
Review:
From the moment we drove through the gate we were greeted by friendly and efficient staff, and our check-in was seamless. Our room was clean and inviting, and my 4 year old granddaughter loved the 'sea' theme. The staff in the restaurant gave us a very warm welcome each day, and remembered our names! Wendy & Amanda were lovely! All the staff behind the scenes that we didn't get to meet deserve a big 'thank you' too. As for our stay, it was really enjoyable. From the fantastic new pool, to the fairground, super shows and pantomime, and 'meet and greet' with the characters. Myself, my Daughter, and my 2 granddaughters aged 4 and 8 months had a fantastic holiday. Well done Butlins! We will certainly be back!
Read less

Name: Bengal Tandoori
Title: indian sit in meal
Review: went to the bengal tandoori restaurant on saturday evening. the ceiling above my table was stained from a leak above,the seating was very tight to get into. curry tasted as if gravy powder had been added to thicken it. as i came out and was waiting to pay the area used to prepare the chunteys was stained by spilled food not good

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: One night stay
Review: The staff at first meet were extremely helpful moving us to a downstairs room when they realised my mother could not cope with the stairs , unfortunately there was a lot of noise from the people in room above us

Name: Parsons Table
Title: Dinner
Review:
We visited the Parsons table twice while staying with our daughter. The fist time was a Wednesday evening, we didn’t book thinking it wouldn’t be busy. It was full, luckily for us 4 people had just left. The place is small but not overcrowded, it felt warm and cosy. The staff are just the right amount of attentive and seemed to know what we wanted before we did. They’re friendly, funny and knowledgeable about every aspect of their menu.
I can’t remember what I had the first time but it was beautiful and everyone of us inhaled our meals. The second time we booked as it was a farewell dinner, I chose off of the special’s board. I had the crab minestrone soup followed by the hake, again it was amazing, this time however I took it easy as I didn’t want it to end. The food is locally sourced and so fresh. Give this place a try, it’s fabulous but book, well in advance. Parsons table, well done, I think you may just have some of the best waiting staff I’ve seen!!
Will be back in December.

Name: World's End
Title: Grilled food needs a lot of improvement
Review: I hate writing bad reviews. It’s rare I do, but I’m afraid I have to here. The positives - nice atmosphere, friendly staff, and the starters. And that’s really where it ends. My son had a burger which was cooked beyond recognition. He still ate it, but that was through sheer hunger. As for me, I ordered a medium rare steak. Alas, it was probably the most well done steak I’ve ever had. I had one bite and left the rest. Far credit to the waiter though, as he spotted this and said he wouldn’t charge for my plate. Still hungry, I ordered a sticky toffee pudding. Don’t make that mistake. It was an insipid, dry sponge with a small amount of frankly disgusting toffee sauce on top. It resembled no STP I had ever seen. Again, one mouthful and I couldn’t eat any more. Then, to top it all, they completely forgot about bringing out a pudding for my father in law’s birthday. All in all, it wasn’t a celebratory night. We won’t come back, I’m afraid.

Name: World's End
Title: Excellent Christmas Day Lunch
Review: We booked our Christmas Lunch after having had some excellent meals at The Worlds End this year . It was an excellent Christmas lunch , the service was great , the food was superb . Without even asking we were offered extra Yorkshire’s and gravy . The table we booked was ready and decorated when we arrived and there was no rush to leave at all . Well done to the owners and the staff for making Christmas Day a great one !!

Name: The Deli
Title: Lunch
Review: I visit The Deli at Aldwick regularly and have been for well over a year now. The service from Emily is always excellent and the food is great especially her cakes which are so light. Her rocky roads are very generous and taste great. I highly recommend a visit. Emily has a roast day and a pie day. The menu is always full of variety and choice.

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Reasonable pub restaurant food
Review:
The Robin Hood is a Chef & Brewer pub and Hotel.
Can not comment on the Hotel facilities as I have not stayed there.
Food is resonable both in price and quality. However we have experienced some inconcistency on quality.
The menu is a standard C&B menu served either in the restaurant with waited service or pre-paid as a bar meal.
There is little waiting time and you are usually warned if there are delays due to the kitchen being busy.
Staff are generally friendly and helpfull but you do tend to be forgotten towards the end of the stay at times having to go and find someone to sttle your bill. Other wise a good place to eat frequented primarily by locals.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Cleanliness leaves a lot to be desired
Review:
The food was as I would expect from a chain such as this. Went for convenience as near to where we are on holiday. Restaurant area where we sat not very clean. I had to ask for table to be cleaned, even though it was set. I also had to ask for new cutlery.
Went to use the toilet and needless to say they don’t appear to be well attended to.

Very busy but no excuse for me cleanliness in a restaurant is paramount. Staff friendly enough to be fair.

I did raise with one of the managers who bluntly put didn’t seem to bothered about my comments. One of the waitresses with him however made an effort to attend to us after which was appreciated

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Christmas break
Review:
Spent 3 nights visiting family. Loved it and will make it our regular
Our WiFi was excellent and I only had the free one
The staff were very friendly and helpful I loved the surroundings and thought the place very comfy
We only had breakfast as we were visiting family but it was cooked lovely
Read less

Name: Mustards
Title: Bognor has a restuarant to be proud of
Review: This is a really nice restaurant. The food is amazing, really well presented and top quality, the service is very good without being over attentive, the facilities are clean, its not cheap, at good Arundel prices, but then the food quality and presentation warrants it. From that perspective it would be highly recommended. However, there are a couple of minor consideration. It a bit stark, the lighting is very full on / harsh, so it does not create any ambience, a few dimmers and some table lights would help a lot, and it has a huge echo problem, so its very noisy even with ordinary conversation. You must try the apple and blackberry mouse for desert. EXCELLENT

Name: Moathouse Café
Title: Lovely breakfast
Review:
Stepped in for late breakfast and weren’t disappointed.
Friendly staff and scrumptious breakfast.
Great location by the castle in Arundel.

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Worst Sunday lunch ever.
Review:
Well - I have just returned home at the end of a day when my family and I experienced what must be one of the worst lunch experiences ever.

We arrived at 1.20pm for a 1.30pm booking and were shown to our table. Finally someone took our drinks order at around 1.45pm and the drinks arrived at 1.55pm at which time we were informed that due to lack of kitchen staff it would be another half hour before they could take our food order and then maybe about half an hour more before we would be served. We were asked if we wanted to stay (bear in mind we had just got our drinks) and knowing that it was nearly 2pm and there was probably no chance of getting a table elsewhere we decided to bite the bullet and stay - as long as we weren't charged for the drinks. Which they agreed to.

Our food order was actually taken at around 2.15pm and we waited for our food. And waited and waited and waited. And waited. We complained to the management who, I'm afraid to say, were decidedly unconcerned. In fact I would say that the owner was actually rude in his response. "Oh, It's coming. It's coming" he said - as if that was enough.

Finally the food arrived at 3.15pm! One and three quarter hours after the time of our booking. Needless to say, by this time, my family were starving, losing the will to live and almost willing to accept anything. The meals were more or less OK except for one beef dinner which was almost cold. We were offered free desserts but to be honest we just wanted to leave as soon as possible.

If only we had been told about their staffing problems when we first arrived instead of after half an hour we would have had a better chance of finding a lunch elsewhere. I'm afraid that if this is the usual attitude of the owners then they are in for a rough ride in the pub business. We will certainly not be returning and I would advise anyone else to think twice before booking.

I have to say that I have given The Spotted Cow one star for one reason only. And that is for the very polite waitress who did her best to look after us and was obviously sympathetic to our appalling Sunday lunch.

Name: Butlins
Title: Dirty room
Review:
The holiday was let down by the room it was dirty. We found used underwear left on the bathroom floor not clean rubbish under the beds you could not cook as there was no key cooking utensils not even a cheese grater or wooden spoon and 3 glasses for 5 people all different sizes
Read less

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Exceptional service!
Review:
The staff at the hotel were absolutely terrific throughout our two-day stay and couldn't do enough for us. We were made to feel really welcome and were treated like guests and not numbers. Absolutely first class.
Read less

Name: Avisford
Title: the worst Hilton I've ever stayed in...!!!!!!
Review:
The only reason I've given this review 1 star is because there is no option given for no stars.
My Girlfriend and I stayed here whilst visiting the Goodwood members meeting.
it cost £250 for the Saturday night that we stayed.
although the staff were very nice and helpful the hotel its self was very disappointing to say the least,
the room was very dated and smelt mouldy and damp.
this hotel is now very tired and in desperate need of refurbishment.
How Hilton put there name to this hotel is shameful and a discredit to the Hilton brand...!!!!!
Read less

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: Disappointing lunch
Review:
We were looking forward to a special 3 course lunch but after the first course it went rapidly downhill. We received a lovely welcome from the waiters and thoroughly enjoyed the delicious home made rolls and celeriac and apple soup which was excellent. However we had a very long wait for our main course of hake. The plates were only just warm. Then when we eventually were served our sticky toffee pudding it was cold, the pudding was hard and solid, the ice-cream portion far too small for the amount of pudding and rich sauce. The restaurant itself was lovely and the tables beautifully laid however.
Read less

Name: La Cucina
Title: Excellent all round
Review: Food is just fab here all fresh and tastes fantastic. Service always excellent too. Well worth a visit if you haven’t been yet.

Name: The Dragon
Title: Very dissatisfied
Review:
I have been to the Dragon on many occasions but it now looks like it is on its last legs.
Starters arrived too quickly and looked like the came from Iceland,
Rest of the meal was disappointing, a pity because it used to be a great place
Staff were surly and unsmiling

Name: Cockburns Tea Rooms
Title: Great food and excellent customer service
Review:
I came here for lunch whilst in Arundel for the day and was very impressed indeed.
I asked if it would he possible to order a vegan sandwich and was immediately offered two different options. When it arrived my food was tasty,well-presented and the serving size was generous.
However, having spotted vegan brownies by the counter, l also had to have one of those, with some loose leaf tea.
I was asked if l would like a top-up for my tea-pot and whether my food had been ok, which l was impressed with. It seemed that the staff really care about the service they provide and whether customers are satisfied. The place itself is cute and cosy and has a relaxed atmosphere.
I loved it here and would recommend to others. Prices are also very reasonable.

Name: Cardanom Bay
Title: Worst service ,rude staff
Review:
We visited as a group of 6 , table was booked weeks in advance for 8pm , arrived table not ready , we said we will go off and come back which we did , 30 minutes later table was ready . Waiter quickly took drinks order , left leaving no menus . Eventually brought menus , ordered food and waited hour and half for “complimentary starter” . Asked when main course would be served was told another hour , 2 1/2 hour wait for food was a bit extreme especially as Resturant had emptied in the time we had sat and waited, by that point we had all lost the will to live , and were all starving so left .
Will never recommend this restaurant or use them again .
Food might get good reviews , but no good if can’t back it up with good service.

Name: Butlins
Title: 80s weekend
Review:
Our room was in the Wave hotel which was lovely and clean and comfortable beds and a great shower.
The food was good and we enjoyed what we had.
The entertainment was non stop and some acts were better than others.
The staff were all very nice and the comedy club comedians the black one in particular was hilarious
We will be returning to do it again
Read less

Name: Inglenook
Title: Shower is poor
Review:
Stayed for the weekend. Due to age of building no air con
Bathroom was musty and the shower was poor
