Bed comfy and room clean
Breakfast was included
Hot food cooked to order.
If 3 people had the fruit salad it had to be refilled.

Name: The Fish Factory
Title: Dad’s birthday meal
Review:
7 family members booked a table for a birthday meal we were early for our booking which wasn’t a problem we were given a warm welcome offered drinks whilst we read through the fantastic menu
We all thoroughly enjoyed our various fish lunches I can honestly say it is the best fish n chips I have ever had cooked to perfection very well presented the deserts were also excellent all in all we would all highly recommend this restaurant we will definitely be returning.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Christmas breakfast
Review: Amazing food, all we can eat for £9.50 and the sausage and pain au raisins ate delicious! Great service as always. Even had xmas crackers!

Name: Dolphin Hotel
Title: Exceptional food.
Review: Very atmospheric place. The food is fantastic, it is run by a very friendly and welcoming couple. Very comprehensive food menu and a good selection of drinks.

Name: Chez Moi
Title: A French oasis in the land of fish and chips!
Review: A good choice of excellent dishes both for lunch and dinner. Best croque monsieur to date! Obviously very popular so booking advance to be sure of a table. Parking tricky but only a short walk from the town centre.

Name: Avisford
Title: no sense of urgency or organisation
Review:
I turned up ready for a wedding with the intentions of enjoying my stay without any hassle.
After the amount i paid for a "deluxe room" to make the occasion special, it annoyed me to my core to hear that friends who had paid a percentage of what i had were offered suites and rooms of the highest standards. Friends of mine had also lost their suites due to other peoples upgrades.
We wanted to have a nice family meal before the big day and after ordering 10 meals for the table, we then waited forover an hour in what was an empty restaurant. We were made aware of the extra wait for BBQ food but anything over an hour it would of been appreciated if we were made aware of the status of the food. Eventualy the food did turn up albeit it the wrong orders and therefore leaving me still with a hungry stomach. I was scared that if i ordered more i would be there well into the night. Not ideal prep for a long wedding day. We did have our drinks removed from the bill but even the drinks took over 20 minutes to arrive. it was only a nudge from my friend who was fed up of waiting , who went to the bar himself to get a separate drink as it was a hot day and was parched (34*)
On the day of the wedding i needed to iron a number of shirts which luckily was not a problem as the room had all of the utilities it promised. ALTHOUGH even with the iron only half full it decided to leak all over my shirt leaving a water stain. It was at this point that my opinion on the Hilton Hotel brand had been tarnished. To the point where on the last day of my stay at 11:15 i stood at the downstairs bar in an attempt to get a fruit shoot for one of the kids and was unable to due to NO STAFF manning the bar which i had been directed too. This was not a busy time of the day and i had to walk away and disappoint the child of my failure to provide a sweet beverage in what was one of the hottest days of the year.
Read less

Name: Pizza Hut
Title: Great Buffet Lunch
Review: Attended as a group of 7 at lunchtime for the unlimited buffet. The service was very good and there was always a fresh full supply of pizza to choose from. Salad bar was nice and fresh as well and was kept tidy. Also ordered the refillable juices and this was a diy service which means you can actually get refills when you need/want them. Pizza was cooked really nice and was tasteful. Toilets were also clean. Would recommend and would go back again at a lunchtime.

Name: KFC Bognor
Title: Couldn't even get served
Review: Waiting at the ordering point in the drive through for quite some time with no one requesting our order, we assumed the intercom wasn't working. Drove round to the serving window to be asked if we'd stopped at the ordering point to which we advised yes we had for quite some time. They told us they can't take orders at that window so we'd need to go back round again. If they spent more time serving and less time talking to eachother they would have got our custom. With burger King just down the road that's exactly where we went. Won't be trying to eat here again

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Avoid eating in the bar
Review:
Harvesters are usually low end eateries but perfectly acceptable. But if the restaurant is full do not choose to eat in the bar area, dirty and untidy, tables not cleared or cleaned, bar staff not interested in customer service, unwelcoming, unwilling to replace missing condiments and cutlery, "go and see if there are any on one of the other tables" as a party of 10 I would normally give a generous tip, not on this occasion
On the plus side the food was ok, but I won't revisit

Name: Pier Road Coffe & Art
Title: Coffee and Cake
Review: Fantastic Coffee shop located in Littlehampton. Not only do they serve delicious coffee and scrumptious cake, they also have on offer a shop full of Arts and Crafts for sale. They also have classes during the week which you can join.

Name: Harbour Lights
Title: 20 minutes for 3 coffee's
Review:
Took my parents in for a coffee yesterday after finding out it had reopened.

How disappointing

They now only have 1 till instead of 3 and although I counted 6 members of staff behind the counter, it took 20 minutes to order 3 coffee's. I must mention that it wasn't busy, only 2 people in front of us.

I'm not sure who designed the new layout, but to only have 1 till is crazy. I've also never seen so many staff in there, in total I counted 8 front of house staff (which is more then it had before it closed and was really busy) and out of all of them, the only one I saw doing any work was the heavily pregnant waitress, the rest were just stood around doing nothing!

Really disappointing to see it like that and certainly won't be returning

Name: Pizza Hut, Littlehampton
Title: Not same as in Pizza hut restaurant
Review: Pizza from takeout pizza huts dont taste the same, can be oily at times even on crust which should be bread like but seems to be coated in some kind of oil. not good pizza. topping are cold and pizza base warm not hot. hmmm Dominos Fail every-time and pizza hut pizza tastes awful, seems no place in town to get a decent pizza

Name: Mustards
Title: First class food in tasteful surroundings
Review:
I have lunched twice at Mustards within the last few days.

My first lunch included last Sunday was a delicious homemade broccoli soup and a generous, equally delicious, portion of roast lamb, Yorkshire pudding, roast potatoes, gravy and two side dishes with freshly cooked vegetables. In addition there was warm, home baked bread and a Carafe of water.

Today being less hungry I chose fried cod, chips and mashed peas; all cooked to perfection. Once again there was freshly baked bread. Afterwards I ate homemade lemon, lime and raspberry sorbets - so much better than thé mass produced variety.

On both occasions the service was efficient and friendly. Mustards is stylishly furnished and attention has been paid to many details: for example: cloth serviettes and cloth towels in the immaculately clean bathroom.

Name: Waterside Café
Title: Rude......
Review:
We decided we wanted an ice cream rather than a cuppa and a sit down so chose our flavours before wandering in to look at the view.
Immediately a woman 'commanded' us rudely that we had to sit at a table so she could take our order. Followed to be told loudly "you've walked into a cafe, you need to sit down' order.
I told her we had decided to just have an ice cream...
The curt reply and stare back was "well, the flavours are out there on the board you have to go in THERE to order'.....
Needless to say, we didn't stay and the last thing we would want to buy and ice cream from you!!!
Dreadful social skills. Rude Rude Rude...

Name: The Lion
Title: Bad experience
Review: Arrived for a meal sat down at table not set up to have an early drink before sitting down at pre booked table. Asked to mov3 on as table booked for lunch doors opens on cold day to see us out quick. No heating very unwelcoming missing regions managament, suggest avoiding unwelcoming to disabled customers and very unfriendly wont be back.

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Around the castle
Review:
Last time we visited the castle and gardens was a few years ago when for some reason there were not that many rooms. Today we returned and we were well surprised at the rooms we had not seen before. They were all magnificent and by comparison to say Windsor castle, Arundel is much better value for money. The gardens are also excellent and in parts quite surprising. We will return next year and I would highly recommend paying for the top ticket. Furthermore, it’s probably better to visit on a weekday when there are less people and your enjoyment will increase.
Read less

Name: Hawking About
Title: Amazing Experience with Owls
Review:
I so enjoyed a great hawk and owl experience last year, couldn't wait to go again. This time a friend and I went for the Owl Experience - amazing again! Flew 5 different owls - non stop hands-on experience, learning so much as Kevin shared his knowledge and affection for these stunning birds.
Highly recommended for all age groups.
Read less

Name: Lemongrass Thai
Title: Amazing food and service
Review: Lovely food , absolutely delicious! Really recommend! Great service with lovely waiters all really friendly

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Family visit
Review:
Friendly and comfortable place to eat
 Food well prepared and wide choice of menu available. Staff friendly and helpful.

Name: The Lamb, Angmering
Title: Two Night Stay
Review: We stayed here for two nights using it as a base to tour the local sites with our friend who also stayed overnight. This is a friendly, homely, vibrant pub with fabulous atmosphere. The breakfasts were really good and waitress served and we stayed for one meal in the evening and it is really superb fine dining, the food was excellent. I would thoroughly recommend this pub. The room was tastefully furnished, cosy, clean and comfortable although if we came back we would request a different room. We were directly above the bar area in Zebedee Peckett and it was noisy till past midnight . Our friend had a spacious room on the second floor which he said was quiet and very good. We would definitely return though as it otherwise ticks all of the boxes.

Name: The Gravy Boat
Title: Mrs.j
Review: Went for lunch for my son's birthday, booked a table just in case really busy. Didn't go till 1.45 so prob didn't need to being a Wednesday. Took grandson, pizza he enjoyed, 2 had carvery husband had liver x mash . No complaints, staff very on the ball. Plenty of choice on the menu, will go back again.

Name: Anokha
Title: Our New Year's Eve experience
Review:
So we booked a table over the phone on the 30th December for a nice meal on NYE with my family for 7pm. Just 3 of us only to arrive and there not being a booking for us. However they managed to get us a table so all good.
Then we sat down ordered our drinks and poppadoms but on the table was a 5 course set menu for £22.95 per head which is all good if you can eat 5 courses and dont have kids with you.

We asked if we could order from the main menu and the guy told us that we could choose items off the menu and pay for what we have only this changed when we was about to order. They told us we could only have the 5 courses! There was no mention of this when I called and the staff were extremely rude and obnoxious. We paid up what we had and left.
We weren't the only ones. The table of 6 next to us were also Ill informed. They got told that the menu would be £14.95 per head. What a joke. I think they were about to walk too.
We should have learned from our last experience of our takeaway from the Anohka, West Meads. We had to wait an hour and a half for cold food.
They will never have us as customers again.
So disappointed.
P.s. we have been customers of the Anokha since we moved from Surrey in 2014 and until recently it has been great. Something has drastically changed and I think it's the staff and their incompetencies and rudeness

Name: TAO
Title: Just call it a sports bar
Review: Awful, no atmosphere, awful music. I'd rather watch paint dry. Feels like a weatherspoons. I'd love to get my hands on this venue.

Name: Elmer Tandoori
Title: Elma tandoori
Review: I always order from this takeaway as I think the food the coast and presentation is amazing and super friendly when visiting. I rang up to place an order before 10.20pm took my address and my whole order witch took 10mins to be passed on to another gentleman who explained rudely that he can’t deliver to me with no explanation. This is more for the restaurant eyes in hoping they read this and treat people a little nicer on the phone you may have business but no wants to order to someone who is bloody rude and not polite!! The words can spread you know might want to have a few with your staff!!!

Name: The Holly Tree
Title: Outstanding 9/8/19
Review: Visited here for dinner friday night and we were certainly not disappointed! The food was fresh and tasty and you could tell the chef has a real passion for what he does. The blonde lady that seemed to be running the restaurant was extremely polite and efficient and nothing was too much trouble. All in all excellent food and excellent service, we will be returning!

Name: The Lamb Inn
Title: Front of house lead the way
Review:
Went for a family meal to the lamb inn. Lovely local pub interior and exterior.

Service was amazing the waitress was lovely and couldn’t be more accommodating.

Food was a slight bit hit and miss, some was lovely and very well cooked. Unfortunately some meals where a little disappointing maybe the chef should of checked the plates before sending them out(no response needed chef).

Nice experience

Name: Royal Oak
Title: Food and drinks
Review: Another great evening drinks and food at its best usual high standard thanks jan for the great welcome

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Service was shocking
Review:
Had a reservation booked for a birthday , table we was given was right next to the kitchen door which was very frustrating because there was lots of noise coming from the kitchen and the door kept getting left open , we asked several time for it be shut and the waitress who looked like she was in charge made an excuse that the door wouldn’t shut because the front door was open ... once we complained enough times she finally went in a turned of the FAN off that was making so much racket ,when she honestly could have just done it the 1st time round . Also really frustrating that whilst I’m eating my dinner there is no table service for drinks and that u can’t ask the many staff they have floating around for a drink and that you have to get up and go to the bar whilst eating your dinner , by the time your back from the bar your foods cold ??? Ruins the whole experience of paying to sit down and have a meal and feel like the staff are looking after you . Continuing with the staff , they all seem nice enough but there is a lot of them but still impossible to get hold of any of them ....
Food was delicious just wished I felt more welcome and not a burden to the staff that was ‘ looking after us’ .

Name: Bengal Tandoori
Title: Just vile !
Review:
Without doubt the worst Vindaloo and so called Korma I've ever had the displeasure of putting in my mouth !
First the Vindaloo ... Sauce a very dark brown, boardering on black with the over-powering taste of burnt garlic. I'm sure a Michelin tyre would of been easier to bite through than the chicken floating around in the grease.
The Korma ... Oh my, where to begin ?? Opened the container lid to reveal a globulous grey sludge with a watery yogurt poured over the top. The taste was indescribable - overly sweet and not remotely anything like a standard, creamy Korma. Again the chicken was tyre worthy. Basically, I threw both dishes in the bin as they weren't fit for human consumption in my opinion. Just terrible and the utter audacity of the place to actually have the gaul to charge customers for outright crap !

Name: Butlins
Title: Great for a family break
Review:
We have just spent a half-term week at Butlins and it was better than I had expected. There were alot of people but with some planning (getting early for a show/swimming at off peak times such as lunch time and late afternoon) it wasn't too much of an issue. We had a new style silver apartment which I would highly recommend. They are much nicer that the silver apartments, more spacious with grey furnishings. The beds were comfortable and the whole place was warm which was important for Feb! The pool was grotty and run down but the new one will open in a few months which looks amazing.
Read less

Name: Spring Cottage B&B
Title: Highly recommend
Review:
Gorgeous bed and breakfast, everything so pretty and clean. The place smelt amazing!!
Myself and my two boys were made to feel very welcome and had a great nights sleep in the blue room. Everything was thought about with care and my boys were as impressed as I was.
Thank you Michelle, we hope to be back soon!!

Name: Out of Bounds
Title: Adult laser tag party !
Review:
Soft play laser tag for adults ! What an awesome idea and lots of fun.
From first enquiry to confirmed booking and the day staff were attentive and friendly .Venue always busy and if anything we need more places like this around for kids , adults , families and all for fun .

Much fun had adults or kids parties great here , climbing , soft play , laser tag and bowling spoilt for choice . On a good weather day the golf too.
Read less

Name: T-Bone Burger
Title: Disappointing
Review: After reading many positive reviews I decided to visit T-Bone. I was part of a largish group, there was a few couples seated as well as a very large group of people who appeared to be known to the owners of the restaurant. From the moment we arrived there were children running around the restaurant (from the large group), we were all a little concerned with all the plates of hot food coming out of the kitchen, and to be honest you don’t expect that in a restaurant when trying to enjoy a meal out. We decided against starters so we were given complimentary nachos to nibble on while we waited for our mains, which was a lovely touch and quite tasty, although the cheese appeared to be like the sort you’d expect to come out of a squeezey bottle. The main course (I chose a burger and fries) was huge, far too much for myself, although I’m sure many would be able to finish it off, so great value for money. Unfortunately the burger itself was nothing particularly special, a few of us found the burger bottoms to be quite soggy and found that we had actually been eating the paper it was served on as that too became very soggy. The cheesy chips appeared to have the same squeezey cheese on. Overall I was a bit disappointed and probably won’t go back, maybe having another large table along with us was a factor, maybe it was just not to my taste. Sorry.

Name: The Waverley
Title: Meeting venue, lovely staff.
Review: I’ve used this venue on several occasions now for business meetings and every time the staff are super helpful and efficient. Thank you for your quick reaction time this weekend in sorting out emergency tea and coffee at really short notice for twenty people. No mean feat when you were short staffed and busy with the DDay crowd. Much appreciated. Warwick x

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Good quality food, reasonably priced
Review: The quality of this restaurant is above average with a friendly, welcoming atmosphere. The staff were more than helpful and very accommodating. Top marks

Name: Kam-Too
Title: Really poor quality
Review:
Bought a takeaway which was £48, my favourite 'the lantern house' is temporarily closed.
The food was gross, the only thing edible was the chips and the prawn balls. Ended up throwing it all in the bin. Greasy, bland, and just not very nice. I will not be going here again. I should have read the reviews first.

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: Mini break
Review: Everything was good . My husband could get a paper without going far . Bus stop 5 minutes walk. Easy to get to Littlehampton , Worthing , Bogor Regis And Rustington . The Lamb in Rustington is great for meals .

Name: Flying Fortress
Title: Average for a play centre
Review:
As play centres go this isn’t on par with others. Needs updating, staff miserable and atmosphere dreary. Food on menu not available and no WiFi (was hoping to work as the kids played). At £7.50 for myself and one child I felt it was a bit rubbish
Read less

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Good pub bad toilets
Review: Excellent pub, had great time, very big pub. One thing I would change is the toilets. They are unisex and only 2!!! Went into one and there was no loo roll, not even a loo roll holder so was very inconvenient.

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Tulip Festival - a feast for the eyes! You must go to see it!
Review:
Arundel Castle has been hosting its Tulip Festival for a few years now and it is always a delight to see it. This year was no exception; however, due to the hot weather over Easter most of the white double headed daffodils were over, as well as some of the early flowering tulips. However, there are still plenty of very colourful flowers to see in such well designed beds and borders. Some of the blooms are huge in size and most unusual in colour and shape. Good value for money and lovely to see! You must go!
Read less

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Rude female staff member letting the place down!
Review:
We were there for a family meal. One member of staff was very rude. We were told we couldn’t sit in an area requested as it was booked but nobody in the whole time we were there sat at this specific table.
We were also guests at the premier attached so had breakfast there. Two days the young lady that seated us was very warm, friendly and helpful. The last day once again we were told that there wasn’t a table big enough to fit 5 people and a high chair that hadn’t been booked. There were lots of available tables much better than where we were seated and much more suitable not having wine glasses behind our heads on a shelf like where we were seated.
This morning happened to be ran by the and rude woman the first evening.
The food was however beautiful and it was a shame this one woman was so rude as it lets the place down.

Name: Fino
Title: Superb!
Review:
Absolutely fabulous dining experience, amazing quality food professionally presented and delivered by courteous staff.

If your looking for quality in a beautifully decorated environment then head here!

Name: Butlins
Title: Butlins Shoreline Hotel
Review:
Shoreline hotel rooms extremely well presented and family friendly. Great view of seaside. Well equipped with fridge and tea/coffee facilities. Comfy beds & cones with bunk beds for little warriors. Great housekeeping services.
Read less

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Oh dear!!!
Review: After a walk along the beach we didn't feel like walking far for a restaurant and as this Harvester is a few minutes from the beach and had vegetarian options I thought we'd give it a go. It's the one and only time I'll eat in a Harvester. On the plus side the staff were incredibly nice and helpful. Both my wife and I opted for the garlic cheese mushroom starter. It tasted as if it had been made with very old mushrooms. The main meal was very large portions - my wife had fish and chips which she said was ok; I had a couscous dish with looked vile and tasted even worse. It was inedible, the couscous was either not cooked or died out and the rest tasted awful. I cannot recall the last time I left a meal. The waitress did ask if there was something wrong with it and I just said it wasn't cooked properly - she did say I could have re-ordered but I'd had my fill from the buffet salad bar which was mostly ok although the salad had clearly been left out for a long time. My wife had a desert which she said was quite nice. Overall I guess my wife would have rated the place a 2 or 3, I'd have rated the staff a 4 for effort but the starter and my main meal, well the less said the better.

Name: Motte & Bailey
Title: Terrible Service
Review:
Not impressed at all with this place waitress was uninterested in serving me and when I asked for water along side my breakfast it seemed like I was an iris ring rash. Young blonde waitress with an air of superiority!

Food was very average but service was terrible

Name: Church Farm
Title: Bad customer service, dirty prestige rooms
Review:
Decided last minute we would like to extend our holiday for another 3days because family and friends decided to come down to bognor regis as well. Called reception, been told all caravans fully booked. Checked online, exact same one was still available, confronted they said we would still have to move to a different caravan (wait 6 hours until is cleaned) instead of swapping then on the computer, in the end they all the same "prestige" caravans. About the caravan itself, no signal, beds covered in flies, didnt let that ruin our holiday, but what ruined it is not being able to extend it when we were prepared to pay full price. Disappointed, never again, Church Farm.
Read less

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: Comfortable stay
Review:
The room was clean and comfortable and a good size. I arrived after 10pm but there was a friendly receptionist there to greet me, and my request for a hairdryer was dealt with promptly. Perfectly satisfactory stay.
Read less

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Work Gathering
Review:
I had arranged to meet up with a group of work colleagues, on the 21st July It was a lovely evening with around 15 to 20 of us there. Things did not start to well when the first drinks we ordered, to be told two of the Real Ales were not available. This not worry us to much, but within an hour we were told theta there was no Coke, Lemonade or Soda water available unless we wanted bottles as they had no Gas !!!
Then within another 30 Minutes they had no draught beer either due to no Gas !!!
Bearing in mind that this mid July & a rally nice evening, a Pub cannot serve draught beer.
When we arrived the garden was full of patrons, but once people were told no beer, unless they wanted to buy bottles, the place juts emptied, we were also about to leave around 30 to 45 minutes later to locate a pub serving beer, but one of the staff came out and advised us that someone had got gas from another pub. So we decided to stay
I am astounded that this was not done much earlier in the day to avoid this very issue, especially on a Saturday night.
This was a great location for us as a group to meet, but this will not happen again.

Name: Six Bells
Title: Pub lunch with parents
Review: Surprisingly quiet on a lovely Saturday lunchtime. Good pub food, friendly and very accommodating service. Mum and dad both had the ham and eggs - which was excellent - followed by very generous sticky toffee pudding. I had a very good steak pie - and was much too full for anything else! Good value - a good find!

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Breakfast
Review:
I booked a table for my family to have breakfast this
morning & we were seated quickly. We were then left for over half an hour before someone came to take our order & then waited almost an hour to get our food. When the food did arrive it was very disappointing & just slapped on the plate. The restaurant wasn’t even full with many empty tables. At no stage did any member of staff apologise for the delay & the three members of staff we did see all looked very stressed which didn't help our experience. When paying the bill we were told how much it was & they didn’t even ask if we enjoyed it! To be honest we have been previously with similar circumstances but gave them the benefit of the doubt. Will not be returning! Wouldn’t give them any stars if I had the choice.

Name: Avisford
Title: Not what we expected.....
Review:
A little shocked if I’m honest.. stayed in Hilton’s all around the world and this hotel just doesn’t live up to the Hilton’s normal standards. Walked into the bedroom which was like a box. Only one bedside table, the other side had a wardrobe stuffed up next to the bed. Went to open the window only to find the last visitors leftover takeaway on the windowsill.. the room looks nothing like the photos advertised... a real disappointment
Read less

Name: Moathouse Café
Title: Excellent value
Review: Arrived as a family of 3 to find they had no tables spare so we came back after 30 mins and were seated with no problems , service from the minute we arrived was first class and the food we ordered came out quick and was of really good quality, it’s very cosy in there with the tables quite close together but we would definitely come back , staff really attentive

Name: Picturedrome
Title: Ok for price
Review:
My wife and I went here to watch IT 2.
The screen we were in wasn’t very comfortable, the chair I was sat in was awful. It was also very warm in there.
The price of the cinema is very reasonable.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Pathetic Bar Staff
Review:
Attending the 1970’s weekend. Great music but just try getting a drink! Bar staff act as though you are invisible and do NOT serve customers on s first come first serve basis and when challenged ignore you. The service and attitude of bar staff need to improve.
Read less

Name: Jade
Title: Customer Service disgusting
Review: Ordered food at 5.51pm, arrived 8.35pm. It took 2 & half hours for my order, plus the food was just warm. Would never order from them again

Name: The Steam Packer
Title: A hidden gem
Review:
What a splendid little place.

So welcoming, great food and great live band. And very good value. We loved it

Name: Habib Indian Takeaway
Title: Still not arrived 👏
Review: Ordered over two hours ago - expected to have arrived after 50 minutes, as per the website. Been a loyal customer for a while now, but a really dreadful service tonight.

Name: Mustards
Title: Family reunion meal.
Review: Eight of us visited this restaurant on Saturday 4th May 2019. We had a large table in the window, the moment we sat down my knee knudged the table and to my horror my pet hate , an extremely wobbly dining table. I called the waitress over and she immediately remedied the problem with a few wads of knapkins. We quickly had our drink orders taken, and I was delighted with my large rhubarb and ginger gin with aromatic tonic water, delicious, the drinks arrived quickly. Most had starters and everyone thoroughly enjoyed them , especially the three who had the scallops saying they were the best scallops they had ever had. For the main I had a rare steak with fries and salad, it was perfectly cooked, my wife had the beef wellington which she said was exceptional and perfectly cooked. Suffice to say everyone enjoyed their puds, the presentation of them was so pretty to look at. I have to say that despite the restaurant being full to capacity, the service was excellent, we had time between courses to talk, and if you wanted more drinks they came quickly. All in all a thoroughly enjoyable dining experience, yes its a little bit more expensive than your average restaurant but you pay for what you get and what we got could not be faulted. Excellent and would love to visit again next time we visit family in Bognor.

Name: World's End
Title: Awful lunch
Review: Chicken Caesar burger with cold chips and a rather inexplicable bowl of strong garlic mayo (not Caesar). My sister had chicken Kiev served with school standard boiled cabbage (apparently the green beans weren’t cooked and “still in the oven” ?! Nice enough staff and pretty surroundings but the food was quite dreadful.

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Lovely querky hotel
Review:
Lovely hotel in center of town right next to castle Staff were excellent our room was lovely great bed good nights sleep bathroom had lovely shower. Breakfast was really good lots of choice with good products Already planning trip back so we can go in the castle
Read less

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: cold food
Review: we went on a quiet night staff hanging around food arrived cold didn't go back. The waiter was friendly enough I think kitchen staff need to make sure food is hot before sending out.

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Tiptoe through the tulips
Review:
Visited the castle grounds , to see the tulips , they were beautiful as were the rest of the gardens, year round interest and well laid out, only viewed the castle grounds on this visit but the castle looked interesting, there is a riverside cafe close by that was very reasonable and pleasant
Read less

Name: Wave Hotel
Title: Reef apartment
Review:
First time in wave and booked a reef apartment as staying for a week to use the kitchen facilities.
I paid the extra to select a room with a sea view and was advised room 547 had a good view.
Having seen some photos of views of the hotel roof I called the hotel directly, prior to staying, to ensure it didn’t have this so was disappointed to find the side view was just that!
The front view, however, was much nicer.
Friendly staff and quick check in.
Rooms were all clean and daily housekeeping was good. Worth noting they don’t put dishwasher on like the do at Center Parcs, not a big deal though, easy to manage! 😀
The room is spacious with good air con/heating and comfortable beds.
On the down side there are no heated towel rails which are useful for drying swimwear.
Neither of the DVD players in the kids bunks worked and reception were not interested when this was reported. Apparently the DVD players are not being replaced, my thoughts are that they shouldn’t advertise them if they are not maintaining them as leads to disappointed children. My little one had spent ages choosing ones she wanted to watch in bed. (For the novelty).
The showers were good but water not really warm enough, if, like me, you like a hot bath or shower rather than just warm.
The cafe in the hotel is really good for lunch in a nice chilled setting. The staff were so accommodating of dietary needs and made be a bespoke meal to be gluten free but include halloumi. (The rest of the site not so accommodating)
Nice coffee too 👍
Lovely hotel but a long walk from the new pool and for me felt a bit out the way, loosing the atmosphere. I will stick to the other two hotels on site in future I think.

Name: Burger King
Title: Oh dear!
Review:
I have never had a greasy burger from a Burger King before but today was the day. The turn around service is the fastest I have ever seen. The choice of drink from the vending machine promises a wide and varied range but in reality- limited to Coke Cola, Fanta and Cloudy Lemonade. When I informed the member of staff, although acknowledged there was no action to rectify and refresh.
The staff were totally miserable and distant, if the person who served us cracked a smile they would need to reapply their makeup.
Dirty, unappetizing and resembling another fast food outlet.
Shame really as we had travelled 6 miles to have one as there is not a Burger King where we live. Oh well, at least it gives me the incentive to make my own.

Name: Black Horse
Title: Amazing food and ambiance
Review:
One word WOW!!
We heard the Black Horse was under new ownership so we thought we’d give it a go. Firstly We were greeted by such friendly staff. Nothing was too much trouble! It had such a friendly atmosphere and the decor is just beautiful. We had a delicious meal. The steak was cooked to perfection and the Thai fish cakes on the specials board were the best I’ve ever had! Just delicious. Thank you Black Horse for a lovely evening we will be back!

Name: The Windmill
Title: Good pub food
Review:
First time here and ordered bar food.
Delicious garlic prawns!
Friends had camembert, fish goujons, chips, chicken and bacon salad
All superb and we cleared our plates
Good value
Would return and try restaurant

Name: Premier Inn Littlehampton
Title: Could not fault!
Review:
Great Premier Inn with a fabulous, friendly pub & restaurant right next door. We were in Littlehampton for a birthday party. Got back to the hotel before closing time, was able to have a quick drink before going to bed and as a bonus...got to order food to takeaway to our room...just what we needed after a day celebrating a 50th in the glorious sunshine of Littlehampton!

*Premier Inn is £10 taxi ride from the station.

***WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND***
Read less

Name: Denmans Gardens
Title: Tranquil place
Review:
Atmospheric Garden, not too manicured just a lovely, well thought out space, we were lucky enough to have the garden to ourselves which was extra special.
Lovely open plan tea shop with some tables under the trees

Name: World's End
Title: Sunday lunch
Review: We took our whole family for a Christmas lunch the Sunday before Christmas and booked the lovely big table by the fireplace. However, although the meal was good our dipstick waiter completely destroyed the day by asking my son's girlfriend who is 26 for her ID, could not believe it, she doesn't have a driving licence or bus pass so could not show any ID so he refused to let her have a glass of wine ! I called the manager who was very pleasant and explained that once challenged a drink is not allowed. This waiter needs to go to specsavers or be sacked. I was beyond furious and will not go back there again even though we have been going there for at least 25 years. Our whole afternoon was ruined and everyone at the table where as furious as I was and will never go there again. UNBELIEVABLE.

Name: Premier Inn Arundel
Title: A great stay
Review:
Clean and welcoming. No noise from the main road and there is a pub next door that serves food. Would recommend this location for sure. Also just down the down is a filling station with a subway and maccy d’s.
Read less

Name: The Norfolk Tap
Title: Lovely pub
Review: We didn't stay here but had a drink. The bar staff were efficient and friendly and made some recommendations for drinks. It also had outdoor space and secret garden at the rear which was lovely. Great location and friendly staff ; what more could you want!

Name: Beachcomber Inn
Title: Older grandchilds favourite,makes him feel like a grown-up choosing from adult menu
Review: Service is good , food is good standard pub grub .The kids menu has everything they need. Always visit at least twice in 5 days as we like to eat in a range of on site places. Always having a leaving day breakfast here value for money good

Name: Arundel Cathedral
Title: Amazingly Artistic @Arundel Cathedral
Review:
Amazingly Artistic Flowers on display at Arundel Cathedral , well worth a visit to see the 'carpet' within the Cathedral and the array of handmade flower arrangements.
Read less

Name: George & Dragon
Title: Pub Lunch
Review: The last time we visited here with our family of 15 it was superb. This time however, 13th May 2019, we arrived as we were passing by around 1pm. When we entered the pub, a very efficient lady came up to us and asked if we had reservations. We told her we did not and she said that we couldn't sit at the reserved tables which was obvious to us!! She also said that we couldn't sit in the lower garden so we would have to sit on the terrace. She then proceeded to tell us that if we went outside and it got cold, it would probably be too full to come back in again. I told her we had been sea-watching at 530am and were not bothered by the cold. She didn't reply We had food, we were hungry but will not return. All extremely negative and unfriendly...

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Very Disappointing .....
Review: We ate at this restaurant on Wednesday evening with friends, the 9 of us regularly eat out , but this was an experience we wouldn’t wish to repeat, the portions were very small and the food was cold, 7 of us chose the chicken and ham pie which was over cooked and the pastry very hard, the seats were also in need of a deep clean ( very grubby ) , after my negative comments I want to say how lovely all the staff were, Shame .....

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Shocking service
Review: We should never have gone tonight because we've had other bad experiences here but as there were 4 adults and 2 children wanting a quick meal we thought we'd try it. We arrived at 6.15 to be told we couldn't get a table until 6.45. Got sat down then it took ages for them to take our order. The kids ordered starters...o my garlic bread and we then waited an hour for this. When they eventually came the waiters said they had started cooking our mains. Then about 45 mins later and after us asking a few times still no food. We gave up and left! No communication and it really wasn't that busy. Really badly managed place. Shame. Definitely avoid.

Name: Butlins
Title: Grim New Pool
Review:
We went on a day pass yesterday, purposely to see the new pool after all hype that was made around it.I wish i had not gone at all. The changing rooms were grim , not clean and pubic hairs all over the floor, it was gross, we overheard a family saying lets get out of here its hell. It was hell, i wish you had kept the old pool open. We wont be coming here for swimming again, the pool is great if you are a toddler or early teens, nothing for adults here, not even a bar or food by the pool, avoid this place if you can. I read other peoples reviews on here before going and thought people were being picky however i agree with them.I also think you should think about doing more entertainment for adults during the day, couples come here not just families and i think it would be nice have a mix of adults and kids stuff. I am also shocked the on site fish and chip shop is closed on a Sunday and Monday yet the takeaway part is open, that should be changed, the whole site should be open not half, you pay enough on a day pass and even to stay there you pay enough I am so shocked at the new pool. GRIM
Read less

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: Best chicken burger ever!!!
Review:
During a day in Arundel we came across this burger shop and decided to give it a go. Got seated quickly, crayons were provided for our youngest with the children’s menu.

Had nachos for starter and was not an issue to have one lot without jalapeños. Ordered the ‘rooster’ chicken burger, the buttermilk and seasoning marinade of the chicken was amazing, best chicken burger I’ve had. The hot rooster was also deemed to be the best chicken burger too.

They were happy to take unwanted items out of the burgers which was much appreciated.

Will definitely be back!

Name: Parpadelle
Title: Lovely looking restaurant - shame about the food
Review:
I ate here with my 3 year son after looking for a casual Italian restaurant. Typically you can't go wrong with italian food for a little one and Parpadelle looked cosy yet casual from the outside. It turns out the menu downstairs is different from upstairs (I didn't realise there was an upstairs until later in the meal). I ordered a kids margherita pizza and moule frites

The kids pizza came up. The base was flavourless and undercooked and it was smothered in cheese and covered with herbs and rocket salad. Fine for an adult. Not fine for a fussy 3 year old.

The mussels were worse. I ordered it with chips but was offered bread as there was plenty of sauce. I said yes to this but then turned out it was bread OR chips so never received the chips. It didn't matter in any case as the mussels hadn't been washed and I after 4-5 mouthfuls of grit and sand I gave up and sent it back and picked at the equally inedible pizza.

On the upside the service was friendly. The waitress did apologise and said she would tell the chef / not charge for the mussels which was fine. But in the end I just left hungry and would have preferred to pay for food I could eat.

Name: The Town House
Title: Best ever
Review: This is probably a bit late but in my opinion along with family and friends I have brought here over the years-this is without doubt the finest dining establishment ever-great food,great service along with a fantastic ambience-we have enjoyed every visit here 110 percent-it so so sad to see these lovely people go-given a choice I’d even rate it better than the Ritz overall(been there done that a few times)-we wish them all every success in the future-thank you guys

Name: The Gravy Boat
Title: Wonderful meal with a beautiful view
Review: We had a lovely meal here on Saturday night, 4 of us all had the carvery and the meat was lovely and fresh and hadn't dried out as many carveries do, the veg was plentiful and again fresh. We sat upstairs near to the large glass window which made for watching a beautiful sunset over the water. When we are next down this way this will definitely be a go to place to visit.

Name: Parsons Table
Title: Delicious lunch!
Review: First visit to this restaurant, came here with 2 family members for lunch, two courses for £19.99. Not big portions, but certainly enough, worth the wait between courses, every mouthful was delicious, every item perfectly cooked. The duck was soft with a crispy skin and lovely accompaniments, all so tasty. My sister in law had the fish which she said was delicious too. We had 3 different puddings and every one was superb, I could have had any of them. I will definitely come here again and would recommend this restaurant. I can see why it’s the no1 place to eat in Arundel!

Name: The Lamb, Angmering
Title: Good Food
Review:
Pre booked table for lunch for 3 - friendly welcome on arrival, restaurant busy for weekday at 1pm. Good choices on menu with great variety. Having ordered drinks that arrived quickly. We skipped starters and ordered mains, all choosing various fish dishes which were excellent, of good portion size and hot. Presentation was very professional.
Deserts were offered with good choice but we were not only full but found the prices quite steep, a practice that seems to be creeping in of late at most places.
This aside a good venue and without doubt quality food. We would return.

Name: Avisford
Title: Poor standard Hilton
Review:
Stayed with a group of friends, all of us were hugely disappointed by the standard of the rooms. Extremely small, dated and unclean. Bathroom was filthy! Enjoyed our weekend, but wish we'd all booked a different hotel, this just isn't worth the money which is a shame as the staff were nice and facilities could be good, just needs a lot of money spent.
Read less

Name: Premier Inn Littlehampton
Title: Worst Premier Inn I have ever stayed at
Review:
Absolutely AWFUL. Check In was fine, but I got put in a room in the "New" block which meant a walk outside a 0 degrees celcius :-( When I got to the "New" block, the front door was swinging in the wind, which meant the enterance and corridors were also very cold. My room was cold (until I found the Aircon control). Having set the aircon to 21 Celcius I'm then confronted with a system that's noisy (sounds like a jet plane cruising). Then when I went for a meal at the attached pub/restaurant that was dire (I left Hungry) and because of this experience I cancelled my Breakfast at reception. Finally (and to me the last straw - hence this poor review) when I went to order pizza from a.n.other I needed a postcode, only the Post Code on the website was advertised as BN16 1AF, when infact it's actually BN16 1EB. Complete disgrace. WORST Premier Inn I have ever stayed in (and believe me I've done quite a few). Recommend - certainly NOT.
Read less

Name: King Pizza
Title: Takeaway
Review:
I usually use this place for food delivery and up until now have been good but last night food took nearly two hours to get food to me!
When app said it was due I waited another 15 mins to be told it would be soon so another 15 mins go by so I go to the shop to be told its on its way now. I dash home to meet the delivery bloke but he still hadnt appeared. Another ten minutes and he rocks up. Such bad customer service. Will not be using again

Name: Butlins
Title: Amazing as always
Review:
We absolutely love coming here and it just gets better. We were able to check in at 1pm and our room keys are activated at 4 so that meant no long queues at 4 to get your key. Once 4 came we came to apartment on the 2nd floor and whilst we were lugging our luggage up I turned round and one of the housekeepers had also carried some of our stuff up for us which was really kind. Every single member of staff we encountered were lovely and stopped for a chat. The place is kept very clean and tidy. The circus was brilliant!! The skyline gang as ever put in great shows and although people have said that these are the same shows all the time, it's perfect for the kids as they learn the songs and dances so can join in. My son met every possible character and literally just smiled for the whole holiday. That's worth every penny.
Read less

Name: Belinda's Tearooms
Title: I am amazed at how many good
Review: I am amazed at how many good reviews there are! We called in for breakfast today. How disappointing! The menu choice was extremely limited. We ordered poached eggs on toast and scrambled eggs on toast with cappuccinos. When I heard the microwave “ping” I was worried! My husband’s scrambled eggs were extremely yellow, dry and overcooked. My poached eggs looked and tasted odd. The coffee was undrinkable. We definitely won’t be returning.....

Name: The Gravy Boat
Title: Sunday lunch
Review: First timer, I thought the service & quality of the food was outstanding. My mom & her partner really enjoyed the salmon dish & I had a good sirloin with hearty mushroom sauce. If anything it was quite a lengthy wait but it was a weekend & full! I’ll be going back with family to sample the ‘Carvery’ at some stage.

Name: Howards Coffee Shop
Title: Disappointing
Review:
Not that good food board outside not same as inside.
Couple bits wanted not avalible.
Staff not that pleasant more places avalible.
Toilets could do with a good clean

Name: Inglenook
Title: Dinner
Review: Nice meal but we had roast but quite high price for 1course other meals not bad tasty but would only visit once as there are better restaurant in the area

Name: River Breeze
Title: Always great service and food
Review: We have been here many times and nearly always have the steak pie meal. The food is always amazing and service from the young staff they employ exceptional!!! It's nice to have a family run cafe like this where the staff and owners really care and give amazing service and food!

Name: Norfolk Gardens
Title: Café!
Review: The cake was just good enough to cancel any regret about not ordering the cheesy chips!I can’t comment on the golf but if you’re in the area and feeling peckish then have a look at the cafe menu!

Name: Hotham Park
Title: Fantastic park
Review:
Found this during a Butlins stay and is next door. Brilliant park which has Alice inWonderland theming, a miniature railway, boating lake, playground and adventure golf. Cafe is great too you really can’t go wrong!
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Love love love
Review:
We come to Butlins about 2-3 times a year 2 adults 3 children we always stay in the hotels and we absolutely love it every time! We came for a Xmas break but to also share my youngest birthday and stayed Mon- Friday this time which was a first and will definitely be booking again! Well done Butlins you always make our stay brilliant!!
Read less

Name: Premier Inn Arundel
Title: Great Value
Review:
Stayed recently and was very pleased with the friendliness of the staff who were most helpful even to the extent of helping set my new mobile phone so it would act as my alarm. Next door to the Beefeater where you have excellent choice of food at very good prices. The breakfast offered extensive range of continental and cooked English breakfasts. The hotel room offered comfortable bed with tea / coffee making facilities. The cost which is per room is competitive even if you are staying as a single visitor. Thoroughly recommend this hotel.
Read less

Name: LG Café
Title: Beautiful place, lovely staff and amazing food/drinks
Review: Cannot stress how lovely this place is. Me and my partner both had hot chocolates of different flavours and they were the best I have ever tasted (definitely have the cream on them). We also shared a grilled cheese toastie and had a cake each, both gorgeous. The staff were really welcoming and very helpful including looking for us around Arundel when we managed to leave a bag behind. You must go and visit this place.

Name: Simla Tandoori
Title: Ordered Chicken Korma x2 chicken Dansak + Rice Nam Bread x 3
Review:
Chicken Korma was like two portion's of Diarrhoea and the chicken smelled and was like chewing Rubber, the Nam breads where the same a bit like chewing a flavoured rubberier ring.
The family Meal that was brought turned out to be Horrendous experience.
Very Disappointed with whole take out order from this restaurant, will never use this place again.

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Was bad
Review:
Keanu and holly: was awful food was cold beef was terrible and pork was under cooked all veg was cold would never come back and wouldn’t advise anyone too
Tony: was disgusting

Name: Monsoon
Title: Extremely rude and arrogant waiters/staff
Review: As a regular I have always been aware of the rudeness of the two guys in front of house but I could deal with it. To cut a long story short I work away a lot and get back at late hours and sometimes waiting for food while I have a wine (or two) let’s me combine a drink after work while getting a take away. However, the staff are rude (considering I am a very regular customer) but last week was enough...snide comments, lack of professionalism, being judgmental and totally lacking any kind of customer service I have decided to never go back. PS- if you live in the Rustington area then opt for Cinnamon in Littlehampton, food is Devine and service impeccable- lacks a bit of atmosphere is the only downside.

Name: Six Bells
Title: WOW !! Great lunch
Review: Visited on a quiet wedsnesday lunch time in Oct, as other people have said drove pass and missed at first, visiting because of the good reviews and wanted a lunch in the area. Lovely warm welcome for hosts, and a great menu , hard to choose with such great choice , the food was Fanastic, the best liver and bacon ever tasted, the veg served with the pie was 1st class , recommend to all and will be back . Thank you for a lovely meal .

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Male
Review:
Don’t eat in resturant food poor no flavour his your champagne l leave you to open it what do you say to that most main dishes over price I ask for a plate to go with our hot shareing plate what do you think she brought a cold plate no sense all so when she brought the glasses she brought them with her fingers inside the glasses
Read less

Name: The Diner
Title: Raw Chicken,Extremely Slow Service
Review:
Was really really disgusted at both the food and the service yesterday at the diner.The service is really shocking,Takes for ever to bring you your drinks and then once your food is then served you struggle to get the attention of any member of staff having too feel that your chasing them down even to get the bill.The chicken in which my partner was served yesterday was raw inside I then managed to find a member of staff who said oh let me check with the chef if it is raw?!.Er excuse me I don't need a chef to confirm what I can see very clearly which is not pink but RED chicken.Our starters came out with our mains? Which was nachos with cheese,There was hardly any cheese and they nachos were soaked in grease.
No apology regarding the raw food and was given the response that it had simply been taken off the bill! Would NOT reccomend the diner sorry!

Name: Thai Kitchen
Title: One and a half hours no food
Review: Arrived with 3 friends, ordered starters and have waited one hour for main, asking for the main told another 30 minutes more. Not sire whether to rate the food or starve

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Appalling customer service
Review:
Booked a double room during August festival, costing £89 no breakfast, had to pay for parking. At no point were we told the band would be playing outside our bedroom in the courtyard with smoke billowing from a wood burner into our room because the window does not shut. On return to our room at 9 pm it was full of smoke and the music was deafening. We complained but the ‘owner’ just kept saying you knew there was a festival on. Yes we did in the surrounding streets but not in our room! Refused to move us or do anything to help resolve the situation. Appalling customer service, bad attitude by the management. Had we been told the band was playing outside our room we would never have booked a room at this hotel.
Read less

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Poor Sunday lunch
Review: 14 pounds 50 for two medium slices of beef, a dense Yorkshire pudding, roast potatoes that were hard skinned and over cooked veg was too much by far.

Name: LG Café
Title: Dissappo
Review:
Made a special outing to Arundel purely to visit Le Goûter and travelled 45 minutes to get there following a recommendation.
The ‘garden’ was a small terrace between two buildings and only had 4 tables. Vegetables and herbs were being grown in pots which was lovely to see.
I ordered an almond croissant and was given a flat round ‘patty’. It was not flakey in any way and rather sought. What surprised me the most was chocolate on the middle!
The total bill for two coffees and a croissant came to over £8.
I will not be back and will not recommend this café.

Name: Cockburns Tea Rooms
Title: Lovely cakes
Review: Lovely cakes - superb gluten free toffee cake, and a great coconut and raspberry sponge - coffee was OK, nothing special.

Name: The Beresford
Title: A good place to visit
Review: Excellent carvery ................... apart from the wafer thin meat ! Very good ambience and atmosphere ( surely necessary wherever ! ).

Name: Subway, Chichester Rd
Title: Flies
Review: Went in for a sandwiches. Used toilet first and noticed loads of flies. Went to the counter, flies everywhere and flies and bugs on the back of the glass where all the ingredients are.

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Frozen Roasts and Microwave Over-use
Review:
Just finished a Sunday roast with my family and we were all left really disappointed. Roast potatoes were obviously from the freezer as were the Yorkshire puddings and they have then microwaved to death along with the rest of the meals. Couldn't say it was busy as there was one other table in the whole place eating. My daughter's mashed potato had been microwaved so much it was solid and her corn on the cob was stone cold. The kids pizza is a microwave Chicago Town pizza that was just awful.

Disappointed really as the food in here used to be really good but has gone majorly downhill.

Name: Swanbourne Lake
Title: Greedy Swans
Review: Lovely walk round Swanbourne lake even on a chilly January afternoon. Take duck food, not bread, or wild birdseed will be greatly received. Watch out for the swan who waits outside the Cafe at the bottom of the steps at closing time at the Cafe. He is waiting for the tray of crumbs the staff throw his way at the end of the day. Delightful. Little ones just love feeding the ducks & the swans.

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Mrs
Review: Good evening meal. Cooked breakfast on offer cold and continental breakfast not on offer. Poor service at breakfast time. Staff too busy eating their breakfast!!

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Bloody slow service
Review: Visited with some friends from overseas. Food was acceptable but the service was very very slow. It took ages to get drinks, ages to order our meals and ages for the food to come once ordered. It’s not as if it was a particularly busy Wednesday night either. Over 2.5 hours in total for three courses.

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: Check your bank statement after staying here
Review:
Rooms were clean and tidy and we were very satisfied with our stay. However what a surprise when I checked my bank statement upon return home. We were charge on the day of arrival and then again 4 days later! You are unable to contact anybody by phone - as there is only a 087 number and once back home overseas we are unable to contact such a number. Only avenue for contact is email and am yet to receive a response.
Read less

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Fantastic family Golden Wedding Anniversary Meal
Review: Right from the start the Manager and Lucy our server could not have been more helpful. We were a party of 9, there to celebrate our parent's Golden Wedding Anniversary. Our order was taken efficiently, food great and they even hid our surprise cake until we required it. This was topped off with a couple of bottle of complementary fizz thanks to the Manager. Thank you so much for making our parents celebration even more special. We would highly recommend The Crossbush and will be back again.

Name: Church Farm
Title: Lovely place
Review:
Just come back from a Monday to Friday stay lovely and clean site great customer service from all of the staff had food in the restaurant every night good price and choice deluxe caravan very clean and lovely bedding
Read less

Name: Cinnamon
Title: Best service good food
Review:
Wonderful food amazing service
Indeed everything amazing specially service from haque fantastic he make me always laugh such lovely fellow
Keep up the good job guys
One of the Best restaurant around litleheampton

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: Godzilla's butt!
Review: Crap service crap food and crap price took nearly 20mins to get served when was 2nd in line,ordered a battered sausage chips and beans came to £6.20 and tasted like Godzilla's droppings

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Saturday 15June. Night before Fathers day
Review: Family meal, 9 adults 2 children. Good location and ambience. However we were told, but only when we sat down to order, "Steaks off the menu,we have to save them for tomorrow, Fathers day". Anybody else aware of a beef shortage? Of the three orders for Rib of Beef with bubble and squeak , two were served cold. At least they did not charge me for them. Chef does not appear to know that Bubble and Squeak is fried, not just mash and cabbage. Lamb rump was tough. All in all we wont be going back.

Name: George Inn
Title: Evening date night
Review:
The George at felpham is quite frankly in a league of its own. It has everything we had hoped for from a local pub and some!

The place had so much character and the roaring fire only added to it's charm!

All the staff went above and beyond to ensure everything was perfect, and nothing was too much hassle.

The food was amazing and choosing only one dish each from the new winter menu was genuinely the hardest part!

The chef even took time to come and greet us for feedback which was so refreshing.

To top it all off, great value for money is an understatement!

Thankyou to all. Congratulations for running such a great place. See you again soon.

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Horrific service
Review:
AVOID! Terrible service. We were barely greeted by the young man serving tables, when we sat down and asked for the table to be wiped down (it was grotty, full of empty glasses and ash), a cloth was chucked on our table and the waiter left. We then decided not to spend our money here and enjoyed lovely service and food elsewhere.
Read less

Name: Parsons Table
Title: Absolutely delightful
Review: We had lunch today at TPT for the first time and we cant wait to go again. The service was seamless and very friendly. The food was outstanding and the value for lunch was so good for this quality of food. Only regret is that its not closer to where we live!! The choice was also very good and featured lots of fish. ( it was Friday!) The portions for us were perfect. Nice little touches that we find important. The bread was delicious and the butter perfect room temperature ( hate it when its too cold to spread!) Tap water was nicely presented and we had spritzers that tasted of good quality wine with our soda. The outstanding part though was for sure the food..... 10/10. Just check the website for their pictures and they are true to what we had. Lovely location too tucked away. We'll be back!!

Name: Church Farm
Title: Enjoyable wkend away
Review:
Just got back from a weekend break at Church farm Haven holidays at Pagham .

We payed for a 2 bed prestige caravan with check in time of 2pm. Check in was quick and easy, we drove to the caravan and was upgraded to a 3 bedroom there was only two of us ?. On entering the caravan and looking around it was nothing like the pics on website, it looked very tired and the living area was cramped, we had no 40 inch tv or hairdryer that was supposed to be included. I rang reception, they were very helpful and offered us a 2 bed prestige caravan , we decided to to transfer to this one and boy was we glad we did,it was nearer the complex and just looked the pics on internet. It was well equipped in the kitchen, the shower was good and a very comfy bed.

The complex was clean and well maintained, the Mash and Barrel served good food that was tasty, drinks were quite expensive, the show bar downstairs was ok, not very quick to clean tables, can’t comment on entertainment as we only saw bits of it. The terrace bar outside near the pool was clean, they just needed to wipe down tables after clearing, also be careful of the padded chairs as they hold water when it’s been raining. We had a vegetable pizza from the terrace bar and that was tasty.

All in all a enjoyable weekend away, with helpful staff and thank you to the reception staff for changing our caravan.
We have been before and will return in the future.
Read less

Name: The Gravy Boat
Title: Great lunch
Review:
First time here, even though we had not booked, we were made very welcome.I had the carvery and it was really good.Great choices and very tasty.My partner had the calves liver and bacon, followed by salted caramel pudding with ice cream.
Service was excellent.
Would not hesitate to recommend The Gravy Boat.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Meal
Review: Thank you to carol for a good meal we really enjoyed it and she looked after us and made it a good evening

Name: Wimpey
Title: Excellent
Review: Fantastic food friendly staff. And much congrats to the chef Alfie for the cooking skill you have. Great atmosphere will definitely be coming here again :)

Name: So India, Little.
Title: Inedible
Review: Dreadful takeaway that was thrown away. Had we been eating in the restaurant, we would not have paid. The mixed starter was unlike any we have eaten before. Onion bhajis and samosas were a sodden mess, drowned under some sort of sauce. The main course was pretty awful too. The rice was congealed and barely warm, the chicken dry and inconsistant and the sauce insipid. We won’t be returning.

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Disgusting overpriced and cold food
Review: My sister and I visited last week October 2019 we ordered cod and chips battered sausage and chips 2 slices of bread and butter tea and a coke. it was well overpriced. my meal was just above satisfactory my sister's was cold he said he did not have the OAP portions so she was served the normal sized portion. It was undercooked and tasted funny. She complained and she got a replacement. five minutes later a customer who had bought some takeaway brought it back and demanded her money back for the self same reason cold fish undercooked

Name: Castle Chocolates
Title: Love the fudge
Review: Mouth watering fudge. Visited here with friends. Great choice of sweets well worth a visit.by sam age 10

Name: Avisford
Title: Tired outdated hotel
Review:
Came for birthday celebration hotel has wonderful grounds but oh how tired the inside is, rooms so outdated no lift swimming pool no bar round pool, no jacuzzi needs an upgrade desperately. Surely Hilton hotels could spend some money and have a hotel in 2019 standards
Read less

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Cleanliness an Issue
Review:
After my first review of Establo I’m afraid things have gone downhill.
The cleanliness is not up to scratch and it feels the place is run by young adults who are not experienced enough to know better.
Twice I have ordered a pint glass of water and both times seeds and remains of cocktails were inside the glass, the tables are often tacky and the cutlery not as clean as it should be. All my friends have the same opinion you have to check before you eat or drink.
Finally last Thurs eve two of us ordered chicken bang bang and there was no Pak Choi, broccoli or sugar snap peas!!
Not as described at all - disappointed with all the failings - the management needs to get the place sorted!

Name: Hawking About
Title: Hawking About, unforgettable experience
Review:
What an amazing experience. Kevin broadened our knowledge about Harris Hawks. A true passion shown for the amazing birds in his care. To walk with Skye and have her soaring above you and coming down to get her treat was an experience I'll never forget. A day that will be remembered and even more special to share it with my family.
Read less

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Fun place to eat
Review: Located right on the seafront at Littlehampton, nice, clean restaurant with friendly staff and good choice of menu. Ideal for children and adults alike. Food well cooked and presented and reasonably priced.

Name: Steam Packet Inn
Title: Not open!
Review: Friday 13th September.I checked the opening times on the web site and confirmed that your open until 15.00. Arrived at 13.45; closed.Checked the website again, still saying your open.Really miffed as we traveled to Littlehampton, primarily to come to your pub. In the end, your loss is the Arun Views gain. We’ll not bother in the future

Name: LG Café
Title: Really poor
Review:
Unfortunately very disappointing. Living locally and having tried a few places around Arundel keen to give something new a go for afternoon tea, and Patisserie can be lovely when done well - unfortunately, this wasn’t!

In fairness, a warm and friendly welcome from the staff and much was made of the fact that they have two French chefs making everything fresh every morning. I couldn’t tell this from my brownie, which rather than having that fresh, chocolately and slightly gooey texture that makes a freshly baked brownie a delight was utterly lacking in flavour and you could have been eating anything. Any taste came from the icing and basically from the sugar within, which only merited a couple of mouthfuls and nothing more. Family experience similar with an eclair and tart. Coffee was ok, but just average.

If a coffee shop I’d give a two for the welcome, but when this is trying to specialise as a patisserie and fails so miserably on that point it has to be a 1. With the amount of competition around Arundel I’m afraid I can’t see it lasting unless they really improve the quality here.

Name: Butlins
Title: yuck! avoid new pool it’s disgusting
Review:
we decided to return again for the bank holiday weekend after hearing that the old and grotty pool was being replaced with a new state of the art leisure pool! what a huge disappointment!!! there is only one word for the place ! disgusting..
it’s not been open long and it’s a mess. parts of it are falling off and the place is so dirty it made me feel like i needed a tetanus shot! the changing area was so disgusting and dirty with hair and rubbish everywhere. not once did i see anyone cleaning. as many have said it’s most definitely not centreparcs!
then to add to it you can’t even accompany your children down the main slides as they are restricted to under 18?? only! i’m not sure why??? so there was very little for me to do but walk around looking at the state of the place which is supposed to be state of the art but is in fact filthy and breaking already!
then we move onto the fairground rides. half of these were broken down so basically we moved between three!
i’m sorry butlins you have really lost your edge! in tough times you will not get the customers if you don’t buck up your ideas. the state of the pool says it all. if you can’t get that right what hope do you have!
can’t see us returning, i’m paying the extra and going back to centre parcs
very very very disappointed
Read less

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: Service second to none!!!
Review:
This was a glorious one night stay for us at a top quality hotel.
We stayed in a Sussex room in the Thatched house and it was perfect. There is an underground tunnel of approx 25 metres from here to the main hotel.
The History of the hotel is fascinating and the style is just beautiful, its like being in a medieval village, read the history, as I said it is fascinating!!
The main thing about Bailiffscourt for us though was the unbelievable service from every single person we came into contact with including the manager who served us our pre afternoon tea drinks. Nothing was too much trouble for any single member of staff, credit must go to them all.
This is NOT a budget hotel, do not come here if you want £4 pints of lager and pub grub, it is high end and amazing. It is an experience to saviour, a place to relax in luxurious surroundings and be treated with upmost courtesy.
We will be back!!!
Read less

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Food hygiene? What food hygiene?
Review: So visiting relatives we took our daughter for a visit to the seafront and wanted to have traditional fish and chips! This was the closest and I wish I’d checked TA first! My partner and I shared a fish and chips due to the cost and our daughter had sausage in batter and chips. We asked for bread to make a chip butty. The bread arrived with the crusts cut off which we thought odd but then realised the bread was stale. I asked for replacement bread and when the cook held up the bread with bare hands )he didn’t look the cleanest) it was green all down the side we could see. Disgusted we said forget the bread. When we paid we expressed our dissatisfaction but were still charged full price! We now all feel sick! Avoid. This place needs FSA to investigate.

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Very cold room
Review:
The room we was in was very cold an the thermostat didn't seem to work, the women on reception was very rude and made us feel like it was our fault, definitely will not be staying here again or recommending
Read less

Name: Sen
Title: Such a shame
Review:
Such a shame... just got home from SEN. We went with our family for a nice meal. We have been a few times before and it has been lovely and well worth the money. This time however we do not feel the bill was correct (have I had known at the time I wouldn’t have paid it) we opted for the 3 tapes dish for £9.99. We were not charged this, we charged the normal rate per dish. When a member of our party asked about the bill, she was told “you didn’t ask for the deal so you got larger portions...” which is odd as no where on the menu does it state that if you opt for the deal you get smaller portions..

We have eaten there before and the portions are the same size deal
Or no deal, if they aren’t, surely you should state so on the menu?? Do not treat your local customers like tourists that you can rip off which is exactly what you thought we were.

So disappointing.

Name: Inglenook
Title: Exploring Pagham
Review: Fantastic stay! What a lovely Hotel. Very clean comfortable Bed. What lovely friendly people felt so welcome! Food was delicious. Best breakfast I’ve had in a Hotel. Can’t wait to stay here again. Pagham people all seem so friendly we going to buy house here this stay has helped us realise we made a good decision

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Despite all I hoped for - food was Poor
Review:
I had driven by a few times in my own and had also read some good reviews of this place, so in made a special effort to take my wife to the Oystercatcher.
With the lunchtime food that I was served it looks like I was the only one who made a special effort!
We had a very pleasant drink of draught lager and ordered some food. I ordered the Chicken BLT and
my wife wanted just some chips with skins on.
That’s where it all went downhill - the chips both on their own and with the BLT were over cooked to the point of them being inedible!
The bread that the BLT was in was dry and almost stale.
We had both had a long day and could not be bothered to raise the issue with the staff as in my opinion they should know if they are serving rubbish food!
It’s a pity as this was our first visit there and it will probably be our last.
Very disappointed!

Name: Grandads Front Room
Title: Mr Shaun Harding
Review:
Danny and the team do not only provide material necessary articles for people to furnish their home when NEEDED,they provide a wealth of love, compassion and empathy for all individuals circumstances thus promoting active support to help build up fellow human beings down on…
Read more

Name: Royal Norfolk
Title: Very large group visit
Review: The hotel was comfortable and clean. The staff generally were very good and tried hard to accommodate the needs of a very large group as we were. The general manager was friendly and hard working. There were some failings on the food side with choices not available for some inexplicable reason and some meals very poor and even burnt! But on the whole good value for a budget holiday.

Name: Black Horse
Title: Lunchtime
Review: We went to the Black horse for lunch, it was cold and drafty in the pub and not very welcoming. The food was ok but nothing special my friend had the burger and chips and I had a different brioche burger not over impressed in all honestly and because it was so cold and there was a real draft around your legs it spoilt any enjoyment that we could have had. So it wasn’t a comfortable experience so we wont be rushing back there.

Name: Sea View Hotel
Title: Awful Meal :(
Review: Went for family meal, Food was awful, Staff were Miserable and Unwelcoming, Garden and Restaurant Eating area had dogs in and barking at each other. Never asked how food was or anything. Had worst bit of Fish ever, Would not Go back If FREE.

Name: The Town House
Title: All round excellent restaurant
Review:
We had an amazing time at The Town House. The food was fabulous, ample portions, expertly cooked and full of flavour. We had rosti potato and smoked pheasant to start, local partridge, South Downs venison and cauliflower cheese for mains all washed down by a lovely bottle of Flurie. To finish off they made me an affogato (my favourite) and my husband had the frangipane cherry tart which was truly gorgeous. The meal was full of so many 'oh that is sooo good' moments.

10/10 to them for having a full vegi menu too, rather than just a couple of options.

We were lucky to be able to stay at the Town House too. The room was lovely, both spacious and comfortable and we were able to enjoy a lovely cooked to order breakfast.

We were extremely well looked after everyone, particularly Harry who had us laughing throughout.

Arundel is a gorgeous place and worth visiting and if there I would, without hesitation, recommend a meal (and a stay) at The Town House. And don't forget to look up whist your eating to see the most beautiful ceiling.

Name: Rowan Park
Title: late night check in!!
