Very poor all round. Not sure how others have said about friendly staff, perhaps they had left as they definitely weren’t there on our visit.

Name: The Locomotive
Title: Sunday lunch
Review: Been here a few times now for Sunday lunch. The 2 or 3 course options are great value and not been disappointed yet.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Breath of fresh air
Review:
How to start this review !!!!
Most public house/restaurants associated with big chain hotels what you in and out in the same movement or just couldn’t give a dam, well that’s our experience. Sadly.
Not so, here at The Roundstone, what a breath of fresh air.

Welcomed and seated and nothing was too much trouble, fresh food products and an amazing cooked breakfast.

Well done to all the staff, other establishments could learn a thing or two.

Would we come back, if in the area oh yes.

Not the same to be said about the premier inn next door, rooms looking tired and missing curtain middle.

Name: Anokha
Title: Best ever
Review: What a great evening we had, the waiter had a wonderful sense of humour, he was welcoming and attentive, he served at the bar, waited on the tables, organised the takeaways and all with a smile on his face, the food was excellent and they gave us a free taster starter, they made a small mistake with our order but then gave us the correct meal to take home for no extra charge, without doubt this is the best ever, we always order our deliveries from Anokha too, I totally recommend this place

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: quality of food was poor
Review:
Quality of food was poor, evening meal was greasy and breakfast pretty poor too.It was also late to arrive when i needed to get a meal early. Some staff were not overly welcoming either. Bed was good and comfy, clean room.
Read less

Name: Royal Norfolk
Title: Food horror show
Review: Just arrived back from 5 day holiday at The royal norfolk,breakfast is fine,BUT avoid evening meals at all costs.Every dish was served with disgusting roasted veg,bland and tasteless consisting of corgette sultanas too name a couple! !!!!!!!On way home had packed lunch £4.75 which consisted of one slice of ham,salad i.e. a piece of wilted lettuce,a can of pop,and ready salted crisps (no choice )

Name: Picturedrome
Title: Film
Review:
Excellent old fashioned cinema and very cheap compared to the new ones have got multiple screens so there is plenty of choice
Read less

Name: Fino
Title: A birthday treat...
Review: Our first visit... for a Sunday lunch... a little bit special as it was a 'birthday'... My roast lunch was excellent... the 'beef' was really a steak! A rump and was perfect. Friendly attentive service... we will be going again, but next time to try the evening menu. We felt it was nice to be able to go a 'quiet' restaurant... for a change... rather than pub/restaurant where the level of noise is greater... we like both but it depends on the occasion. We would recommend Fino...

Name: Tajdar
Title: Very poor
Review:
On arrival ordered drinks to get a warm lemonade which was flat and poppadoms were stale , food order was taken at 5:45. An hour later still no food and staff were poor and didn’t seem to care , so we left.
Wouldn’t recommend it

Name: Town House
Title: Outstanding
Review:
We were taken there by friends and my only regret is that we do not live closer to Arundel for, if we did, we would be there regularly.

In an old merchant’s house (admire the incredible ceiling in the front room of the restaurant) half way up the hill to the Castle, the place is friendly, attractive and the food is brilliant.

Gazpacho with the freshness of the tomatoes vying with the delicacy of the spices. A perfectly cooked haddock amply garnished with fresh vegetables, although my wife said she would not have swapped her half and half lobster for anything- quite simply half a lobster split in two with one part served cold and one warm. We progressed to their sweets - a local berries special and it too was excellent.

Well worth a detour and relaxed visit

Name: Butlins
Title: Half term fun
Review:
Stayed in Atlantic village in a newly refurbished block. Very clean, comfortable and quiet.
6 year old granddaughter loved every minute and there was something for her to do every minute of the day. Shows were professional and great entertainment but you did have to queue but that was ok.
Swimming pool looking tired now and the new one will be amazing.
Staff friendly. Food - good choice and only negative was the noise in the dining room. I dont think the music was necessary - with so many children in there, it couldn't compete
Read less

Name: Wheatsheaf
Title: Afternoon meal
Review: Went in for a afternoon meal all food saved quickly and was pleasant friendly staff and well priced will revisit again

Name: Cardanom Bay
Title: best
Review: probably the best Indian of eaten both takeaway@ eating in .Prompt delivery in an awkward PO . Had a meal with all the family on different occasions .

Name: Arden B&B
Title: A great stay, will return.
Review:
My friend and I had a great stay at this B And B. The location was excellent, a few minutes walk to both the train station and the centre of Arundel. The breakfast was lovely with a variety of options to suit all tastes. The room was comfortable and clean and most of all the landlady was helpful and friendly. Would recommend.
Read less

Name: Penang Village
Title: Not So Good
Review: Tried it twice and have been disappointed each time. Better choices elsewhere locally. Dishes are bland and pretty tasteless.

Name: The Beresford
Title: Shame when quality declines
Review:
Sad to feel the need to write this review tbh as l have been a frequent visitor in the past and the staff are very welcoming.
I do not have a problem with the calvary sure the meat portions are a bit small and the roast potatoes not always very convincing, my disappointment is the decline of some of the once amazing deserts!
They once had an apple pie that had melt in the mouth pastry that was so delicious in so generous a portion that many people shared!
This obviously couldn't carry on it was too good value and totally eclipsed the other deserts so when it was taken off the menu l found two tasty alternatives the apple and pear crumble (more like a dinky little pie tbh)or a tasty little bannofee ensemble.
Today was my birthday and l selected the apple and pear but what a disappointment the crumble was like flakes of tasteless cake crumbs on top of apple that was either pretty raw or had not been defrosted.
When l complained l was told the chef said it has been changed and the apple is fine.
I did receive a refund and declined choosing an alternative.
Sad to see so much quality giving way to increasing profit along with lack of quality conrol or ownership of faults although l will no longer be a contributor

Name: Haskins Garden Centre
Title: Very pleasant
Review: A very pleasant tea rooms situated in stunning garden centre we enjoyed cream tea and a warm pot of tea

Name: The Diner
Title: Disappointing
Review: The service was very slow, beer was flat and the food was a bit tired looking to say the least. It looked like the chips had been left under the lights for an age - very dry. Wouldn't return!

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: FAR TOO SLOW AND NOT RECEPTIVE TO COMPLAINTS
Review:
We were a large party six adults and five children.
We had booked a table and elected to sit outside as it was very warm.The mains took over an hour to arrive and the puddings also over an hour ,one desert had to be sent back as the dish was hot but the contents frozen.
The complaint,from my wife, resulted in some strange rebuffs "people like you always complain" "you have thrown my apology in my face " An explanation of the first comment would be enlightening ??
44% of the diners at this restaurant reviewed "terrible " or poor"
If this was an individually owned establishment I would say it has all the signs of a business in decline ,but it is part of Mitchell and butlers vintage inn chain.M&B owns 7000 restaurants 184 of which are Vintage inns .I have looked at other vintage Inns and it is not uncommon for the terrible or poor reviews to be around 33% of diners. I would say those are people who are not coming back .The MD of vintage inns should have a detailed look at the poor performers in their estate . I would expect the top line to be shrinking .The food was not bad but the service and response to complaints unacceptable .
I would not recommend

Name: Ship & Anchor
Title: OMG the pies are to die for!!
Review: Honestly Joy's husband makes the pies and they are insanely good, the best pies we've ever eaten! Dog friendly and staff very friendly. Highly recommend +++

Name: The Lamb Inn
Title: Excellent Service - Nice hot food
Review: The young lady who took our telephonic reservation was very efficient and extremely pleasant at reserving us a table at 30 minutes notice. Her attitude on our arriving was very welcoming and showed us to our table immediately and took our order within a few minutes. Our food arrived piping hot within reasonable time, which was excellent in quality and ample in proportions. We have been frequenting The Lamb for over 30 years and their service and quality have been maintained throughout. Will go again soon.

Name: Mustards
Title: Great Breakfast
Review: Came here for breakfast it was fantastic i had the avocado with poached eggs on rye with granola it was beautiful well worth the visit please stop by

Name: Avisford
Title: Disappointed
Review:
Pros - Great location for Goodwood festivals and beautiful grounds. Quick check in and check out.

Cons - Tiny bedroom couldnt swing a cat, rusting bathroom, dated and neglected hotel. Tiny gym which is falling apart.
Read less

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Great food and fantastic service
Review: We visited Arundel Crossbush Beefeater on 11th July 2019. Our server, Hazel, was very pleasant indeed, and made sure we felt like valued customers. The food was bought out quickly, and was fantastic quality; I had their new ‘Double Short Rib & Maple Glazed Bacon Burger’ and it was quite possibly the best burger I have ever had! I thoroughly recommend this restaurant - having come here many times over recent years I have always left very happy (and very full!).

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Two decades after my last visit and Arundel Castle is still mighty impressive
Review:
We went as a family. The last I came here wa some 20 years ago and Arundel left a big impression in me. The castle is still impressive and its still one of the best castle and stately home in England. Unlike some large castles, it's not run and marketed as some sort of theme park. Arundel Castle is run much like National Trust properties are. Although a few of the staff inside could try being a bit friendlier. It's worth coming back and it woukd be nice if they had annual membership.
Read less

Name: Ocean Hotel & Spa
Title: Could do a lot better
Review:
Hi
Just back from a weeks holiday at Butlins Bognor regis wish i had gone to Skegness.
Lets start with the ocean hotel two tiny lifts that are not adequate for the number of guests. Sometimes waiting 10 to 15 minutes to get in, over the weekend one of the lifts was out of order for 3 days. The room (411) dirty with hairs all over bathroom, carpets stained, luckily on complaint this was rectified quite quickly. We had hotel dining plan, avoid get dine around instead. the buffet consisted of a set menu every night only changing the meat option. My wife is a veggie this choice was almost non existent resorting to cheese and biscuits on third night luckily on complaint we were up graded free to the dine around option. Has any one from butlins been to lego land and seen a proper buffet? .
The pub and kitchen what a joke 25 minutes wait for dessert when mentioned to waitress she came out with lame excuse that the printer was,nt working in the kitchen
she should have realised no desserts were coming out and chased this, the dessert chef must have thought it was his lucky night being so quiet ., but worst of all the manager did,nt know what was going on. We had some side orders to pay for she got that bill wrong when rectified she could'nt work out the change £6 from £10 she had to be told by her manager.
Don,t bother queuing for rides just push in the ride operators won,t stop you.Their good at telling little ones they are to small but won,t say anything to queue jumpers (cowards). The same in the pool.
Now for the worst bit the pool is far to small for the size of the complex you are not allowed to ride the slides with your children having to stand around waiting. The cafe is separate so my non swimming wife had to sit on her own while we in the pool (thank god for costa).You cant get a drink in the pool area and chill out. The rapids are dangerous when you get to the bottom the water channels you in to the corner where there is a handrail waiting to catch the unwary. My son
 banged his head another gentleman split his forehead open and a young lad had some teeth knocked out .
There are numerous other niggles i could go into but i wont.
Overall we had a good holiday making the best of a bad week. my son enjoyed himself, the shows were funny, but we wont be going back to any butlins very quickly if ever. next year i,ll chance Disneyland Paris.
,

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Friendly and yummy!
Review:
We’ve been there twice so far since opening and enjoyed both visits! The first was a few weeks after opening so a few hiccups are almost expected.. But our second visit was outstanding! Staff are friendly and welcoming, we all got involved with dressing up! And as for the food.. Yum!!
Recommend! And will be returning again and again!

Name: Pub & Kitchen
Title: Fun night out for 20
Review: I visited as part of a large group on Saturday night for dinner. The food was fabulous, I had lamb shank which just feel off the bone, delicious. Our waiter Tony was so accommodating & friendly. Nothing was too much trouble. Every request was met with a smile.

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Lovely stay
Review:
We just stayed for one night, checking in was very friendly and quick. Our room was a double room overlooking the castle which was fabulous, breakfast was ok, lots of choices of cold/continental, cooked was not so great, although ordered at the table it was barely warm which was disappointing. I would stay here again.
Read less

Name: La Campagnia
Title: Supper
Review: Nice Italian restaurant serving traditional dishes in a cosy atmosphere and a distinct cut above the average Italian chains

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: Lovely hotel - great stay
Review:
We had a really nice long weekend here. The spa is marvellous and the location is great. The hotel staff are excellent - friendly, professional and helpful and the food is very good ( especially the breakfasts). I have a slight niggle that the menu was the same for each of the 3 nights, but it was so delicious I didn’t mind having the lobster soup twice! So why only 4 stars? It’s about value. It is expensive and I think not quite luxurious enough for its high price tag. Our room ( a Sussex room so not the cheapest) was quite small, with hardly any storage but a lot of furniture making it feel cramped. The towels are quite small and the hairdryer cheap ( you have to keep your finger on the switch to keep it going). The bathroom is lovely but there was no shelf to put my toiletries. Having said all this - we loved our stay and will return.
Read less

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Food ok. Service seriously slow
Review:
Staying in the premier inn overnight and went through for an evening meal.
Was told we're fully booked all night. No worries we'll go somewhere else. Hang on we'll fit you in. Found us a table that seats 7. 35 mins after ordering we're still waiting for our deserts and a round of drinks to arrive, but to be fair that has been the average for all the courses.
The food when it arrives is really nice, well cooked and presented well even if it is over priced.
The teenager that served us was excellent whilst the older lady was sullen and looked like we were an inconvenience to her.
If we were not staying at the premier inn would I think about using here again,
NOT a chance.

Name: Black Horse
Title: Disappointed
Review: We stopped for a bite to eat over the weekend , staff were very friendly and we were seated immediately . Firstly we noticed the strong smell of Disinfectant which smelt like it was masking a wet dog smell . We noticed a dog attached to the bar sleeping in their bed , we have absolutely no objections to animals and consider ourselves very pet friendly . But what we disagree with is that a member of staff that serves food and drink over a period of 5 minutes petting , stroking , cuddling the dog . She immediately went behind the bar , poured a pint without washing her hands , and handed the glass by the rim to the customer . This immediately put us off eat8 g and we drunk up and left .

Name: The Lamb, Angmering
Title: Superb quality and service
Review: Booked for lunch here a few days ago and simply can't praise it enough. The Lamb has been thoughtfully and tastefully refurbed and is a pleasure to be in. Tables beautifully laid with generous space between them. Excellent choice on menu but couldn't resist the pan-fried cod which was thick and generous and perfectly cooked...moist and juicy. The accompanying vegetables were delicate perfect to complement the fish. I chose one of the three well-kept real ales to go with my choice and really enjoyed it. The service throughout was top class. We will be back!

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Very nice food, good staff
Review: Overall a nice visit. The restaurant is pleasant and the staff very attentive. The food was lovely with very generous portions. The only down side was the gap between starter and main, it was less than 5 minutes from the starter plates being cleared to the main arriving. With such large portions a much longer interval would be better.

Name: The George, Burpham
Title: Great eatery
Review: Visited on the Sunday lunch just gone. Lovely menu and food. Very friendly staff. Pet friendly also.

Name: Best Western Restaurant
Title: Poor quality and value
Review: Oh dear. Meal for 6 in the Tamarisk restaurant. £241 bill and still hungry. Personally I had a crab starter.....£8 and I could have eaten the whole thing in one mouthful. Weird vaguely crabby mousse on a bed of something sweet. No bread served with it. (Did get some sliced, very dry bread while waiting for food and had to ask for more) main course of seafood linguine. So easy to make! This was a pile of overcooked tagliatelle in a thick creamy sauce that tasted horribly like my partners creamy mushroom soup starter. No white wine or garlic here. Then to dessert. It looked lovely...and the sorbet was, but the tart was straight from the fridge, hard and stodgy.....5 mins in an oven and it would have been so much better. Such a disappointment and an expensive one at that.

Name: Sen
Title: Disappointing inhouse menu
Review:
We went to SEN and were given a totally different menu to the one that is on their website. The menu was dated and expensive for what we were given.

We had looked forward to some great sounding dishes from their website but the dishes on their inhouse menu were the usual unexciting dishes served in many English tapas bars.

The starter of meatballs in tomato sauce consisted of 3 small meatballs costing nearly £5. The 4 thin slices of aubergine were also nearly £5.
The chicken shish kebab was tasty but did cost nearly £13.

All in all it was not the meal we had anticipated from the online menu which sounded great.

Name: Butlins
Title: New pool of disappointment
Review:
new pool open in june 2019... dissapointing in july 2019. getting in the changing room was a scrum with an awfually designed bottles neck on tiled floor tool was overcrowded with floor as slippery as any ice rink !. swimming was the one tbibgs we didnt do in the 4 hour visit. we stood in water, stood waiting for slide, waited for rides to be repaired, or looked on as the rapids were closed .. all in all a disappointment of a day and a opportunity to do something great missed by butlins. last of all dont be fool by the online pictures.!!
Read less

Name: Maypole Inn
Title: Disappointing
Review: I agree with a previous review. I had a lunchtime skittles Christmas meal. The skittles was good as was the company but the food was a big disappointment. The basket meal was poor, the chips dry and something described as scampi arrived, but nothing like I have ever had before. It appeared to be a ground up paste re-formed into a scampi shape (like a chicken nugget) and not proper, moist scampi tails. Not good value for money.

Name: Butlins
Title: Property stolen from our room
Review:
Stayed here 8th - 12th July 2019. This is the second year we have visited the resort. The rooms are in desparate need of a refresh but the new pool was great and that is what we have given the 1 star for. The reason for my negative review is the customer service we received after we left. Our 1 year old was sick so we rushed home and left 1 bag of our items in the electric cupboard. So as soon as we realised I attempted to call guest services. This alone took over 48 hours to get through to them. Finally I have spoken to 3 different people and was promised a call back by 12 noon once the cleaners had checked the cupboard for me. 12noon comes no call so I asked the lady when I can expect a call or call back myself. She then told me 4pm but this is when the new guests check in surely the room could be checked at 11am when the previous guests left or whilst they were there give them a curtesy knock to ask to check the electric cupboard? So I call back at 2pm to find out that our stuff has indeed been stolen which amounts to just over £300 plus a bank card. So disappointing as should this have been dealt with promtly and efficiently we could have got our stuff back. Will not reccomend butlins to anyone nor book another holiday with them.
Read less

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Ruined our stay at the Premier Inn
Review: Reserved table for the Roundstone Restaurant on arrival at the Premier Inn. Later Restaurant staff insisted that the reservation had not been received and that they were fully booked. They could however put us in the bar area but there would not be any waitress service. We were in fact shown to a table in an empty cold room devoid of any atmosphere. We were informed later that this room was the restaurant overspill area. We were waited on but the waitress was totally indifferent to our concerns with our experience thus far where we found dirty dining tables, cutlery not laid out, broken, unstable chairs with torn fabric. The food when served was of poor quality, (see photo). Nothing to write home about or recommend. Having said that, breakfast was taken in the main restaurant the next morning with personable and friendly staff in attendance and the full English breakfast that was served was a big improvement on the previous night.

Name: Rustington Golf Centre
Title: Excellent facilities, warm staff and vibrant feel
Review: Myself and a few friends came down to visit Rustington Golf Centre for the first time as the social media on facebook and instagram caught our attention. We were greeted by friendly staff who gave us a full run down of what they had to offer, followed by a delicious cup of coffee. The driving range was immaculate and the new Toptracer system was great, we could play a virtual golf course which was amazing. We played 9 holes on the par 70 course, taking around 1.5 hours to play 9 holes which was good time. We were in awe of the course condition, bunkers were pristine and the greens were playing like summer greens! The fairways were shaped very well and we came off with hardly a speck of mud on our trousers! We will definitely be returning again for happy hour on the driving range!

Name: Foxwood
Title: Great campsite
Review:
We visited this campsite for the first time this weekend with two other families. The campsite owners were friendly and helpful and really care about their business. The site is safe and very family friendly, and our kids loved going off exploring. The pitch sizes were good and the showers excellent. You are allowed to make campfires, but you must use logs purchased from the site - this is the same as other sites that we have visited in the uk. The price for the logs is £7 per bag, which is also reasonable.

The world’s end pub is about a mile away and serves good food. We also drove 15 mins to a nearby beach at littlehampton, which is recommended.

I would definitely recommend this campsite.

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Tastey
Review:
One of Mark's good pubs good ham egg and chips lovely views good service with a nice atmosphere
Goid place for lunch

Name: Glorious Spa
Title: Lovely Salon!
Review: Never had a bad experience here. I visit Amy frequently for waxing and she is super lovely and friendly, always chatty and makes you feel extremely comfortable. I actually travel specifically for these appointments as i wouldn't want anyone else!

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Would not recommend
Review: Recently had lunch here on a Saturday, table of 4 adults. The service and food very poor. Only one person serving tables. Starters arrived and were ok but not great. After 20 minutes we asked about our mains and were told they would be at least another 15-20 minutes due to another table not receiving their mains and they had be waiting 45 minutes. When the mains did arrive were not very nice and seemed over cooked. We will not being eating here again.

Name: The Mezze
Title: Birthday dinner
Review: Perfect! Food amazing, staff 100% attentive. 10/10 for The Mezze. Would highly recommend!!!! Been meaning to come here for ages and I wasn’t disappointed.

Name: T-Bone Burger
Title: Family Visit
Review: We recently visited T-Bone with a big Party of us. Straight away we was seen to our table. A new member of staff was our waitress who was very attentive. We ordered our drinks the cocktails were very good . Our food arrived pretty quick and tasted very good and our food was hot and plenty of it. Only one fault really.. The women’s toilets were very dirty! The tiles on the wall were filthy. This actually put me off ordering my food as I went to the toilet before ordering.. Hopefully this can be sorted out soon as.

Name: Motte & Bailey
Title: Disapointed, messed up Gluten free order
Review: Having a rare moment to ourselves for brunch, this cafe resteraunt seemed pefect as the menu listed gluten free bread. So after reading other establishment's menus in their windows we decided on here. My husband asked if the sausages were gluten free as he wanted the breakfast,waitress said no ( real shame as you'd expect in Arundel at least to have sausages without fillers, proper meaty one's, so major disapointment) I mebtioned my husband was very gluten intolerant, he asked to substitute the sausages for beans. I offered mine and it all looked nice, tasted nice and after the doubt crossed he's mind that the extra tasty sluce if toast wasn't GF. So I asked tbe waitress and she said " oh no it's not, you didn't say" well yes actually we did abd discussed GF alternatives too before ordering. She did return with a Slice of GF toast. Damage now done and our trip to Arundel ended with a hasty return to our own bathroom, where my hubby now has extreem gastro problems, as a result of the mess up. Such an annoying shame.

Name: The Mezze
Title: Fantastic
Review: Everything about this place reminded me of Turkey. Food and atmosphere is fantastic, true taste of Turkey. Only down side is no garden then you could of been in the country it's self . But it's the next best thing . Well done everyone

Name: Ship & Anchor
Title: Absolutely appalling worst pub I've ever been to in my life
Review: Went to the Ship and Anchor today day with some friends there was 12 of us overall gonna go in there for a quick drink and then get on our kayaks and kayak down to Arundel. the reception that we got when we got there was the most disgraceful horrible reception that I've ever received at any business or pub in my life. Disgusting, do not go there do not give these people your money. Place should be shut down.

Name: Royal Oak
Title: Sunday lunch
Review: Just had Sunday lamb roast lunch , cauliflower rock hard , roast potatoes tasted that they were reheated potatoes .. and the lamb was not the best cut fatty

Name: Waterside Café
Title: Hairy breakfast
Review:
Popped into nearest cafe prior to our visit too the castle... ordered tea and bacon sandwiches.
I'll cut to the chase....mine arrived with someones dark hair in the sandwich.
It was pointed out to the young lad and stressed that I didn't want the same sandwich back minus the hair!!
The bread is cut fresh from the loaf and unbeknown to the lad my sandwich was quite thin on part of its slice so exhibited 2 holes within the slice.
What did I get back within less than a minute but another sandwich with a thin top slice and 2 holes in it. Told the lad it was the same sandwich and he said they had replaced with new bread.
No apology from him.. took it straight back to the ordering point and said I'm not eating that.
Later a girl waiter came over with another sandwich which was refused.
Had to explain to her that an apology would have been nice.
Received a refund which I didn't ask for as thought I'd return the compliment with a trip advisor review.

What happened to kitchen hygiene and the use of hair nets or hats.
Shame about the experience as it has a perfect location by the river.
Come on guys.. dont employ any old bod in the catering trade who doesn't understand hygiene or customer protocol.

Name: Heygates Bookshop
Title: Thank you so much to the kind, caring owner
Review: Just visited this book shop as we do every holiday. The owner of the shop was so kind to me. I had just had a huge argument with my family and felt like bursting into tears because I was so upset. He spoke to me so kindly about funny books trying to cheer me up. I just want him to know that I really appreciated his kindness. This book shop is a place I would recommend anyone to visit, not only do you get the best selection of books, but you also get friendly conversation from a kind caring owner. Ps, my daughter and husband are loving their books, I will be in for a ghost book next time! Thank you 😊

Name: Butlins
Title: Just for Tots
Review:
Had a fabulous break at Butlins. Lots of activities for little ones. Stayed in the Wave hotel which was brilliant. Good choice of restaurants on site.
Only downfall was there was no hand soap in our hotel room.
Read less

Name: Cardanom Bay
Title: Not a great night, service patchy
Review:
When you open the door to the restaurant you were met with a Sullen faced manager who seem to have little or no interest in the restaurants clients when I enquired about the table booking he eventually condescended an acknowledgement.
Some advice sunshine” if you don’t like the job give it up before you ruin the business”
It was the Monday night feast night and the food was generally okay the The tableservice and unlike the reception manager were efficient and pleasant restaurant is busy of course and quite noisy but even at the reduced rates it certainly is not a place I would recommend anybody to visit

Name: The Lion
Title: 20 of us with not a problem
Review:
We went to the lion on Saturday night. There were 20 of us and kids too. Staff were amazing and took kids orders first and adults after. The female waitresses were so lovely and very patient and kids were actually very well behaved. We didn’t bother the other diners and even the waitress said how good all the kids were.
I had whitebait to start which were delicious and then the shoulder of lamb with chips. The lamb was succulent and in a tasty gravy and chips were hot and yummy. Kids had burgers which were great, mac and cheese and ham and eggs. Other adults had mussels, pork belly, sea bass and adult burgers. Everyone cleared their plates and no complaints apart from one of the burgers was a bit rare. Not expensive at all and good value for money. Would recommend.

Name: Qmin
Title: Chicken chat
Review: Quite a few people said you must try it ! So I did, chicken chat and korma with a touch of heat, fabulous

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Disappointing
Review:
We have eaten here on previous occasions and food has usually been ok but the service has been routinely patchy. Last night it reached a new low
There was one waitress, who was very pleasant but who was rushed off her feet. She took our drink order which then took over thirty minutes to be brought to the table.
There were several items on the menu that were not available even though it was very early in the evening. The food service was very slow. We had to ask twice for a carafe if water and it finally arrived just as we were finishing our meals.
The waitress apologised for the delays and she was working hard under real pressure. The fault was not hers. It is down to poor management and organisation
We won’t hurry back

Name: Hawking About
Title: HAWK WALK
Review:
The Hawk Walk was a fantastic experience
from great communication at the very start and easy to organise. Kevin gave us plenty of time on the walk and was very informative about his Hawk , Storm. As we walked through the woods Storm would swoop down onto our gloved hand. It was very laid back and enjoyable, a terrific experience and I would definitely recommend it.
Read less

Name: Vicky's Café
Title: Probably the unfriendliest place I have ever visited
Review:
Let me set the scene. 10am early for a meeting, decided I’d try the café that advertises as the best, on their boards on the main road. Go into the place and i was the only person there other than an elderly gent, door open on a cold day, tried to shut door which was stuck open. Music playing in the back kitchen where the host (presume Vicky) was at doing nothing in particular. Eventually she came to the front, no hello, no smiley face just a miserable attitude. I ordered a bacon sandwich and a cup of tea. I asked politely for ketchup on the sandwich, then informed “it’s on the table”. I asked for strong tea without sugar, to be told abruptly “sugar on the table and the bag’s left in to sort myself”. It cost £3.50, I only had a £10 note and was rudely asked if I had smaller. I said no and offered a card, then got change and sat at the table. Then the other gent got up and ordered, same attitude and when he asked for crispy bacon was told “obviously that’s going to take longer”.
After a while and relative silence in the restaurant area and muffled music from the back, my sandwich was delivered (nearly thrown on the table). Dry old bread, under cooked bacon and cheap Margarine. Someone else came in during my stay to check if they were open as he’d tried on two previous days to get in and they were shut. He was given such attitude by this lady that I’d be surprised if he came back with his 5 friends, I wouldn’t have and certainly won’t be going back there again. Absolute waste of money and certainly worth driving passed. (No zero points unfortunately)

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Sunday Lunch
Review:
We were looking forward to having Sunday lunch with friends at the Castle Restaurant.
We found the Hotel car park at the rear of the hotel, but after entering through a barrier, I went to get a permit to park the car and was told we would have to pay £10 to park, as we were not staying at the hotel(WHY) the car park was empty!!! Bearing in mind we were about to spend over £100 for lunch. We then left and parked in the road free.
We then went back in to get a coffee while waiting for our friends. The barman looked like we had asked for something unusual ( 2 Americanos), he went across the courtyard as that was where the coffee machine was!
Our friends arrived and the waiter was hovering waiting for us to take our place at our table, this was now about 1pm, the restaurant was completely empty! We were surprised as it was Sunday lunch. We were then told that some of the choices on the menu were not available, the roast only included chicken or Pork Belly(not what you would expect on a Sunday no Roast Beef!). However the food was ok really nothing that exceptional.
Where were all the people, very soulless, heated by a fan heater although they did have an open fire! After time a couple came in for lunch and another for a cream tea.
We left quite disappointed and will not return. We have been to some really superb restaurants in the area nothing like this.
Read less

Name: Aviator
Title: Nice pub with football (Sky)
Review: My father and I spent the afternoon watching football here, there isn't much choice in Bognor now for watching football. We had a really good relaxed time and chatted to some nice people. The service at the bar was great and the whole atmosphere very relaxed. A good range of beer and I especially liked the aviation theme throughout the pub. Lots of people eating, which is a positive sign but I have no experience of apart from the beer and great atmosphere. Thanks we will return.

Name: Ye Olde Fish and Chippe Shoppe
Title: Still using polystyrene cups!! Shameful
Review:
I give the shop 1 star, not because of the food, but the use of polystyrene cups to store the mushy peas and sauces. There are so many environmentally friendly alternatives. They need to stop using polystyrene it’s just so bad for the environment. Please change to something else!

The food itself is otherwise good.

Name: The Lamb, Angmering
Title: Great Service, Fabulous food.
Review: Unimposing from the outside but the welcome is warm and friendly, the food superb and the young staff efficient and professional we were inn Angmering for 4 nights and had dinner here twice. Very Very good and not overly expensive.

Name: Aldwick Café
Title: Rude staff
Review: went for lunch today ordered jacket potato with cheese takeway got to office opened box found potato with chill con took back after got the rudest reply from the owner

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Afternoon early meal
Review:
Naively i thought they might have improved but alas no
Of course they are catering for day trippers crowds and that suits their needs perfectly well
However if you have any sort of idea of wanting an above average meal this is not the place for you
the service is ok
Ambience ok
Food hmmmm not worthy of mention

Name: Mustards
Title: oasis in bognor
Review: lovely food served in an area that is less than wholesome, but dont be put off, it is worth the risk, i had lamb three ways, delicious, i thought the wine was a bit steep but what the heck, food outweighed all, will definitely return

Name: WWT Wetland
Title: Great for the kids and adults alike
Review:
Nice day out with the family...4 generations of us and it was suitable for all...this would be great for all abilities as everything has been provided. Easy access for most things, even the boat ride. Loads to see and do, especially for the kids which is much needed...maybe more picnic areas as we struggled to find some that weren't around the play areas...more bins dotted around would be good too... lovely clean cafe. Price not too bad but don't mind paying for this type of attraction as it's a good cause. We went over the Easter holidays and did the duck hunt, which was too confusing for younger kids and too long winded.
Read less

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Not very good!
Review: Came here for Mother's Day. The fish and chips I had was okay, but my parents told me the roast was dreadful, as indeed it looked to me at the time. The fact the dining room was practically empty at one o'clock on Mother's Day was probably a give away. Got the impression it was a drinkers pub, not at all classy. Will avoid in future.

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Had booked into the restaurant for lunch on Sunday Feb 17th
Review:
The meal was average...not the best for such a renowned hotel..small portions as well as not enough vegetables for the 4 of us. Our whole experience was ruined when we were told we'd need to pay £10 to park our car at the back of the hotel. Never again...daylight robbery
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: From our point of view.. It wasn't for us.
Review:
I am coming at this from a mum of a 3 year old who we usually take to centre parcs.
first off some of the staff were amazing and I hope this review dosen't put the place in much of a bad light, but at the same time let me explain why it was not a good holiday for us.
First of all the "schedule" compared to CP yes there are activities which are scheduled... BUT dose the pool have to be so ridged in its times during a tots week? CP are open all day every day with food and drink available... with a swimming mad son... and this being his only really love at the place it gave us little to do the rest of time...
You might be think ahh there are shows.. rides, slot machines, activities, stuff to do around the park... well... Not for us..
Son didn't like the rides, didn't like the shows and the slot machines (which I really wasn't happy with... introduce your child to gambling... emmmmmm...) 30 mins at the most of entertainment. The winter break and constant rain meant we were stuck inside the resort and thus we exhausted the craft activity was left craving to go home. The one show we did take him too ended up scaring him...
He could not go on the big soft play because of the height restriction
The bed was dirty on arrival (They changed it right away)
The pool changing area could have offered overshoes.
We ended up coming home early and little one was sick and then my husband and I came down with it 2 days later...
Having been to CP both UK and Belgium they seem to offer less yet we get so much more out of the holiday. Maybe its because we really don't like that type of entertainment. I have left feedback with them... we had a reply, which they didnt address my issue over the gambling aspect of the site. wont be going there again.
Read less

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Great day out
Review:
We had a really interesting enjoyable day here ar this beautiful castle & gardens..
Good value & well organised nice food and restaurant
Read less

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Really Disappointing Return
Review:
We hadn't visited The Oyster Catcher for over 9 months since moving house. However, it really seems to have gone downhill. Stood in a queue of about 9/10 today whilst one person was taking orders. The other person decided to put glasses away and ignored the queue.
Tables outside had not been cleared and cleaned - We used our own water to clean our table.
Waited nearly 30 mins for a Burger and Pie. I had to check how much longer we had to wait and was told it would be out of the kitchen next . And as if by magic it was.
Then the real disappointment the Wagyu burger was done to a crisp - I mean really well done. We asked the waitress to take a look at how well done the burger was. She told us that it was the company policy to server burgers "well done" and she walked off without further debate.
The "company" should visit The Gribble Inn to see how a burger should be cooked and served.
The pie was good but carrots were sad and cabbage (assumed cabbage) was good to death and had little flavour. A couple of pictures attached.
I would have mentioned this to the manager but it was too busy.
We won't be going there again.

Name: Simla Tandoori
Title: Questionable hygiene...
Review:
My partner's father had phoned ahead to book a table... Upon arrival, restaurant was empty, but, being a Monday evening, it didn't cause too much concern. (Prefer bit of space!)
The food seemed reasonable, but later that evening, and over next 24-48 hours, we ALL suffered upset stomachs.
This is the only venue where myself, partner, and her parents had eaten together, and would suggest something may have been amiss? Naturally, it is difficult to pinpoint where the issue might have been, but, the aftermath was undesirable!

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Don't know what to say
Review: So our story here is a short one, family of 5 got seated quickly given menus then ......... waiting...... waiting.......waiting ........,.gave up and left. So can't comment on the food but if you can't order any then I guess that says all you need to know. We left for a lovely local restaurant the Arun view, there you actually get served and get to eat .

Name: La Campagnia
Title: Treated like royalty!
Review: We have dined here before and enjoyed the experience and decided to take some friends. We hadn't pre-booked but was given a table by the window. The wife and I dined on sardines, our friends had the mixed meats platter. The portions were generous and very tasty. The second courses ( various pastas ) were just as tasty and we'll presented. At no time were we hurried. We all enjoyed good Italian food served by well trained staff who looked after us without fault. Thanks very much, we will return!

Name: Comfort Inn
Title: My home from home
Review: This is a great place to stay. I work down here a lot and always book here. A great hotel for tradesman as there is ample parking to the rear. Brilliant staff who always make you feel welcome and will do what they can to make your stay a good one.

Name: Butlins
Title: Waste of money
Review:
A family group of 16 all had gold accommodation, in Atlantic bay. I dread to think what bronze is like.
When we got accommodation in one of the Sofas had a big rip in it. They did change it, but the mess underneath it was revolting, peanuts and general rubbish. Seems to the refurbishment is new carpet.
Swimming pool is a paddling pool, just a small adult area to actually swim in water past your knees.
The whole experience was a waste of money. You can buy pass passes for £15 to get into entertainment, but unless you want to sit in there for 2 hrs before anything starts then don’t bother.
Certainly won’t ever return.
DONT BE FOOLED BY THE PHOTOS EITHER
Read less

Name: Café 83
Title: Slooooow
Review: With no other orders pending why does it take 25 minutes to prepare 2 panini? The next customer after waited 30 minutes for his food. I didn't actually give us what we wanted in our panini but after such a long way we need to eat it and get going to an appointment. Needless to say we won't be going back.

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: SUNDAY LUNCH
Review: Never again. I have had 3 meals at this venue and each of them have been dreadful. Determine to give them a fair chance, I kept going back. Very sad really because it's a lovely venue and I really, really wish they would sort their Kitchens out.

Name: Pub & Kitchen
Title: Good range of foods for adults and kids
Review: Staff were friendly and the food was a good range of pub food and came pretty quickly. Didn't have to queue at all any time we were there which makes a difference to the rest of the resort!

Name: Boat House In the Marina
Title: Peaceful environment with tranquil setting
Review:
visited for the first time yesterday with friends yesterday. The fish was fresh and batter cooked to perfection. Beautiful surroundings overlooking the Marina and countryside. Tranquil setting was an asset to an enjoyable lunch.
Staff friendly and helpful, and food served on time. Can't wait to make this place a regular meeting point, and highly recommend this restaurant.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Let Down
Review: Our table was booked for 6pm and after a short wait taken to our table. Our drinks order of 2 pints was taken straight away. The waitress at one point said she would chase up our drinks. Nothing happened. She told us that she was on her own and that everyone came in at once. Not really my problem and to be honest it wasn't that busy. Another waitress came in duty at 6.30. One of the chefs was actually serving food to customers. Finally after 40 minutes the waitress came to take our food order and still no drinks!! She finally bought one pint over which turned out to be flat. I took it back to the bar myself rather than wait for the waitress and was told that they had just changed the barrel and would bring our drinks over directly. After waiting a further 5 minutes we walked out must as the waitress was bringing our drinks. Extremely disappointed. Will not be returning any time soon if ever. What a complete let down!!

Name: Avisford
Title: Not up to Hilton Standard
Review:
I am so disappointed in this hotel - staff are friendly .. so this is not about them but to say the hotel is tired is an understatement. The building maintenance is shocking with rotten windows and a full dog waste bin near my room obviously been like that for a while. I was fortunate enough to have a nice room but the wallpaper was coming off the walls. I think this hotel damages the Hilton brand such a shame as I am a loyal Hilton guest.
Read less

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: Good for a short break in Arundel
Review:
Stayed here with my family. We had a quite room with very little noise from other guests. The price was very good for the 2night stay. It is what it is for a budget hotel but beds were comfortable and room spotless. Reception staff very helpful.
Read less

Name: Littlehampton Caravan Site
Title: Never again
Review:
Greeted no, welcomed no, commanded to park in an exact position. When I pointed out that our awning was on the other side because it is a French build, how inconvenient, then commanded to park in the opposite direction but MUST be in line with a marker post.
Their website clearly states you can join when you arrive, not so, told we should have joined before arriving. £40 per night! £12 supplement for non members, what a rip off.
These people would fit in well with the Hitler Youth.
Customer service is a foreign language absolutely disgraceful.
And internet is extra, on top of £40 per night, do me a favour.

Name: Pagham Beach
Title: beach visit, never got to see it re parking issue, not welcomed
Review: we read the good reviews and thought great, staying in caravan site near by, so off we drive and we thought we must have missed somewhere to park, went along a very bone shaking dirt track that finally came to an end and lots of signs saying no parking,, I do not walk too far so need to park near to places I want to visit. THEY REALLY MUST HATE VISITORS THERE. Other areas we found lots of yellow lines.. So in the end we gave up and drove out of it, after all you either want the custom or you don't and with a huge potential of caravan visitor income they have turned their noses up. We were 2 older people not some sort of riff raff and from what we experience Haven site is alot better than another well known firm who can have lots of nasty finds. Often we are seeing that where there is a caravan site for holidays the areas seem to be run down, question which came first. It is odd that when we came this way before we went west of Pagham for days out and they did not want us in those places either. one place it wanted £10 to park it began with W. so we turned the car around and got out fast. That was quite posh, so again it is not on my door step thank you. We come from the Ashdown forest area re Winnie the pooh visitors and near by spa town too and i have not seen this sort of anti social attitude.

Name: Famous City
Title: Almost perfect!
Review: The actual food is lovely, well priced, delivery was quick, everything delicious, genuinely filling. Didn’t have that tired or hungry again an hour later feeling.... only fault is the curry with chips doesn’t come with enough sauce. Would be better to have a bag of chips and a pot of sauce instead of premixing. We’ll be back!

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Just awful ........
Review:
and quite possibly the worse food I have ever eaten. We were a group of 4. One of our meals was sent back to the kitchen, another had a sauce so lumpy it looked like the plate had been vomited over, a third was such a tiny portion it would barely pass as a starter and a fourth was probably no more than ok.
Just awful and the place really needs to get its act together. Avoid it at all costs until it does.

Name: Tuptim Siam
Title: Very disappointing
Review: Three of us went for a lunchtime meal on Sunday. Admittedly it was only £6 a head and quite busy. We are all seasoned travellers having experienced authentic Thai food many times. I’m not sure why other reviewers have given this place a good score but I can honestly say that the buffet food on offer was absolutely dreadful. There was no decent curry but a medley of vegetable based dishes that all tasted much the same, i.e. bland with no authentic flavour at all. The rice was cold as were some of the main dishes. We asked about drinks and were told there was only apple juice or tap water. I tried hard to eat my meal but in the end left most of it. The management needs to rewrite the menu and quite honestly I could do it for them. No one asked if we enjoyed the meal but if they had we were prepared to tell them. Please don’t go there! There are other authentic Thai restaurants in the area.

Name: Black Horse
Title: Curry and quiz night
Review:
My wife and I came to the curry and quiz night the other week.

The curry was very nice indeed. We both felt that the portion size could maybe have been a little bit bigger. Having said that, we didn't feel short changed by the size it was. We both fancied a dessert; at first the waitress said that the chef wasn't doing desserts as he wanted to concentrate on the curry (Which was fair enough.) but then came over to our table a little later to say that the chef was now doing desserts. I went for the cheesecake and my wife went for ice cream; both of which went down a treat.

The quiz was good fun and one of the better quiz's we've been too in the area. We'll definitely be back for more Black Horse quiz night's, other commitments permitting.

The Black Horse is definitely one of those places worth making a trip too. Keep up the good work guys :)

Name: Premier Inn Arundel
Title: Valentines stay
Review:
we stayed here for a few nights over Valentines we had a lovely stayed and well looked after just same about have breakfast in the a joining beef eater but we learn our lesson and went into arundel the following morning for an amazing fry up. all and all nice place to stay.
Read less

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: Just wow
Review:
This place was wonderful. At a wonderful price. You go here knowing this is a luxury. It was stunning from when we first arrived to when we left. We went when the weather wasn’t amazing so we didn’t go down to the beach but for walkers this would be amazing. We stayed in the upgraded rooms with the four poster bed and it was absolutely incredible. So comfortable and just nice touches like homemade cookies for you. The food was outstanding. We had the dinner deal and chose from the better menu at an extra cost. The food was absolutely amazing, the drinks were great. I had the recommended English sparkling and it didn’t disappoint! The spa is very nice and on a weekend after 11:00 it was lovely a quiet. We both had the mediterranean massage which was an hour and a half and just glorious. If we didn’t have a life and no where to go we would have happily stayed in the spa all day. Couldn’t recommend this place just for a nice weekend or night off. However it comes at a hefty price. You only live once though right?!
Read less

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Great Service and Food
Review: Stopped off for a break and dinner. Great service, Lynsey definitely provided the entertainment with her witty remarks. Very pleasant atmosphere. Would recommend.

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: Noisy, overheated and no hot water.
Review: This hotel is very tired. There's traffic noise, no air-con and the boiler had packed up when we visited. The staff were very good and were badly let down by the hotel. It seems as if this hotel is overdue for refurbishment.

Name: Chez Moi
Title: délicieux
Review:
Actually popped out for an Italian but was fully booked and stumbled across Chez Moi.
I’d like to say a massive thank you for turning us away as this was the find of the holiday.
Fantastic service and beautiful food. They even accommodated our 12 year old by amending the dish to his taste.
Shame we’re going home tomorrow as would definitely have visited again.
Highly recommend to anyone.
Thanks again.

Name: East Beach Café
Title: Lovely lunch
Review: We have just enjoyed a lovely lunch at this Cafe overlooking the beach. Car Parking charge a bit high. Food at the Cafe was very tasty. Kedgeree with poached egg and crab linguini. A real change from usual fish n chips.

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: Fabulous
Review:
Just back from what felt like a week but was just a weekend stay with you! 4th visit over a number of years. The absolute best!! Staff were fabulous - sorry but a huge improvement. Spa (thanks Annabel) brilliant!
RELAXING (which I find hard).
Book early for treatments and dining!
Photo one from outdoor jacuzzi across heated outdoor pool!!!
Fabulous x
Read less

Name: Ye Olde Fish and Chippe Shoppe
Title: Very good fish and chips
Review: Service was polite and welcoming. The food was cook-to-order but we still received it quickly. The portion size was hearty and the little seating area outside provided an added bonus. Very good if in the area.

Name: Hotham Park
Title: Lovely place to go for a walk around.
Review:
Lovely carvings from fallen tree's here. In the summer it would be fabulous for picnics. In winter it is still a good place to go with a very good cafe to get refreshments.
Read less

Name: Mustards
Title: Outstanding !
Review: This is a fairly new restaurant in Bognor Regis and replaces a popular cafe style restaurant on the site. It has done so with excellence !

Name: Butlins
Title: Julie V greeted us on arrival and was extremely helpful and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble. A delight to meet.
Review:
Great time had. Noise level high at night but to be expected on an adult weekend. Clean amenities and friendly staff. Security very helpful and friendly. Julie V was on hand to assist and made our stay fabulous.
Read less

Name: Norfolk Gardens
Title: Lovely golf setting by the sea. Shame about extremely rude staff who locked us in after hours! Will not be back!
Review: Tagged along with husband and his mate so they could knock around the beautiful 9 holes here late on a Saturday afternoon.A young 6 year old boy who doesn't play golf at all in our party showed and interest half way around so my husband showed him how to do a few swings. The old miserable man working there came and had a go at us calling us dishonest for not paying for him when he hadn't actually played the 9 holes, (and nor did the guys in the end!) He ended up saying that his wife was waiting for him to go home and we had held him up from leaving and locked us in without telling us he would do so.Resulting in myself having to get over a wall/gate when I'm currently 7 months pregnant and also us having to lift our 15 month old toddlers travel system buggy over the wall/gate too! Absoutely disgusting behaviour. He shouldn't work with the public in my opinion. A guy in our party is local there and hes known for being a misery apparently! Wont be back and will not recommend despite the beautiful setting etc. Cant excuse bad staff imo as I work with the public myself.

Name: Ship & Anchor
Title: Dont go there
Review:
Yesterday 10 of us went to the ship and anchor. Its opening hours were shown as open but we got there at 4pm, and it was closed.
We then went to leave via the pub car park onto the river bank but were stopped by a man who informed us it was a private gate only and we couldn't go out that way (the only way in and out of the pub onto the river bank path!?). So, being polite, we turned around to leave, using the only road that comes into the pub, and then, we then had some ranting very angry woman who was taking our photos and telling us we had to pay £5 each to leave!
We didn't pay and wont ever be going back there.

Name: Foxwood
Title: Lovely stay in the woods! Very clean toilet block
Review: We had a great stay camping amongst the trees. Lovely setting with choice to camp in the field or in the woods section. The woods were quieter and a lovely setting, with open space for sitting out. Also great that we were allowed open fires! Toilet block was well maintained throughout the weekend

Name: Mustards
Title: lovely food-incredible value-nice people
Review:
Just come back from Sunday lunch with my wife.
First time visit but it will certainly not be the last.
Presentation of the food was top class as was the cooking.
The price -17.95 for two courses represents extremely good value.
Staff were very friendly and professional.
Deserves its best restaurant in Bognor rating.
I thoroughly recommend a visit.
ps-they serve cocktails and have a mixologist in Saul

Name: LG Café
Title: Super visit
Review: We visit Le Gouter today and we were not disappointed, the staff were super friendly and went out their way to make sure all our family had an amazing experience from the youngest to the oldest. The food was out of this world, the pizza me grilled sandwich was epic, cooked to perfection. But the cakes are what makes this place amazing, they look incredible but unbelievably taste even better. I would leave more than 5 stars if I could

Name: Littlehampton Harbour
Title: Boaring Visit
Review: The pontoons are very well kept , clean on shore facilities below the main harbour office . Very friendly and helpful harbour board staff . Plenty of restaurants on the quay side . Great little seaside town .

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: What a wonderful place to visit
Review:
Carol Kirkwood, the weather presenter on BBC Breakfast, had presented from the Castle gardens when there was a Tulip Festival on and so, as it as still on, my wife decided we should go and see it on our way from Winchester to Hastings.

Are we glad we did!! The grounds with all the tulips were stunning with all the flowers in splendid bloom.

We were then inspired to visit the Fitzalan church and then the castle itself. What a treasure that is, although if you want to see it all, be warned that there is some climbing involved. But again, the whole visit was well worth the effort.
Read less

Name: Lemongrass Restaurant
Title: Not amazing, actually. And a service charge.
Review: This place used to be better and it used to be good value. But it provides neither good food or good value now. I don’t know what’s changed but the only good thing about our visit was the soup. They added a service charge to our table of 4 which I think is out of order. If I had just been with my family I would have had it removed but they rely on people not wanting to feel awkward about removing the charge. We only had 2 small beers each and the bill including service was £160. It’s just not worth it. Will never go again. There are better Thais in Chichester.

Name: KFC Bognor
Title: Disgusting hygiene,
Review: How is it possible to manage a restaurant as such. Toilets, restaurant ground, tables...everything was just disgusting. It's a shame for such a brand. Even the windows were not clean and don't look at the terrace.

Name: Bognor Museum
Title: Interesting Museum
Review:
Well looked after and interesting museum, with lots of local memorabilia. Deffinately worth an hour of your time.
Read less

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Awful Christmas Day Meal
Review: Paid £57 per person for a Christmas day meal. Absolutely awful, All the courses had items missing, we waited an hour and 30 mins for the main course. None of the waiting staff offered us any drinks in this time or explained why we were left waiting so long for our food, which looked nothing like the photos on the menu (see photo). Have had previous meals here and never had a problem, but this has put us off returning.

Name: Aldwick
Title: Fantastic
Review:
Excellent B and B, lovely welcome from host Mike, given ice cold water in the room. Lift to all floors, comfy beds. Near to sea front but not noisy. Fantastic lady called Dina from Switzerland was service in breakfast toom and she was so friendly. Breakfast choice was vast, cereals, fruit, yoghurts, porridge, toast and full english cooked breafast and tea coffee whatever you wanted. We shall be returning very soon, great place to stay with a really lovely atmosphere.
Read less

Name: Dolphin Hotel
Title: A great experience
Review: In these days of bland, uniform, boring chain pubs, visiting this unique, characterful, slightly quirky pub was an absolute pleasure.

Name: The Mezze
Title: Gorgeous meal as always!
Review: Gorgeous fresh and tasty food, as always! Very welcoming and attentive staff, despite being very busy, they are always friendly and there is a lovely atmosphere

Name: Littlehampton Beach
Title: Shell collecting
Review: It maybe mainly pebbles but there's a high water mark row of shells towards Mewsbrook park that kept the children amused. Clean beach with lots of parking and refreshment facilities.

Name: Lemongrass Restaurant
Title: Service horrific
Review:
Visited last night for a celebratory meal. Service was dismissive and rushed. Very quickly we were asked to order and then twice after that, each time saying no we weren’t ready. Staff were hovering behind us it was clear they wanted us to order. Had chicken satay and dumplings to start. Chicken was ok but dumplings were the worst we’d ever had, hard and dry.
Starter plates were cleared and I still had food in my mouth eating. Was wondering what the rush was and then I realised, the other waitress was stood behind with our mains. Hated this as had no break in between starters and mains and again it was made apparent there was a rush.
I had ordered what was meant to be a very very mild curry. It still had chillies in and was too hot to eat. Maybe the reason for this was that the waitress wasn’t even making eye contact when taking our order and was in a rush?
One waitress asked why I hadn’t touched the curry and we explained it was too hot to eat more than a mouthful. Rather than helping she walked away?!!!
When our plates were cleared another waitress apologised and told us we wouldn’t be charged for it. Very kind and we did appreciate this. But she said to mention it earlier in the future and they could have changed my meal. (We had mentioned it earlier and this didn’t happen).
Bill came and there was an automatic 10% service charge on there. Something we would have refused to pay had they not taken the curry off in good gest.

Overall we were in and out in 1 hour, nearly £80 down. That is not what we expect when you save to go for a celebratory meal. Felt so rushed and unwanted the whole time, and can not believe we were only there for one hour. Other food ordered was nice enough but service is horrific and means we won’t be returning!

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Rotten salad and vegetables
Review: Out waitress was really lovely, unfortunately that’s where the positives end. We waited ages to be seated and the food also took an age to come. The salad with my starter was brown and the vegetables with my main were no better, they looked like they’d been cut a week ago. The manager did take this off our bill and apologise, I’m just left wondering how on earth this food left the kitchen in the first place. My husband’s burger was revolting, like a cheap value one someone tight brings to a BBQ. We didn’t complain about this, he was so hungry from waiting so long he just ate it, I tried a bit and I wouldn’t have been able to stomach it. My pie was the only saving grace, it was quite nice. I think they need to look carefully at their supplies and kitchen practices.

Name: Mustards
Title: Ruined my wifes Birthday
Review: Eaten here loads of times before, always exceptional, never felt the need to leave negative feedback for anyone else before, but on this occassion i feel our experience tonight deserves it.Food was disgusting, turns out the local big business man was having a staff get togethor so it appears he's money is more important than mine, oh well they're loss. Eat here but only after asking the question about who has booked on the same evening. Tonight was my Wifes birthday, and they ruined it. Cheers..

Name: Black Horse
Title: Casual food and wine with friends
Review:
Very hospitable. Super friendly staff. Spotlessly clean. Great wine and good food. Well worth visiting. Suitable for families, couples or friends.
Highly recommended.

Name: Fino
Title: Superb
Review: Been here twice in as many months. Love the food as it is slightly different for Italian. Well presented, freshly cooked abundant menu. Daily editions. Staff enjoy working there.

Name: Swan Hotel
Title: Sunday lunch
Review:
Heard the news that this is the place for Sunday lunch in Arundel. Lunch was fine but accompanied by eye watering London +++++ prices for drinks. Raised it with manager who shrugged and was sorry about that ... hmm
Read less

Name: Wheatsheaf
Title: Mr r wadey
Review: Great Christmas lunch staff went the extra mile been several times since and been great highly recommend

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: access to wheelchair users
Review:
I would like to offer a great review BUT I am fully dependant on using my manual wheelchair and cannot use the site Buggy to get from the visitor entrance to the castle which is up a long and steep gradient. This in reality makes this attraction impossible for me to see as cars are not allowed to enter the site. Surely the site could invest in a buggy that takes people in a wheelchair that cannot transfer to the Buggy. I am really disappointed that they have not really understood the real meaning of access for all
Read less

Name: World's End
Title: Great Country Pub
Review: We were both greeted in a friendly welcoming manner although even though it was a Thursday evening and was very busy a table was quickly made available for us. We just enjoyed a main meal of Chilli Bean & Squash risotto and Rose Veal which were great. The service was great so we will definitely visit again. Well worth searching out

Name: Navigator
Title: If you dont want any sleep stay here
Review: Do not stay in the hotel part above the pub and definitely avoid room 5 as the noise is absolutely horrendous everytime water is used you get woke up, I have stayed in the navigator too part which was fine, breakfast was fine,staff were fine but like i say if you want to sleep this ain't for you

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Bit pricy but beautiful!
Review:
Really lovely castle and grounds - I loved seeing the enamel rosary beads of Mary Queen of Scots especially.
Read less

Name: The Lamb, Angmering
Title: Great food
Review: the place has great food, fantastic staff and lovely atmosphere. really enjoyed eating here and found it great value for money

Name: 47 Mussel Row
Title: Perfect
Review: Visited here with husband Saturday night. We had pre booked a table which we were glad of as it was busy. Both starters, prawns and scallops were beautifully cooked and well presented. Mains were also superb, i had the pork dish which was wonderful and my husband had the shrips/grits which he said was the nicest meal he had eaten out for a long time. Cheese board and plum and almond tart to finish washed down with a bottle of Rioja. Fabulous!! Not the cheapest place to eat but superb food, excellent service and wonderful atmosphere. I would definitely recommend and we will be returning soon with friends

Name: Littlehampton Beach
Title: Littlehampton Beach
Review: This is a first class beach,lifeguard supervised and as long as you swim within the markers it is very safe. There is also Avery pleasant promenade with a large grass area where you casita do picnic. There is a large but gets full early in good. Weatheri

Name: China Royal
Title: Downhill
Review:
I’ve never had an issue with this place,
However I ordered I delivery and it came within 20 mins, which is strange considering it is a 5min drive away and was 2 meals..
It arrived warm, not hot.
The crispy beef was stale, it was far from crispy.
The rice was so gloopy and sticky you could build a house with it.
The salt and pepper chicken was hard.
And the crispy seaweed had no flavour and tasted like it had just been left out half of the day.
Honestly. It was awful and 90% of it went in the bin.
Very disappointed

Name: St Mary's Gate
Title: Day trip from Essex.
Review: A day trip spoiled by the frustrating delay in serving our lunch.Having a limited amount of time, we had carefully timetabled our afternoon to allow time to visit the Castle and the Cathedral.Having to wait well over an hour, for a simple plate of fish and chips , meant that we had to hastily eat, no time for dessert, and had to miss a visit to the castle.Would certainly not recommend.

Name: The Holly Tree
Title: Great to be back
Review:
We haven’t been back here for a while but when we did it we were so glad as it was fabulous and the whole evening was fun and the food was delicious.
I understand new chefs are in place and it really does make a difference.

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Very disappointing
Review:
We were having a 2 night stay in the Premier Inn attached to this "restaurant" We often use the "Premier Inn Basildon" for breakfast £9.50 all you an eat, and it is excellent, waitress service, always cooked fresh and always hot, not so here at the Robin Hood. The menu is advertised as "Premier Inn" and as such you would expect a similar standard - no such luck, We eagerly went down to breakfast to discover a buffet type set up. Cold bacon, over cooked cold sausages, scrambled eggs etc. No bubble and squeak, no poached eggs. All available food was put on to cold plates resulting in a very disappointing breakfast.

That evening we decided to try the evening menu, again the same as our local "Premier Inn", why oh why did we bother - we had booked a table for 7.30pm, went down at 7.30 to discover they had given our table away!! We took a table in the bar as offered without making any fuss, were handed menus and told of 2 items unavailable, Hubby made his choice - cod and chips and I made mine - chicken in a basket only to be told "Oh sorry thats not available" Made a 2nd choice "Oh thats not available either" - and my 3rd choice was unavailable too!! By this time I had lost the will to live and went for gammon roast, 2 very small slices of gammon 3 awful soft roast potatoes and mixed veg arrived with a yorkshire pudding you could have used as a ping pong bat!! NOT GOOD! My husbands fish was not much better, grey looking cod with soggy batter - the triple cooked chips were the only saving grace. I felt very sorry for our waitress as she knew it was not good - she offered us free desserts which we accepted as we were starving. Mine was delicious (chocolate and raspberry torte) my husbands vanilla ice cream was ok too!

Our actual Premier Inn room was lovely, clean tidy and as you would expect, but you really need to sort out the restaurant side of things - we were advised by the grumpy restaurant manager that the restaurant was a different business to the hotel, but in my eyes it is endorsed by Premier Inn and should be a much higher standard. We will not be back to the Robin Hood which is a shame.

Name: Interchange Café
Title: Rude
Review: I went into the interchange cafe in search of a coffee and possibly food however when faced with a miserable woman with her arms folded saying ‘ Do you want anything or are you just looking at the books?’ I decided to leave and go to the small coffee booth on the opposite platform. What a rude woman she clearly doesn’t want to be there

Name: Pizza Express
Title: Sub standard pizza's
Review:
I visited Pizza Express Arundel towards the end of May with my wife. We ordered 2 pizza's one was a classic the other on a gluten free base. After waiting 20 minitues our pizza's arrived. The gluten free pizza looked like a child's pizza with thinly spaced topping. I asked the waiter why my pizza was normal size and the other smaller. He said the gluten free pizza's were the same size (I think he needs to go to Specsavers). He also explained that all of their pizza's come to them frozen. I have been going to Pizza Express for many years, however haven't visited Pizza Express for at least 2 years. This was a bad experience not to be repeated.

I Have a wonderful pizza restaurant that has a pizza man who comes from Naples, near to where I live. He makes authentic pizza's (not frozen) and in a wood fired oven.
Pizza Express is not good value for money. I used to recommend them, however never again.

Name: Hawking About
Title: A WALK WITH STORM
Review:
A wonderful gift from my wife and a fantastic experience to get up close and personal with Storm the Harris Hawk. Kevin is passionate about his birds and his knowledge and guidance were superb. Both I and my wife were thrilled with the whole experience - thanks again Kevin just home my photos do it justice.
Read less

Name: World's End
Title: Not good enough
Review:
Wild mushrooms for starter, lovely sauce but some of the mushrooms were so wild they ended up being spat out into the napkin as way too chewy, rubber like.

Homity pie that did not live up to the menu description, if this pie wasn’t simply bunged into the oven from frozen id be surprised.

3 game sausage dish was lacking in gravy and too dry.

Didn’t bother with dessert.

At £25 a head this food was appalling.

Staff were great, approachable and attentive, also young and rushed off their feet, I do hope they aren’t on minimum wage.

The place was busy so people obviously like going there, but Hall and Woodhouse seem to be a faceless corporate entity, bums on seats and increase that profit margin.

Won’t be going back.

Name: Rustington Golf Centre
Title: What's happened to this club!!!!!
Review: Went to play today after few years off...the place has gone to the dogs.....the site is just littered with cut down tree's all over the place, the head green keeper I'm told has changed n the last few years, may I suggest a NEW one be appointed !!

Name: George Inn
Title: Lovely
Review: Popped in on a friday evening for a pub meal. Both had the crispy pork belly . Was actually surprised how nice it was !! Served with mash cabbage and carrots. Both agreed it was excellent , quite a large portion served fairly quickly in the saloon bar , the fire was going making it very cosy. Had a couple of drinks as well.will definitely return to try some more of their menu. Recommend a visit from my first impression. And friendly customers too.

Name: The Diner
Title: Very bad service
Review:
Arrived at just after 5 to be told it was a 45 minute wait for food as everyone had just sat down. So we made a reservation and returned 45 minutes later and was sat straight down and was told waitress would be over shortly. 10 minutes later we had to ask the manager if we could order drinks as no one had been over! We waited nearly another 10 minutes for the bar maid to come over and say they didn't have the wine I ordered. Our food order was taken and we asked for starters first. Went with the music wheel for my partner, 2 year old and I to share. It was really disappointing for such a long wait. Half an hour went by with staff sweeping the floor and cleaning empty tables around us when our plates hadn't been cleared. We heard the people around us complaining about the wait. It wasn't busy at this point so there was no excuse. It was getting closer to 7 o'clock and the table behind us obviously wanted to get the the show and had to ask for their dessert to go.
