My partner had to go up to the bar to ask our waitress for another drink. She never passed the order to the bar maid so he had to go up again. Our waitress walked past and we had to ask her to clear the table. It was like we had asked her to lick the table not just move the empty plates that had been there half an hour. Our 2 year old after being strapped in to a high chair for an hour was getting really tetchy so we had to ask for our food to be taken away.
It really ruined our night because we actually looked forward to trying the diner and actually spent the most money here out of all the other places. The food was also really poor considering we were only waiting for hot dog and chips. My partner had the chilli dog which had basically no chilli on it. The bread rolls were dry and split. We ordered extra coleslaw at about £2.50. The waitress failed to mention both our meals came with coleslaw so we didn't actually need it. When the bill came they tried to charge me for the more expensive wine I ordered thay they didn't have! We complained to the manager on the way out about the poor service and we may as well not have bothered. Her response was 'I don't know what's happened there.'
Don't waste your time or money coming here.

Name: Tudor Tavern
Title: Christmas meal
Review: It’s a lovely pub, not long been refurbished to a good standard, we got our starters which were all really nice, so looking forward to our mains which were all a total disappointment, the roast beef was tough the veg must of been cooked the day before and reheated, the veg option was more rice cake than nut roast, the desserts were a mixture of good and bad the cheesecake couldn’t be deciphered as what fruit it was and the coffee finally no one enjoyed it as far too strong maybe serve with cream rather than milk

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: As if the apprentice contestants ran a restaurant full time.
Review: Sadly we did not enjoy our visit. What should have been simple food done well was expensive food with mixed results.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Great service
Review: Had festive steak meal, steak well cooked and rare as asked for. Service was excellent, friendly and attentive chased our food when it took a while. 3 young men and 1 young women were doing a great job. Also warm and friendly with kids. As a manager in this field this is what I value in staff. Hope they are appreciated!

Name: Pier Road Coffe & Art
Title: A very different experience
Review: So you won’t find your Mona Lisa hanging on the wall much less the laughing cavalier not a Bankys in sight but what you will find as you step through the door is a very warm welcome by the owners Mike and Lucy who carry a lot off knowledge on the fantastic local artists who’s incredible work adorns the walls what a relief says she who never quite managed getting past a colouring book and pencils this brings a wonderful addition too the area so go you won’t be disappointed there is something for everyone and off course added benefit off a plethora off reasonably priced art and craft classes not too mention divine coffee and cake

Name: Avisford
Title: Great Staff
Review:
That’s the best thing about this hotel. The staff are smiley, polite and offer helpful efficiency. From check in to check out, everyone we spoke to was so pleasant.
The exterior and interior is in need of a lick of paint. The bedroom and bathroom was clean and comfortable but basic and in need of new fittings. The hotel is OK but it lacks charm, the greater part being because it’s interior needs a complete makeover.
The kitchen staff need Gordon Ramsay to go in and shake them up. The chicken skewer I had tasted nothing like chicken. It was slimy and rather unpleasant.
Read less

Name: Punch and Judy
Title: Couldn’t get served
Review: Went in for a quick pint. Gave up in the end staff just wanted to chat to there friends and regulars. Then walked of and went to the toilet. Was flabbergasted

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: I was straight up not having a good time ✌🏼
Review: Not good. Very bad. Would not recommend. 0/10. Much disappointment. Sort it out. Grow up. Boring. Cheers, sons crying now.

Name: Howards Coffee Shop
Title: Mediocre
Review: Very disappointed I had fish and chips and quite honestly it was awful. No taste and dry non flaky fish. My husband had a steak and kidney pie which he said was just about OK. Presentation of food on plate awful puts you off before you have a mouthful.

Name: Fino
Title: FABOULOUS
Review: Both starters and main courses which were all different where throughly enjoyed. For a Wednesday evening this restaurant was very busy which speaks volumes. The ambience was very good, even the toilets were clean and tidy, just wish there was a Dyson Air-blade in there!

Name: Zeera Lounge
Title: Mrs Tinsley
Review: We have just had our third takeaway from here, and every time the food has been absolutely amazing!!! Beautifully cooked, good size portions, fantastic flavours! We will never use another takeaway since discovering this one. Delivery is always prompt and the food arrives piping hot. Cannot fault this place in any way.

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: A full pint?
Review:
I politely requested a top-up on a very frothy-headed pint of ale and was astonished when a barmaid was going to refuse this request, while trying to assure me that it was a legal requirement that my pint of ale should include a head of 10%!

Sadly, it appears that she was unaware of the GUIDANCE NOTES ON THE DISPENSE OF DRAUGHT BEER BY FREE FLOW AND HAND PULL -

1. A measure of a beer served with a head must include a minimum of 95% liquid
2.The beer should not be made available to the customer until bar staff are satisfied with the measure
3.Requests from customers for top-ups should be received with good grace and never refused, subject to avoiding spillage of liquid.

Fortunately, the bar manager stepped in and my pint was topped up.

This experience has not encouraged me to return any time soon!

Name: Belinda's Tearooms
Title: Lunch with a friens
Review:
I had not been in the cafe for some years and it was a different name then, it looked much the same still quaint. It was retry full but we managed to get a table. There only seemed to be 2 staff working they were flat out.
We decided to eat a meal at lunchtime and both opted for ham, egg and chips. It came quite quickly and was very tasty. The ham was thickly cut and the eggs cooked perfectly.
The tables are quite closely packed in but a cosy feel. All very nice thank you.

Name: Magna Tandoori
Title: Disappointing !!! If I could rate as zero I would
Review:
Have been to this restaurant several times in the past but tonight’s meal was very disappointing.
Took ages to take our order.... seemed to serve 4 other tables that came in after us.

Starter was ok but our main meal was discusting !!!
We shared a lamb rogan between us with a naan bread

The lamb was tough with no taste whatsoever,the tomatoes hadn’t been cooked at all (raw) and the sauce just tasted peppery

Complained to the waiter that cleared our plates that we weren’t impressed and he just said sorry will tell the chef !!!

Presume it was the boss that came to take our payment and he seemed to find it funny that we weren’t happy

Weren’t offered any discount or a free coffee or even an apology

Certainly won’t be returning here or recommending this place to anyone!!!!

Name: Church Farm
Title: "Sun" holiday
Review:
Our caravan was clean and well equipped.
The staff were friendly and very helpful.

We would not come here again on a "Sun" holiday as we had requested a caravan near the entrance and were allocated one almost as far away from there as possible.
We were assured that there was no other one nearer.

We needed to be near the entrance as we had travelled by public transport and my husband has mobility problems.

A thoughtful member of staff kindly drove us with our luggage to our caravan but every day my husband had to struggle to and from the bus stop outside the Park.
It was especially difficult on our last day dragging our cases all the way.

I don't know if booking direct would guarantee a better choice of location...

We did not use the facilities so we cannot comment on them.

The 600 bus service to Bognor one way and Chichester the other was frequent and excellent. Avoid school turnout time as the bus gets crammed, though the children behaved very well and were helpful and polite.
Read less

Name: The Bear Inn
Title: Poor food
Review:
Just been for Sunday lunch with family 10 of us. Told they had run out of Turkey and did not have enough chicken breast for all who wanted. Roasted veg served on the plate had been sitting around for a while. It tasted ok but the plate was hotter than the food and portions were small. The children's portions were the same size just on a smaller plate.
We wont be going here again. Even my 80 year old dad complained and
 I have never known him do that

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Awful veggie sharer (nice location though)
Review:
My husband and I went to the Black Rabbit with our 6 month old baby on a Wednesday lunchtime. We ordered the veggie plate from the sharer menu and were very disappointed.
For a bit under £13 the platter offered an uninspiring selection of food that you could easily buy from tesco out of a packet. It included two boring falafels, a tablespoon of tzatziki, one piece of pita bread cut in half with a teaspoon of humous, a handful of cold cabbage and some cold cauliflower. The presentation was also very poor.
An embarrassment, and we were totally gutted as it's such a lovely pub with great views and drinks.
Although it's only a pub, they should be trying a bit harder to get these basics right.
We complained to the waitress who went and spoke with the chef and manager, but did not return to us for 20 mins. They did offer us another small portion of humous and pita bread, but too little too late.

Name: Sen
Title: Birthday Meal
Review: As always amazing food amazing service amazing staff. Can't think of a better place to celebrate. Everyone should try here you won't be disappointed. Thank you for a lovely evening. Sean & Ali x

Name: Butlins
Title: Waste of money we left early
Review:
Honestly, go somewhere else.

This place is expensive for what it is.

The new splash water park is terrible. Disgusting changing rooms absolutely filthy. Water in pool freezing, hair and dirt in all the water. 30 minutes queue for rides. Open to the public so very very busy.

Accommodation was dirty and dusty everywhere. Room service came didn’t replace tea bags/milk etc.

90% of staff miserable and rude. Especially at check out. Asked for our room number and said that’s it you can go..

Didn’t ask how the stay was etc

Food was over priced and on par with my local weatherspoons.

£180 a night, trust me go aboard or anywhere else but here!!
Read less

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Rogers
Review: Had a really lovely steak, cooked beautifully. Our server Marie was absolutely fantastic, told us about 50%off so saved us money. Haven't enjoyed a night out in ages, Marie had us in stitched so funny. All the staff very nice. Well worth a visit.

Name: Butlins
Title: Discriminating behaviour towards my little girl by a lady staff member named HAYLEIGH at Butlins Bognor Regis Resort
Review:
On our 2nd night at the resort, we attended a family event at the Reds venue where we had a very nasty experience with a red coat staff member named HAYLEIGH. She singled out my 5 yr old girl and stopped ONLY her from taking a picture with the Mr. Potato head character.
When I saw my little girl close to tears I approached HAYLEIGH and requested politely to grant her just one picture as she was the last child in line. I would have understand if there were more children behind her and all asked to leave but to ask just the last child out??? I was told rudely by her that they had already done the countdown to end the photo shoot and that ‘ I should have used my ears to listen better’ !!!! She also said that instead of dancing with my little son on the dance floor,I should have ‘paid more attention to the queue’.
I was extremely shocked at her condemning manner and reminded her that after the countdown five other white families had stood in the queue in front of my girl and had been granted a picture and why was she, the only one to be left out? Also, what does me dancing with my son have anything to do with my daughter who was waiting her turn patiently in the queue????
What is worse is that my daughter had only joined the queue (after the countdown) once I checked with the male photographer there. He later denied any responsibility saying that he was just there to take pictures! When I reminded HAYLEIGH that such an attitude towards a guest and a child was not acceptable, she very arrogantly pointed to her name tag and asked me to report to whoever I liked, it made no difference to her! She spent about 2-3 mins arguing with me and the Mr Potato head character remained in the background but she couldn’t use a minute of that time to make a little girl happy????

We have been to many other family resorts and have never experienced anything like this. In fact, most other places go out of their way to make the little ones feel special. We were initially very impressed by the Butlins resort, the ocean hotel room, the pool zone and entertainment shows where we did see friendly and attentive staff like the hotel receptionist Kirstie and most staff at the pavilion arcade. I am surprised that someone like this lady Hayleigh works in a resort of this stature as she definitely has a problem with brown/dark skin and clearly does not know how to communicate with guests.
I strongly condemn such obnoxious and discriminating behaviour in a place that claims to be dedicated to families and fun. As parents we did not spend our hard earned money, for our daughter to feel inadequate and reduced to tears just before her birthday! (she didn’t want to attend most character events at the resort after that). We checked out of the resort a day earlier than needed and must say that we have been extremely disappointed by Butlins on this occasion.
Read less

Name: Wheatsheaf
Title: Meal before movies
Review: Been to the Wheatsheaf a few times since new management been in. Went their for dinner before going to movies and had a great meal, the service was quick and friendly, had one of the new burgers deffo recomend. The Manager Micheal is incredibly friendly and helpful especially with my incredibly picky and fussy girlfriends order. We will be back again.

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Cosy atmosphere
Review:
We are in the restaurant of the Norfolk Arms on a Saturday night. There is a lovely small bar with a log fire adjacent to the restaurant and it was very relaxing to sit in there and view and order our menu before sitting down to dinner. Food was very well presented and extremely tasty. The staff were friendly, helpful and very attentive. It was not an extensive manu but had enough choices for us and we were not disappointed with our meal. We would visit again if in the area
Read less

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Really good night, with friendly staff - on the up!
Review: We had a great night in The Roundstone a few nights ago. The vibe of the place was really friendly and the staff had great rapport between them. The bar was constantly staffed and when busy all customers were acknowledged and treated cheerfully with playful banter and politeness. The mood in this place is on 'the up' with a much more personable feel about the place now. Although, synonymous with passing trade from the motel, it is developing the feel of a proper local. Special mention in despatch for the barman from 'down under' who seems to energise the place.

Name: WWT Wetland
Title: Disappointed
Review:
We’re regulars at WWT Washington so thought we’d pay a visit while in the area. To say we were disappointed is an understatement. It’s great if you like swans and ducks but there’s very little else to speak of. Seemed to be very overgrown in places too, making bird spotting/photography almost impossible.
I’m pleased we’re members as I’d have been gutted to have paid nearly £27 for very little.
The staff we came across weren’t very friendly either, totally the opposite from WWT Washington
Read less

Name: Qmin
Title: If I could give a 10 I would
Review:
Staying at church farm park.
Thought we would try something different b4 heading home.
Glad we did.
We ordered on line to make things quicker.
Big portions very big.
Polite staff. We rang to confirm they had the order as we had. It had a email.
Guy on the phone said sorry u should have had a confirmation. Yes we have order it will be ready at six
Went food was just coming out.
Piping hot and delicious.
Will deff come back when we come back to church farm.

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Dreadful
Review:
Popped in on the off chance.
Shown to table, told our waitress Emma would be with us soon.
No drinks offered whilst we wait.
After 15 minutes we were asked by Emma was everything okay?
Said we wanted to order our food, she said I didn’t see you there!
Food arrived nicely presented and very delicious.
The manager offered the dessert menu, we declined but asked for the bill.
A further 15 minutes, the waitress appears, we ask for the bill again.
Not a great experience.

Name: Butlins
Title: Butlins discrimination
Review:
Butlins discrimination.
Any single people planning to book a break at Butlins, don't bother. Same sex couples need to read the terms & conditions too.
On Wednesday 17th July I booked a 4 night break for Monday 22nd July to Friday 26th July.
I booked a single room for a single person and then an extra payment for breakfast and dinner for 1 person each day. Butlins accepted my booking, took my payment and sent me a confirmation email.
Today, Friday 19th July, I recieved an email saying that my booking had been flagged because I am a single person going on my own. I thought the email might have been a scam so I rang the number on my original confirmation email to be told that, as a single person, I can only go on a live music weekend to a Butlins resort and that it's in their terms & conditions. I was also told that I would have to wait a further 2 or 3 days before I got my money back, so roughly by Sunday 21st July. Seeing as I've planned a break commencing from Monday 22nd July this leaves hardly any time to book another break using my original holiday fund.
During the phone call I asked if it was ok for a married couple with no children to go on a Butlins break and was told that it was ok for married couples of opposite sex but same sex couples would need to prove they are married. On that basis it would be interesting to know if an unmarried, opposite sex couple, would have any booking problems.
The fact that it's in their terms and conditions doesn't change the fact that it's discrimination and, let's face it, how many single people would read the terms & conditions to find out if they had to be accompanied by a child.
Conclusion: If you are single or gay then Butlins don't think you're safe to be around children.
Read less

Name: Avisford
Title: Weekend Lions Convention
Review:
Stayed for a weekend Convention.
We were happy, but as this is a old hotel, please be aware that there are no lifts at the property. However reception were able to change a disabled person's room from upstairs to a ground floor room. So, very accommodating
Read less

Name: So India, Felpham
Title: Tasty food
Review: Michael is a super Manager of this place, and ensures all is well. Food is very good and theme night such fun

Name: Hawking About
Title: Very privelaged
Review:
This was the most amazing experience. If you want to see birds of prey in their natural environment that you get to handle guided by an expert caring owner then this is for you.
Read less

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: Excellent
Review: Stayed for 3 nights over Christmas - second year running - as close to my parents. Hotel as expected for a Travelodge, clean, decent room, shower etc and excellent value for money. Reception staff very friendly and helpful, especially as they were working over Christmas.

Name: Arun View
Title: Amazing
Review:
Just moved to the area, found this by chance. and wow the place was hit with us. Food first class, service excellent, staff helful and friendly. We had fish and chips price was good flavour amazing.
Will definitly be going but. The view from the restaurant is lovely over looking the river. It was a very pleasant evening.

Name: Toast
Title: Meal with friend
Review: Nice food but it was not hot,service was appalling it was Monday night not busy.Most expensive Indian Restaurant I have been to.Curry was bought to our table we had to ask for cutlery ordered 3 poppadoms only bought 2. We will not be going back definitely Would.not recommend to a yone

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Beautiful
Review:
Give yourself a few hours at least to go through the Castle and gardens. We went from top to bottom, there are guides everywhere to answer questions and direct you to the next point.
Be aware that the castle was built before equal opportunity, so if you have physical challenges you will find it very difficult to navigation some of the areas inside the castle.
Read less

Name: The Swan
Title: 2nd visit and this time not at all good.
Review:
The first time we stopped her the sandwiches were gorgeous but last week quite different, it was a Tuesday and the blonde lady who we assumed was the manager was not there.
A new girl tried her best but we were ignored by the barman. Uncovered croissants were left on a plate on tge bar.
Service took ages and then I was served an oval dry rusk type object with no raisins.
Barman ignored me and new girl was confused. After almost giving up but having paid my teacake appeared which is what I had ordered to begin.
I have no idea what the first offering was but suspect it had been forgotten in the microwave. No napkins nor knife were offered.
Shame as the first visit was pleasant.

Name: The Spur
Title: We stopped off at The Spur
Review:
We stopped off at The Spur after a long drive from the West Country.

We shared two sandwiches and both were absolutely delicious.

The staff were friendly and I enjoyed my pint of Doombar.

We will visit again soon.

Name: Sea View
Title: Restaurant recommended by others and will come again
Review: Stopped here for lunch with a colleague on the recommendation of others. Tucked away on the left just before you reach the sea and you can easily miss it. Externally it looks tired but the inside showed signs of some modernisation. Staff were very friendly and we ordered drinks and a lunch and both were served quickly and food was well presented, hot and very tasty - good value too. Will certainly come again and go for a walk on the shoreline. Toilets were dated and doors to and from the toilets could do with cleaning/painting but I assume this will be undertaken in the near future.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Awful
Review:
My grandma needs a table with disabled access, and there was a perfect table but it was ‘booked’ but nobody turned up! Just lying, i don't know why!
The steamed vegetables just looked like a frozen supermarket packet, the lamb was served cold! Our table wasn't cleared we did it ourselves, and we got the wrong desserts! What was supposed to be a lovely meal with friends was met with terrible service!

Name: Best Western Bognor
Title: Good location right by the sea.
Review:
Goodto be able to park very close to the hotel.Reception staff excellent, friendly and helpful. Room with sea view very good. Breakfast excellent, nice to be able to sit outside and finish of our breakfast tea.
Read less

Name: Carlyle's Café
Title: Gluten free breakfast
Review: Me and my kids went for breakfast. Very welcoming and child friendly. Loved the fact they had gluten free bread and gluten free options. Only struggle was no halal food. Especially gluten free and halal. However that’s a difficult one to cover but it was very sweet of them to say they would look into it.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Still not great
Review: Revisited after a bad meal last year , though I’d try it again , food was ok but not brilliant , the salad bar was virtually empty and wasn’t restocked for a while . Sadly I think this is our last visit , shame

Name: Butlins
Title: awful accommodation
Review:
We booked the Seaside apartment this time having been to another part of the site a year and a half before. My grandson is 3 (one and a half last time) and my daughter thought The Seaside apartments sounded nice - don't be fooled like we were.We went in October half term as my other daughter and grandaughter have a different half term to other areas of the country. When we arrived at the apartment we started to unpack the few groceries we had brought with us - I felt quite queasy as the dining table started to move (unstable). everywhere felt sticky and the veneer (if you can call it that) had started to peel off. My grandson's white socks soon became very dirty and slipper bottoms were tacky. We could hardly get into the bathroom (you almost had to get into the shower to get through the door) and we had to call out maintenance twice as the contents of the toilet and sink would not empty and started to fill up. The outside drains had to be rodded. Our front door would not shut properly on a couple of occasions and the windows of the rooms were very poor - condensation and we could not leave the window on the catch to ventilate and the lounge window hinge was buckled. Our friends also had a similar appartment and they left a day early (there were 3 in their group but 6 in ours). We did have a power cut which took out most of the surrounding area and I have to say the staff in the fish restaurant were a delight and kept reasuring us (fortunately we ordered before the power went off so we got our meal). I have already been in touch with a higher authority to complain but I felt I was being patronised and it was if the lady who responded was pacifing me with answers off a script. There was no offer of compensation only that if we were to go again they could offer a discount (we could probably get that by booking on line anyway). It has totally put me off Butlins and sad to say that my 3 year old grandson will probably miss out on family visits like this in the future - there must be other wonderful sites out there.
Read less

Name: Glorious Spa
Title: Fantastic treatments and well skilled staff
Review: I have been visiting Glorious Spa Rustington for three years to indulge my one treat to myself - a regular geleration manicure. Shaunna has been doing my manicure (and sometimes pedicure, massage and eyebrows!) - ok a couple of indulgences- since I started going and I trust her 100% to do my nails exactly how I want. They always turn out perfectly! Glitter is my poison and Shaunna is great at full coverage, graduated and nail art. Such a great range of colours to choose from....can’t wait for my next visit!

Name: Robin Hood
Title: Sunday Dinner
Review: Ordered a bottle of New Zealand rose wine the roast pork for me lamb for my partner. The wine was just placed on the table could not be bothered to open it never mined offered a tate. The meal mine was pork on the plate was belly pork tasteless a thin strip cracklingg opaque, roast potatoes look good but hollow peas and broccoli stuffing an for some reason Yorkshire pudding.. Offered apple sauce but was not fresh suspect mass produced. My partner meal was lamb shoulder it was exactly the same except for the meat she said the lamb was OK but the rest Very disappointing . We both suspect that the meal rather than being cooked fresh had been cook either in morning or day before and reheated overall a very disappoting meal. Was going to have a pudding but decided not to bother in cas it was like the rest.

Name: Clymping Beach
Title: Dreadful
Review: Visited Climping to take a walk on the beach. Car park £1.50 an hour or £7.50 the day - outrageous. So we parked further along, free in the street, & walked past Climping. There is almost no beach, shingle having been washed away. Didn't use the café but the toilets were AWFUL. Dirty, no seats, no toilet paper, no soap, nothing to dry your hands on. What is the car park fee for exactly? DON'T BOTHER.

Name: Cardanom Bay
Title: Dissapointed
Review: Used to order a decent take away fish curry from Cardamon Bay for delivery - tonight could only order from the take away menu they delivered to our house ie chicken tika masala etc ? Presumably anything 'different' come eat in the restaurant ….. Or not ?

Name: Jerichos Sweet Store
Title: Exceptional
Review: A wonderland for children. Lots of choice, including some sweets from my childhood (about 1,000 years ago). Definitely worth a visit.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Absolute Shocker wish I’d read the reviews
Review:
Waited 7 mins to be greeted. I don’t time these things but I was looking at the time on my phone when we got in there. Think about that. 7 minutes standing there hoping someone would at least give us a nod, let alone approach us with an 82yr old and 2 small overheating thirsty girls. Totally unacceptable and I should have left then but the girls were hungry and it was my 82yr old mums birthday. What a treat she got, not.

When the server finally came over she sternly asked if we’d booked (as though it was unlikely we’d get a place)? It was 5:45pm, hello.

The restaurant was half empty by the way so id dread to think what it’s like when it’s busy. Unless you have the patience of a saint id avoid this place. I’ve come here on and off for years when invited by others and although the food has improved, it’s more expensive than it used to be but there’s always a problem either with hygiene, sticky tables, rude staff (not today though, they just didn’t get near us), poor supply to the salad bar, etc.

30 mins after being seated we were given no salad bowls but more importantly we were parched but STILL NO drinks on the hottest day of the year, so no rehydrating my 4 and 6 yr old in sweltering heat. 30 minutes after ordering with not even the jug of water that we ordered is unacceptable in that heat. When I finally had enough I wandered up and got my own jug at the bar. Intriguingly it had a big bite mark chunk out the side of the skanky worn out water jug. It should have been in the bin. Oh and they don’t have any ice on the hottest day in summer!!! Basil Faulty runs this place, surely?

No tomatoes or cucumbers in the salad bar just a watery mess where they once lived. Loads of sauces to choose from but it was a lucky dip as none were labelled running the risk of giving your child chilli sauce instead of ketchup or relish.

We ate the cut-down salad off little side plates as nobody gave us bowls so we improvised with what was there. My mum only had salad bar as she’s elderly so her whole meal was on a tiny side plate! Disgraceful.

After being left to fend for ourselves I cleared the finished salad plates myself in the end and put them on the tray I got from the bar when I went to serve myself and my family that jug of water.

As a side note I took my little one to the men’s bathroom. She’s kicked off her sandals under the table in the heat but I hadn’t realised. She then walked into the toilet and walked in urine leaking from the urinals. They had put out of a sign to say wet floor but it was puddles of wee all over the bathroom everywhere so my little princess had walked through lots of pee to get from the cubicle to the sinks, the poor little mite. It should have been mopped up or locked up.

Nobody asked how the food was, we weren’t offered any more drinks (not that they arrive anyway) despite it being sweltering. We didn’t get spoken to by anyone in that whole time since ordering food and due to the continued lack of staff I eventually had to go up and stand at the tills and interrupt a member of staff in order to actually pay the bill and get the hell out of there.

I noticed on the wall above the till it said something like “remember, no more bad reviews like the one from D.L” with a big arrow pointing towards it or something similar so it’s not as if they don’t know they need to buck up their ideas. To be fair the 2 people I encountered at the till were kind and apologetic. I wasn’t one of their tables but you could see they were frustrated and working under pressure in what seemed like a sinking ship so I did have sympathy for them. Very poorly managed though I’m afraid and lots of customers looked disgruntled. More staff and someone in maintenance to sort the bathroom, ice machine, I’ve cream machine is what’s needed.

The simple food took 45 minutes to arrive which is way too long in a half empty restaurant. Other restaurants set your expectations if there’s a long wait over 20 mins.
The food itself was ok when it arrived but I just wanted to get out of there by that point. I’d have to be desperate to go back there

On my way out I passed other miserable looking families that I’d seen waiting to be spoken to / seated for ages. I felt for them because I knew what was in store for them

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: Excellent service
Review:
This is an older hotel and need some TLC but the service is outstanding and that makes all the difference. Dulce was lovely from the start an did everything she could to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. Will definitely return just because of the service I've received!
Read less

Name: Osca's
Title: Good fish and chips
Review: Last Friday we visited littlehampton for a day out and decided to re visit oscas for a fish and chip lunch.We have been here many times before and on the odd occasion the fish was not as good as before.On Friday the fish was very fresh and cooked beautifully and the chips were fresh and chunky just as we like them.The service was up to its usual good standard and we were glad to have revisited Oscas.We visited about 12-30pm and they were very busy which is a good omen.All in all a nice lunch.

Name: The Lamb, Angmering
Title: Spinola
Review: Gorgeous food, really yummy. Staff OK, but feel they didn't meet my needs. It's all about the food, and we loved it.

Name: Motte & Bailey
Title: Very poor value
Review: We took my mother for her birthday, we had cake at £3.45 a slice that was the size of medium sliced bread, glass of prosecco £7.75. Plus teas and a couple of scones, tea cake, tonic water. £37, the cakes etc that we did have were very nice but not at that price?

Name: Swan Hotel
Title: Fabulous ; wonderful value
Review:
£71 bnb it was excellent
Lovely cooked breakfast
Staff really pleasant and helful

They don't take Scottish money which rattles my husband everytime but that's a bigger national issue and you don't go on holiday for a battle.
Read less

Name: Black Horse
Title: Early evening dinner
Review: Andrew and Jen are the perfect hosts. We had a lovely meal in the garden, the service was brilliant, meal fantastic, a very welcoming atmosphere. The waitresses were friendly and helpful. The food was delicious.

Name: Butlins Day Visits
Title: Total bargain
Review: When centre parks charge over 40 quid p.p to spend a day with your family, butlins invite you to visit for £12 p.p. You get to do everything the residents do and you can bring your own picnic. They even provide areas to sit and eat your own food. You can visit in summer from 9 am till you’ve had enough. A brilliant day for all the family and not a rip off price.

Name: Butlins
Title: Family Fun
Review:
We have been to Bultin's many times, we have stayed in the budget rooms which were very basic with limited facilities and we have stayed in the hotels.

Room only - very basic, a bit cold when we stayed in February, no room service and no area to dry clothes from swimming or rain! It is the UK after all!!

Hotel rooms, we have stayed in all three hotels. We prefer the Wave hotel as we pay for higher level rooms with balconies, albeit you have to pay a lot more these rooms they are bigger and you don't have lots of kids running past the doors. This hotel has a games room on the ground floor to keep the older kids a bit more occupied.

Bognor Butlins has changed since we first went, it has been upgraded a lot and the prices have reflected this. The new swimming pool is good fun but gets crowded.

My kids have started to grow out of the fairground and the activities. If you have younger kids 10yrs and under then they will love it. Older kids will get bored.

Be prepared to spend more money on site in the arcades and queue for shows.
Read less

Name: 47 Mussel Row
Title: Disappointed
Review:
I don’t like to leave reviews after having not said anything at the time as I work in hospitality myself and I’m aware that a review is detrimental to business, however there was so much disappointment on our visit that really I wouldn’t have felt comfortable addressing at the table.
My first suggestion would be to inform people as their seated what dishes you don’t have, rather than wait for them to decide to order and then let them know then. As not having crab (my first choice) and then another fish dish (my second choice)..
Other tables spent a while deciding as did we to then be told you didn’t have the dishes.
Also I really have to say that serving scallops on a piece of brioche is bizarre, so so sickly as was the over bearing sweet jam with so much ginger in. Just a really disappointing dish for £11!
The roast dinners could have been alright if the beef wasn’t overcooked and hadn’t been swamped in the ridiculous amount of almost jelly like gravy, also couldn’t make out what the white sauce was on the plate initially I thought horseradish or bread sauce but it literally was just a tasteless white sauce floating in the gravy.
Your menu looked great it’s a shame your prices don’t reflect the quality of the dishes.

Name: Littlehampton Beach
Title: Long promenade
Review: Perfect beach to walk along with plenty of seating when you get tired. Wide prom to cater for wheel chairs, cycles and pedestrians.

Name: Inglenook
Title: Restaurant very disappointing
Review: Not good. Where to start? We had booked a table for Sunday lunch and were seated in the "garden room". Sounds lovely, but this turned out to be one side of a corridor with the carvery on the other side giving all the atmosphere of a school canteen. Staff generally disinterested and service slow. Food very so-so all round. Steak sandwich was dreadful - it might have once been steak, don't know what it was by the time it reached me. Sorry, can't find anything positive to say.

Name: LG Café
Title: Rude not once but twice
Review: I am a local so like to use local businesses, well I have tried twice with this place. The owner is rude and frankly just goes out of his way to belittle customers. Both times I went in with a different friend and both times we just could not believe it. I also did try to buy a patisserie in there to take away. I have to say they may well be delicious and made on the premises I will never know as frankly the price was just too high to buy 6. I have since heard another local had eaten in there several times but after an incident will not be going back. Shame as concept is good. Nice to have somewhere serving early evening light meals that are not pizza. However I fear when winter comes and tourists dry up loss of local support may see takings fall

Name: The George, Burpham
Title: Not what we expected
Review: As a small group of walkers we stopped here for lunch today. Usually we would individually order our food and drink at the bar and then find ourselves a table together. Today we were directed to a table and our drinks and food order taken at the table, which took some time. As we left we were called back to be told that we had not paid all the bill. This turned out to be a 10% service charge which they automatically add for parties of 6 or more. On the one hand we wanted to warn the pub in advance there might be a group of us eating, but apparently by warning them we incurred a 10% surcharge. So beware if you are in a Group.

Name: Butlins
Title: New Years eve
Review:
Great few days away would recommend family’s for this break so relaxed and great time away seeing in the new year with the kids, so much to do swimming was great and the Bar and Kitchen restaurant was very nice. Comfortable apartments but pick a new upgraded one
Read less

Name: Bognor Museum
Title: Fantastic wonders of the past.
Review:
Beautiful museum with more than the eyes can see in one visit. Wonderful displays taking us back to the old days of a lovely coastal town.
Friendly staff in lovely calm location.
Must go back again.
Read less

Name: Tudor Tavern
Title: Fantastic In every way
Review: Visited with family on Weds lunchtime after taking dog to nearby beach. Had a super welcome from friendly landlady. Really modern interior which is immaculate and lovely outside space. Dog friendly both inside and out in the garden. Ordered food and all four meals were amazing. I can thoroughly recommend the steak and ale pie with mash and kale and the Mediterranean tart which were delicious! Staff were very attentive! Can't wait to visit again with family to experience great friendly atmosphere, service and food once again. Entertainment nights sound fab too!!

Name: La Campagnia
Title: Great lunch, top service with scillian wine and Italian olives
Review:
On a visit to Arundel castle this was a great find half way up the high street on the left side, The prawn and Salmon salad was superb, the Goats cheese salad was enjoyed and the house white wine a fine accompaniment.
Nice touch of olives and water. This was great food served well and enjoyed.

Name: Ocean Hotel & Spa
Title: 70's weekend
Review:
We have just been away for a 70's weekend. What a weekend! This hotel and the weekend in general deserves every one of the 5 stars I've given. The room was really nice; clean, comfortable bed, hot shower. The food was superb, plenty of variety and delicious. Staff were friendly and helpful. The event entertainment (we went to Centre Stage) was superb. We particularly loved Showaddywaddy, Too Tex and Flash.
We had such a great weekend with our friends, it was all brilliant and we'll definitely be back!

Name: The Fish Factory
Title: Sunday dinner
Review: Absolutely delicious dinner here today with children. Had a previous bad experience here but today definitely made up for it. Well recommended!

Name: Inglenook
Title: Nice food, charming waiting staff BUT!!!!!!!
Review: My husband and I eat here often and I have never had the need to post a negative review before - lovely homely food in a nice relaxed atmosphere. I do however take exception when a female “manager” fails to charge us for our drinks when preparing our bill then actually stated it was OUR fault they missed them off. This is the second time this has happened therefore prompting this review. Such a shame a wonderful team are being repeatedly let down by such unprofessionalism.

Name: Avisford
Title: Charging top prices for low quality food
Review:
Had the buttermilk chicken burger from the pub menu. The chicken steaklets were clearly over cooked. They definitely were not freshly prepared and likely bought in bulk at an Iceland store. Same goes for the french fries. This would be all good and well for the local pub. This is however a Hilton restaurant charging £15 for a low quality burger. My advice would be to go elsewhere, no matter how hungry you might be.
Read less

Name: Magna Tandoori
Title: Terrible service
Review:
We visited this Indian last night . Food was ok.

We had1 lady in a wheelchair struggled to get through the front door. Waiter just stood there without offering to assist. The waiter was so miserable . He took the Order incorrectly and stood and argued with me as he disagreed
The service was terrible, didn’t offer us a dessert menu. Rude staff is under statement. .

Name: Butlers
Title: Nice meal
Review: My wife and I visited Arudel on Easter Sunday & decided to have lunch in this restaurant. The staff were friendly the meal was a great Sunday roast lunch. The only moan I have is I was charged £2 for an extra which was a jug of tap water.

Name: Premier Inn Arundel
Title: Enjoyable Stay
Review:
Premier Inn is a pretty safe bet if you want a comfortable room and great value. Arundel doesn’t disappoint. Ideal location to visit Arundel or to explore along the coast.
What sets it apart is the staff, everyone we met was polite and helpful.
A special thanks to Maurice, he is above and beyond and is simply excellent.
Nothing is to much trouble,a font of knowledge and happy to share that knowledge with guests
“Thank You” Maurice you made our weekend away extra special
Read less

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Good
Review: Had a lovely family meal for our granddaughters 3rd birthday got to thank Maria for helping make it a great night for Mollie

Name: Arundel Cathedral
Title: If in Arundel take the walk up the hill
Review:
It is certainly worth calling into and is suitably impressive albeit on a relatively small scale compared to many cathedrals. Elegance and spaciousness of structure and lovely stained glass windows certainly make this very much part of a visit to the lovely town of Arundel.
Read less

Name: The Thatched House
Title: Disappointing
Review: We booked a table for a special dinner last night to be told on arrival they had no chef so no dinners ! I had left my mobile phone number having eaten here twice within 10 days so we could have been told so disappointing as we had recommended the restaurant in spite if poor service the previous weekend due to staff shortages need to get a reliable chef on board to make it in this village

Name: Motte & Bailey
Title: Light Lunch.
Review: We were taken here for the first time buy our son and his wife who raved about the food and we were not disappointed. The place was very busy but we managed to find a table and immediately were welcomed with a smile. The lunch menu was quite small but we think that this is sometimes the best way. The food was excellent and the service was quick. As we were pushed for time we took a selection of cakes away with us and eat them later. They were also delicious. Will definitely be back again.

Name: Syrup Café
Title: Avoid
Review: Went in for a sandwich to take on the train the sausage was burnt and dry was a complete waste of money threw it in the bin

Name: Arundel Historic Tours
Title: Great tour - Martin was excellent!
Review:
We visited Arundel yesterday and decided to book this tour with Martin and we were so glad that we did.

Martin was really enthusiastic and is a local lad; a “mullet” as he called it. He had great knowledge of Arundel and throughout the tour he would tell us about his own personal stories which added a nice touch to the tour.

We learnt a lot about Arundel and would definitely recommend this tour to anyone who is planning to visit!

Tom.

Name: T-Bone Burger
Title: Lunch
Review: We came here for Lunch on Friday. This is the first time we have been here. My wife (5 Months Pregnant) had a kids meal! This was perfect size for her and she had a nice hot dog! My daughter and I had Steak burgers with fries. A 6.99 deal-Not badky priced. The food took a while to arrive (It wasn't very busy) but it was very nice and filled us up. Good service and food all round!

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Very disappointed
Review: My previous experience of Hall and Woodhouse was a fabulously fresh and artistically presented ploughmans lunch at World End in Patching, Worthing. My friend and I decided on a ploughmans each at the Black Rabbit but it was disappointing. The rocket had wilted, spring onion was the outside throwaway shell, celery again outside section, unwashed so too chewy, bread roll not crusty or warm and salad a little sad as though it'd been sitting around. When we told the waitress she never replied and when paying for it we were asked again if we'd enjoyed it, we said no. No reply, no queries, nothing. We only saw student bar staff and no one appeared to be in charge so did anyone care enough to feed back our disappointment? A worthy establishment would surely be concerned or at least deduct our coffees or drinks off the bill? Poor.

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Few beers and light lunch
Review: Lovely pub with plenty of tables by the river on a lovely sunny day. Good food. Good view of castle. Can walk from castle to pub in about 20mins.

Name: Star Fish Kingdom
Title: poor quality at big prices
Review:
Called in for some chips to go with already bought roast beef! Smallest portion was £2.40
of which I must have thrown away the £2 worth. Poor quality. I should have learned from a visit 2 weeks ago to buy 3 pensioner portions.(£5 per portion) Smallest fish I've seen, more like a fish finger however the chips on that occasion were reasonably edible. Better travelling further to Oceans. Better quality, bigger portions and cheaper prices!!

Name: The George, Burpham
Title: How long should you have to wait?
Review: We arrived at this pub at around 1.45 and, according to the manager, our order went in at 2.02. It was just two sandwiches and not a difficult order, I would have thought. At 2.40, we asked when we could expect it and were told two minutes. At 2.45, there was no sign of it. We asked for our money back and left. Obviously, we cannot comment on the quality of the food.

Name: Anokha
Title: Disappointed
Review: We just ate in here, as we do every boxing day, and ordered 3 set meals between 5 of us. The food wasnt as good as it used to be either. The waiter stated we could split our meals no problem, however when it came to paying he tried charging us for 5 meals!! He also said the same to the table of 10 behind us too, however tried charging us almost £40 for one meal!! Sad really, because we used to enjoy it here. Won't be coming back.

Name: Clock House Café
Title: lovely relaxing place
Review: This is a cafe so e marked it on my experiences of cafe's, i found it relaxing with plenty of room, service was excellent, and you get what you want the menu is a guild so dont be afraid to ask they will get what you want

Name: Aldwick Beach
Title: Time travel on a beach.
Review: Took me back to my childhood, walking barefoot in the warmth of the shallows, lovely firm sand and then the excrutiating pain of struggling up the shingle to get back to the promenade. Memories are made of this.

Name: Pagham Beach Café
Title: Mrs AM
Review:
Food overpriced and nothing special.
The size of ice cream scoops depend on a waitress mood as one day they were big the next day half of the size?! Won’t go back

Name: Peri Peri House
Title: Don't ever use this place !
Review: Ordered my food at 3:15pm was waiting for a hour so I called them and they said they haven't even started it yet! Will be with u within 20mins!, The driver was outside my flat for 10-15 mins Chatting to his mate!, Till I called the shop again! And told him to read the instructions! Finally he comes up to my door and my other half asked who's the boss today and the driver got all moody and swearing at my partner! What made him mad! If I could give no stars I would!!!

Name: Boat House In the Marina
Title: Only go if booked.......and if they know your spending money!
Review: So seen as my constructive critism review was "mysteriously" wiped away from your website Julie Fear, I felt the need to tell my fellow trip advisors me and my Gf went friday the 29th we had a lovely meal...Julie the owner was very friendly to us so were the staff...I wrote an amazing review not only on her fb page but on my own as well, upon this recommendation my Gf's family decided to go for drinks and cakes they were told they would be served only to be ignored for 15 minutes while they pottered about and did other things...one member of staff was even wiping tables instead of serving...Julie herself claims they were busy tending to "customers who booked" maybe you only appriciate business if its £70 worth????Maybe you only accomidate for people you deem worthy?? Either way thats not how you run a business...everyone is equal! Yes its nice views and food there I wont deny... but they are only nice if you book and stay for long periods...so I suggest to go Arun view(across the river) where the staff are friendly to everyone.. foods good and the view is great too!

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: 1 night stay which was slightly disappointing
Review:
We had a 1 night stay here for our anniversary, we have stayed before so was happy to book again. We booked an executive room, but to be honest we felt this was not so, we found our room had a tidy clean bed and clean bath, toilet sink etc, but the dust in this room was not acceptable, dusty walls, and dirty window sills, dusty shelves and hair on shelves as well. dirty behind bathroom bin, and just really mucky when looking close. We did tell the receptionist when we left who firstly said it was just a days dust which that would could have accepted, but this was months of dust, which was totally unacceptable, she apologised and made a note. Everything else was good, the staff were nice, the breakfast was lovely and plenty of it for the price. Please Norfolk Arms Hotel, give your rooms and deep clean now and again!
Read less

Name: The Bear Inn
Title: Very Pleasant Stay
Review: Staff here are lovely, really made us feel welcome and seemed to enjoy having us there. Gent behind the bar showed us up to our room and offered for us to dine before the kitchen closed, which we took up. The lady who served us was really professional and friendly. Food was delicious and we had an amazing homemade Eton Mess for dessert. The morning after we were greeted at the dining room with breakfast all set up for us and staff were ready to take our order straight away, definitely a benefit of staying at an Inn with only 3 rooms, very personal service! Breakfast was delicious and a very generous portion. We also loved the two very friendly dogs. The only reason that I’ve left 4 instead of 5 stars is that the room just needs a little bit of work. The room is advertised as a king bed, but we’re fairly sure it was a double (however we didn’t have to pay extra for this, so not too fussed). The carpet is a bit dated and there isn’t a bed frame or headboard. The lamp in the room also didn’t work. Otherwise all very good!

Name: Papa Johns, Butlins
Title: AMAZING!
Review: Went to character breakfast this morning, It was great to see the team dancing and interacting with all of the children. The food selection was fantastic and tasted amazing. Would highly recommend.

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Ms
Review:
This hotel is one of the worst places I have stayed. Rooms are extremely dated and in need of repair . Nothing like the photos don't be fooled . Should be rated 2 star hostel . Very expensive for what you get
Read less

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Nothing is like it is stated
Review:
Staff is very nice and trying to do the best comparing to what they can provide or they can work with.
Food is ok, though they do not have anything like it is stated on the menu. The main courses like lamb shank, salmon is spotless, great, but the side dish is not what you order. With none of the orders. They provide a few vegan food, but more then half of it they ran out. (On a Sunday it means the restaurant is not prepared for guests.) It is hard for a vegan person.
Not mentioning the problems with the coffee.
Payment is complicated f you want to share the bill with your friends. Basically a menu is thrown to you and calculate and figure it out on your own what you ordered and need to pay.
A well operated place is doing that you say what you ordered they add up on there terminal and it is done, bill is out.
Very expensive related to the quality and value.
Cheaper, less known places provides better food.

Name: Butlers
Title: Clearly very cliquey - no gluten free bread!
Review:
We came here on a Sunday and enjoyed a lovely Sunday roast - really delicious and great roast potatoes.
The only problem was the service received - the restaurant clearly has a lot of loyal customers that are very kissy kissy with the female manager. This is fine and is typically a sign of a good restaurant - however it isn’t great when you are treated differently to them. For example, on arrival we asked for a cock tail menu and were told no cocktails on a Sunday. I have been before just for drinks on a Sunday and enjoyed an espresso martini and also a pornstar martini so was surprised to hear they weren’t available. I then noticed the table next to us had almost empty pornstar martinis (including the Prosecco glass) and the table that arrived after us (kissed the manager) and were given cocktails...
The staff weren’t very attentive even leaving our empty glasses on our table for the duration of the meal, we were practically stacking them at the end. Our plates took ages to clear also.

They don’t have gluten free bread which is quite unacceptable these days with over 1 in 100 people affected by a gluten intolerance or allergy so I watched my husband enjoy his bread whilst I waited for my starter...

I wouldn’t rush back but I did enjoy the food - well done to the kitchen!

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: Wonderful!
Review: Some of the best fish and chips we’ve had. Everything was fresh and tasted amazing! The kids menu was also brilliant and very good value. The staff were fab, from the waiters to management, all professional and friendly. Lovely restaurant in all, with very nice decor. We’ll definitely be back!

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Terrible attitude ruined trip
Review:
Trip ruined by an incredibly rude member of staff at reception. For some reason she was intent on creating an argument and is obviously a graduate of the Faulty Towers School of Hotel Management.

A shame, as although this overpriced hotel is tired and deeply unexceptional, the rest of the staff were pleasant.
Read less

Name: Hawking About
Title: A memory to be treasured
Review:
What a truly wonderful experience to be highly recommended. We had so much to learn and came away with the thrill of understanding the Harris Hawk in his natural habit and flying free. Thank you Kevin.
Read less

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Arundel Castle Garden are first rate
Review:
Tourists used to come to see the castle and then the gardens but now it’s often the other way round. The gardens over the past few years have really come into their own as one if the finest in the South of England. Starting in the early spring and progressing through the amazing tulip display in May and then onto the glorious herbaceous and roses. This is a garden for all seasons. Whoever created and designed this garden is a true talent.
Only negative - it really is expensive to get in.
Read less

Name: The Gravy Boat
Title: Great place for eating out!!
Review: Great food and staff here. Very varied menu including carvery. Even been here for my last Christmas do!! Visited many times over the years!!

Name: Swan Hotel
Title: Not worth the money for an "indulgence room"
Review:
Didn't feel "indugent" at all! The walls and paint were scuffed. The double bed was two single divans pulled together so you slipped down the middle of the two of them. No bath, only a bare windowless shower room with lino on the floor. It is stated that not all rooms have a bath but the bathroom itself was tatty, with a cracked sink and toilet lid. Decor was more plain than stripped back. The furniture was stained with other people drinks. No minibar or fridge.

Positives - The room was clean. The bed was comfy if you didn't go close to the middle! A complimentary bottle of Proseco as it was our anniversary. The pub is excellent and the staff and breakfast both faultless. The fault does not lie with the staff or their hospitality. Fresh milk for tea in the room.

It was a large and okay b&b type room but lacked a level of polish that I would expect at this price. I felt mis-sold by Fullers, the room I got is only featured in one of their photographs (and only on the separate booking companies website) whilst the rest of their rooms look far more "indulgent!"
Read less

Name: The Lamb Inn
Title: Not learning from mistakes
Review: Again very disappointing visit to this pub. Although placed in perfect location it just lacks atmosphere. Seems like it’s being run by an amateur with no idea how to manage a pub. Menu not very exciting, drinks overpriced. Definitely not recommended!

Name: Avisford
Title: Back to the 1980's
Review:
The Hilton at Arundel isn't really like any other Hilton I've stayed at. The room corridors are very shabby and decorated in a faded mix of orange carpets and yellow walls, which seemed not to have been improved since the 1980's. The room was dingy and pretty small and decorated in the same way. Staff were all very pleasant and the breakfast was good - but for £179, definitely not the stylish and pretty standard experience I have previously experienced with the Hilton chain. I'll check the reviews more carefully next time. I suggest that you avoid rooms 1-42 which are in the neglected part of the building.
Read less

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Family Christmas Dinner
Review: Paid £55 per head/7 for very poor meals. The quality was not there, one of the meals had clearly been kept warm as the sauce was congealed, the fillet steaks left a lot to be desired as did the quality of the turkey dinners. Two people had ice cream bombs which were served with cold sauce hence they could not melt the chocolate; therefor fairly inedible. We were the last people for dinner (4pm), which showed in the standard of cooking, also some of the service was dreadfully poor; had to ask for water on 3 occasions. Will not be going back anytime soon, £400 wasted, shame on Beefeater, spoiled our Christmas Day.

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Stunning....
Review:
Beautiful location and breathtaking buildings. Gardens are incredible and leaves in awe of the beauty surrounding this incredible castle! Well worth a visit
Read less

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Worth a visit
Review:
Spring is definitely the time to visit and admire the extensive and well manicured gardens at Arundel Castle
Read less

Name: Avisford
Title: Absolute disgrace!
Review:
I cannot even explain how disappointed I was in this hotel stay. This was booked for my birthday as a surprise pamper night away,my partner saved up for a while to take me away.
We were given a tiny box room with a miniscule window, we wanted to relax swim and use the spa...
Instead we went to Arundel for the evening as we couldn't relax in our old, dank teeny box.
Pool closed, spa full, could barely walk round the bed in the room.
May as well have set fire to £200. Absolute joke.
If you're going cancel ASAP!!!!
Read less

Name: World's End
Title: Very expencive bad food
Review: Had a salad their with my family, food quality was very poor. The salard looked like it was a month old I wouldn't of eaten ot if it was in my own fridge so was very surprised that they had even served it. The pub its self has been done up to a very nice standard but what a shame about the food. I did complain but no refund was offered. Wont be going their agen.

Name: Premier Inn Littlehampton
Title: awful experience
Review:
awful soundproofing, people stomping above, not enough tea coffee. decaff was a specific request, pub is horrible, noisy bathroom fan, cold temp, no choice of healthy breakfast. Never again. very disappinted indeed. Chose it over the the Worthing one for peace and quiet, it was like a creche, kids everywhere.
Read less

Name: Papa Johns, Butlins
Title: Amazing Service!!
Review: Our server Laura H was amazing! So easy to chat to, helpful with orders and lovely with our child who is normally pretty shy. We went in very shortly before they closed and she was still super friendly! The food was great and the potato wedges were awesome! A great visit overall but can’t thank Laura enough, not often you get great service like this!

Name: The Spur
Title: Shocking service, burnt lasagne, uncooked veg!!
Review:
Where to start.... waitress didn’t know the vegetarian options were available.
They TWICE mixed up the veg & meat lasagne orders, causing my vege wife to be sick from eating the wrong food.
When this was pointed out, the waitress didn’t care less & tried to pick an argument with my wife over it.
Felt like they were doing us a favour by waving the cost of the lasagne from the bill that my wife threw up!!
No concern shown or apologies from either waitress or management.
Parsnips were cold, roast beef wafer thin & spread across the plate to make it look more. Couldn’t cut it with the cutlery supplied.
Poor customer service, poor food control. Not going there again.

Name: The Gravy Boat
Title: "Nachos"
Review: Nachos are absolutely amazing! Nice carvery but surprised that they served the veg, not sure if that's the norm!

Name: Inglenook
Title: good location
Review:
A Very friendly Hotel with helpful and happy staff and a good location. Even a parrot in the bar! Pretty gardens and good Food.
Pet friendly.
Staying in a private owned hotel s much better than staying in a chain owned hotel .
We would stay here again. Thank you

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Great food, very very friendly staff !
Review: just come back from Knights table and we were starving hungry ! ..we were greeted by some very friendly staff who loved our 2 JRT pups and they loved the attention too! ( we didn’t know dogs were allowed in tbh- just spotted ‘dogs welcome’ outside ) ...we were shown to our seats and then the very friendly chef served us our carvery meats. I have to say this food was top class home cooked taste. Succulent melt in the mouth meat and amazing roast potatoes and crackling ! ....and for £14 pp well worth it too ! ...I am not that impressed with too many places to eat in Arundel ...this is one we will be back to for sure...Thanks for a lovely meal and great friendly environment

Name: Parsons Table
Title: The best in Arundel
Review:
My wife and I visiting from Florida went with another couple and had an outstanding dinner. The atmosphere is cozy, not packed with tables and the food is outstanding.
A must when visiting Arundel

Name: The Lamb Inn
Title: Impromptu visit
Review:
We passed this pub on the way to our weekend cottage and it was a great find.
The food choice was good. Homemade items too. Waiting staff very friendly and attentive.
Food was really excellent for the price. We would have been happy if it had cost more.
The side salad was fresh and tasted amazing. Care and love of the food preparation showed.
I would definitely recommend this one.

Name: The Beresford
Title: Great food but shame about the dogs
Review: Have eaten many times in the past as live locally but very disappointed that dogs are allowed in especially when this establishment is predominantly for food. Luckily had eaten meal today when when a couple with a dog sat next to us and I can't describe how smelly this dog was. Finished drink and left. Should dogs be allowed in the restaurant eating area?

Name: Sen
Title: Lovely friendly restaurant
Review:
Had a lovely meal at the Sen a few weeks ago on a Sunday our waitress Sam was working the front on her own smiling and very efficent and it was very busy she is a credit to your buisness.
Food was delightful mussels were great atmoshphere and surroundings were fantastic highly recommend to all

Name: The Lamb Inn
Title: Very poor service!
Review: Waitress working on a lunch time shift on the 22nd April displayed lack of service. Took our order without asking for drinks and did not ask how are food was. Her name ( Kate ).!

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: Family room
Review:
Brilliant stay all staff were helpful and welcoming. Parking was good. Fresh towels and extra pillows/blankets available on request free of charge. Got good night sleep both nights as was nice a quite both inside the hotel and outside. Handy local shops/petrol station and a loverly pub across the road. Booked in for breakfast (thinking was a cooked breakfast) but was cornflakes and muffin with orange juice but the team was understanding and gave me a full refund. Would recommend this travel lodge
Read less

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Disappointing
Review: We visited on New Years Eve hoping there would be something going on. Last year there was live music and it was really good. However this year was a big disappointment there was no party atmosphere even the staff who are usually very friendly and fun were not even trying. One member started blowing out the candles on the tables at 11.30 and clearing up, even though they were supposed to be open till 12.30. Big big disappointment.

Name: Chez Moi
Title: A Real Find!
Review: I tried this on the recommendation of a friend. 'Chez Moi' is a French bistro-style restaurant with friendly staff serving excellent food. (The homemade bread is particularly delicious!) Being something of a Francophile and a self-confessed foodie I can be difficult to please, but I thoroughly enjoyed our lunch with friends and will definitely be going again. I also had a nice chat with the chef who was charming. In addition, his French wife does conversation classes on some mornings with fresh patisserie - which I shall also be trying. A little bit of France in Bognor.

Name: Arundel Museum
Title: So glad we popped in.....
Review: My partner and I had arrived the day before from Canada and had decided to take a train from London to Arundel to take an old friend out to lunch. We arrived a little early and took a walk through the town. We almost didn't go into the Museum..... it is quite small .... but my partner is a right History buff, so we went in. He went off and did his thing (He thoroughly enjoyed it all) and I spent ages looking around the lovely little store. The store assistant was very knowledgeable about Arundel. I bought some Arundel Strawberry Jam, to take back to Canada to give to the lady who was looking after my house. A very enjoyable visit.

Name: Swan Hotel
Title: Fabulous Service Good Pub Grab
Review:
Popped in for lunch during a day visit to Arundel, didn’t book but they found us a table, plenty on choice on the menu we had the Sunday lunch which was fresh & tasty food, we really enjoy our visit & will be recommending The Swan Hotel.
Read less

Name: KFC Bognor
Title: If you want lousy service and greasy food visit here
Review:
We visited here on the 17th June as it was convenient to where we were staying.

The server couldn't be more uninterested and unhelpful if he tried. We took our order away with us and didn't realise the following until afterwards. The food order was half wrong with different food to what we'd ordered and was so greasy it got thrown into the bin.

We'd asked for sauces, napkins and hand cleansers and none of them were given. They probably would have tasted better than the food ......

Name: Sen
Title: Best ambiance and food in bognor
Review:
I went there 2 days ago because of the reviews that I saw and I have to admit it was delicious spicy and I'm talking about not just the food.
If you are looking for a cosy place where you can sit down and chill out by yourself or with someone.
Highly recommended

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Nice Hotel but he prepared for early wake up calls
Review:
I’ve stayed at this hotel several times, it’s local to my work and bang in the middle of Arundel. The hotel itself is fine, the staff friendly, the breakfast always brilliant, BUT... and it’s a big BUT! The last several times I’ve stayed here the fire Alarm has gone off at very unsociable times of the night. Sometimes more than once. When I stay away for work it’s because I need to be fresh the next day & saves me commuting for 2 hours from Bournemouth. I don’t know why the Fire Alarms keep going off, but I always get told by reception when I have a moan “that someone smoked in the room or a shower set it off”. Last night was the same & is probably the final straw for me in terms of staying at the Norfolk Arms.

I’ve never had any offer of compensation on the numerous occasions it has happened & the bigger concern for me now, is that I take it for granted that it’s not an actual fire, I don’t even get out of bed for these alarms. so one day a fire may actually occur and any frequent stayers will probably just ignore it.

Great shame because if it wasn’t for this I’d easily give it a 4 out of 5.
Read less

Name: LG Café
Title: In the pink
Review: We visited this afternoon and had a very enjoyable lunch. The pizza and garlic cheese sandwiches were great. The salad Nicoise with a pink egg and edible flowers was tres bon. Pink bagel, smoked salmon and goats cheese a delight. We had three different mint teas made with herbs from the garden, very refreshing! The service was very good too. We recommend. We didn’t try the cakes.....

Name: Butlins
Title: Treat your three year old to some violence
Review:
I could spend an hour complaining about this run down filthy resort but I’ll restrain myself.

Instead I’ll focus on just one thing. To do anything in this place you are forced to walk past an amusement arcade. I was at a tots week and the machines at the front had huge screens with gun displaying violence and death. For £2 you could treat your three year old to the bloody murder of people of dinosaurs

It is impossible to avoid seeing the screen of the game Halo!!!

Billy butlin would be turning in his grave to know that his family fun resort had been turned into a centre for inciting violence.

Disgusting !! Avoid if you have a family
Read less

Name: Galley Restaurant and Tea Rooms
Title: All day breakfast, not
Review: The menu states all day breakfast served until MIDDAY. I asked for eggs on toast at 1pm but was told it was too late. They then offered me a toasted egg sandwich.

Name: Haskins Garden Centre
Title: Large Store, Great for Christmas Decor
Review: Went into Haskins before christmas and the store was packed full of different items to purchase, I thought the store was well laid out, large food area, toilets were clean and tidy and the venue benefits from a very large car park so no issue with trying to find a space.  If I am in the area in the future I will definitely visit when I have more time to browse.

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Excellent value
Review: Great portions of very tasty food. Staff friendly and attentive. All in all excellent value for money. Will be going back.

Name: The Lion
Title: Great pub food
Review:
We often eat at the pub when we stay with family during the holidays as we live abroad. Very family friendly and excellent food. Waitresses are smiley and attentive. Although they are sometimes very busy, I have always had a good experience and enjoy returning with my husband and child and the grandparents are regulars.
Also dog friendly which is a plus for my father who likes to take his sidekick everywhere he goes.

Name: KFC Bognor
Title: Terrible
Review:
My first visit to eat a meal.

I had a bucket. Chicken was ok, but not that crispy, kind of soggy.
The fries are not good in fact they were chips, just like you get at your local fish and chip shop, again soggy, hold one and it flops down , not at all crispy. And not like fries should be.
Men's toilets not great green water marks and black mold on the urinals.
Enough said.

Name: Lemongrass Restaurant
Title: Birthday dinner
Review:
A must restaurant for Thai food,very accessible and friendly staff make your visit special. The food is outstanding with fantastic helpful staff. We started with the mixed platter and for my main I had a massaman curry with lamb all very tasty.
All our food was first rate and all very tasty a very enjoyable birthday meal. A return visit is a must.

Name: Chez Moi
Title: Lovely atmosphere
Review: Heard a lot of good things about this rare french restaurant for Bognor Regis. The restaurant is very rustic with well placed pieces adorning the tables, shelves and bar giving it a very authentic air. The menu is plentiful but not complicated and the prices are reasonable. My friends had cider served in tea cups and the house red was gorgeous. Little tasters are offered whilst browsing the menu and no pressure put on us to choose. All dishes chosen were authentic french and very tasty. I will definitely be back. Just need to mention the excellent service from the floor team. Well done guys

Name: The George, Burpham
Title: Disappointing experience
Review: My son and his partner took me to the restaurant for a birthday meal on 20th July 2019.We arrived as arranged at 7.30. We were shown directly to our table. Eventually we were asked to place our orders. However our starters did not appear till 8.30!!!!. No one came to our table to apologise for the long delay. The customer service was not good. Even when I finally received my main course the salmon was very dry although the risotto was tasty. We actually gave up on the dessert and didn't order. When we were asked if we would visit again we said no. The man explained that they only had one chef but did not offer to reduce our bill. It was a very disappointing experience.

Name: Raj Doot
Title: Dont waste your money!!!
Review:
Our usual favourite indian was closed so we decided to try this one. The chicken tikka was overcooked, dry and tough. The lamb was completely inedible and I dont use that word lightly! It was like chewing on a lump of rubber. The lamb was my partners and when she said she couldn't eat it I thought she was exaggerating. She wasnt.....
The onion bhaji was burnt and flavourless. And the samosa was soggy.
To make matters worse it was about 20% more expensive than the order for similar meals from our usual. The curry sauces were palatable but nothing more. The naan bread was the standard bought in ones that most Indians have so were reasonable but nothing compared to freshly made ones.
Save some money and order from Cinnamon in Beach Road. You will have a much much better meal!

Name: Golden Grill
Title: horrible
Review: i went there hungry and usually i love kebab, i ordered a lamb donner for myself and chips for my boyfriend the chips were fine however the kebab for me made me physically sick the next day, all day and still couldn’t really eat for 2 days after. i won’t be going again not impressed.

Name: Royal Norfolk
Title: Needs an update
Review:
Stayed for 2 nights, on the plus side the check in was easy and the receptionist was informative and polite, unfortunately this is pretty much were the plus(s) end..

The room was large enough and was clean, the carpet could do with being renewed and had an iron mark by the end of the bed. There was only 2 tiny bars of soap, no shampoo / conditioner etc. There was instant coffee and tea but no bottled water.

The breakfast was an experience, we arrived to an almost empty dining area and the waitress wanted to seat us by a window in direct sunlight and almost on top of a couple of gentlemen on the table next to us, the tables were so close. The waitress said she would have to ask her manager to change our table . . . The dining area was empty???

The manager appeared and said they had a coach party and they had allocated tables. OK, but we are paying guest too! She reluctantly moved us to another table and we ordered breakfast. Breakfast arrived, the toast was cold and brittle (been made a while) and I had a long hair in my baked beans, I did not eat the breakfast and asked the waitress to take it away, I was offered a replacement, but declined.
