So ridiculous to have a non smoking ok site rule ( except for on designated areas) that’s not enforced whatsoever! I even watched staff stood next to a guy smoking in the fairground! People outside our front door smoking constantly, my apartment stinks. Not good butlins. Especially for a family friendly place.
Read less

Name: St Mary's Gate
Title: Badger Heaven
Review: If you go to top of hill in Arundel you will find a right treasure of a boozer, St Mary's Gate Inn. Located adjacent to the RC Cathedral and well worth the effort of getting there. Good food and great beers on offer, highlight the 3 Dorset based Badger cask ales on offer. Tanglefoot, Badger Ale and Fursty Ferret.

Name: WWT Wetland
Title: Great place to spend some time
Review:
First visited the Wetlands about 14 years ago and always wanted to return. Finally did so earlier in October and it was everything we had hoped for....lots of good tracks and boardwalks and dozens of types of waterfowl, all in quite big numbers. Wonderful to see. The staff were very helpful and obviously take pride in their workplace.

Not to be missed if you are a nature lover and are anywhere near.
Read less

Name: The Diner
Title: Thank you liam
Review: Thank you to Liam, service was fast and food was ok.. liam was very friendly and helpful, dirty fries was lush by the chicken wings were horrible.

Name: Butlins
Title: Amazingly fun
Review:
I’ve just came back from my hen do a 80s adult weekend. Wow what a laugh we’ve had. We went to a pool party, dressed up in fancy dress and went to a silent disco which was fun. Staff were amazing but a man called Craig and lady called Elisha who were working on a bar in the skyline stood out for me and the girls. They sang and danced and joined in the banter with everyone who was there, and were always smiling.. Which was lovely to see. I have already booked to come back in November and thank you for making my hen do so amazing.. memories to last a lifetime. The rain didn’t stop our fun and games! Thanks butlins
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Perfect family stay
Review:
So we went to Bognor Regis resort for the first time in september, Wow what a week, fantastic from start to finish. We stayed in the shoreline hotel with hotel dining and can’t fault anything at all, room was amazingly clean, friendly staff and the food was lovely, I feel I must give a special mention to Wendy who was one of the waitresses during our stay, we was a breath of fresh air and a real asset to your team. I’m sure my children will never forget how lovely she was to them. The whole resort was lovely, plenty to do and lots of team members to help you enjoy your stay, we normally stay at Skegness however will definitely be returning to Bognor soon 😊
Read less

Name: Inglenook
Title: Superb Service
Review:
My wife and I, spent 2 night here in June, It was a last minute booking but despite having one one room available they ensured that we were able to meet our request of a room with a bath. They were also able to accommodate the last minute change of us having to bring our small dog.

We had stayed at the Inglenook several times in many years ago and always enjoyed our time there. If anything the hotel has improved.

The room was small but immaculately clean with everything you would need. There is a basic but satisfying choice of cereals and yogurts, jams and marmalade and juices. The cooked breakfast options were plentiful, very well prepared and used top quality ingredients.

We did not eat in the restaurant on this occasion but it was always busy and the menu and specials looked wonderful. The Sunday lunch carvery look particularly delicious.

The bar was relaxed and friendly with an impressive variety of beers, ciders and specialised spirits. Despite the intermittent weather we were able to enjoy a couple of hours in the wonderfully maintained garden. It is easy to understand why this is a popular venue for functions

What impressed us most was the service and attention to detail, nothing was too much trouble. Service delivered by a team that enjoy what they do and with a pride that can only come from a truly independent hotel.

I have no hesitation in recommending the Inglenook. We will visit again.

Name: George & Dragon
Title: Unedible duck
Review: Booked lunch here as it always had a good reputation. Three of us ordered duck breast which was so raw to be unbelievable! Whilst we like our duck pink it was RAW and we could not even cut it with a knife. We complained but to no avail and paid the bill hungry.very disappointing.

Name: Kerry's Tea Room
Title: Friendly Local Tea Room
Review: Friendly local tea room. Always enjoy popping into Kerry's for a coffee and a milkshake or ice-cream with the children.

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Right next to Arundel castle
Review: The staff were great and very friendly and the food was very good. I went for the burger that was perfectly cooked the rest of the family had the carvery two of them are chefs and they were really impressed and enjoyed it. Would 100% go back.

Name: The Lamb Inn
Title: Worst meal ever
Review:
I went to the Lamb for a family meal, and I can honestly say it was the worst meal I’ve ever had.
It wasn’t really busy but we had to wait a very long time for starters to come. The beef rib was so dry. The mains were even worse. My father had steak and kidney pie, and l don’t even want to explain what it looked like, just splatted on a plate. It was mushy and bland. I had lamb shank, and it was absolutely covered in oil. My mother had scallops which weren’t cooked. No waitress came and did a check back so we had to go and find a waitress to complain. We were told ‘You don’t need to pay for the scallops’, well I should think not as they were uncooked!! I said about the lamb shank and it was shrugged off. Management didn’t seem to know what they were doing, had to call the landlord who wasn’t there to ask what they should do. Next time, The Lion is the place to be!

Name: Juniper
Title: Excellent coffee, cake and service
Review: We popped in here today for coffee and cake. Very warm and friendly welcome and service. Yummy Nutella cake, and good quality coffee. Will definitely return.

Name: Royal Norfolk
Title: Mainly good but a few oddities
Review: The food was lovely rooms clean and loved the sea view.My friends guide dog was made very welcome.I was surprised I had to take my own cases upstairs and just given number of room not shown there.It would have been helpful to have 2 keys was told no way was this possible is in other hotels I have stayed in.Biggest oddity was breakfast 8.20 dinner 6.50 times non negotiable on holiday like to choose how early late I get up

Name: The Holly Tree
Title: Good value food
Review: We recently visited Walberton and we had an evening meal at the pub. We were very impressed with the food and the staff could not have been more helpful. The food was excellent value for money and we returned the very next day for another meal. Keep up the good work and we will see you again when we return later in the year.

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: T. B. S Arundel
Review: We waited twenty minutes to order and waited a further 45 minutes for our meal. We took some students in who came in and ordered before two other groups yet got served after both other groups, in fact the last group got their order first and the other group also complained, not only that the waitress went to sort out payment for another table and sat another group down as the food was on the counter getting cold.(the bell had already been rung to say they were ready.) Very disappointed, and will never go there again!

Name: Town House
Title: Large room, uncomfortable bed
Review: Stayed here for one night. Good large room and bathroom in a central location. The age and standard of the bed mattress was very poor. The shower was difficult to set for the right temperature and offered little water. Very poor value

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Sunny day in Arundel
Review:
The Black Rabbit is a beautiful pub on the river next to Arundel Castle. We sat outside (myself, my mum and her partner) right on the river. Unfortunately, for the first time this summer, I saw wasps everywhere! I know this is a natural thing, I felt like the pub could have put some prevention/traps in place to assist so customers wouldn't have to have so many wasps flying into their beers or into their food.
However, other than the wasps, the food was actually really nice, although I'd expect this for the price. A little pricey, but the quality was there to match. The service was decent, and both waiters that we experienced were very polite. The bar lady behind the bar was also super polite.
Overall I give this 4/5.

Name: Avisford
Title: Hot room and woken by staff
Review:
The price of the hotel was very reasonable but the room we stopped in was extremely hot and had to request for the heating to be turned down. This was sorted but the room was still hot.
Secondly at 8:00 in the morning a member staff tried to enter our room without knocking or making themselves present. Luckily we had the latch across the door. In result of this we was fully awake and was at unease.
Thanks, Shane.
Read less

Name: The Waverley
Title: Sunday Lunch
Review: I was looking for a good pub in the area to go to with my son and dog, We were recommended to this pub as not only are they dog friendly in and out but also their roasts where the best around. I had the chicken roast and my son asked for the 'Trio' pork belly, beef and chicken. We also opted for the sides - parmesan crusted roasted parsnips, maple roast marrow and kale with roasted shallots. My dog is well behaved most of the time and we were welcomed inside by the very friendly staff (especially India - who really gave 100% bringing over a dog bowl with water and some treats for my little lady). Food was amazing - I can't recommend the extra parsnips enough - I need the recipe for Christmas.

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Not What It Used To Be
Review:
We arrived about 5:55 and it must have been shift change or something as staff were standing around chatting and ignoring the small queue that had started as there was just one team member serving at the bar.
For one of our drinks I ordered a G&T, as they have a good choice of gin, and was watching the gin being poured into the measure and was very surprised to see that it was a short measure and when the team member was challenged they denied it. Measures should be filled to the top, not half a centimetre below because they’re afraid to spill the spirit.
On ordering our food I asked for gluten free mozzarella sticks to be told that there were none. This isn’t the first time there has been menu items or drinks unavailable because of poor stock control.
When our meal was delivered one item had to be returned as it was cold and a gluten free burger had a gluten containing side on the same plate which had the risk of cross contamination.
For desert a gluten free was ordered and when it was subsequently brought to the table it had a wafer in it, so was sent back.
Whilst our food related problems were resolved there appears to be a wholesale lack of knowledge about allergens and this should be addressed as a matter of urgency.
Extremely poor customer service - The staff were not engaging with the vast majority of customers and seemed to have favourite customers and had no awareness of what was happening as there were tables left uncleared for 20 - 30 mins. Started to feel that we were an inconvenience to them.
If this had been a first I might have put it down to a one off but it seems this is becoming the norm.
Establo is a great asset to the village but has definitely gone down hill recently which is a huge disappointment as it has a prime site and potential to be a great success.

Name: Avisford
Title: Worst experience ever
Review:
I went to spend a relaxed weekend.The hotel has spa facilities and we found a good offer including 2 spa treatments
Our room was supposed to be “deluxe ” (please check the photos) it was facing the parking,the carpet had stains,the shower was about to fall…poor quality in all materials,we had the feeling that the hotel was built in the 90s and has no had any renovation.
When we arrived we were told that they had 2 weddings that night,that was not a problem at all.The issue was that around 1am the fire alarm started to beep.Being 8.5 months pregnant didn't help to get out of the room quick, went downstairs following the signals and we ended up behind the hotel in a dark and isolated point,nobody from the hotel was there to help
After 2 minutes someone said it was safe to go back -not an official communication from the hotel.
The following morning we discovered that our room was above the staff entrance to the spa or some other facilities so around 6am a door was banging constantly.Remember:8.5 months pregnant woman had 4h sleep.We complained at reception,but not any compensation (other than free hot chocolate –honestly?) was offered
The dinner was v nice, quality of the food and the choices, but not the service who forgot about the bread, brought us a different order and we were only 4 tables in the restaurant
The service,their response,noise, the terrible status of the room…those are not things you expect when you go to a Hilton and especially if you’re a Honors member
Read less

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Poor standard
Review:
This is only any good if you don't mind bad service and poorly trained staff, variable tariff so you don't really know what your getting and doesn't give value for money, though the room was clean and well presented.
Read less

Name: Maypole Inn
Title: Great Skittles Night
Review: Felpham Singles group visited yesterday for a skittles night. Great fun and completed with a variety of basket meals well served and plentiful. Thanks Sam and staff an we will be back. Photo of the winning team.

Name: Chopsticks
Title: Takeaway
Review: After waiting over 2 hours for delivery received chicken balls not cooked properly. Kids had already started eating as served them first. After driving down to restaurant and showing them they refused to give a partial refund even though meat was pink. They stated was against their policy and when asked for copy of policy the gentleman pointed to his head and said policy was all in there had no proof

Name: Cinnamon
Title: Mr
Review:
We were 12 people the table has been booked days before they still manage to serve the starter for 3 of us before taking any other order from us and is very expensif for just an indian
Never again

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Nice spot, atrocious food.
Review:
A nice spot, with plenty of out- and in-door seating, next to the river.

However, the food was atrocious. We ordered some garlic bread (doughy, tasteless) and a mixed platter which contain chicken wings (insipid, soggy), barbecue pork, kofta (disgusting - inedible), and sausage (vile.- swimming in oil).

The kofta, sausage and wings were swimming in grease (see photos), and all were really terrible.

If you come here, stay for a pint, but avoid the food at all costs.

Name: The Diner
Title: Service is terrible
Review: Nice place and not too expensive for where it is, but service is terrible. The waiters don't come quickly too busy chatting to each other. Orders a few items which had to reorder with different waiters as the original never turned up. Food arrived stone cold, not impressed. Also at lunch you can only order from the lunch menu, they do not serve any food from the main menu.

Name: Bagels and Coffee
Title: perfect brunch / filling snack
Review: great little shop really friendly guys , good selection of fresh bagels and fillings the coffee was excellent, menu is on a chalk board but you can basically build your own if you like , nice

Name: East Beach Café
Title: Don’t bother
Review: Staff are rude and food was cold when it arrived. did not enjoy anything about the evening. Much better places in the area

Name: Butlins
Title: Boring boggy butlins
Review:
Well silver accommodation was ok, apart from a filthy washing up bowl, dried milk stains on kitchen worktop, an oven with no instructions and a fridge that goes all watery if you turn the temperature Under number 3.....and if you wanna cook your own dinner a baking tray and a sharp knife would be handy....oh and a measuring jug thrown in would be great! As for food on the complex.....chips dry as old bones from the ‘traditional chip shop’ , pub stops food at 9pm, not everyone likes eating pizza and burgers, the diner not open at 8pm....did it even open?? Where are people meant to eat after 9pm? Burger King or papa johns just are not acceptable choices?!?!? Considering this is a holiday why does butlins shut/stop so early?? It’s ridiculous...adults are kept in line with the children and so called adult entertainment is abysmal....for example skyline ended tonight at 8.15 pm, the cafe there wasn’t open at 7.15pm when we walked round.....not even a chance of a coffee and centre stage ended at 10.15pm, as I’m not a drinker I have no desire to sit in bar Rosso...so off we go home to bed as nothing else to do.....a nice early night to get up early and look forward to a load of nothing again.....I remember when butlins was really good, kids had a great time, you could get a coffee with ease in the evening, you can’t even walk round in the skyline and have a look in the gift shops or sweet shop as they all close at silly o’clock....the cinema is no more it’s now a left luggage place.....seems to me butlins can palm the kids off with rubbish entertainment as kids accept any old crap.....adults don’t, so we won’t be back.....the most happiest member of staff I met was the litter picker man on the Monday nice friendly happy old chap....now....what is this smoking area ‘thing’, designated areas, it’s like we are being treated like 2nd class citizens the way these smoking places are positioned.....yes smoking is anti social but you have taken it to the extreme, as for one of your funfair workers lecturing me about if I smoke by the rides he will be telling me off and him finding it funny how the smokers are hidden in the ridiculous smoking area by the ice cream shop.....really?!?!?! I do not expect to be spoken to by one of your staff like that.....my holiday wasn’t free gratis and I don’t expect hostility because I smoke.....you need to up your game all round in my opinion
Read less

Name: Navigator
Title: Amazing sea view
Review: Stayed here Saturday night with friends. We were in Navigator too and had room 21 with sea front view and comfy sofa to sit and look out. Friendly welcome and good value at £40 a person including breakfast. Only problem was the walk in the gales to get breakfast two doors down! Great for a short stay.

Name: Tandoori Nights
Title: Not great
Review: I had been recommended this restaurant and don't get me wrong the service was good but the food very bland... no real flavour.. couldn't taste any spices... I wouldn't return...

Name: The Dragon
Title: Fantastic food
Review: A friend and I ate from the ‘eat all you can’ menu. We loved every single dish we ordered. The staff were very attentive and we were made very comfortable. My only reason for not giving a 5 out of 5 is that the acoustics were such that it was too noisy. Means we could hear our neighbours better than we could get each other

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Possibly my worst roast dinner..?
Review:
It was Easter Sunday around 3pm and we were hungry. We saw the Norfolk Arms was advertising roast dinners and, although it was fairly expensive, decided to give it a try. I went to the Norfolk Tap bar to order two roast beef dinners and one pork, and bought some drinks, including a lovely Tarrant Street IPA. When our food arrived, the pork roast had some apple sauce included, but we had to ask for horseradish sauce to go with the beef. It arrived quickly, but without a serving spoon.
Although mum-in-law's pork was OK, our beef was dry and overcooked. The roast potatoes were hard, dry and leathery and the Yorkshire pudding hard and dry as a bone. The parsnips were almost raw and inedible. This was food that had been standing a LONG time. I don’t tolerate bad food and, had we had a check-back, I would have voiced our dissatisfaction. However, none was forthcoming and, as the kitchen was a long way away and it was now after 3 o'clock, we thought we'd have to get on with it or go hungry.
This was one of the most expensive roast dinners I have had, but it was also one of the worst, only one I foolishly ordered from a Wetherspoons being worse.
If you can't keep food warm satisfactorily, then don’t sell it. My wife is a chef and knows how to keep food warm without spoiling and NOT to serve food that is no longer fit for eating. We’re local and will never come back, but it would be nice if other customers didn't have to endure such poor standards.
Read less

Name: Fino
Title: Dinner
Review: Have eaten here a few times and it never fails to disappoint. Food excellent, service superb and the ambience is spot on. Very difficult to think of anything that I coguld possible fault. John newman

Name: LG Café
Title: Lovely new restaurant
Review: This is something a bit different, and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The food is beautifully cooked by French chefs, and our waitress Kelly made sure we were very well looked after. Friendly owners too and nice surroundings, I hope this restaurant does very well.

Name: Avisford
Title: Not a 5*
Review:
Me and partner visited last November, room was disgusting small and old. Miles up and down corridors to get to the room from reception. We must have been given staff quarters as could hardly move, woodchip walls and old tiles. Nothing like the pictures on site. We are visiting Arundel again this year but have chosen to stay elsewhere.
Read less

Name: Swan Hotel
Title: Lovely staff - tired hotel
Review:
The staff - everyone, could not have been nicer. friendly, accessible and so helpful
Food was average pub grub - a bit pricey for the quality but acceptable
the room was adequate but at £110 , pricey
But the place was so tired. Paintwork chipped and flaked and smudged. Carpet could do with a good clean, well replacement actually
The staff did what they could to keep the place clean but, frankly, the pub needs a compete root and branch overhaul
We would love to see the staff again but not the premises
Sorry
Read less

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Poor food, service and over priced drinks.
Review: This place is in such a fantastic setting and could be so great. Probably one of the worst dinners I have eaten in a long time. The weirdest fruit crumble, watery base and uncooked porridge oats thrown over the top. The place was very quiet, only a couple of tables in, yet service slow and erratic. Half the table of our group were cleared of the plates and then the rest were left, we had to remind them to come back to finish the job. Desserts took ages to arrive even though everything was pre ordered. Some of the dishes that other members of the group were enjoyed so not totally awful for all.

Name: St Mary's Gate
Title: fantastic people and fantastic pub
Review:
fantastic people and fantastic pub.
We stayed with a group of friends for a weekend and were made SO welcome by the great team at the St Marys Gate Inn.
Food great, people great, rooms great. Booked to return as we left and will visit, stay eat and drink there as often as we can.. excellent pub.

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Clean
Review:
We have not been back here for over 6 years we used to go a lot , then we had 1 bad meal the plates were cold the food was cold and the carrots tasted like old tinned carrots
This system does not allow you go back past last year so have ticked the earliest date

Name: Mustards
Title: Absolute delight
Review:
This restaurant has only been opened for a year but what an absolute gem. I was looking for somewhere nice to take my elderly aunt for lunch . The people were so helpful and friendly and the food was really rather good. Lovely atmosphere and quite busy even on Wednesday lunchtime.

If your taking elderly relatives there are a couple of steps to negotiate coming into the restaurant but they have a grab rail and my 90 year old aunt managed them.

So lovely to find a nice restaurant in Bognor!

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Birthday meal
Review: Short wait to be shown to a table. Great service good food friendly staff not too long for food to arrive

Name: The Gravy Boat
Title: Christmas Party
Review: Nice menu, superb service and a comfy environment. Like a number of local companies, this place caters well for groups. Due to one particularly rowdy group, we were moved downstairs and the staff were extremely attentive. Starters were excellent and the meat carvery was fine, although the veg were lukewarm and overdone. Small but very pleasant place.

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: An excellent day out
Review:
My partner and I bought the gold plus ticket and were not disappointed in any way. All areas of the castle and garden were outstanding and the staff were very helpful and knowledgeable.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Day Visit
Review:
We came for a look with a new to booking a week away. with the baby, or an adults only weekend with our friends. We were very impressed with the changing facilities for our baby, the entertainment provided, the funfair, the swimming pool and the shows in the pavilion, the nightlife.We went into the travel shop to ask about booking & the lady was very helpful.
We had a drink in the Ocean & decided thats where we would prefer to stay, it was very pleasant. Lunch in the pub was huge, very generous baguettes & very tasty. Again reasonably priced. The day only cost us £12 plus a bit for parking so a good day out. We will be back, with or without the baby !!
Read less

Name: The Diner
Title: Refused
Review:
Family of 4 decided to visit Thursday at 630, couldn’t book as website says no bookings. Arrive and a table was being seated and there was about 5 other tables in the restaurant. Greeted by the girl on the host station and asked if I’d booked. Nope as website says no bookings.
She proceeded to explain that there was a long delay on food and that she had just sat a table of 20. You can come back later. We declined and visited the beach comber pub for the second night and service was 100% food served quick and was really nice. I wouldn’t say I’t was the highest quality but deliver with care. This pub also was over half full and with a outside area. How can you not serve 40 people. Joke

Name: Hawking About
Title: Amazing experience with two Harris Hawks
Review:
This is a wonderful way to experience the old skills of hawking. The Harris Hawks with which we walked, Storm and Sky, came frequently to our gloves and followed us through the woods as they were called. Very well worth it and a unique experience.
Read less

Name: Mustards
Title: Great meal reasonably priced
Review: Food was fantastic presented beautifully the best meal I have had out for ages and at a reasonable price. The staff were lovely attentive but not over powering

Name: St Mary's Gate
Title: A pleasant stay.
Review:
A comfortable and clean room with friendly staff. This is our second stay, and the second time in a row that the cleaner has arrived in our room before check out time to turn the room round whilst we are still getting ready! Good job we were decent!
The breakfast was very tasty and the BnB is very well located in Arundel for access to the cathedral, castle and antique shops.

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Great location,rubbish food
Review:
We live only 15 minutes away and have been here over the years. We are not coming again despite the location.
The food and the beer is overpriced and of low quality.
We should have complained but we were entertaining visiting family and were uncomfortable about doing so.
The veggie plate starter was pathetic. My steak pie with a slop of mash and cabbage was cheap food but cost £13.50.
The beer was ok but expensive. The children’s meal of one very small fish finger and tired chips and peas was £7.50. Yesterday we went to another pub and the adult huge fish finger wrap with chips and salad was £5.95 !
The staff seemed pleasant but nobody seems to bother to clear the tables.

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Disappointing
Review:
A lovely looking pub I have driven past a couple of times and thought, I must go there one evening. That evening came about tonight. My friend ordered pizza and sweet potato fries which he did enjoy. I opted for slow cooked beef rib with bubble and squeak, carrots and a jus. I will start with the beef rib. It must have come from a miniature cow. It looked very small on first glance, when I cut into it over 2 thirds of it was just fat. There were 3 mouthful of beef.there was no bubble and squeak, just mash with 2 pieces of carrot. For 14.50 I expected a lot better. Was the worst meal I have had in the area.
Very very disappointing.

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: Comfortable stay
Review: Good value for money, great sleep, bathroom good. Only downside is the dual carriageway nearby used as a racetrack by the local Barryboys. Other than that, thumbs up. The staff are lovely. There's a Shell station within walking distance to get a snack, and one day the Subway and Burgwr King next door may reopen.

Name: Butlins
Title: Fun packed holiday
Review:
We really enjoyed our holiday at Butlins. The new pool splash is fantastic fun, definitely try the rapids, they are particularly fun. Entertainment was plenty. The only niggle was the cost of all the activities, plus the arcades cost a small fortune with 2 children who wanted to play. We got the all action passes costing £20 each, this worked out excellent value for money and included; go karts, bungee trampoline, American pool, crazy golf, ten pin bowling. I would recommend booking a meal plan, breakfast & dinner, it saved us a lot of money & the choice was excellent .
Read less

Name: Pagham Beach Café
Title: Disappointed dogs no longer allowed inside
Review: Hadn't been for a while but on last visit we sat at our normal table with our dog tucked under the table and was told dogs were no longer allowed inside the cafe. We were amazed and really disappointed at the change of policy. On all other ocassions all the dogs were well behaved. I can understand Big or unsettled dogs not being welcome but common sense doesn't seem to apply these days.

Name: Lodwicks
Title: New management is an improvement
Review: Visited for lunch. Not a vast selection, but everything was cooked and presented well. Service was very good. Parking can be a challenge if the hotel or restaurant is busy.

Name: Sea View
Title: Sunday Lunch
Review: Well, despite some slightly negative reviews, my wife and I have just had a delicious Sunday lunch at The Seaview Hotel. The staff were friendly and offered a table outside in the glorious sunshine as, again despite some negativity, all tables inside were fully booked for lunch. We had the roast beef and the trimmings...crispy roast potatoes, nice big crispy Yorkshire pudding and nicely cooked veggies. All for a very reasonable price. And it came quickly and piping hot! Lovely!

Name: Motte & Bailey
Title: Fantastic breakfast. Lovely
Review: Fantastic breakfast. Lovely atmosphere and very friendly staff. Would definitely recommend and will go again soon

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Dissappointed
Review: Booked in November for Boxing day meal with family. Very dissaponted to find that instead of being seated in the restaurant, we were led to a table on the pub side. As my family had to travel two hours home,and we had no idea when a table in the restaurant would have been available we took.the table offered. It would not have been so bad if the area had at least been decorated for Christmas. The small candle on the table, which I lit myself, didn't really cut it. It felt as if we had been put there as if it was some kind of last minute booking. Not very festive at all, and the meal was not that good either. Wish that I had cooked at home instead. Never again.

Name: La Campagnia
Title: Wednesday Fish Night
Review: Brilliant food, brilliant friendly quick service. Wednesday Fish night very good value, food tastes and is presented lovely.

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: Cheap and functional accommodation
Review: This is a typical Travelodge location at a service area on a main road, and as such it served us very well. The room was spacious and clean, everything worked, and we got a good night's sleep. The complementary drink items included decaff coffee which is a real bonus for us. Our room was at the back of the building and quiet.

Name: Sea View Hotel
Title: Family
Review:
Great pub the management are very moody and rude they hate kids and dogs
The manager has a scary rude face she shouted at people today

Name: Black Horse
Title: Amazing service and food
Review:
We went to Black horse for Sunday roast and everything from calling to book reservation to requesting vegan meals was excellent.
Nothing was too much trouble, even making mulled wine.
Two of us are vegan and the nut roast was delicious, staff knowledgeable about ingredients.
Can’t wait to visit again

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Burnt chips and bad service
Review: Chose here as a convenient lunch stopping point on way home from holiday. We arrived early so ordered as soon as food was available at 12pm. My partner and I had burgers which were fine but the chips were appalling, very overdone to the point they were extremely crunchy and burnt tasting- like the overdone ones on a tray of oven chips. No one came to ask if our food was ok so didn’t have any opportunity to complain, no staff in evidence except an overworked bar lady with a queue. My daughters meal was meant to come with peas but arrived without so we had to request them. Sat for 20 mins with dirty plates in front of us before my partner had to request my daughters dessert which came with kiddie meal. When our plates were cleared and I told the waitress the chips were uneatable she said she would tell the chef and we hear no further, no offer of replacement etc. A bad experience, won’t return.

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Lovely Convenient Hotel - Staff and Food Excellen
Review:
We stayed as a group of 21 for the weekend. We could not have had better service. The staff looked after us, arranging a private room for Breakfast and Dinner. We had booked an evening meal for each evening and the food was the best we have ever tasted and we have been doing these weekends for well over 20 years. Sadly the Chef was too shy to face us all, but I made sure that he knew how much we appreciated his food! The staff bent over backwards to make sure that we had everything we needed. The rooms are very well appointed bearing in mind the age of the property, which was part of its charm. There are just a few issues that could be easily fixed such as the curtain off its hook. Some people may find the stairs a problem but they do have rooms in the Courtyard. Once you do reach the top rooms I gather the view of the Castle is breath taking. The private parking is very useful as I think it is quite expensive in the town itself.The convenience to the Town and the Castle was perfect, so I would definitely stay here again.
Read less

Name: The Town House
Title: Great food, lovely staff!
Review: Booked, having read the reviews, for the Goodwood Revival weekend. The food was delicious - very well cooked & presented - both my sister & I had the lobster. The restaurant obviously has regulars but we were made to feel very welcome, especially by Harry who was fun & had us laughing with his straight forward nature. Amazing price as well for the quality. We will definitely be back. Recommend booking, the restaurant is small and you are not rushed, which is nice in today’s table turning industry.

Name: LG Café
Title: Rude owner
Review:
Sadly I seem to have had a similar experience to a lot of over people. Strange & rude behaviour from the Owner.
The waitress was really friendly and her customer service skills are spot on, it's just a shame what I assume is the owner is quite rude.
I was going to buy brownies to take away with me but decided not too after a bizarre experience.
I was even worried to write this review as I've seen the very rude things he's replied to other people on here.

Name: White Swan Arundel
Title: Great foodie place
Review:
I picked this hotel for its proximity to Arundel town centre. We had planned a visit to the castle and its gardens and the cathedral.
Although only 1.5 miles to the town, its not a easy walk as the path runs out, so youll still need to drive or book the short taxi ride.
I booked thru booking.com for the first couple of days in May 2019.
The hotel was very quiet, not that many covers in the 2 evenings we ate there.
The food was 10/10. My wife rarely is offered interesting vegetarian options, but here the selection was amazing. The quality of the food matched the description as well. My food choices were also immense and overall we were extremely satisfied. Im a real ale fan and always choose the local beers in offer.
The 2 local Ales offered were very plain and not something you wanted a refill of.
We visited the Arundel Brewery and they had some very tasty beers I could recommend to the manager. The room was adequate. It was in need of TLC, but it was clean and the bed pretty comfy.
The view from the room had good and bad aspects, we could see the open fields instead of the road, but the kitchen flues were a couple of feet from our window si we kept it shut, just in case. Service was tip, top, though we didnt see the same people serve us twice, i guess due to shift patterns.
I would certainly go back, but perhaps choose a different room to 28.
Lovely staff.
Read less

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Fantastic
Review: To save cooking use harvester littlehampton 2/3 times a week. Most of time go there a young lady called shannon has misfortune of serving me, this young lady always has smile on her face and is always very helpful. Always great food great value for money and amazing service

Name: The Fish Factory
Title: First and not the last time.
Review: Sunday dinner with family. Such a nice restaurant. Food was delicious and big portions. Service Superb very friendly waitress. Nice atmosphere very relaxing we didn't feel rushed at any time. We will be back very soon. Thank you!

Name: KFC Bognor
Title: Disgusting
Review:
Absolouty disguising place.
Food was stale and cold, staff were very unhelpful. Staff had disgusting hygenie practice.
Toilets have got to be the worst I've ever seen.
So many complaints.
Food could not be eaten.

Name: Butlins
Title: Unclean rooms, staff that don't really care!
Review:
For a company that has check in at 4pm as they need time to clean, you think they could get it right....wrong

As we entered our room we were more the angry to have to witness our child pock up 2 pairs of mens pants that had been left in the room!

We then opened the kitchen cupboards to find put of date food.

Staff at customer services said sorry but not as sorry as we were for booking here in the first place.
Read less

Name: Parpadelle
Title: Poor seating
Review: I just felt l needed to share my experience today...we have eaten in pappardelle’s on a number of occasions and had a coffee or two in Osteria - having never eaten in Osteria we decided to give it a go (never again) the main seating is a large long copper top table which looks lovely but not at all practical....when we arrived about mid day, customers were seated at both ends of this table and the chairs back onto the wall, l kindly asked the customer seated at one end to allow me enough room to pass behind him, so l could be seated further along the table (in the middle)...this did not go down well with him !!! and he basically refused to move and gave me such an uncomfortable look - not tolerating this behaviour we walked out, as we did the waitress (to which l have no issue with) asked why we were leaving - l obviously explained and left annoyed and frustrated with the whole situation. It’s such a big shame, purely because it’s nothing to do with the food or service, it’s just the impersonal, impractical style of the seating that will stop us going back.

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Great food and lovely atmosphere
Review:
Fantastic and reasonably priced food.
Staff were polite and the food came reasonably quickly for such a busy day.
We both enjoyed ourselves here and will definitely return when next in the area.

Name: Butlins
Title: great stay
Review:
my friends and I have stayed at butlins before particularly at this resort
we went for an adults weekend always good fun and a good atmosphere.
We always enjoy our experience however we wanted to book a room for 4 of us
but were told this not possible even though the room we stayed in Wave hotel
did come with a double bed and two bunk beds.
which would have accommodated 4 people instead we had to get adjoining rooms which was fine accept we had to pay a bit more for this.

This did not inconvenience us too much though I Have to wonder how they accommodate lager parties and also question why we could not just have stayed in one room??? there is no clear explanation for this other than to charge more money.

overall we had a good time I would highly recommend the adult weekends if you have never been before GO! its so much fun
Read less

Name: T-Bone Burger
Title: Great night with High Quality Entertainment
Review: I went to T-Bone Burger for the first time last night 24/05/19. I was greeted by lovely friendly waitresses and served with a drink straight away. The Manager/Owner also came over and greeted us. The Restaurant has a great atmosphere and is very comfortable. It was fully booked but the service was brilliant as was the food. The highlight of the evening was Three Lovely Girl Singers " The Silhouettes" They sang songs that lots of people new and were singing along too and later on people were getting up dancing the night away. "Great night with high quality entertainment. I understand that "The Silhouettes" are going to be there once a month. You will need to book early as I am sure these evenings will be fully booked

Name: Osca's
Title: Long wait
Review:
Very very very long wait defidently if just order chips, even if you do order fish he takes an while and doesn't look tising won't be going eating here again, curry sauce taisted plain

Sorry but if you tell your guest how long there food might take their might mind anther thing curry sauce needs an little bit of flavour

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: Medieval Magic
Review:
A beautiful unique hotel where the rooms are all in different Medieval buildings, some even connected by a secret tunnel.

The food and service fantastic. We were celebrating my sisters special birthday. They made her stay so special.

We enjoyed 2 days of being throughly spoilt.

Looking forward to returning.

If you are looking for something different this truly is an amazing hotel and spa.
Read less

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Terrible
Review: We've been to Beefeaters before and always been fairly happy on previous occasions. However going there today I can only say that it was the worst Sunday roast I have ever had. Roast potatoes were so overdone it was ridiculous. My wife had a vegetarian roast and when asked for more gravy was brought out beef gravy. She's not vegetarian but what if she had been. The waitresses were nice but the service was incredibly slow and drink orders kept getting forgotten. This was probably because it was understaffed. I won't be going there again and feel like I've just thrown away £50 on a pretty awful meal. It didn't help that we had a couple sitting behind us who had also a bad experience but didn't excuse the fact that the man was swearing constantly to his wife when thd staff weren't around. Needs a new chef!!!

Name: Butlins
Title: Brilliant Christmas holiday
Review:
Currently still here after a weekend at butlins over Christmas break. The kids have loved it. From the fair to swimming to the shows it’s been a great few days. Dreading going home tomorrow. The kids have had a ball. I just want to say all the redcoat, skyline Gang, and the staff work all hours god send. But a special mention to a lady at the cafe in the skyline. I wasn’t sure how to spell her name but I managed to ask for the receipt today and got it. “ELISHA” always served with a smile, made sure my children had there cakes (Oreo ones) and milkshakes and by the second day knew my order, I was visiting in the morning and at night time and she was always smiling and made time to speak. Also made me and my partner the best caramel latte coolers! Yum! Please send this message to her from the pickard family... Also a big thank you to the wave hotel. What amazing service and lovely accommodation. Already thinking of booking for next Christmas.. maybe 5 days this time.
Read less

Name: La Campagnia
Title: Excellent!
Review: We had booked for lunch, which I would advise doing, on a Sunday. We were greeted at the door by a very friendly waiter. The waiter was extremely accommodating and so were the waitresses throughout our whole meal. The food was excellent. We chose to have garlic prawns, scallops, soup and garlic bread as starters. All cooked and presented beautifully. Main courses were again superb. We chose, sea bass, carbonnara, penne pasta in a peppercorn sauce with chicken. There were clean plates all round at the end! Puddings were great too. Bannoffee pie, chocolate brownie and a cheese platter to finish our meal. I would highly recommend visiting this restaurant. A truly authentic taste of Italy with a great family feel. Thank you!

Name: Sea View
Title: Dangerous high chairs, terrible food, strong chemical in glass
Review:
Had a terrible meal here today. Greasy food, chips that looked and tasted like they had been reused and re-fried from someone else’s left overs. Our order was lacking extras asked for. I had a glass of water with the food which tasted like there had previously been bleach or a chemical in the glass. After tipping out on the grass there was some odd residue in the bottom. It smelt strongly of chemicals. I hope it wasn’t anything dangerous.
The wine was nice though!
Most alarming to me was the fact I tried to use a high chair here for my 13 month old baby which was filthy and the strap had sharp staples through it and had sellotape which was obviously meant to cover the staples that had slipped. A second was exactly the same! Disgraceful

Name: Aldwick
Title: Another great stay
Review:
New people have taken over and we were made to feel welcome straight away by the lovely couple Mike & Veronica, can't recommend enough, room bright, clean & spacious every consideration taken care off, coffe, tea, hot chocolate & even biscuits at hand along with filtered water along with the niceties of shampoo, soap & body lotions. Your stay will include a fabulous breakfast made special with the company of Deena she is one lovely lady, this is one of the best b/b we have stayed in and always use it when we visit family in Sussex, look forward to staying there again. A BIG thank you Bob & Liz
Read less

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Good value for money
Review:
Good combination of old style hospitality and modern spacious rooms. Has a cosy atmosphere in the restaurant and bar but the rooms were up to date and clean. The soundproofing was good and there was no noise coming into the rooms from the bar. The staff were friendly and helpful
Read less

Name: La Campagnia
Title: Dinner for 2
Review:
We came for dinner last Monday and had an enjoyable meal, the portion size was very good, so good we couldn't fit in a dessert but... starter wise we ate the mushrooms which were on special and the mussels, then for main we had the roasted chicken and the sea bass all washed down with house white and house red wine. All the food was very well cooked with great flavours and a good price.
The only downside we had was the table where we were sat, right beside the bar. The problem being the shape of the bar encroached on your table space making you feel cramped. Answer was to move the table a foot out from the bar which solved the issue. If that's the worst thing tha happened then I'm pretty happy.

Name: The Diner
Title: Avoid
Review:
We waited an hour for our food order which never arrived. I asked a member of staff how much longer the food would be. He did not know, at this point we witnessed a large amount of people leaving because they had waited for food that did arrive. We decided to cut our losses and leave as well.
This place needs a good shakeup to survive.

Name: Haskins Garden Centre
Title: Bland dry cake.
Review: Met friends here today for coffee and cake. Found what we believed to be a clean table which unfortunately proved to be incorrect as 2 members of our party soon discovered that their sleeves were damp and stained red presumably from a spillage that had occurred earlier and had not been cleaned properly. I chose the coffee and walnut cake which could only be described as bland with not even the merest hint of coffee and the cake itself was so dry it was like eating cardboard. When we complained about the dirty table all we received was a "Sorry" and my complaint about the cake did not even elicit a response. If it were not for the convenience of this place I would be very unlikely to visit again.

Name: Butlins
Title: Good day but not as described
Review:
Visited for the day with our little girl (9 months) and although we ended up having a nice day that was more because we made the most of it, rather than because of the site and facilities. Feel like the website is incredibly misleading, and wouldn't recommend it for those with very young children.
Firstly with the mini fairground, swimming and entertainment we felt like we were given an impression that there would be plenty for us to do with our daughter. However everything had height restrictions on and we were not able to accompany her on the rides either. That meant the only thing she could really go on were the paid for rides in the arcade. Not sure what the point is of a mini fairground if those who can't ride the main fairground rides are excluded!
We'd planned on the swimming being a big part of our day, and having read the website we had high expectations. The changing village 'designed with mumsnet' featured several rave reviews so we were looking forward to using them. However to be blunt they are like any other changing rooms I've ever visited, just with a seat belted chair for children in each changing cubicle. The underfloor heating promises 'no more soggy socks' but must have been off on the day we visited as there was a good few centimetres of standing water everywhere - including the toilets! It was a horrible experience really, we wanted to get out of there as soon as possible.
We also had a terrible experience in the pub-style restaurant on site, with slow service, poor prices and terrible value, limited availability from the menu, staff who didn't listen to requests and low quality food.
Both the meals my wife and I wanted were unavailable, and there was no coke zero. We also asked for no ice in the cokes and they were packed full. Our wait for food was long despite the pub being quiet and when it arrived the portion sizes were terrible for £6/7, note the 'side salad', and my chicken & bacon bbq wrap tasted awful.
The bar/bowling area was great and we enjoyed that, although it was bizarre we found the best changing facilities here.
Overall perhaps we were naive to take our little one at such a young age, but we booked based on the info online and feel mislead. Wouldn't recommend for very young families.
Read less

Name: Bengal Tandoori
Title: Rude Staff
Review: First visit and last Visit. Tool waiter with deep voice , was taking the piss out of me when i order a Chicken Korma, apparently it is woman food he said. Also said : Get a proper man food. Before you visit this place find out what is man food!!!! Disrespectful a no apologies. Owner hope you keep employing staff like that . Well done! Tables cloth dirty, carpet dirty. Wondering how is kitchen looks like ?

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: A very good stay!
Review: We enjoyed a very good nights sleep here. The welcome from staff was super. We were given information about the room, the hotel, the area and places to visit and how to get to them. The room was large, clean and the bed comfortable. The TV and shower worked well and there was plenty of free tea and coffee.

Name: Butlins
Title: It’s not the same as it was. It’s changed and not for the better.
Review:
Hi we are currently stopping at Butlins Bognor Regis (July 2019) in the gold apartments. This has totally changed since we last stopped in 2014. The entertainment is very limited. Reds and Jaks both closed. This cost me £700 for 5 days. Well 4 nights. Accommodation is alright. Wasn’t very clean. Cupboard to boiler is broken can see the broken walls and cobwebs etc in the cupboard. Asked for some pillows for the beds as I have a disability two days ago still no extra pillows. It looks like butlins but there is something missing from what it used to have. There is something not the same and it’s not the same cleanliness and entertainment there used to be. It’s mine and my kids first holiday since 2014 and we have already changed our train tickets so we can go home on the Thursday evening. :(. Sorry butlins I had been looking forward to this for months.
Read less

Name: Dee Dee's
Title: Beautiful place
Review: Great place lovely decoration lovely staff and the new owners are fantastic. A definite visit for walkers to locals. Fast friendly service warm greeting great place

Name: Rustington Manor
Title: NOT fine dining AVOID AVOID AVOID
Review:
We dined here 4 weeks ago on a Saturday evening.
The menu consisted of a variety of 5 choices of meals one being veggie so we both like meat so this was reduced to 4 meals! The waiter then told us that the fish dish was not available!! down to 3 choices now and that there was no more rump steak but we could have Sirloin.
Well better cut of meat so that is what we ordered.
This was the toughest piece of meat we have had and a total waste of money.
ALL there meals come with chips, (ALL OF 5 when available) and they call it this FINE DINING!!
We decline having deserts or coffee but the waiter insisted we spoke to the manager.
The manager was called and I asked about the wording of 'FINE DINING' he said they was going to remove that and offer a new menu which would be in 2 weeks and took our number and said he would phone us when this NEW menu was available for us to sample free of charge as a gesture of good will as our evening had been spoilt.
The venue is pleasant, and apart from us there was 6 other people??? on a Saturday night speaks volumes.
The Lamb pub is very close with far better menu and far better quality food
We are still waiting for the call from the manager.!!!!! AVOID!!!

Name: Mustards
Title: Great food and atmosphere
Review: I joined a group of friends for a meal at Mustards, the food was good and the staff excellent. I asked for a peppermint tea but unfortunately they did not have any, but they offered me real mint tea instead. It was delicious and I appreciated their going that extra mile.

Name: Comfort Inn
Title: Mixed Feelings!
Review: A great locationfor us,as a couple,as we were visiting Arundel Castle for an event there. The Comfort Inn,part of a large concern,was welcoming,Jana,at reception was very smart and professional with checking us in,the room was large,as requested,King size,nice and quiet,with seperate bathroom with an overbath shower, obviously lacking a grab rail in the bathing area,the bathroom could do with a lot of TLC or refurbishment,unfortunately this would apply to the whole building.Breakfast was,indeed, awesome.again spoilt by serving only with cold plates,also a great amount of dust was seen under the serving stands,spoiling the good look of the whole restaurant,which,in turn was advertised on the website but did not operate in the evenings,so making an trip out necessary.Only made a brief visit to the bar ,but at reasonable prices. Overall the hotel was clean and comfortable, as an aside I must mention,in spite of a notice displayed, people were still smoking near the entrance,Hence my title of "Mixed Feelings". Would we return again ? ... of course and gladly.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: 5 stars from us
Review: What a great meal and excellent, attentive service provided by the team at the Roundstone. Particular mention to Dave the host and Llewelyn our waiter. Will be back.

Name: Picturedrome
Title: Lovely little cinema
Review:
This little old-fashioned cinema is a real gem and the prices are so good. I love coming here. It's so friendly.
Read less

Name: The Lamb, Angmering
Title: A good main dish but desserts disappointed
Review:
Four of us went for Sunday lunch. We had main dishes of fish, roast and nut roast. The welcome was good and they were very willing to bring more vegetables to go with it. All those dishes were of a very good standard and worth the price.
Then we ordered desserts like bread and butter pudding or brownie. These might as well have been something from Iceland and were about two mouthfuls. The bread and butter pud at £5 or was it 6, was just a wet squidgy small oblong the size of a small mobile phone with a tiny scoop of vanilla ice cream. It was not crispy and if we found a raisin it was a surprise. Wish we hadn’t ordered it. Sorry but had a lovely tiramisu about twice the size for £2 less a few days before in Otellos Hove.
I would certainly go again but unless desserts were changed for something actually palatable we would just have a coffee.

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: never got to see it
Review:
the prices for this castle to get in an look around are way too high so 12 adults in our party gave it a miss an went around the local shops instaed
Read less

Name: Ford Market
Title: Parked my car in a slightly wrong area as I wasn't familiar with the site. I was asked to move it by a woman and was discussing this with her when a man over 6' foot tall came over who verbally abused me threatened to f*****g kill me and move my f*****g car now. He shouted swore
Review: Verbally Abusive & Rude staff ignorant and a potentially violent manager

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: Chill weekend
Review:
Lovely location, found lack of bar area bad news. Food ? Novough cuisine is art, not food. Breakfast was grade A, dinner lacking. Questioned a waiter on menu listing "sprouts" was err,,, actually one sprout cut four ways. Diabolical. Had a few stays at the Spreadeagle (sister hotel) and found that excellent in every way. Was planning return trip to Spreadeagle new year, alas they appear to have adopted the same frugal menu. Shame as my wife and I enjoyed our January getaway there.
Read less

Name: The Deck
Title: The Deck
Review: Very impressed with the Breakfast. well worth the money. everything you could possibly want fresh hot and very tasty.

Name: Boat House In the Marina
Title: food with a view
Review: The restaurant is in the marina. It is light and airy and there is always something to watch through the window. The food is all good and the chef will cook non-dairy options is asked. There is plenty of parking and it's easy to leave your car while you walk along the river into Littlehampton.

Name: Mamma Mia
Title: Great
Review: Went here for a quick bite to eat before the cinema, very welcoming, great food... I love carbonara and this was the best I’ve had in a restaurant. Husband loved the pizza too!

Name: Butlins
Title: Football festival
Review:
I have paid over £700 for this accommodation because of the football tournament my child is in.
I wish I could describe the stench from the toilet, how cold I am under the covers or the noise coming from outside
To pay this much to slum it this badly is nothing short of robbery
No football festival is worth this!
Read less

Name: Fino
Title: An anniversary ruined
Review:
Now to be fair the waitress acted responsibly throughout.
The Aperol Spritz despite instructions on the back of every bottle was terrible the recommended 3 parts prosecco, 2 parts aperol and 1 part soda included at least 10 parts soda if any prosecco at all.
The rump steak was not rare as requested but well done and chewy but the worst was the under-cooked fish on the point of raw, concealed within a wrap of pancetta. This any chef will know is very dangerous and can lead to anisakiasis a parasitic disease caused by anisakid nematodes(worms) invading the stomach wall of humans. Offering to cook it again or replace it with something else just doesn't cut it when you are already beginning to doubt the ability of the establishment.
The waitress offered to replace the Aperol Spritz and took it off the bill. The fish course was also deducted but they left the uneaten fries on £3.

So half eaten steak and half bottle of wine consumed whilst waiting ad nauseum for food is a lousy way of spending an anniversary or any other celebration so I would recommend finding somewhere else that genuinely cares about quality.
I will not be recommending it again to friends or frequenting what was once a promising start and now holds no attraction for us.

Name: Butlins
Title: The new Splash pool is disgusting
Review:
I went to Butlins Bognor Regis for the first time today with my 8 and 10 year old and can’t help myself but leave a review about the new pool which I thought was so disappointing. The queues were so long for the rapids and the flumes and they were seriously disappointing, I had to push myself through the rapids and I’m tiny! On top of that the floors around the pools, slides, toilets and changing rooms were absolutely revolting, smelly, full of hairs, plasters and God knows what else!! Surely in a brand new pool hygiene should be of its upmost importance! I will definitely not be coming back again, sorry.
Read less

Name: Arun View
Title: great food
Review: situated by the river in littlehampton. good choice of beers.good choice of food.nice Sunday roast.booking is advisable as very popular.some live music check theither email for dates plenty of parking

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Great Potential
Review:
Some positives - a comfortable bed and a very good location. Sadly a few factors prevent this potentially wonderful hotel from being a great stay. The common areas were horribly neglected: dirty carpets, cobwebs all the way up the stairs, the bin-housing left open almost constantly with all its grime, grease and smells. Employees were seated on the ground, smoking in the car park and dirty laundry was left in a pile by the exit for quite some time.

The back of my bathroom door was heavily spattered with someone else's toothpaste or soap remains, which was an unpleasant surprise although the high quality bath gel and shampoo were welcome. The bathmat had a large hole in it although all linen was clean.

This wonderful, old building could, with a little TLC, a good, deep clean and some attention to interior design, be a really nice boutique-type hotel. Instead it's tired, shoddy and seems unloved. A real pity. Such potential!
Read less

Name: The Lion
Title: Usual high standard of food and service
Review: We visited the Lion twice last week for even meals. Great food .and lovely staff. Such a lovely pub to visit

Name: Beachcomber Inn
Title: Lunch
Review: Fantastic service and excellent food presented with class lovely and clean pub to ...perfect and to a great weekend

Name: Charcoal Grill Meze
Title: Saturday 9pm
Review:
Staff uninterested upon our arrival, no big deal. Waitress struggled with our order, explained by waiter that she struggled with english, fair enough. Starter arrived without salad. Hummus is better in M&S. Mixed grill had no skewers or separation by peppers,onions, tomatoes etc. Tasted and looked like mum should have gone elsewhere.
Upon paying bill (in full) and reflecting feedback to manager, met with defence and disdain. No return custom here. Shame.

Name: Ocean Hotel & Spa
Title: Disgustingly dirty rooms!!
Review:
We visited for a family break in July with 2 young children. As Butlins prides itself on catering for family’s especially with its ‘tots breaks’ we expected the accommodation to be clean. On arrival in our room we noticed hair in the toilet, hair in the bath, carpet looked like it hadn’t been touched with a Hoover, thick dust on the phone and tv (clearly not been cleaned for ages) you could leave finger prints in the dust!! filth all over the coffee tray and filth in the fridge, dust and grime around the edges of the floor and sliding door, some disgusting bit of muck on the sink! we have never complained before to a hotel but the standard was poor and made us feel dirty just looking at it! The manager was very good and moved us to the service recovery room. This at first glance appeared a lot better. Then in the children’s room there was thick dust on the windowsill, the remote for the children’s tv had the batteries held in by 2 plasters which is ridiculous!! ..a hair clip, 1p piece and small bouncy ball had all be overlooked when cleaned and my one year old grabbed 2 of these items off the floor!
The lifts are crazy, you stand there for ages and when one does arrive you can’t fit in. When I put in a letter of complaint I was told the lifts are fit for the amount of guests but I wonder if they have actually considered how many of their guests have young children in buggy’s! In my opinion and many of the people we talked to in the que It would seem not! When I wrote a letter of complaint they took little responsibility for the state of the rooms and stated that they had a ‘resolve on site policy’, having already wasted time moving from the filthy room to the ‘service recovery room’ which was still dirty I would wonder why they would think I would bother complaining more on site. Surely the service recovery room is as good as it gets! All in all I wouldn’t bother with this hotel especially as Butlins are not prepared to take responsibility for their issues and effectively blame their guests for not wasting more of their holiday time complaining about what should never have been an issue in the first place!

Name: Premier Inn Littlehampton
Title: Not great
Review:
Room had an awful smell coming from the shower drain, the bed was to low considering it was an accessible room i had lots of trouble trying to get out of the bed had i of been wheelchair bound i would not ever be able to get in and out of the bad and there was a stained pillowcase
Read less

Name: Fino
Title: A great addition to the town
Review: we had a really good saturday lunch, the restaurant has great decor and everything is clean and smart, the service is welcoming and the food was of a really high quality- we had three children and their menu was very good and great value- given how few quality restaurants there are in the area this is very welcome - will definitely return

Name: La Campagnia
Title: Welcoming staff and delicious food - a winning combination.
Review: Eleven of us visited yesterday for a family birthday celebration. Service was exemplary and all staff were friendly and helpful. The food was absolutely delicious and presented beautifully. A wonderful restaurant and one we will visit again.

Name: Boat House In the Marina
Title: Great food, great services, great view!
Review: I visit The Boathouse in the Marina regularly and thought it was high time I wrote a review. Julie and her team are really friendly and welcoming and the breakfast is always great - with locally sourced ingredients and served with a smile. I have also been down for fish and chips which were delicious - the fish was locally caught and so fresh. My next visit is for Tapas on a Friday night. Well done to the whole team!

Name: Lamb Angmering
Title: Beautiful Surroundings
Review: My wife and I had not been away for 4 years due to my on going hip problems. We were greeted at The Lamb by wonderful staff who,without asking, changed our room to a ground floor room which was very kind and much appreciated. The room was beautiful and very quiet but with everything we could want. We dined in the restaurant and I had the slow roasted lamb-just perfect. If anyone like me who enjoys superb food,magnificent accommodation and exemplary service then I cannot recommend The Lamb enough. I hope to return soon and in better health so that my wife and I can enjoy the experience again.

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Worst fish and chips on the south coast
Review:
4 portions of chips / 2 savolys / 1 sausage in batter £20.40
All the dregs from the chip fryer at the bottom of the bag with greasy chips on top to make it look like there is a load of chips well there isnt this was a medium portion of chips god knows what a small portion is proprabley not enough to feed a seagull
This is supposedto be british fish and chips it aint i dont remember british fish and chips being this bad this must be the worst fish and chip place on the south coast and yes im writing this post sitting on the toilet yuk dont buy dont eat anything from here also watch out for the card machine not having a connection so haveto pay cash.

Name: Anokha
Title: What a hidden gem!
Review: This was our first visit here as so many people had recommended it......& we loved it! The staff were so friendly and welcoming. The ambience was attractive and calm and the restaurant was very clean. We both had a main course & sides with the usual rice/naan, all of which was absolutely delicious. It was served promptly, hot and as ordered. Our waiter (who we think was the manager) ‘Peter’ was very attentive and nothing was too much trouble. We really can’t fault this friendly, tasty restaurant. I don’t think we’ll go anywhere else from now on!

Name: The Swan
Title: Excellent Sunday roast. We
Review: Excellent Sunday roast. We were a family of four. Kids had the kids roasts and they were a great size. Roast was excellent quality and full of flavour. Yorkshire puddings we’re huge and ample veg. Great meal !

Name: Moathouse Café
Title: Great value for money
Review:
Took the family for lunch. Good kids menu. Extensive menu for adults. Excellent service with very friendly staff. Looks as if it is known for its food as it was packed.
Certainly if I am back in Arundel I would eat there again

Name: La Cucina
Title: Superb
Review: My wife had raved about this place for ages so we went there for a family meal on a midweek evening and I think it was the best Italian food I have ever eaten. The staff were superb and attentive, and the food was second to none. Try this place, you won’t regret it!

Name: The Beresford
Title: Back at the Beresford again....
Review: Had a great meal at the Beresford yesterday evening - it was pretty busy too which is great to see for a local. Had the house burger and my wife the fish pie - both were really good and plentiful portions. The chips are exceptional. For local pub grub this is really good - never had the carvery but the main menu is very good indeed - try it.

Name: Arden B&B
Title: Cosy and comfortable
Review:
We were made very welcome. The room was fresh and clean with some lovely complimentary products. I liked the use of the security code on the doors as it felt safe and I didn't have to worry about lost keys. The breakfast was fabulous with lots of choice for hot meals and a good cold buffet. There was no shortage of food. We would definitely return and recommend to friends and family. Thank you.
Read less

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: stress free midwinter midweek break
Review:
booked on one of the special offers. done it midwinter and midweek: thus none of the negatives applied: it was not crowded, the hotel was quiet and cosy and warmed by log fires and because it was a special offer.......it wasnt out of my usual price range. even better I got upgraded and this is not the first time its happened to me at Bailifscourt: they seem to upgrage you if they have a better room available: and that seems to just be automatic. I felt like I was just returning to my old family home in a way: because the same waiting staff who were there a year ago are still there and so they must be happy in their work I assume: I love the eccentricities of this place: the formal dining, the really TALL waiter and the really SHORT waiter, the cut -glass-practically-royal-family accents of the receptionists, the KINDNESS of the beauty therapists. NOTHING all over the world can compare to the joy of waking on a deserted beach and then crossing the lawn and entering a warm honey stone ancient looking building surrouned by lavender bushes.......and drinking local cider by an apple log fire or indeed climbing into a four poster bed with the window open and listening to the sea while eating a freashly baked moist chocolate biscuit and drinking tea out of a perfectly elegant china tea cup. and the next morning: swiming in that warm outdoor swiming pool: nothing but mist and steam and lying on my back in the pool staring at the dark winter branches of the trees and hearing the call of a pheasant. and yet it was only 2 hours drive from central london! i enjoyed my break so much i send my young daughter and her boyfriend: they loved the whole mini break experience too: it made a great christmas present for 20 somethings!!!!
Read less

Name: Flying Fortress
Title: Stupidity doesn’t even come close
Review:
To order food took 35 minutes (don’t mind waiting for it to be cooked as I know that takes time). After an hour or so children were thirsty again so I joined the dreaded food queue. After 20 food order was ready I asked if there was anyway I could just purchase a jug of jug to go with my food (I had correct money to make things easier) “no” was the unhelpful response. I rejoined the queue, leaving food to get cold. After another 5 minutes gave up and went to ask the manager who gave the same answer. I asked for a refund as I wasn’t paying for cold food, refund given and they scrapped all food (£20.00 worth) in the bin. Vending machines also broken
Read less

Name: The Diner
Title: Good restaurant
Review: We visited as a family and were served really quick. The portions are massive here. The prawns were very nice. The ribs were too big for one person but very good and the staff were very good with the kids

Name: The Town House
Title: A taste sensation
Review:
My wife and I shared a starter platter of Lobster Mac and Cheese, Scallops and Turbot all 3 were amazing, I want the recipe for the sauce In the Mac and Cheese.
For main we both had our favourite the chateaubriand with a side of cauliflower cheese, all cooked to perfection, delicious and nine times out of ten my go to dish.
For pudding we both had Chocolate marquise with honeycomb, pudding perfection.
The staff here are all delightful.
The whole meal was something else.
I love it when you go home with flavours still dancing in your mouth.
We will be back again, it’s becoming a good habit/treat eating at this wonderful establishment

Name: Clymping Beach
Title: Official car parking barriers and payment machines are not working - suspicous chalked payment instructions.
Review:
The Environmental Agency are doing major work in this area and there are prominent warnings to keep off the beach near their machinery.

The car park barriers are not working and payment machines locked up and the barriers missing.- the car park seems abandoned!. The Beach Café was not open when we called and we did not see the chalked sign.

The driver of another vehicle was also perplexed by the situation.

The name of the operator or owners of the car park are not clearly shown

Very suspicious about handwritten messages scrawled next to barriers asking people to pay at the cafe.

In contrast with beaches to the West of the cafe the first beach East of the concrete sea defences is the first gently sloping one that is potentially safe for children,

No clear warnings about penalties for non-payment or enfoorcement action .

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: great burgers the best ive ever had
Review: i visited in the day time with my husband we both had burgers we had cheese burger and bacon burgers and I have to say they were amazing. the best ive ever tasted will defiantly come back when we are in the area. great service would defiantly recommend a visit.

Name: Famous City
Title: cold food and late
Review:
I was looking forward to a Chinese for me and my girlfriend one Saturday night, so I decided to get a delivery from Famous City. This was a BIG mistake and I can assure you there’s nothing famous about Famous City.
The food eventually came after waiting 2 hours. This is an extremely long time considering we live within one mile of the takeaway. When it came I had wished it didn’t – it was completely cold and soggy. The crispy Chinese food we enjoy was cold and mushy. The food comes in tinfoil lined bags so it had sweated and gone cold. We microwaved the noodles but as the rest of the food looked a mess so we had to throw it in the bin.
I called the takeaway the following day, not really to complain but to let them know of the poor service I received. The guy told me he will tell the manager and he would get back to me whilst I would likely get 15% off my next order. I never heard back or got an apology from them, hence me writing this review. I wouldn’t go back even with 15% off. I paid £20 for a load of rubbish and the customer service was that of business that simply doesn’t care. This attitude is also reflected in delivery of their food. Littlehampton is a small place with plenty of takeaways, go somewhere else.

Name: Butlins Fish and Chips
Title: Blown away by kindness of the manger
Review: I went there today because i needed a high chair go sit outside as I had purchased a take away from the fish and chips next door (the takeaway one) the manager Karim greeted us and kindly offered to lend us one. He saw that I was carrying a bunch of bags and my sons bike and was there solo with him. I was sure he was going to run off while I was eating and I was so starving. He jumped to offer me the highchair and was going to bring it out to me but ended up just having me sit inside at the table and made me feel so welcome it was far above and beyond his job since I didn’t even buy anything from him he came and bought my son some colouring things checked if we are okay brought him sweets And was just so kind to us. I was touched by how caring and wonderful he was seeing as we didn’t make a penny for him. The food I presume was the same or similar to the fish and chips next door which we had purchased from which was delicious I’m sure and his food would have been great too. Thank you so much. I would have had no way to eat my dinner.

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Lovely roast and fab location
Review: Walked from Arundel along the river and sat outside for a quick lunch. The location is lovely watching the water rush past. Service was great and very quick considering how busy it was. The roast was lovely with great gravy and well cooked beef. Will definitely be back in summer.

Name: The Diner
Title: Rubbish staff
Review:
Took our ordered waited nearly half an hour for food .Waitress wanted to clear the table before we had finished eating and then took ages to get the bill.
Then we realised we had been given sweet potato dirty fries which weren’t very nice she was going to take them of the bill but never returned.
Staff were rude and useless included the manager.
