We have been at butlins all weekend and had a great time and other staff else where were lovely.

Name: Lemongrass Restaurant
Title: Tale-away experience
Review: Really poor quality food. Had meagre sea bass portion and Thai green chicken. It was delivered withi the stayed 45mins which was great but it was stone cold. Tasted ok but quality left a lot to be desired. When I called to explain our disappointment they did ask whet they could do but it was all too late. It was good they hung up on me when I was still speaking. Not sure I would recommend right now.

Name: Partners Café
Title: Homely
Review:
Excactly what is days on the tin! Delicious and filling breakfast, the most helpful and friendly staff, and cute unique atmosphere! We loved feeling like we were at home with you in your cafe .! Thanks for all the advice on what to do in the local area! Found via trip advisor so only right we leave you a review!

Thank you very much!

Name: East Beach Café
Title: Not the best place for breakfast.
Review: We thought it would be nice to have breakfast on the beach,very poor sandwiches for breakfast bread to small,bacon lacking any flavour,Chairs and tables taty.

Name: George & Dragon
Title: Wonderful Experience
Review: Their website states 'Booking Recommended', and they are not kidding. My wife and I visited The George & Dragon one Monday lunchtime, the car park was full, as was most of the inside of the pub. There is a large raised terraced area (available for dining) and a lower garden area with picnic tables (not available for dining), both affording stunning views toward Pulborough and the South Downs Way. The staff were very accomodating, polite and extremely efficient. The interior is very homely, clean and attractive. We managed to be seated inside and were promptly attended to by the staff. Our food arrived promptly and was plentiful and very appetising. Overall, a truly exceptional experience. A venue we have been meaning to try for some time, shame we left it so long. But we will definitely return, and with family or friends to show this place off. But booking is certainly recommended.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: all you can eat breakfast !! Spot on
Review: Great service and food . Really really good range of breakfast food - pleasant staff . Glad I stopped :)

Name: Parsons Table
Title: Only adding to all the exisiting 'Excellent' reviews
Review: A full restaurant on Saturday lunchtime - small but perfectly formed - menu and restaurant. Professional service and fine food served with a smile. Not the cheapest place for lunch but excellent value in a well run and charming venue - would love to return and recommend

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Excellent Sunday lunch
Review:
We were looking for a typical Sunday roast while staying for the day in Arundel. We entered the Norfolk and had a drink in the bar. We liked it immediately. Then we were taken to the lovely dining-room. Nicely set table in a large and smart room with the history of the place written on several boards around it.
We ordered the food and were delighted with our meal. The roast, the veges, the Yorkshire pudding were succulent. Our waiter was most pleasant and helpful.
Thank you.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: 90s weekend
Review:
Arrived 7.30 Fri evening,left site 8am next morning.completely misold nothing was open burger king or papa John's only.pool closed and restaurants as no staff.was told we would eating in our hotel restaurant that too was closed.most visitors were stag or hen party's drunken fighting ensued had no sleep due music tent full volume till 3am.and screaming drunken antics all night till 7am.weekend completely mis advertised basically a hen and stag weekend so if you want too drink all night and sleep all day it's fine.but if you expecting eating choices and to use pool and facilities that are advertised then stay well away.would not recommend to any one.absolutely disgusting place.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Disappointing
Review:
Now me and my hubby rob went to the butlins bognor regis resort earlier this year to find our reviews taken down!? Now we shared a room in the wave hotel which looked nice but there was some loud children nearby which disturbed me and rob later when we was having fun but they got a sight they can never take back! The food was not to bad but there was the occasional imbosile around causing hassle to Rob however it was not to bad apart from the diner - took to long and did not allow us to enter with some hungry kids which we wanted to feed! The Rides were appalling to say the least, we tried to get onto the bumper cars together but they said "not even one of you could fit in one", very offensive and in general very disheartening. There was a statue of Billy Butlin and all the youngsters of the modern age were chanting "willy butlin" - how immature. Overall disappointing stay and will not recommend for any couples looking for a cheeky weekend off!
Read less

Name: The Diner
Title: Lovely meal, great service
Review: Just left The Diner, meal was fine, burgers a little dry. Cocktails were good, but the saving grace was the service. Our waitress Sarah was polite and keen to keep her guests happy. She was very helpful even when faced with a few difficult guests.

Name: Clymping Beach
Title: hot chips on the beach and no people
Review: love it that there is a loo available!!!! you can have a cup of tea and still not have to crouch down behind a windswept tree to wee. love it

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Great staff and good service
Review: Visited for some quick dinner after an evening shop and was really impressed with the service and speed of food. We were never kept waiting long and Sarah the waitress really looked after us from start to finish. Amazing. We will be back.

Name: Butlins
Title: Horrendous noise Oyster Bay
Review:
In Oyster Bay. Oh dear.

Very poor sound insulation and very noisy guests.

From 11.30pm to 1.30am adults shouting, swearing, kids screaming. While we expected some noise, the amount of noisy adults, kids, TVs and lack of sound insulation is just horrendous.

You can hear neighbours TV and conversation very clearly up until 1.15am and again when they are up at 7am. The other neighbour played drum and bass until 1am. The effect of security coming is only temporary. We can hear our neighbours in all of our rooms (two bedrooms and bathroom).

Impossible to get decent sleep or even sleep in.

Oyster bay consists of very long rows of run-down flats with very large "fish bowl"window. You"ll need to keep the curtains closed though as multiple other residents walk right past the windows. The upper walkways aren't level and there are many cracks, it doesn't look or feel safe. The flats opposite are really close adding to noise issues.

All-in all,the noisy accommodation and lack of sleep is ruining the holiday.

Think very carefully before booking Oyster Bay.

We tried moving but site full. Considering leaving but paid £600 for 3 nights.

Butlins should show photos of the outside of these flats. We would never have gone.
Read less

Name: Avisford
Title: Dated 31/8/2019 - 01/09/2019
Review:
We visited this hotel as we attended a charity event. I was expecting this hotel to be quite posh but as we arrived I was shocked at how shabby it looked from the outside. Then expecting indoors to be better, well it wasn’t. We were put in a room near the event room but got given a disabled room (just me and my husband) which was dirty looking, the bathroom especially. The bed was comfy though. Staff seemed ok but didn’t ask how our stay was when we left.
I certainly don’t think it was worth the money and we had a discounted rate. Given the choice I wouldn’t stay here again. So disappointed.
Read less

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Farewell meal.
Review: We had a family farewell meal with our long lost sister and husband from Australia who's travelling back to Australia on Sunday. The staff are very friendly and Katie B who was our waitress was very friendly and helpful.

Name: 47 Mussel Row
Title: Littlehampton is Lucky
Review:
Littlehampton is so lucky to have a Restaurant of this calibre on its Riverside, and a stone throw from the Beach. The standard of food in here far surpasses and other nearby Restaurant, the quality and freshness of the ingredients is second to none, the Chef and his Crew have just the right touch at the stoves and all together it is a Restaurant that bears visiting time and time again.
Some people are a little worried about it being pricey, well it is not a Burger Joint and attention to detail is number one here. To put it into perspective four of us enjoyed an evening meal, with a good French Wine and the bill was just pennies over £100, so £25 each for our most enjoyable meal. You can also enjoy an economical lunch with prices to suit.
We four will be going back to sample more dishes as the summer looms ahead, hopefully!
One thing that stands out is the service, all the Staff and Owners are involved, and a happier and more helpful brigade will be difficult to find, well done to all of you, you do Littlehampton and Mussel Row proud. Thank you for all the little extras that we were served, they all put the shine on our meal.
I now hove two favourite Restaurants in Littlehampton, ones I would easily recommend, Mussel Row and Chopsticks.
Thank you

Name: Tuptim Siam
Title: Best Thai food, bar none!
Review:
If you are a ‘foodie’ and love fresh ingredients, expertly cooked, this is the place to go. The chef is an absolute genius in the kitchen and the food is outstanding! Flavours are literally incredible. Quite easily the best Thai food I have eaten, and coming from London have eaten in many, many restaurants in town.
The decorations are a bit tired and the restaurant decor is in need of a face lift. Perhaps if you are style over substance you might be disappointed but if you just want the best Thai cuisine imaginable, look no further than this gem.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Poor
Review:
One person in the front of house on one of their busiest breakfast mornings, very slow service.
Strange egg omelette more like a Yorkshire pudding.

Enough said .

The answer, would we ? Nope

Name: La Campagnia
Title: Great Lunchtime Menu
Review:
We had the 2 course menu for £12 and it was really good. Nice that the food is cooked fresh and the atmosphere is cosy.

Service was very good and we thought the whole thing was excellent value for money.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Long wait. Bad service
Review: Went with my family and was very disappointed with the service. Waited 40mins to get served. Food overpriced and poor quality. There was a lot of dirty tables which were slow to be cleared. Would not return to this restaurant every again

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: Little disappointed
Review:
Had heard good things about this property but had a few snags with front of house, the Spa & housekeeping, ended up speaking to the General Manager as our experience wasn’t as it should have been. That said Restaurant comes highly recommended. We booked a midweek Spa, Dinner, bed & breakfast package & as members of another H&S hotel Spa had expected to be treated the same. We were actually quite disappointed with the spa treatments (or lack of) a less than proactive front of house & dirty (used) crockery in the bedroom. Overall, this property promises more than it delivers, and as such is not good value for money.
Read less

Name: The Old Barn
Title: A pleasant evening in the sun
Review: Don't know the area very well but stopped and had a few drinks. Seating outside in the sun. Good beer. Pleasant talk with 2 locals. Well worth the stop.

Name: East Beach Café
Title: Janet
Review:
Stopped here for a coffee today but a table was not available so went to the take away area. The assistant was rude and not at all friendly. It took 25 minutes for a portion of chips which were raw in the middle. No sauces or white sugar available.
Shall not be going here again.

Name: East Beach Café
Title: £8.50 for 3 fish fingers in between 2 slices of bread......
Review:
.......does not come close to representing any sort of value for money.

For that price I’d have expected more of a fish goujon contained within a more substantial rustic bread offering....some fries/chips, some crisps, even some salad.....but no!

2 slices of limp sliced brown bread, 3 absolutely bog standard fish fingers, you know, the sort you get a packet of 10 for 50p in Iceland (other frozen and non-frozen food suppliers are available), a thin covering of tartare and some crushed peas.

Did it taste ok? Well yes, but it’s hard to mess it up, but let me tell you, that should not have cost more than £3.50 and they’d still be making double their money at least.

Luckily I don’t pass through there often, if I happen to be in the area again, I’ll be sure to pass by without stopping.

Name: Arundel Park Hotel
Title: Unloved and basic
Review:
First thing that hits you is the stale smell of curry/old people, quite unappealing, the decor is incredibly dated throughout, with woodchip wallpaper, dark old patterned carpets, worn paint, terrible artwork on the walls.

Met at the reception/bar by staff member who was reasonably freindly, producing the booked bill to sign on arrival. No introduction of her name however.

Other staff were reasonably pleasant, but not overly friendly, and again not a mention of a name.
Breakfast was cooked quickly, with a reasonable selection of choices. No frills but filled a hole.

Bed linen was straight out of the 80's, and a bit holey/threadbare in places. Bed was useable but not the most comfy.

Overall the room was a bit grubby in the slightly less obvious places, and again just felt unloved.

Bathroom was fuctional, the shower worked but had seen better days, showerhead quite heavily scaled and worn.

Towels provided are rediculously small.

Overall I would not choose to stay again and certainly wouldn't be recommending anyone I know does either. For £85 a night rather stay in Premier Inn.

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: Sublime setting with Pimms and pebbles at Climping
Review:
Just back from a wonderfully relaxing stay in this delightful little hotel.Just perfect in every way.Staff that go out of the way to make sure you have the best time, sublime food, a peaceful retreat of a setting just a short walk from the rather timeless Climping Beach. We had cheeky upgrade to a Sussex room as it was my birthday which was a lovely surprise, a gorgeously warm outdoor pool inviting you in and with enough sun loungers for everyone .Absolutely recommend to anyone wanting a peaceful retreat from every day life where you will be looked after but not fussed over, hats off to the whole team at Baillifscourt , we have stayed in some lovely places over the years but what you have is right up there, if not at the top... thank you so much
Read less

Name: The George, Burpham
Title: Lovely location and decor... Shame about the food
Review: We've eaten here a few times before and found the food acceptable though not great. Sadly, this time it reached a new low. The hummus was pretty innocuous and the pittas dry... and could have done with being toasted at least. The starters are too small... just two scallops in an odd curry sauce for £8.95. The squid consisted on six smallish bits. Our hake choice looked good on the menu but was over-cooked and dry. Both the triple cooked chips and the sweet potato fries were cold. The cheeses had clearly been kept in the fridge and so were characterless... The ice cream was good. Such a pity...

Name: The Holly Tree
Title: Good food, good service and nice atmosphere
Review: All three of us enjoyed our lunch on Bank Holiday Monday. Two of us had the fish with sauce and one had vegetarian dish. Lovely deserts. Nice atmosphere with good service and friendly staff. Car park at the rear.

Name: Ye Olde Fish and Chippe Shoppe
Title: Visiting Bognor but thought we would come here for lunch first
Review: Saw the great reviews for here, and was not disappointed. Weather was a bit variable, but we ate ours by the sea, there are a small number of seats inside and a couple outside though, which is handy. Battered mushrooms were delicious!

Name: The Roundstone
Title: awful service
Review:
Waited an hour and a half for mains, waited 45 minutes for table to be cleared, no one came and checked if food was ok or to offer dessert menu, had to go up and ask for it
Wouldn’t come back

Name: Avisford
Title: nice hotel but very noisy
Review:
stayed 2 nights attending a wedding nearby, having previously stayed last year.
twin rooms large and comfortable beds. One downside no lift, which we knew before we booked, but with slight mobility problems, steep stairs and long walk to rooms no good this trip. This trip we found extremely noisy and were hapy we were not staying for the saturday night as night of arrival thursday a large party was going on and again friday night absolutely heaving as was either 1 or 2 parties , and set up for more on the saturday. Noisy outside bedroom windows at front and car doors slamming at all hours.
Breakfast on friday was good, hubby wanted kippers no problem. However saturday very young staff serving one did not know what a kipper was? when it was finally sorted, weand another guest were told you were lucky you got them yesterday as we charge £5.95 extra for them? At over £400 2 rooms 2 night stay to pay extra for a kipper was a bit much, only the full english type buffet is in with the price. Also the way the breakfast was set out is a bit chaotic, people were looking around themselves for glasses for juice, milk etc all spread over in different places and rooms. Had to call a guy over twice to ask for Tea/Coffee as none was on offer and he spent another 10 minutes chatting to the girl staff then forgot to bring milk, so not happy about service, more training should be given to all the teenage staff on busy mornings.
Rooms looking a bit tired and tacky.
Pool was good and steam room. No Jacuzzi.
Reception staff good
Read less

Name: Earl's Garden
Title: FABULOUS COLOURS AND BLOOMS!
Review: Didnt realise it had separate listing from castle.Rounds off a visit nicely after castle.Really superb gardens beautifully landscaped with so many varieties of plants and colours. Fountains and water features.One of best gardens I have visited on my travels.Worth a visit if u didnt fancy castle or just a few sections as price guide allows u to do 4 options full visit or just gardens.

Name: Beachcomber Inn
Title: Awful Breakfast/Ok Lunch
Review:
I’ve just had breakfast here with my family. Absolutely disgusting. Cooked badly, poor quality food and expensive for what you get.
Had lunch here the other day which was slightly better but not great.
We’ve eaten at the other restaurants at Butlins and this is by far the worst. Don’t waste your money or your time.

Name: Mustards
Title: Great meal in Bognor
Review: My wife and I visited Mustards last week. We both decided to order from the set meal menu. Three courses for £21.95. The front of house staff were delightful and very helpful. We were both in agreement that all three courses were cooked to perfection and beautifully presented. We will definitely return in the near future.

Name: Sen
Title: Tempting Tapas
Review: Stopped for a quick bite on the way home & as ever, the welcome was warm, the food superb & the drinks hearty!

Name: Ours
Title: Ours in bognor
Review:
Lovely food, friendly atmosphere. Highly recommend you won't be disappointed if you visit

Thank you to Sam and Carla for the hospitality

Name: Butlers
Title: Birthday lunch
Review: Second visit after previously been for a leisurely Sunday lunch catching up with friends. Much quieter when we arrived for lunch today but quite full as we left. Service friendly & efficient once again but a couple of things not quite so good - had to ask for a carafe of water when other tables had already been given one as they sat down, mayonnaise offered didn’t arrive until reminded & when we settled the bill we found the desserts weren’t those that should have been offered as part of the ‘specials’ lunch. However this was rectified immediately. I expect we shall return as the food was as enjoyable as last time.

Name: The Mezze
Title: Couple dinner
Review: We been here last night it was so busy however staff dealt with it amazing lovely food lovely service definitely go back best meat ever

Name: Out of Bounds
Title: Climbing activity
Review:
When it rains the grandson loves it here.
The climbing is his favourite
The staff are attentive
The briefing before hand is through
On the other hand the cafe staff could improve their customer service skills, I’ve stopped using it because they are so rude.

Name: Lantern House
Title: Unusual to find a Takeway that doesn't deliver these days so not a good start
Review:
Service was polite and pleasant but sadly that's where it ended. After spending 48.00 on what was, in essence, a small meal for three people it was disappointing to find such small portions compared to what we are used to with all other local takeaways. 2 large spring rolls that were best described as small to medium, 2 rice in small portion boxes,
 and 2 x sweet and sour dishes in containers 2/3 the size of anywhere else and minum content. I threw away the chicken and sweetcorn soup which had caught so only tasted of burnt sesame oil.
A disappointing experience with a feeling that it was poor value for money with the lower portion size and quality than other locals who would also deliver.

Name: La Campagnia
Title: Bland food and bland service...
Review: Having had great experiences on past visits, my parents surprised me with a table here for my 21st, last night. To our dismay the service was unkind and cold. We were not offered more drinks when glasses were empty. Two of the party had the peppercorn chicken pasta, and it was just totally bland. When asked if we wanted parmesan, the waitress leant straight over in front of one of the party and over her plate, her elbow less than an inch from her face, to reach my plate. Seems like an update in staff training with regards to hospitality is needed. When told it was my birthday, they did not think to say a simple 'happy birthday', just muttered and walked off! Staff did not say even a 'thank you' when we paid the bill and left. Sadly, you have lost a loyal customer. I did not have the heart to complain during service last night, as I did not want my parents to think this shoddy experience had ruined my birthday meal. Quite frankly I feel awful my parents wasted a lot of money on such an experience.

Name: Church Farm
Title: Worst week ever !!
Review:
When we arrived there was no one on the gate to welcome us or direct us.
We had a 20minute wait to get the keys as the caravan wasnt ready. We found drugs in the kitchen cupboard, used straws and lollipop sticks under the bed, creams under the sink. It was filthy. The kichten blind was broken,the toilet blind fell off and the window in the double bedroom had a 2inch gap at the top where it had dropped. There was cigarette butts everywhere around the caravan. We complained to reception, security came to take the drugs. Someone did come and fix the window. The kitchen blind wasnt fixed and the toilet blind was just hung back up but only resting on the clips. We wasnt even offered an alternative caravan. And was told "the cleaners only clean what they see." The water went off on the Tuesday, we had no communication until I received I text on the Wednesday at 10am. Luckily we had spoken to the security guard and he had explained what was happening. All we heard from reception all week was it's not our fault. We had to buy our own bottled water for drinks. I've complained again since coming home and have been told we could have used the toilets in the complex. We were the furthest point away from the complex with a 4 year old and our elderly parents, that all use the toilet throughout the night. The complex dont open through the night!!
Read less

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Just Lunch and a beer
Review:
We visited Arundel for the carpet of flowers, then went wandering around the town for some lunch.

 We found the Norfolk Arms Hotel and its small restaurant (The Castle?), which is on the right of the hotel arch as you look at it. Not to be confused with the other restaurant on the left.

Its a small restaurant, with one member of staff, therefore the service was slow, really slow. The walls had a history of the hotel on them which gave you something to read while waiting.

So why the good review, well the staff member was lovely, just over worked, BUT the burgers were the best we have had in a while and were worth waiting for.

If you can wait, it was about 45-50 minutes, just for a nice beer and an excellent burger, it was worth it.

In a rush, don't bother,
Read less

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: Good Stay
Review:
Good stay at this hotel would go back, when in the area only one thing was not good was the size of the bed it was a small double and not the big size bed, so didn't have a good night sleep, could have changed rooms I suppose.
Read less

Name: The George, Burpham
Title: Quality food and drink with the right service to match 😬
Review:
Perfect location for good friends to catch up, eat freshly cooked to order food and put the worlds to right. Tick, tick and tick.
One diner was dairy free, not a problem and the choices were plenty. The sensitivity of the waiting staff meant we were that nightmare table chat, chat, and not a look at a menu and we were 20 minutes in already. Not a grumble or a sly look to the heavens but a genuine no problem I’ll come back in a jiffy. Just perfect for us.
Not overly complicated food but fresh and tasty. Would we come back, absolutely.
On a personal note the staff go above and beyond, I got caught out a couple of weeks previously on a failed bike ride and used this location as a I know you can find this place to collect me postcode. Whilst waiting outside for my lift (NB they were actually closed) they popped out and asked was I ok and did I need a coffee?? One espresso later and a warm car journey home we’d made a decision to come back and try the inside, so glad we did.
Well done team and see you again

Name: Arden B&B
Title: Arden house
Review:
Instantly made to feel at home by Lucie, Iain and Lola.
This is a beautiful house inside and out with parking. A stones throw from the town centre and Arundel castle. Choices of breakfast all cooked for you on a time of your choosing.
Can’t wait to revisit in the summer. Recommend highly.
Read less

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Poorly run pub in a beautiful location - such a pity
Review:
Set in a perfect Sussex location this pub has deteriorated so much - such complacency will eventually result in it's downfall. The beautiful location almost guarantees plenty of customers for now but they need to be treated with respect if they are to return.

We went for lunch on a busy summer's afternoon. We expected some wait but not so very long - I think they forgot us as once we reminded them we were still waiting, our starter did eventually appear.

The prawn and avocado cocktail was the poorest we've ever tasted. Obviously quickly thrown together- a chunk of avocado, one prawn, chopped vegetables in a vinegary sauce served with stale bread.

They then mixed up our steaks and as we had ordered them cooked differently with different sauces it was not practical to swap. The so called triple cooked chips were flat. The meal was so poor we couldn't face ordering a pudding. We just wanted to leave.

Our table was near the bar and all the time we were sitting there - and it was a long time - we couldn't hear ourselves speak as there was so much noise from the staff constantly loading the glasses into the dishwasher trays and throwing empty bottles into a container.

The girls behind the bar were not great - could do with being taught how to smile and be pleasant to customers as we noticed they were quite curt with some people who had a few queries re the menu.

Hopefully the owners will address these problems as it would be a pity to allow this well located pub to deteriorate any further.

Name: Ship & Anchor
Title: Evening meal out for 15 people.
Review: Thanks to the Ship and Anchor, we had a very pleasant home cooked meal with good service. We were split on two large tables and we all left very content with no issues parking.

Name: Six Bells
Title: Holiday with Arthur
Review: Drove right past the place heading to Littlehampton. Not very well signposted for drivers. We stayed just 5 mins away and had 3 great evening meals. The pub is dog friendly and has a great beer garden and parking at the rear too.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Terrible service
Review: Went here this evening for a get together with ex work colleagues. Some were eating, some were not. However, it was an hour before anyone came to take the order, the girl came to the table, said "right guys" then dashed off. She returned about five minutes later, those who wanted food ordered one sharing platter and another couple ordered a salad bowl, bowl of chips and some deep fried jalapeno peppers. Hardly a large meal. But it took over an hour before the food finally arrived. One lady who had ordered went to the bar to see where the food had got to and was told that they were extremely busy, well I think there must have been some invisible customers. Worst service I've ever come across

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Tried it again. But again was not good. Won't bother again
Review:
Visited last year and food was bad. Manager responded saying would take on feedback. So was in arundel today and thought I would try again.

Place was very empty,with only two families and two staff serving

They were very pleasant and we were given a table and we ordered drinks. These took twenty minutes to arrive

Ordered food which again took ages,was frustrating as the staff were stood around chatting to two friends who had popped in

I ordered the venison burger. Which to be fair was OK. But had salad on the side which tasted really odd

Friend I was with ordered mixed kebab. There was no lamb so was just chicken and pork. This was inedible. The meat was so dry it could not be eaten

The waitress took on the feedback and looked embareesed and went to talk to the chef. Came back and agreed to take the kebab of the bill and offered a free pudding

We waited ages for food. Had a bad meal so did not want to wait ages for a pudding to arrive

One of us left hungry

This place is a nice gimmick but is not cheap. You really need to raise your game on the food

I really wanted to like it but it was ver poor

Name: Ship & Anchor
Title: Give it a miss!
Review: The couple that run it are very rude angry people. I will never go back and would advise anyone to look else where!!

Name: George & Dragon
Title: Saturday lunch
Review: We had a 30 min drive to get to this pub. I had passed it many times on my way to Gatwick. The pub is a 13th century pub and is beautiful and welcoming. Lovely open fire, good selection of beers etc. The menu has a good selection for all dietary requirements. When the food comes out it doesn't disappoint. I had sausage and mash and my partner had fish fingers in a bap. Both were excellent. We finished up with sticky toffee pudding and clotted cream ice cream. Absolutely superb.

Name: Royal Oak
Title: Lovely lunch
Review: Popped in for a Saturday lunchtime catch up with friends. All had starters as we were all ordering from the small plate option menu. Food was quick to come out and the small plate isn’t that small. All enjoyed our starters and mains. The service received was excellent throughout. Because we were in the saloon we received table service for food and drinks. The pub has such a lovely feel about it and we were made to feel so welcome that we popped back in the evening for a local band that was playing. Well done guys

Name: East Beach Café
Title: Grubby
Review: What a wasted opportunity ! Such lovely views but cafe was grubby and tables uncleared. Staff unfriendly when we walked in and at one point a couple walked in and after five minutes of no-one serving behind the counter walked out. Won't bother again !!

Name: George & Dragon
Title: Family Birthday lunch
Review: Only eaten here twice before, travelling from Fareham to meet relatives from Brighton, who originally recommended the pub for meeting up. We weren't disappointed. Lovely staff and lovely food on both occasions made it easy to make the journey again to celebrate my Mum's Birthday and catch up with family. The staff and the food were excellent; thanks for helping make my Mum's Birthday such nice day for her, looking forward to our next visit already.

Name: World's End
Title: Lunch on the terrace
Review:
The Pub had a great lunch menu. Sandwich or a Full Menu. I had a Fishfinger sandwich & sweet potato fries. There were three choices of bread, brown, white or a cobb roll. I chose brown.
It was a beautiful May sunny day so we chose to eat on the Terrace. This was easily accessible for me in my wheelchair from the large car park (ample Disabled Parking Bays)
We got drinks from the bar when ordering & the food came very quickly to our table outside & was "huge"!
The beat fishfinger sandwich I have ever had!
The staff were were polite & attentive. I would definitely go back.

Name: The Lamb Inn
Title: A huge disappointment
Review:
We had never had a bad meal at The Lamb until Sunday evening when we took family who were over from Australia for an evening meal. Having told them for years it was the best place around to eat it was embarrassing.
The service was extremely slow, the table not properly laid & dirty cutlery on the floor. The restaurant was not busy, actually the quietest I have seen it.There was one young lady serving and she was doing her very best so no complaint about her, she deserved to be backed up with another waitress.
We ordered entrees including 3 pate/terrine with toast. The pate was liquid , lacking in flavour and the toast not really toasted plus there was only 2 small pieces.Pate should not be of a pouring consistency !
Main courses included Dover sole which contained so many bones it was inedible . This was replaced with a meal of smoked haddock which my son said smelled off & did not get eaten. Another person who had the haddock said it was over cooked & the spinach was crunchy with sand or earth
My husband had the duck which was over cooked. The ribs were only average, not really smoked correctly.
The children’s burgers were good & enjoyed.
My chicken was probably acceptable, I just didn’t like the flavours in the couscous which was a personal thing
It was meant to be a special evening which was totally ruined by unacceptable food

Name: Arun View
Title: Delicious lunch
Review:
Four of us had very delicious fish lunches including prawns, and crab starters,then cod, skate, plaice and Dover sole main courses. All were presented attractively and tasted delicious. The service was excellent and the ambiance very pleasant.
Would love to visit again!

Name: Knights Table Steakhouse
Title: Fantastic Sunday Lunch
Review: 100% for service & food. Best roast we have had... ever. Roast pototoes are the best. Veggie option very good too. Fab place for a family. Children love the dressing up. Staff brilliant, friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend

Name: Legends Bar
Title: Definitely worth a visit
Review:
Bognor Regis Pier is situated at the centre of Bognor’s promenade.

 It is quite a short pier but has the usual things that you’d expect to find. A fish & chip shop, a cafe that also sells lovely ice creams and a popular amusement arcade. Also on the pier is a night club.

 It’s also very pleasant to walk all around the pier from where you get good views all along the seafront, with views over the sea and across to the Selsey peninsula.

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: Sophie
Review: We love this place, it does gluten free burgers and chips and the food is good and reasonably priced. Very welcoming to us a family with 3 kids under 12.

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Beautiful formal, water and natural gardens with expert staff available to answer questions
Review:
For injured or disabled people the golf carts operated by volunteers offer a great opportunity to see the castle and grounds.

On this visit we used the opportunity of a Gardener's World voucher to enable both of us entry for the price of one.

It was interesting to discover that much of the stonework is fake - it can be cleverly carved wood instead.

We met a helpful gardener in the greenhouse who explained the control of insects by natural predators and the nutritional needs of the large grape vines. That led us to talk about compost and rats that like their accommodation centrally heated.

We even got some tips about how the Wisteria on our abandoned gazebo would flourish if left to grow wild and the age at which a Magnolia would first flower.

Do not miss the Rose Gardens. Many varieties of rose had been chosen for their fragrance and their massed perfume was a delightful added experience to seeing the beautiful flowers
Read less

Name: St Nicholas' Church
Title: Lovely Parish church
Review:
We were lucky enough to visit during the week of the festival and, as well as having a small cafe in and outside the church, there was a talk about its history taking place. The church is divided into two sections with the smaller chapel accessible only in the castle grounds which is catholic while the main body of the church is protestant. Internally I felt this church was more interesting than the larger catholic cathedral and it had a warmth about it feeling like a truly living church.
Definitely worth a visit,

Name: Osca's
Title: Worst Fish & Chips I've ever had!
Review: Staff were rude and unfriendly. Food wasn't great, it was luke warm, must've been sat there for a while. I wouldnt recommend this place to anyone

Name: Butlins
Title: Weekend break
Review:
Decided to have a weekend break and check out the splash complex recently finished. We opted against the meal plan due to an unfavourable experience at Minehead 3 years ago. The new Splash complex has everything except a useable swimming pool, there is a small pool but it’s packed with parents and toddlers walking or waddling across the pool making swimming an impossible task.
The dining options are not good value, high prices for very average food, Papa Johns is the best choice especially the buffet.
As usual the quality of the entertainment was good, a special mention for ABBA tribute that was excellent.
Read less

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: One night stay
Review:
Hotel met all expectations, room clean, bathroom efficient, location perfect for my purpose, staff very helpful, amenities near the location limited but enough to access food, drink and cash withdrawal. Chichester and Bognor Redgis only a short drive.
Read less

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: Back again
Review:
Yet again a good experience, great staff, poor WiFi
WE were flat hunting in the area and this was in a good position to search from BognaRegis to Worthing. Close to main road parallel to coast road but no traffic noise

Name: World's End
Title: Excellent Sunday Roast
Review: A well presented Sunday roast with enormous Yorkshire pudding; curly kale could have done with being cooked a little longer but overall an excellent meal.

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Quick Family Lunch
Review: Wholly disappointed once again. I do not know why people recommend this place. There is no table service and when I went to order were told they were not doing sandwiches. Having gone back outside, we decided on a flatbread pizza, a child’s meal and a portion of fries.I had to order from 2 different places and collect one order. The food was nothing special. Maybe if I’d have forked out £15 for a main we may not have been so disappointed- although at these prices I would have hoped staff to have a smarter look and more professional presence. Will not be returning and do not recommend.

Name: World's End
Title: Horrible food, rude staff
Review:
Not a very nice time at this supposed highly recommended pub. Vegan "meat" balls, only 3, small and cold. Also not nice having to sit under a wall of dead animals eating vegan !!!
Other party had ham and chips, cheap nasty supermarket ham and very greasy chips, oil dripping off the chips.
Over priced.
Staff did not seem to care.

Name: Mustards
Title: Wow!!!!
Review: We had visited this restaurant on the back of word of mouth.....We weren't disappointed!!!! From the quality of the food and the service it was a wonderful experience....Will definately be recommending this restaurant tip ALL my friends and family!!!!

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: Poor experience.
Review:
Visited last weekend with friends. The service was poor, staff had to be reminded for menus and drinks, but still we waited.
 Waited over an hour after ordering before meals arrived.
 The food was so poorly presented..... no pride/care shown here.
 The meals were distinctly average and my chicken & tarragon pie was lukewarm.and all of our plates were cold too.... I was violently sick during the night.
 Such a shame! This pub used to be a favourite of ours for many years... had a lovely menu, friendly, efficient service and a good experience all round. I do hope the new owners act positively upon the recent poor reviews.

Name: Aviator
Title: Worst fish and chips.
Review: Last night of our holiday we thought we would have fish and chips on the seafront at bognor. We were the only couple in the restaurant. The pub was very quiet. We ordered our meal. We were kept waiting, but thought at least our food would be cooked fresh. How wrong can you be! The batter on the fish was overcooked and hard, and chips were overcooked as well. The person who took our order asked if everything ok and I said the batter was very hard. The waitress came over at the end and asked, I said again it was all hard and overcooked and I left most of it. Unfortunately you pay for your meals before you get them or I would have just sent meal back and not paid.

Name: Six Bells
Title: Appalling service
Review: There is a first time for everything. And what I mean by that, is that I’ve never experienced such awkward, inadequate and appalling service. Me, my partner, (she is vegetarian) her brother and Dad, visited here for some lunch. Painting the picture for you. We entered through the rear of the building, with no signage to suggest any sort of entrance, we chanced it and found the entrance via the back as stated. Upon entering, we were greeted by a waitress asking if we booked a table. We did not, so they went off to see if they had a table available for the 4 of us. Whilst waiting several minutes, within that timeframe we were asked if we’d like to get some drinks. It was just myself and my partners dad that ordered a drink, and the (what we believe to be) landlady named Tracey had given my partner and her brother a funny look for not wanting a drink. Once me and her dad had received our drinks, a group of customers came in. They were warmly greeted and received drinks and seated before us. Fair enough if they reserved a table. Once we were seated, my partner had seen that there was only 1 vegetarian option available on the Mains section, which she did not want, and preferred to not eat anything. This was because, I asked a passing waitress if there were any vegetarian options, and that was the only one available. I understand that it was Father’s Day and it was most likely a temporary set menu. However, when it states on trip advisor itself that it’s vegetarian friendly, we didn’t expect that. More to the point, we asked if we’d like to order by the waitress, and we asked for a few more minutes. The landlady Tracey came over to take our order. Myself, my partners brother and dad wanted to order and not my partner as mentioned. However, Tracey said something along the lines of “ i can’t have a table for four people, only ordering three meals and two drinks”. This came across very rudely, and we were speechless. Our response was, that there were limited vegetarian options and my partner didn’t want what was offered on that menu. Tracey suggested something off of the starter menu, minus the cheese because my partner cannot have cheese, insisting she orders something, again coming across very aggressive this time. Anyhow, the offer was refused, and Tracey said she’ll just put the order through and snatched the menus from the table. After discussing what just happened, we decided to leave and take our custom elsewhere. As we were we leaving, we told the waitress why. (Because of the poor service) and left with Tracey, hearing and asking if we were going to pay for the drinks, that we already bought at the bar, in which she served us. Also, over £9.00 for 2 pints, definitely over charged? Given my partners family is from Eastern Europe, I’d assume she is a xenophobe. Because, why was everyone else served in such a warm and great manner?

Name: LG Café
Title: Fantastic new restaurant in Arundel!
Review: I visited on Saturday night and what a great find this is! The service is excellent and the menu offers a great selection of hearty French dishes. Incredible wines and champagnes by the glass and the selection of patisseries is out of this world. I will definitely revisit! A feast for the eyes and your tummy!

Name: Vicky's Café
Title: We found this closed at 8.47am on Friday 26th April.
Review: Went out early especially to have breakfast here. Sign near road doesn't give any opening or closing times, but thought it would be open early for breadfast! How wrong can you be? It was shuttered up and no parking, although we found we could park on the road before turning right, which we will do IF VICKYS KITCHEN IS STILL TRADING. We are wondering if it's closed down. Having to put negative reviews. OPENING TIMES should be clearly marked on the signs.

Name: Sea View
Title: Lunch
Review: Really rude and abusive manageress lived in this area for years my elderly parents always loved this place which was once under professional management I think the Managers would be better off getting out of the hospitality business as they clearly don’t enjoy it. I won’t subject my family to this appalling treatment again

Name: Butlins
Title: Total let down.
Review:
We have been visiting Butlins Skegness as a family for many years now and decided to try Bognor as a change for 2019. This was a mistake on our part. This is the holiday of "No you can't." The water park was much smaller than we imagined after it's billing. Once inside some of the slides have a manufacturer recommendation of no under 18s. So a 6 foot 2 17 year old lad at 15 stone is ok, but a 5 foot lady of 40 is barred? Makes sense. Never seen a slide with that disclaimer. Rammed beyond belief, our two young children bumped and bashed over constantly. The rooms were not as clean as expected and for self catering we were used to having basic things such as the fridge being switched on ready so we could put our food in, especially in hot weather and a tin opener. Shame this Butlins didn't consider that. The forks had thick black residue on the sides of the prongs. Horrible. TV didn't work for full duration. The whole place has been packed like sardines. Way too many people here. Intimidating when you are only three and in a huge crowded area for a show. Plus no account for disabilities. My wife had only standing room for one event. Red Coats just stare blankly when asked for help or reasons. The amount of smokers walking around and not in the smoking areas in a family park was surprising. I could go on, kids being refused autographs as they has bought the "wrong" merchandise (over double the price) of the goods that were allowed was really the last straw. Particular mention to Braydon here who gave some nonsense about the type of pen being used until I told him I work with autographs and then admitted he didn't really know why and walked off when I told him what a poor time we were having in general. We won't be back, a real shame as this was a celebration of a family members return to health after a horrendous 18 months. Gandeys Circus was good, except for that the children's foam hands were stolen from under their seats. Will be looking forward to going home. If we are to make it back to Butlins, it won't be here.
Read less

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: Felt ill after
Review:
A friend and I visited on Saturday 2nd Nov.
Whilst the food appeared fine at the time, we both had upset stomach that evening.
Hopefully just a one off, but I wont be returning.

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: Barely slept due to the awful mattress
Review: I have stayed here before and thought it would be nice to stay here as it was close to family, the service was average but the biggest problem was the bed, barely slept as it was uncomfortable and every time we moved in our sleep the squeak would wake us both up. I personally like to be able to sleep when I pay for hotel.. Terrible stay

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: Rundown and poorly serviced
Review: A disappointing experience! The room was 'tired' but worse it was very poorly cleaned and maintained (see photos).The carpet was definitely in need of cleaning of replacement. There was mess on the floor -- including a needle. There was rubbish left on the shelves in the room and the bed covering was also stained. Overall one would have to say that cleanliness was not of even a moderate standard. We had a broken chair, but when we mentioned this they showed us that they had a pile of broken chairs and that they were unable to get replacements. That would not be a fault of this particular Travelodge, but of the organisation in general.

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: Awful
Review: Visited at 4.00pm on Tuesday. Service painfully slow although the place was nearly empty, when the food came it had obviously been under a heat lamp too long. The curry was congealed as was the children’s baked beans. The fries were over cooked and cold, a really bad experience.

Name: Fish and Chips
Title: Very poor food
Review:
What a disappointment, we ordered two cod and chips and one separate portion of chips, unfortunately there was no vegetarian option for my stepdaughter. The fish was that horrible smooth, light look, and when you cut into it a lot of it was hollow with very little fish inside. The chips were possibly frozen, I’m not sure, hard to get chips wrong but they managed it, they weren’t cooked through and tasteless. They had no knives and forks, no serviettes and didn’t serve tea either, that had to be purchased at a ice cream parlour next door. You can usually rely on a seaside resort to provide a good fish and chips, but sadly,
not here. Safe to say we will not return, ever....

Name: White Swan Arundel
Title: Overnight Stay
Review:
Passing through and checked into The White Swan with my partner. Was met by the manager Jacquie long who was absolutely lovely and made us feel very welcome. had a lovely meal on the evening where we once again bumped into Jacquie behind the bar. She wore a few hats that evening and wore each one well. Comfortable bed, excellent breakfast. Highly recommended
Read less

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Poor quality food, badly presented
Review: Went for a family Saturday lunch. The food was poor and tasteless. My burger was poorly presented, no taste and a tiny portion of fries. My mothers Salmon teriyaki was just a piece of salmon on a plate with a few tomatoes, no accompaniment/vegetables and was not good value. The people who chose from the "cheaper " set menus meals were exactly the same as those of us who ordered the same thing from the main menu except those people were charged more. A rip off! Staff were friendly and helpful though.

Name: The Lamb, Angmering
Title: Brilliant
Review:
Once again The Lamb has surpassed itself, lovely staff, excellent service, and good quality food and wine.
Will be going back soon.

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: Burgers and fries
Review: This place is ok, burgers are tasty, although hardly mind blowing. They had some interesting drink options which made a nice change but chairs are not very comfy and staff did not seem very invested. Had to wait a while, nothing too much but as it was quiet when we were there would wonder what it is like on a Saturday night or other busy day.

Name: The Lamb, Angmering
Title: Good night out
Review:
Night out with girlfriend.
 Really good service . Food was very good. Not expensive for what we had. Nice atmosphere and will be back.

Name: The Lion
Title: Horrendous
Review: Worst service in history, repeated delays meant lunch today took over four hours and food of poor quality too. Shambolic beyond belief. Wouldn’t eat here again under any circumstances and completely baffled as to how they have so many excellent ratings - a Russian algorithm perhaps?!

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Really good burgers and lovely stsff
Review:
I’ve been here a few times on numerous occasions and have never been disappointed. The staff are super friendly and the burgers are really really good, highly recommend.

The location is beautiful as well!

Name: The Bear Inn
Title: Great staff and a lovely roast
Review:
On Sunday we turned up too late for lunch however instead of sending us packing the staff went out of their way to accommodate us, they explained what roasts were left, didn't rush us and we had a lovely family meal.
the meal was good but the staff great, thank you so much for squeezing us in!

Name: Lemongrass Restaurant
Title: Lovely service, beautiful food
Review:
Lovely restaurant. Service was quick but there wasn’t many in the restaurant which surprises me as I’ve never had a bad meal. It was a Sunday night. Lovely relaxing venue. Good food at good prices. Staff always very welcoming and polite.
Lovely fresh food, really tasty.

Name: Parsons Table
Title: Excellent service and versatility of chef
Review: The personal attention and willingness to find possibilities to cope with a restrictive diet were a relief and tremendous confidence builder. We will certainly re-visit.

Name: Swanbourne Lodge
Title: Friendly staff and good food
Review:
Payed a visit to the cafe after a lovely walk around lake, all the staff were friendly and polite especially the proprietor, food was of a good standard with lots of choice of menu.
The staff were clearly having a very busy day due to it was mother's day but service and time taken to fulfill order was good.
Good value as well. (From the awkward customer with the nice family :-) )

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: Gorgeous fish and chips
Review:
Came here after a long walk, haven't been to the black rabbit easily in five years. Wow wow.
Firstly stowford press cider was great equally had a cider for that long. Thirst quenching. That and a pint for my other half was £8. I thought that was quite reasonable as the rabbit always had a rep for being over priced.

We had whitebait and camembert to start (shared) I haven't had whitebait for a long time (theme here isn't there lol) and had been fancying it for weeks. I wasn't disappointed.

For main I ordered something I have never ordered in a pub, fish and chips! I try to stay away from fish and chips in a pub or out to eat as I usually think what's the point as it's cheaper and better at the local chip shop.... Well I was wrong! Gorgeous piece of fish the badger batter was scrummy and so crisp not too oily. The triple cooked chips were to die for.

Alas with a second pint of cider I couldn't finish it.

We will be back!!!

Name: Cardanom Bay
Title: Customer service APPALLING!!!
Review:
This was our most favourite restaurant ever BUT recently (the last few months) the service has been terrible. Today we visited the restaurant for lunch & there was some confusion with the bill (partly my fault) but the waiter was so unhelpful & rude, so rude in fact that he laughed at us. I asked him for his name as no name badge was present but he wouldn’t tell me so I took a picture of him instead
This restaurant has great food but the exact opposite when it comes to the staff. We won’t be visiting again, totally gutted!

Name: The Windmill, Harvester
Title: What a dump
Review: This gasto pub has the envious position of being next door to The Windmill Theatre/Cinema - a catchment for cinema goers wanting a preorder after show drink, which I and my 3 friends decided to have. We were greeted by a “meeting” of 3 staff behind the bar who continued their chat for another 30 seconds before attempting to serve us. The men in our party are beer drinkers - there was NO BEER on pumps and, on asking, they were told NO BOTTLED BEER either. Having ordered 2 drinks already the men opted for lager. We took our drinks to a table for 4 with 4 tub chairs, 2 of which had no cushions. We fetched cushions from other chairs and sat to “enjoy” our drinks. A child of about 6 was shouting and climbing on furniture opposite us where her parents ignored her and had a loud personal conversation with a member of staff whilst we watched the child pull a length of wooden batten away from a seating area. Nobody seemed to “notice” apart from us. The general apathy in this badly stocked pub restaurant defies belief. For a prime position on the seafront this establishment should be ready to serve, equipped for customers’ needs and aware of its clientele. 0 out of 10. As locals we will NEVER go there again.

Name: Butlins Day Visits
Title: Don't bother
Review: big refurbishment on swimming pool ..personally I prefer the old one ..not much for teenagers to do .or less u want to pay for go karts .rock climbing ....looking bit run down and un kept..didn't see any red coats walking around..no board scattered around park to let u know times of shows etc ..would rather go some were else not worth the money for wat u get

Name: The Holly Tree
Title: Holly tree
Review:
Very rude staff, I was waiting with my 3 year old son for about 20 minutes as I waited for my partner to arrive being constantly harassed to take my partners order as they have more bookings in 30 minutes time.
I said she will be here shortly but they insisted I order now before she could even see the menu, I had no choice but to leave as we would of only had a short time to eat due to harassment already.
They did not apologise they just let me pick up my 3 year old son, before I even stood up they started to clean my table.
Never been anywhere like this in my life.

Zero star out of five.

Name: Waterside Café
Title: Still have upset tummy
Review: I’m not sure if this cafe has changed hands but if it hasn’t the standard has dropped. A lot of very noisy staff and the premises looking very tatty. I had a prawn sandwich and have suffered with an upset tummy since!

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Very nice pub fare and ale
Review: This is a franchise establishment with the theme of Bird Names. Bar and serving staff were extremely pleasant, bar, restaurant and toilets very clean. The ambience in the bar was cosy and romantic, the IPA (Irish Pale Ale) was stellar and my wife enjoyed a red wine from the generous wine list. Our meals were very tasty, hot and prompt and the wait staff always seemed to appear just as we were looking for them. I would recommend this Pub

Name: Hangar Down
Title: We had the pleasure of staying here for two nights in July. Warm welcome from Alison and a lovely upstairs bedroom with good toiletries and plenty of tea/coffee plus fresh milk in the fridge. Arundel is a lovely town and we visited the castle on our first afternoon. Early breakfast the following morning before spending the day at the festival of speed. Well kept large gardens offer peace and calm after a busy day out. Breakfast on both mornings was excellent. Thank you Alison we will be back
Review: Fabulous

Name: The Roundstone
Title: 4 nights
Review: Been her 4 nights business £25 per night food allowance. Absolutely crap service food crap staff just chat on table I ask to clear table 3 out of 4 nights we have a account with premier inn we are now considering going elsewhere not good at all . As we speak still not received meal 45 min in and the restaurant is empty do not recommend rip off crap

Name: T-Bone Burger
Title: 20th feb
Review: Been looking forward to going to this place for a little while. On entrance we were not acknowledged despite the barman seeing us.a group of three came in after us and were asked how many the table is four to which I said 2 as we are not with them. Again no eye contact.waitress looked like she didn't want to be there.she said" take a seat" to which I said anywhere and she said yes.... After reading the menu....15 minutes later with no service...but plenty of chat to the barman from the waitress...she then went and started serving the group of 3 people. At this point I stood up and said to my partner let's go. I said to her on the way out that we were before those people and she pathetically said sorry in once again a very .I don't want to be here voice.my partner also said your attitude is not good and it wasn't a good impression from the beginning .plenty of tables empty as well so weren't busy. A real shame.

Name: Flying Fortress
Title: Not very clean.
Review:
My friend & i visited the Flying Fortress with our two children for the first time today. ( 4 month old & 1 year old) As much as we couldn’t fault the price. The cleanliness specifically in the baby area 0-2 years allowed only. Which in my opinion should be the area that is kept the cleanest for obvious reasons. Was filthy & none of the toys provided for younger children actually worked! Absolutely no staff supervision. And food very over priced. Overall not very impressed!
Read less

Name: The Lamb, Angmering
Title: Excellent place to stay
Review: we stayed here on my birthday, the bar was very busy but well looked after. The room we stayed in was excellent well furnished and had dressing area and a large modern bathroom. Would stay again, highly recommended

Name: Avisford
Title: Not my best experience in a branded hotel
Review:
I booked two rooms, 1 double and 1 twin for 3 nights. In my opinion the rate I took from the call centre after struggling for 3 days on the web, was over charged, especially as the first price quoted before I complained bitterly, was £1,116. I explained as the web page was not working the rate went up from £732 to what I got eventually which was £876. I did complain but was told it was due to availabeilty, which was odd, as the follow days when I got the web page to work, it was cheaper, but the $876 brought me a no cancelation clause. Then came the hotel experience, the twin room had to be changed after checking in, my in laws notice sewage in the bath tub, this was I am told due to a blockage. There were no engineers on the weekend, but the room was eventually changed after being told there were no twin rooms left. Perhaps a misunderstanding, meaning on the ground floor. The doubke room was extremely small, perhpas smaller than advertised and looking a little "sad" and well used. The safe battaey needed changing, but after reminding the reception staff, 3 days later it still had not been changed. The staff are very young and in desperate need of training, they never smile, say hello or ask how things are going. There were exceptions of course, but rare. The breakfast had a good variety and was well presented, with additional items for purchase. The hotel location is also very nice. Please note it seems to be a wedding hotel, so Friday and Saturday nights are extremely loud with more than you fair share of people with a little more to drink than normal perhaps.
Read less

Name: Lamb Angmering
Title: Another fantastic two nights at the Lamb
Review:
This place is a gem, and as a fellow hotelier and restaurant owner I know that these guys have got it spot on. I stayed I believe in the James Penfold suite..anyway the one with the private entrance..superb room; quiet and extremely comfortable with top of the range bedding and facilities.

On the Saturday that we were there, my partner and I had dinner..it was without question one of the nicest meals I've had out in a very long time, superb food and a wonderful ambient dining room..incredibly good staff and hassle free

This is my second stay at the Lamb and I would not go anywhere else the next time I visit Sussex from my home in France.. I have to give 5 stars, because although a little pricey for the location, I believe it to be good value. Thankyou "The Lamb" I will be returning

Name: The Diner
Title: The diner KENNY
Review: we had an amazing time. Kenny went above and beyond to make sure that we had a great time. My dad has dementia and this could be his last family holiday but Kenny made it a evening to remember. Kenny made sure we had everything we need he is truly amazing. Even amazing with our children. Thank you Kenny x

Name: Papa Johns, Butlins
Title: Bad pizza and staff
Review:
The staff were miserable and got my order wrong. Went to the buffet and there was a lack of pizza available. I found the pizza tasteless and overly crunchy. Also the ice cream machine was broken for 20 mins yet they still allowed me to buy the cup for it. As well as that all of the toppings as promised for the ice cream had ran out so had to eat it plain.

Won't eat there again

Name: Church Farm
Title: Fabulous for the kids
Review:
So we decided to take a little break with the kids and chose church farm on this occasion, the staff were very friendly and helpful, the activities were fantastic so much to choose from there’s plenty of great pubs local if you want to go out for dinner as well as a great menu in the restaurant onsite, the beach is within walking distance where you can go crab fishing (kids loved it) highly recommended place to take the little ones.
Read less

Name: Spotted Cow
Title: So disappointing
Review: What a disappointment the Spotted Cow is now. Used to frequent here on several occasions in the past and always had a lovely meal. If the meal 5 of us had recently is anything to go on, we will definitely NOT be back. It took ¾ of an hour to actually place an order, although there were hardly any customers. The starters were okay, but the deep fried Brie was overdone, hard on the outside and cold in the middle. The vegetarian options seemed good, until we tried them. The veggie lasagne was small, approximately 3 inches square; bland and tasteless. The Squash was just average and dry, no sauce. I left most of it. The steak had a 2 inch piece of grizzle. The two Ploughmans however, were fine, nice big pieces of cheese. But the 'piece de resistance' was the treacle tart. Yes I am joking. There was no treacle in the treacle tart. It was just pastry that stuck in the throat. Inedible and most of it was left. We did complain, but it seemed to fall on deaf ears. Such a shame as this was a great place, and a lovely meal could always be guaranteed. Expensive for what it is. Not a go-back-to.

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Worst service from THE MOST MISERABLE FAT GIT
Review: Worst service from the man clearly left in charge EVER. Customers treated as an inconvenience!! Never again!

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Visited 12:30 on Saturday
Review:
Visited 12:30 on Saturday 21st December with a party of 6. First initial impressions is looks quite a nice pub, decent selection of drinks etc. Didn’t have to wait for our table- we sat down instantly.

Waiters and waitresses were very attentive, friendly and helpful. Couldn’t have asked for more from them.

However- that’s all the positives out the way. For around £27 per person per head- I had a couple of pints of coke, nachos starter, Double stack burger, and crumble desert.

Nachos- were disgusting. Cheap quality. Disgusting fake cheese. Guacamole straight out of a jar and lumps of tomato dumped onto the plate (once it’s been nuked in a microwave). It was bland and tasteless... it’s so easy to make Guacamole & Salsa- why the hell is it not made fresh?! And the cheese... jeeze, use REAL cheese!!

The Double Stack Burger- was ok. Burger was burnt, but actually tasted average. Definitely had better burgers- but it was not bad. However- all my parties chips were brown, did not taste or look fresh and were basically ‘just about’ warm... so pretty pathetic in reflection.

The Apple & Berry Crumble was a huge disappointment. Again heating of the custard seems to be an issue- barely warm it was. The crumble topping was nice- the rest was more like a soup. Pretty awful!!

I have been to many restaurants that serve much much better quality food for half the price. This restaurant is totally overpriced and not worth it. The food is very poor quality, lazily prepared and ‘slopped’ together. Do not expect anything of quality or fresh.

Name: Clymping Beach
Title: Clumping beach cafe
Review: This cafe is appalling , the food is cheap and nasty the woman who owns or runs it is a disgrace . The smell of weed is a real put off . I advise no one eats there as food and hygiene certificates are not in place

Name: Mustards
Title: First of many visits to come!!
Review:
We visited this lovely restaurant for the first time today. We choose the set menu,it was excellent in all aspects, the food was really tasty well cooked and very well presented.They even bake their own bread which was very nice .
The surroundings are very nice indeed and it is obvious that a lot of thought went into the decor. The staff was very nice and professional, nothing too much trouble for them.

Name: Picturedrome
Title: Screen 2
Review:
Just been with friends to see Mary Poppins Returns in the new screen 2. What a fabulous screen with very comfortable seats. The cinema itself has kept it's old fashioned charm, it is excellent value for money and the staff are very friendly. Much nicer than the huge faceless multiplex cinemas. Thoroughly recommend this lovely cinema. I'm back again on Sunday taking my husband Duncan to see Stan & Ollie. Well done Adam and all the staff
Read less

Name: The Burger Shop
Title: Burnt to a crisp
Review: It was a busy Saturday in Arundel as usual. However we stopped here to get some lunch. The staff weren't very attentive and didn't check back on the food. The chicken burger was burnt and dry and the chips were rock solid too. Its like the forgot about them in the fryer. No check back to solve the issue and we were starving. We had to flag them down just to get the bill after sitting with empty plates for over 20 minutes. Wouldn't recommend, go somewhere where the staff care!

Name: Black Rabbit
Title: No oats
Review: Didn’t offer any oats when asked for special dietary requirements:( sad when they offer breakfast :/

Name: Punch and Judy
Title: Don't ask to watch the football advertised at the door!
Review: We arrived at the pub 20 minutes before the FA cup semi final and the bar person confirmed it would be shown but was unfriendly and unwelcoming. However we perservered and ordered drinks and sat down. Kick off time came and went and no game came on. We asked again and the bar person said they didn't have time to organise the TV and we decided to leave and try somewhere else. As we walked out of the pub she shouted at us-"have a nice night.."very loud and sarcastically in front of the other customers. It was very unpleasant and embarrassing. We were pleased to get away and if you like football don't go there unless you like being insulted !

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: Excellent
Review: Had 3 meals here as I was staying at the premier inn next door a bit of mixture of being with friends and being solo had breakfasts and dinner from the meal deals. All the food was excellent and a funny one to. Ordered a steak with a lobster tail on the last night. It came out without chips and mentioned no chips the chef forgotten to put some on but getting a bowl of chips straight away so no issues. I would recommend this restaurant for the meal deals

Name: Tuptim Siam
Title: Bognors Best
Review:
Definitely our favourite Restaurant in Bognor Regis. The food is superb and everyone is so friendly, it is like visiting your friends.
We have be coming to Tuptims for many years and have never been disappointed. It is such a pity that something cannot be done to make it more appealing from the outside, it really does look dreary, and needs a bright coat of paint and some new windows. It is very deceptive because inside it is lovely, bright and comfortable and with the fabulous staff it is always very welcoming. We look forward to our next visit and would thoroughly recommend it to others

Name: LG Café
Title: Unwelcoming experinece
Review:
After going for a drink with my partner and a few of her friends in Arundel we thought we would try the new French Cuisine Restaurant, and what a mistake.

After asking the “owner” for a table of 7 people I was rather abruptly told “only if you have food” although we were refused after offering to have food because we were enjoying ourselves.

As a fellow member of the service industry I felt a bit let down that this establishment with the lovely decor would not accept 7 working adults from London who were looking to enjoy a glass of champagne and each other’s company.

Will not be returning.

Name: Denmans Gardens
Title: Wonderful
Review: The most beautiful gardens, wonderfully maintained by the staff. The planting combinations are stunning. A lovely cafe too and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. The lovely lady in the entrance deserves a special mention. She truly loved the gardens and spoke very fondly of John Brookes. Very special.

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Not great
Review:
Just returned from a one night stay here and felt the need to air some concerns, firstly the room we stayed in was well over priced for the quality of it, thin uncomfortable pillows, stains on the carpet, very narrow bath and no shower, I don’t mind the lack of a shower but there wasn’t an attachment for washing hair, just and old jug put on the side of the bath.... we ordered breakfast to our room for 9.30 am, at 9.50 it hadn’t arrived, we decided to call reception, we couldn’t even do this as there was no information with the number to call reception which meant my husband had to get dressed and walk down three flights of stairs to ask where our breakfast was, he was told it was a busy time?? Yes and? We paid a £6 tray fee to have it bought up! The hotel did remove the tray charge from our bill but our experience was ruined by then, all this this for £170 for one night, too basic and not enough facilities for that price!
Read less

Name: Parpadelle
Title: Coffee and cake
Review: Been a number of times and always good hot coffee and always little alterations are no trouble to the staff

Name: Toast
Title: Breakfast for the hungry
Review: I was told about this place a few months ago but only recently managed to get here. Real value for money. Cheerful place, great atmosphere. What a wonderful place to have a very generous breakfast. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff. Loved the place.

Name: Black Horse
Title: Drinks with friends in the refurbished Black Horse
Review: Friendly staff, good selection of ales, fabulous new decor and furniture gives the whole place a much more welcoming and contemporary feel. I will definitely be back with more friends soon.

Name: Butlins
Title: Disappointed stay - don't waste your money
Review:
Very disappointed with our stay, arrived at 4:30pm Friday told to park up and go to Oyster Bay reception to collect keys, would have been nice for them to tell us to take all our belongings on a trolley so we didn't have to walk back and forth!
After settling into our room we headed out for dinner "The Diner" was very nice but expensive, we then thought we would go around the fair big mistake it shuts at 5pm and majority of the shops were closed too even the kids soft play was shut! Note this is closing time everyday for everything except restaurants, pubs and of course the shows.
Alcohol and snacks very overpriced.
Even though our room was upgraded it wasn't the cleanist and the shower smell was vile! Yuk!
Don't be early risers as u can't do anything until 10am, be prepared to que in the Splash Area for an 8 year old and teenager it's alright once they did all the slides then bored same for us.
We were going to go home late Sunday evening but have decided to leave straight after breakfast don't see the point wasting a whole day here.
Butlins seems fine for toddlers wouldn't recommend for older children think we will stick with camping!
Read less

Name: Avisford
Title: Spa day
Review:
Arrived at the hotel for a 40th Birthday celebration with a friend for a spa day, first we were directed to the pool area to collect towel and dressing gown. The lady seemed really busy. Then got told the steam room was broken so couldn't use that. We then had to keep asking for a key card to get into the female changing area. Then when my friend and I got changed to use the swimming pool couldn't use it as there was aqua swim fitness class going on in the pool. So we sat in the room to chill, there seemed to be lots of people in the room chillin. We then had to chose what time to have lunch and our beauty treatments were 2pm and 3pm, so that day we couldn't even use the pool. We had also been told by other people in the room that you had to get changed back into your clothes to eat lunch? We had to keep asking about everything which seemed that there was no organisation. What was really disappointing was that this was our 40th Birthday celebrations. The only thing that was good was the beautian she really made the afternoon with a relaxing back massage and a relaxing facial. Thank you.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: Needs uplift
Review:
Last came to butlins in 2017. Was looking forward to seeing the new pool. Stayed in oyster bay in the silver apartment. On arriving at 4pm we got to our room to be told by the cleaner that she needed an hour! When the room was ready it was clear that no hoovering was done, there was hair all over the floor. The clothes airer was broken, the window latch was barely on and the toilet only flushed after about 10 goes. We paid almost 1000 for fri to mon and I feel robbed. Ocean drive was where we ate and although there was enough of a choice the food was cold. I witnessed various people hit there head on the balcony as it's very low down at the top of stairs. Unless your under 5'6 you better hope for a ground floor. Much preferred the old pool. New one is more for toddlers I feel and my 8 year old got bored very quickly. Drinks are expensive and decor hasn't changed at all. Pigeons flying around inside and pigeon poo on the floor. Its very very run down. Needs a total shut down and revamp.
Read less

Name: Butlins
Title: The diner restaurant
Review:
My wife ,grandchildren and myself had dinner in the Diner restaurant while staying at Butlins Bognor. Good food especially the ribs,service was brilliant from Sarah & Liam . Liam even took time to perform a magic trick for our grandchildren.
Read less

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Slow slow slow
Review:
My wife and I get coupons through the door, so thought we would give them a go, the first time it was ok, but everything took time, but the food was ok, the second time we went, was worse, nobody was available to seat us, so we sat down at a table trying to catch someone’s eye, when we finally did, it took 10 minutes to get a drink, 25 minutes to get our meal (which was cold and sent back and microwaved) 10 minutes for coffee, then 5 minutes wait to pay!! Only 2 staff on apparently?
