Review: We hold an annual charity golf day presentation and dinner for fifty plus people at the hotel. The attention to detail, service and quality of food is always superb and highly recommended. Edna, Tony, Sarah and their staff always ensure that the evening is perfect.

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Beer afterwork
Review: Popped in for a beer afterwork and was served by a guy called Alex AKA Trap. Never been greeted by such a fabulous person before, 5 stars would defiantly visit again.

Name: Pub & Kitchen
Title: Don't eat here
Review: Presently stopping in butlins, everything has been good apart from the bar and kitchen. Expensive food and when arrived 2 meals were okay and the other 2 were awful. The burger was extremely dry and hard, the garlic bread had been sat out for around20 minutes and was burnt and when we told them of the problem they only offered a free pudding even though we never had our main. Would not recommend eating here. The beachecomber was much better service.

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Disappointed
Review:
Unfortunately it’s a lovely central hotel in the little town of Arundel that lacks finesse. The room was suitable for purpose in a back courtyard that was quite and unobtrusive. The most disappointing thing about our stay was the disgusting and virtually inedible breakfast. The cold buffet was mediocre (dried up cheese, ham with dried edges- looked a day old) in comparison to other hotels I’ve stayed in, I asked for a hot chocolate and was told no only tea or coffee, so asked for a flat white and was told no that wasn’t possible so decided on tea which was obviously what they wanted me to have! Anyway let me really tell you about the so say Norfolk Arms Full English breakfast. One shrivelled tomato that was so dried up it was like a rock, a hash brown so deep fried the grease was oozing out, a piece of bacon that was dried up and burnt, inedible scrambled egg that was more like dried shoe leather in a flat thin section, a cold piece of black pudding, cold beans and mushrooms that had the most dreadful flavour of as I’d imagine old socks.. the only good thing was the one tiny little sausage that was probably a local specialty.. I wish I’d just had sausages!! I can honestly say if this place had a decent chef you would not have to go elsewhere, but if you can avoid breakfast do as there are loads of other places in the town that you can eat at! Hotel staff were pleasant and polite.
Read less

Name: St Mary's Gate
Title: Family Party
Review: After a traumatic journey to reach our destination we were greeted at the bar by pleasant staff and made to feel welcome straight away, we were shown to our room entrance via the car park and we could see the front of the Cathedral from outside our door. Comfy and clean room with all you would need for a night or 2. Reasonably priced too. Well deserving of 5 stars I am giving.

Name: The Old Priory
Title: Great Start to our UK Holiday
Review: Stayed in the Double Barn ensuite room. Deborah was welcoming and friendly and had tastefully decorated the room. We arrived tired as we had been up since 4am and it was a real delight to walk into this beautiful room. Cost 87 pound per night. Bed was comfortable and the shower great. The breakfast the next morning was delicious. We were even lucky enough to have a slice of Deborah's homemade cake. A really lovely stay. Her big fluffy dog was welcoming too.Plenty of off street parking. Ate dinner at "The Lion at Pagham. Food there and staff were top notch.

Name: Simla Tandoori
Title: Good food and service
Review: we visited the Simla with some friends and were really happy with the service and food, it was nice and hot and very tasty would recommend and will definitely be going back. Shame it doesn't get busier but I think this little restaurant gets forgotten about being in a village. Would recommend, so give it a try !

Name: Rustington Manor
Title: Great little hotel
Review: Stayed here for one night in the single room whilst attending a rugby tournament in Worthing. Room was very clean and nicely decorated. I wasn't expecting any frills so was nicely surprised to find tea, coffee and biscuits!! in the room plus complimentary soaps and shampoos. Breakfast was excellent and arrived quickly. All in all real value for money with great customer service. There was a very rude elderly couple who, in my opinion, were being very unreasonable about the fact the hotel restaurant is closed on Sundays (as set out on the hotel website) and not liking the alternative recommendations they were given. The staff handled the situation very well despite the intimidation.

Name: Rowan Park
Title: Quiet site
Review: Stayed for 2 nights as visiting Bognor Regis. LOVELY AND QUIET. Lidl just 200m away so handy for food. Bognor approx 2 mile away. Nice walk to the cinema and a swimming pool for extra calorie burn off. Would definitely stay again.

Name: Pagham Beach
Title: Better than the Med!
Review: Ok, it was hot on Sunday. Looking for the nearest beach to my holiday stay I found Pagham. Easy (disabled friendly) parking, clean public loos, Co-Op shop, cafes, food, beach shop (to buy beach shoes for paddling on the pebbles) so everything you might need within 200ms of the beach which has easy access for all abilities. The beach was super clean, the sea clearer than those in the Mediterranean - I saw fish spry - and the sea warm enough to paddle or swim without a wet suit. Lots to gaze at on the water sitting next to the yacht club. Perfect!

Name: WWT Wetland
Title: Disappointing on this occasion
Review:
As a WWT member of many years standing (I first joined in the 1970s at Slimbridge, and in the Queen's 25th Jubilee year I managed to visit all the English sites) I often pop into Arundel for free just for a leisurely stroll with added interest, plus a snack in the cafe.

Yesterday I was sadly disappointed. The lovely big pond next to the reception centre is being "re-developed" (I dread to think what that will turn out to be - from the little info given it looks alarmimgly commercial rather than preservational).

On the plus side the reed beds, newly trimmed, looked wonderful in the low winter sunlight and while the new boardwalk surfaces with built-in anti slip are noisier they do look to wear better than the previous chicken-wire solution.

I would like to apologise to the surly girl in the cafe whose kitchen gossip was interrupted by my presence - never mind lass, I paid by card so you didn't have the extra burden of working out change and could quickly return to the kitchen for more chat.

Thank goodness for the reception/shop staff whose friendly service on entry and on exit shone through brightly.
Read less

Name: Swan Hotel
Title: Return visit and just as wonderful
Review:
We stayed here the other year for a much needed weekend break and we needed somewhere to stay for a family birthday party nearby.
This was just as nice as before and my other half very much enjoyed her G&T with an amazing iceberg floating in it along with a slice of passion fruit.
The room was comfortable if a little chilly at first (we don't like it too hot in the bedroom at night so this was fine!).
everyone is very friendly and helpful, live music in the restaurant was "just right", not too loud to spoil a conversation but a peaceful background. The food was very good and the only drawback to the Swan is the lack of parking and cost of a day in the nearby car park (if you can get a space. Even so I'm sure we will be back sometime soon for another getaway.
Read less

Name: Church Farm
Title: Poor customer service
Review:
We've been coming to church farm last 2 years (4th visit) the customer service this year though been awful. The site was advised many times (me and my partner even advised them) that she has mobility issues struggles to walk and we needed to be near the main complex (notes were taken down apparently) did we get that not we did not and to make it better anytime we've needed to speak to someone in reception they have not been interested genuinely not interested. Tried to raise it as a issue but keep getting fobbed off excuses (please don't do a generic reply to this either) Really let down by poor staff attitude this year
Read less

Name: Empress Bar
Title: Patronising and poor customer service
Review:
My girlfriend and I visited for a drink on our anniversary. Asked for a gin and lemonade and a pint, the drink clearly had no lemonade in and soda was used. We paid £12 for the two drinks.

From the get go we both felt like the older woman behind the bar was very condescending towards us because of our age. Looking at us once we ordered our drinks, she lent over the bar, expecting our IDs rather than asking. Must admit I felt very embarrassed at this point. We took our drinks and sat outside.

After a few sips of her drink, we realised the gin clearly had no lemonade and was completely flat. It tasted of watered down gin. I went and politely told the lady about it and she was very blunt blaming it on the fact we had “waited too long” and the ice would have made it taste like that. Being our anniversary the thought of leaving it and just going to our booked restaurant early instead seemed like a much better option. My girlfriend had to leave the majority of the drink, which clearly meant we weren’t trying to get a free one of what the lady probably assumed.

So from a perspective of working in hospitality too, the fact that there was no option for either a replacement or even offering to fill the glass up with lemonade or even an apology, I thought was appalling. Especially when paying more premium prices for the drinks.

No establishment should be patronising towards anyone or make anyone feel unwelcome. Being clearly the youngest customers should not have any difference on how we are treated. Hence my review.

Personally a very embarrassing visit and will defiantly not be returning again.

Name: Butlins
Title: Easter weekend away
Review:
my family and I went away for easter weekend as usual, now we normally go to centre parcs but was fully booked for the accommodation we required. with this we decided to try Butlins. lets just say we won't be returning and our trip was "eye opening".

PROS OF BUTLINS
- good fairground
- decent food

CONS OF BUTLINS
- the pool (ABSOLUTELY disgusting, hair and plasters all over the floor and had only been open a couple of weeks )
- paper thin walls in the accommodation, noisy neighbours meant lots of disrupted sleep
- apartments are very basic, stayed in the "new style silver" yet it had a very musty smell to it
- far too busy
- supposed smoking places yet people are smoking and vaping everywhere including accommodation
- questionable people staying
- horrible nylon bedsheets

the list could go on!
Read less

Name: Travelodge Littlehampton
Title: Disappointing
Review: An hotel in need of a deep clean and freshen up. Do not expect luxury but this hotel fell far short of acceptable. Very unpleasant stale smell in room. Bath badly stained. Large area of room empty, possible convertible coach removed.

Name: Butlins Day Visits
Title: Butlins you should be ashamed
Review: So after hearing about this multi million pound leisure facility we were thrilled to be local enough to go and try it out. As you enter it's the usual packed holiday resort pool with unisex changing. All seemed well until my partner and daughter went on the 2 big water slides there is available. On their return I took 1 look at my partner and knew all was not well. What's wrong I asked. Pubes all the way up the stairs. So we moved to the rapids. Which clever person thought it was a good idea to make wet people queue in front of an open doorway was clearly from Antarctica. I gave up and left the family to it. On route to the changing room I stopped briefly in the baby pool to get warm to be whistles at by 2 members of staff not 2 feet away from me. Not once but several times both of them. I wouldn't have minded if they weren't in talking distance!!! Ok so I can complain about the reason the only warm pool n the complex was being cleaned as all kids have accidents sometimes. I decided to take myself off to get changed. Stopped off in the loos which were at least a cm deep in other people's wee. Grimaced while I sat on layers of loo roll. Found myself a cubicle to change in BONUS! Went to pop my towel down on the floor to stand on and noticed the floor was dirtier inside the complex than outside and had a nice matting of what I can only assume was all the hair from the opening months customers. Omg get me out of this hell Hole!! It's been open a month the nice young girl politely smiled and told me when I asked show long it had been open. Never going again unless I've had an up to date vaccination!!! Butlins you should 've ashamed of this awful standard.

Name: Bailiffs Court
Title: Struggling to award "Mediocre." Light lunch and Dishonest food.....
Review:
To honour a Milestone birthday,we booked..Stunning architecture and glorious weather should have contributed to a remarkable day. Remarkable for all the wrong reasons.

Starters ? Opted for scallops. We expected, given the £ supplement, to receive 2 maybe 3 King Scallops. We were given what appeared to be 4 Queenie's, just the width of a10p piece max, BUT CUT IN HALF through their girth to a max thickness of 2 £1 coins stacked, presented as 8 pieces,seared side up ????

Mains? I opted for herb crusted cod fillet, again, mean-spirited portion. Tad wider than a fish finger, tasty yes but again tiny .The penultimate negative? Hubby ordered " Cake " A Fish Cake of sorts, on a "Lobster Cream" and a "poached egg" on top,which,as eggs go, had the unyielding stance of a cold squash ball and needed pinning before carving. Given the the slow service, it had been sitting on the pass for too long and is why the lobster cream dissipated.

Final negative? A bill for £100 excluding service with just one small glass of average wine.

Upon complaint..Charlie, a fine ambassador for the BCH simply advised us that our remarks would be forwarded to the chef. By then a tad too late, day already spoilt. Given BCH knew at the time of booking it that it was an important event, I am just so sorry they failed to live up to their own reputation. Most importantly it made our own celebration day way below average. Let's hope it was a just bad day but struggle to justify going back to,or recommend it to others
Read less

Name: Bengal Tandoori
Title: My birthday ends badly
Review: Had a curry with my family for my birthday, there was 5 of us. We had a nice meal and the food was nice. The services was OK to. Not perfect but OK. Anyway the problem was we went to bed 4 out of the 5 of us had diarrhoea most of the day and sickness as a result of our dinner. Won't be back again.

Name: Crossbush, Beefeater
Title: sunday lunch family get together
Review: Friendly service on arrival ,restaramt a little grubby and in need of a refurb . It was busy but not overly for sunday lunchtime . Took twenty minutes to take our order luckily we had already bought drinks at the bar area . Starter was probably the best part of the meal , although its difficult to go wrong with garlic bread . We warned of a 40 minute food delay but not that they were running out of the ingredients to serve , When the food did arrive my daughters chicken was like leather, the slow cooked beef pieces were tiny ,not sliced like a normal roast .Roast potatoes were hard to describe , it was a disaster on a plate to be frank . We didnt order a sweet as the meal as a whole was two hours ,luckily we had two for one vouchers ,which still outweighed the value of the meal . We came here three years ago ,we thought in reality it couldnt get any worse ,we will not return it has . The photographs of the sunday lunch had absolutely no similarity with the poor meal we had served to us today.

Name: Butlins
Title: Best holiday we've had
Review:
I stayed with 2 5 year olds. Everything was faultless. Staff, accommodation at the shoreline hotel. The kids had an amazing time. We made some new friends there which we will stay in contact with. Their fav part was the skyline gang. New pool is amazing! I've already booked another holiday in a few months!
Read less

Name: Arun View
Title: Room with a view
Review:
Visited for Father’s Day with five others to this beautiful venue. Right by the river with room both inside and outside to take in the surroundings.
The staff were very good and all mixed in too ensure that each table was suitably looked after.
Food menu was varied as well as having a specials board.
The selsey crab cocktail was delicious. The fiery lamb shank was heaven, I declined desert but the others did have. Seems the sticky toffee pudding was well greeted.
Prices very reasonable. Would recommend. Sadly we live too far away to make it a regular visit.

Name: Haskins Garden Centre
Title: Afternoon Tea
Review: This is in relation to the Afternoon Tea for two, not the restaurant or food in general which is great.  When we sat down it was brought straight out, with no preparation, and we quickly realised it wasn't fresh, had been prepared in advance and then stored in a refrigerator. The result was all of it was very cold:  -2 small sub rolls each - dry, hard with no butter and overly chilled filling. -The cake tier had a nice selection, but again really chilled with slightly soggy mini  battenbergs (how they get when they've been exposed to the air a while). -Scones on top, again slightly cold and dry from the fridge. The clotted cream was  like ice cream  That for £12.95 which has gone up this year felt like poor value for money.  I expected good things from Haskins, as mentioned, their restaurant and food is really good and we eat there often. But this felt like they were just on the afternoon tea bandwagon as an easy money-spinner, without any care or attention to the experience which normally people book as a treat.

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Amazing Castle
Review:
This was my first castle of our 12 day UK trip where we saw 21 castles. And what a choice to start with! This is the most picturesque castle I could imagine. We did the Gold+ ticket and spent about 3 hours there exploring every area. There is so much history there and so many time periods when things were built. It's incredible to see it all, and the town is charming as well. I would go back every weekend if I lived nearby instead of across the pond. Worth the visit for sure!
Read less

Name: World's End
Title: Amazing pub
Review: Lovely pub, amazing staff they should cherish and especially thank you to Tarren to served us, such a professional young man

Name: Establo Lounge
Title: Coldmeal
Review: Ordered chicken burger, arrived cold, no apologies had to ask for cutlery. Not a good experience.Have been here before with no complaint. Must have been a bad day...............

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Dinner out
Review:
So we decided to go to the Oyster Catcher for a spot of dinner, wow what an experience, without a shadow of a doubt the rudest staff I have ever encountered, we got greeted by a woman called Emma, who just looked at me and said, "Yes", no pleasantries or welcome, but that's ok, then we ordered food and drinks, and whilst she was ringing it in, I saw a sign on the wall saying bar snax, and then noticed a covered plate, with olives, pistachios and chilli bites, so I lifted the lid and used a cocktail stick to have an olive, BIG MISTAKE.... Emma just looked at me as if I had taken a crap on the bar, and snarled "you have to pay for those" so I apologised and said how much do I owe you for an olive, apprantly £2:40 as they can't sell them after I removed one because of a potential allergy problem? I did explain that no prices are marked anywhere, that fell on deaf ears, I ended the conversation with a comment about needing a crystal ball. So I brought a bowl of olives that I didn't want, although the sign on the wall said they come with bread, they don't.
It doesn't end there... When the food came out another Emma, even ruder than the first one, had a go at me for moving tables after ordering food, I did maintain that I hadn't moved tables at all, but it appears it was our fault that someone had moved the table number before we sat down, I have never been spoken to as badly as I was tonight.

Name: Norfolk Arms
Title: Superb location friendly staff
Review:
Stayed for 3 nights as part of attending a function. Very nice freshly cooked breakfasts with friendly and helpful staff in all parts of the hotel. We were a bit concerned about a wedding disco but having asked in advance for a quiet room (Room 15) never heard a thing. This is an historic coaching inn right in the centre of Arundel.
Read less

Name: Mustards
Title: Great
Review: Sat in bar area and had set menue, good service and great food. Staff lovely. Will definitely go back again.

Name: Arundel Museum
Title: Worth a visit
Review: Dropped in after a visit to the castle. Nice local history museum with a small gift shop. Covered a wide range of subjects related to the town. The small entrance fee was worth the visit.

Name: The Steam Packer
Title: Wonderful stay at “The Steam Packet”
Review:
Our two wonderful hosts, Arleta & Mark, couldn’t be more accommodating. Our room over looked the little harbour and sunset sky. Romantic, quaint, clean and warm.

The food was not only tasty, but the pub was ever so friendly. Exceptional stay all in all.

Thank you

Name: Pub & Kitchen
Title: Excellent
Review: We visited last week as a large party of 14. Everything about our visit was amazing. The food was lovely. Many of us ordered steak, which was cooked perfectly to suit our different tastes and the chips were to die for! We were served quickly considering the size of our party. Our waiter (Lewis) was attentive, polite and efficient. I would definitely recommend.

Name: The Gravy Boat
Title: Staff are beyond excecent
Review:
the food is just about average - most served within 5/6 mins of ordering - so not fresh cooked - just restaurant bags of prepared food
Ordered mushroom ravioli with a truffle sauce -NO - just 15 pieces of ravioli covered in the thickest of tomato sauce - inedible - so thick and stoggy
where was the truffle sauce - no mention on menu it was covered with a massive coating of tomato puree
Cannot fault the staff - just the best we have seen - work hard - friendly
Must say we have been here for the carvery & that is brilliant
Sad that we also hear people mention that the food is not what is stated on the menu
Mushroom ravioli with truffle sauce - is what I wanted
- not an overload of pasta with buckets of tomato sauce

Name: Travelodge Fontwell
Title: Great stay
Review:
Clean and well maintained. The beds were lovely and comfortable. The staff were very helpful and accommodated for us very well. We had a good night sleep and had everything we needed. We can’t wait for our next visit!
Read less

Name: Hotham Park
Title: Fond memories
Review:
This is a lovely park to walk around whilst enjoying the local wildlife, take some peanuts in the shell and the squirrels will come down and if you keep very still you can hand feed them. Lots of dogs shame not all on a lead. The play area is modern and safe for small children. They also have a magnificent crazy golf course 18 holes.
Read less

Name: Ye Olde Fish and Chippe Shoppe
Title: The best chippy around
Review:
I have yet to find better in the last 15 years. Juicy fish, lovely batter, the best chips.
I’m never bothered by waiting a bit at peak times. It is always well worth the wait and you can always order ahead by phone. Friendly staff too.

Name: Avisford
Title: It’s a shame !
Review:
It is a pity and a shame for Hilton name! The hotel must be a 2 stars hotel and nothing more . Dirty ( very!!), old and never repaired, neglected, stinky, with the fitting that I have never found in another Hilton hotel.
The room had a lot of missing items ( in a four stars hotel I pretend at least the fridge with at least one water bottle inside), the ceiling was stained, the room was hot even with the open windows and due to this it has been placed an old ventilator and a noisy movable conditioner, with hanging cables everywhere.
The indoor swimming pool had dirty water and floor around it and it hadn’t even the soap in the ( not illuminated) shower.
In the room there were cables and missed switches, one bed lamp was broken and not working.
In the night we were waked up by the fire alarm ( as all the hotel guests) due - they told us - to an alarm in one room ( or by a mis-contact as we suppose). Then at 6 in the morning it was noisily inserted a apology letter under the door, waking us up again.
We have chosen Hilton and not one of the ( many) other hotels because we supposed to have the grant of quality but we were totally wrong. We just paid a 4 star hotel price (270 pound for one night!) to sleep one night in a old, neglected, stinky hotel.
Read less

Name: Tuptim Siam
Title: Lovely food
Review: Very nice Thai food. Quick service, fair portion and really good value. Carpark near by so it is very convenient.

Name: Vardar Restaurant
Title: Robert loney
Review: I would thoroughly recommend this restaurant the food was amazing as was the service,beautiful setting an amazing experience, would definitely return.

Name: China Palace
Title: Great restaurant with attentive staff
Review:
I have visited this restaurant in the past and may well have given a review, but once again I must congratulate the both the owners and all the staff who served us that it was a great evening - delicious food, plenty of it and very good service.

Highly recommended

Name: Moathouse Café
Title: Excellent
Review: Went to arundel for Mother’s Day breakfast . Was going to go to partners cafe but is was closed so decided to try the moat house for a change and glad we did . All 3 of us had the full English breakfast and it was perfect in every way .staff were good and nothing was to much trouble for them . It was very busy as it was Mother’s Day so had a little bit of a wait for our food to arrive but that was understandable and when it did arrive it was hot and freshly cooked so well done to the moat house . Next time we go to arundel for breakfast we will be going to the moat house .

Name: The Diner
Title: Food good, service not so.
Review: We booked a table for a birthday dinner. Arrival was fine and there were balloons on the table which was lovely. Starters arrived really quickly but then it went downhill. Main courses took ages by which time the kids lost the will and went to the park. As we had ordered the set kids meals we were charged for the puddings they didn't have as our main courses took so long. Service was slow. Do yourself a favour and go to the Pub & Kitchen instead.

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Not to be repeated experience
Review: Friends local to Roundstone received coupons through their letterbox and invited us to try this restaurant for lunch. We ordered their specials which included fish and chips, 6oz ranch steak, gammon steak and paprika chicken and drinks. The only meal that did not have a negative comment was the gammon steak. The rest left a lot to be desired.

Name: Café 80
Title: Dull and disappointing
Review: Need to improve your staff customer care. Waitress was outside smoking while we waited for her to come in and serve us. She barely acknowledged our presence. No hello, smile or thank you (and this has been the same on previous visits). Most cafes have their staff looking smart with tidy hair and some sort of tea shirt/uniform or apron. We wanted a toasted sandwich on brown bread. Were told “don’t have other bread only farmhouse bread”. The toasted sandwich arrived in extra thick doorstop bread! The cheese had solidified. It’s a shame as when this cafe opened it was such a cheery place with a lovely waitress and owner. Won’t return.

Name: Raj Doot
Title: Customer Service I think NOT!
Review:
I've only had a take away from here via on line at just eat it was fine
Deceided that I would dine in the first time of doing so
Telephone to make a booking WELL.........
Rude, couldn't care less attitude, Thought about it, felt if this is the attitude I don't want to dine there so teephoned back and cancelled got the same couldn't are less response
REALLY terrible shan't darken their doorstep again!

Name: Butlins
Title: Weekend break
Review:
I took my disabled mother in law for a break she booked it through a company , I was very disappointed that the company also butlins had the room as an adapted room all it had different was a wet room ! No grab rails anywhere apart from bathroom and no armchair for her to sit in just a velour curved low seat . We did ask at reception but they just gave us a wooden dining chair Also no adult entertainment really especially for older people all in all I would not recommend this holiday if you are disabled or you aren’t taking children away.here is a picture of the chair for my disabled 22 stone in law to sit on to relax
Read less

Name: Oyster Catcher
Title: Sat 6th july
Review:
14 of us pre-booked a table
Stressed out staff
One poor person serving at the bar (Emma ) who is a complete credit to your pub and tried her utmost to keep up .
No flavoured gins even though gin menus were everywhere
Long long wait at the bar due to there being only one Member of staff on a Saturday night
No ice
Portion sizing tiny think we counted 10 chips with my husbands steak
Coconut chicken curry rank dry as a bone

chicken with microwave rice and a tomato sauce not as described felt so sorry for your poor staff didn’t have the heart to complain
You really could do soooooo much better if this place was managed properly.
Lots of unhappy customers saw at least 10/15 leave to go elsewhere

Name: Bognor Museum
Title: Great Hour Spent
Review:
A small museum packed with lots of exhibits from yesteryear. Commentary by way of telephones are provided for a few exhibits. Very enjoyable.
Read less

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: A wonderful relax
Review:
Only for one night but it was so lovely. The room was really nice and the bed was so comfortable! All the staff were lovely and the pub/restaurant attached was lush. Breakfast made to order was super too
Read less

Name: The Mezze
Title: Turkish food to savour
Review: A warm Turkish welcome, fantastic choice of many Turkish dishes and all cooked so you can see it being prepared if you wish. Great food and it has quickly earned an excellent reputation with the locals who like me will go back on a regular basis.

Name: Fish & Chips
Title: Is one star as low as one can go?
Review:
This place is a disgrace.

If I’d have read the reviews before venturing I wouldn’t have paid a visit.

The toilets were absolutely disgusting, the cleanliness left a lot to be desired.

Upon our arrival I asked if credit cards were accepted, and we were told “no problem”

However when it came to paying the bill I was told that today was the day that they couldn’t accept a credit or debit card, and being without any cash was despatched to a cash machine about 5 minutes away.

No apology was offered. Clearly the staff don’t find it necessary to communicate between each other,

The food was ok, not special, but edible.

Not somewhere that I’d recommend, and we certainly won’t be going there again.

Name: Arun Leisure Centre
Title: Shocking
Review: Went for a swim which was fine in itself but otherwise shocking facilities. Dirty changing rooms with lockers that don't work. A sign in the ladies changing room warning male employees may be in attendance which is fair enough but not when the cubicle curtains don't close properly. Cafe service apalling. The ladies at the till did their best to cover but there seemed to be a constant queue. Adding insult to injury, money seems to have been spent on cosmetics ie tarting up the reception area. Why bother when you can't get the basics right?

Name: The Roundstone
Title: Come on Whitbread
Review: Not a great place to be or to eat. Food is poor, not like little chef but not so good. Pub stinks and is dirty and run down. Staff ok but not great. Sat at a table today with plaster off the wall and not in a theme way. Poor poor poor. 2nd night at the hotel and pub and full of guys swearing and shouting and the staff and manager does not take any action.

Name: Chez Moi
Title: Personal warm, professional touch by the Chef and his wife (owners- family run restaurant professionally! )
Review: Warm, personal, professional touch, an enjoyable welcoming, relaxing atmosphere, in a British setting with a Parisian feel to it, the chef is attentive, and crafts the meal in a Michelin style! They create a community atomosphere, welcoming both visitors, & locals.

Name: Angmering Manor
Title: Not the 4* hotel I'd expected.
Review:
We booked a superior double for one night costing us £139. Arrival was hardly welcoming and the room was dated and absolutely not at a 4* standard! I'm shocked this is rated as a 4* hotel. I can only assume it's because of the pool. The bed was uncomfortable, the fixtures and fittings were extremely dated and quite frankly ugly. Staff was miserable and at times, rude. Cooked breakfast was nice but the cold selection was extremely poor. Very disappointing. Would absolutely not return. I'd say it's about £50 overpriced.
Read less

Name: The Beresford
Title: Sunday lunch
Review:
We had a fantastic lunch here. There is something for everyone with a Sunday carvery to die for and the desserts were great too! The f staff very attentive and helpful.
Highly recommend Sunday lunch here.

Name: Inglenook
Title: Delicious meal
Review:
Attended as a group for a meal with no prior booking. Made to feel very welcome by every member of staff from the bar and restaurant. Fantastic menu with superb fresh fish dinners, salads, steaks and classic pub meal like scampi.
Beautifully decorated in dining area and conservatory area. There’s a large outdoor seating area too.
Due to menu and staff I highly recommend this pub/ restaurant.

Name: Selwood Hotel
Title: Shower didn’t work, do NOT stay here!
Review:
Proprietor nice enough however shower either boiling hot, ie kettle hot or icy cold
Proprietor unable to fix hence no shower in the morning, bad bad start to our day!
Bed seen better days
£85 for the night
Way too expensive for this b&b

Name: Haskins Garden Centre
Title: Lunch with my daughter
Review: Everything looks so nice and plenty of variety.. been many times but this time I had the fish and chips ,, fish was poor quality and very dry and not one crisp on the batter , soggy ! Wife had macaroni cheese and enjoyed it , daughter had the curry and ate the lot..

Name: Premier Inn Bognor
Title: A few days away
Review:
We found the hotel to better then we expected the staff the room were excellent car parking was also very good the location was just outside Bognor which was idle for us the restaurant was very good the menu choices were very good and the costs not too expensive
Read less

Name: Arundel Castle
Title: Brilliant
Review:
Lovely Gardens. Great history explained well. Good for all ages.
The jousting events are also very good a organised well.
A great day out at a reasonable cost.
Read less

Name: LG Café
Title: Rude owner poor food
Review: Went in for a light lunch and was greeted by a very rude owner, we overlooked this as the waiter was friendly. Poor quality overpriced food. Won’t be returning
